title: Maybe It'll Turn Into a Pumpkin
description: John Kenneth Galbraith says he's finally decided what to do with that purple and gold Cadillac presented him recently by the Harvard Lampoon at an award for being Harvard's funniest professor in 100 years. Reached by telephone last week in London, where the 67yearold economist is ta2mg a program for the British Broadcasting Corporation, Mr, Galbraith reported, I'll only drive it on state occasions.

title: Demonstrators Battle Police in Madrid
description: MADRID, April 3Thousands of demonstrators calling for a general amnesty engaged in running battles with the riot police along rainswept streets and squares in the center of Madrid tonight.

title: Coming Apart
description: The battle cry of the student revolt of the 60's was that academic requirements were irrelevant. When confronted by an angry and occasionalfy violent student opposition, universities tended to buy peace by simply dropping requirements instead of reforming them.

title: Goolagong Snaps Evert jinx
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 3The streak is dead. Long live the streak.

title: Geren Watson Plans Nuptials
description: Geren Jean Watson of New York, a fashion. editor of Mademoiselle magazine, plans to be married in June to John J. Fauth 4th, an assistant vice president of Citibank with Citicorp Commercial Inc.. its subsidiary in Minneapolis.

title: Upstate Darn Ruptures. Washes Away Trains
description: WARRENSBURG, N.Y., April 3 (AP)A darn ruptured and washed away part of a factory, freight cars, barrels of dangerous chemicals and other debris today, threatening structures along the Schroon River below.

title: Paula DiBenedetto Fiancee of Physician
description: Mr. and Mrs. Cnarles DiBenedetto of Rockville Centre, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Paula Ciare DiBenedetto, to Dr. James F. Caravelli, son of Olga Caravelli of Mundelein. Ill., and the late Dr. Anthony F. Caravelli, who practiced internal medicine.

title: Susan Henry Plans Bridal
description: Mrs. John R. Henry Jr. of Rye, N. Y., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Susan Earle Henry, to H. Thayer West, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Margerom West of New Canaan, Conn.

title: Design
description: COLUMBUS, Ind.J. Irwin Miller's motives, he admits. were somewhat selfish. He is chairman of the board of Cummins Engine Company, the multinational diesel manufacturer that is by far the largest employer here, and he was concerned that Cummins, based in a prairie town of only 19,000, was proving less than attractive to the brightest young executives. Miller's family roots run deep in Columbus history, and moving the company was unthinkable. So he began, slowly, to remake the town from a tired, decaying prairie place into the sort of city he saw as an appropriate home for Cummins. His method was architecture. He announced in 1954 that the Cummins Engine Foundation would pay the architect's fees for any public building in town designed by an architect of national note. And now, 22 years later, so much has been built in Columbus that the city is considered one of the major showplaces of modern architecture in the world.

title: Two novels
description: Hugh Nissenson established himself as a writer of consequence with two volumes of short stories, A Pile of Stones (1965) and In the Reign of Peace (1972). All these stories except one dealt with Jewsin Poland, in Israel, in New York of the early century, in New York today. All of them were written with fine control, in a style distilled, compassionate, just. And dominating most of these stories was one agony: the existence of pain and cruelty and evil in a universe that itself exists within divine mind.

title: FOR SHAKESPEARE, TO BE OR NOT TO BE
description: STAMFORD, Conn., April 3All of Bloomingdale's was a stage here today as the management played its role in saving the American Shakespeare Theater in Stratford.

title: September Bridal For Matti Marks
description: The engagement of Matti Debra Marks to 45cott Borowsky has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. George Marks of Wyncote. Pa., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Irvin J. Borowsky of Philadelphia.

title: FRENCHWINEAREA FEARS NEW STRIFE
description: MONTPELLIER, France, March 29 There is an uneasy feeling that sporadic violence is becoming a way of life among the wine growers in this sunny, troubled region where much of France's inexpensive table wine Is produced.

title: LONG BEACH PLAN ASKS TRANSIT HUB
description: MINEOLA, L. I. The creation of a transportationhub and officebuilding complex over tracks of the Long Island Rail Road and the construction of attractive specialty stores in the center of the city's main thoroughfare have been recommended by the Nassau County Planning Commission in a comprehensive study and plan for the city of Lone Beach.

title: Pat Holley Sings And Plays Piano In Stylish Manner
description: This town is full of singerpianists who are merely going through the motions because they have nothing individual to offer. So it is frustrating and distressing to run into as fascinating a singer at Pat Holley, who accompanies herself on piano at Oliver's, 141 West 57th Street, on Tuesdays and Thursdays. She has a warm, personal flow as a performer but is buried under an inept amplifying system and is limited by a dreadful minipiano.

title: Eric Carmen Sings At the Bottom Line In an Uneven Show
description: The Raspberries were an American band that broke up last spring just when one might have thought they were on the verge of making a successful transition into real live bigtime rockandroll. Now Eric Carmen of that group has emerged as a solo artist, with a No. 1 single behind him already. This weekend he's at the Bottom Line (closing tonight), and although he is entertaining enough, he is not yet a very interesting rock artist.

title: The Golf Clinic
description: Ben Hogan startled a group of journalists in Manhattan recently when he said he ???ioys practicing more than playing.

title: Vote S. &
description: Usually when the California primary rolls around, Jesse M. Unruh can be found heading the campaign of the leading Democratic liberal contender for President.

title: Charge Up Sagamore Hill
description: Tour of Teddy Roosevelt's Home and Oyster Bay

title: Pamela Rose Becker Is Bride Of Edward Joseph Feinstein
description: Pamela Rose Becker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph E. Becker of Washington and Aspen. Colo., was married yesterday afternoon to Edward Joseph Feinstein. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. David Feinstein of Holyoke, Mass.

title: Where Smoking Is an Elective
description: ACIGARETTE butt is flicked from the fingers of a 15yearold. It spins for a moment, then smolders on the white linoleum floor, a floor speckled with tar and nicotine stains.

title: Jacksonville Police Are Barring Press From Some Reports
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., April 3 The police here are refusing to let reporters see certain police reports that were previously available to them, as part of a move to prevent defense attorneys, particularly public defenders, from getting Information they need to prepare for criminal trials.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The shadow of the nationwide trucking strike fell over the stock market last week, the fear being that a prolonged walkout could hamper the economic recovery.

title: ABORTION BACKERS ON MARCH IN ROE
description: ROME, April 3 (AP)More than 50,000 women marched through downtown Rome today waving their clenched fists and shouting slogans against the Pope and Prime Minister Aldo Mom and his Christian Democratic Party for their opposition to legalized abortion.

title: Udall Backers Challenge Primary Law in Indiana
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 3 (UPI)  Associate Justice John Paul Stevens of the United States Supreme Court will be asked next week to issue an emergency mandatory injunction directing Indiana to put Representative Morris K. Udall's name on. the May 4 Presidential primary ballot.

title: The Cost of Power: Utility States Its Case
description: UTILITIES vs. the Consumer" (March 14) cotaineda number of points regarding Lifeline electricity rates and the Jersey Central Power & Light Company's position on such rates, which should be clarified.

title: FOOD
description: WELL  DESERVED praise has been accorded a kitchen appliance called the Culsinart Food Processor since It first appeared here more than two years ago. It is to the home kitchen what the computer is to small business: highspeed efficiency accomplishing small and tedious tasks in seconds.

title: Lost Luggage and Bashed Bags: C.A.B. vs. the Airlines
description: Last year some 3 million passengers on the nation's domestic airlines were left up in the air after their planes landed: Their luggage had been lost, mishandled, damaged, pilfered or stolen. Perhaps the most amazing fact about that statistic is that it represents progress.

title: New Police Policy Frees Prostitutes Of Roundup Fears
description: The police, under a new policy, are drastically reducing arrests of prostitutes, and the prostitutes, aware of this, are becoming more numerous and more aggressive in street solicitation, particularly in midManhattan.

title: Argentina's New Start
description: Argentina's new military rulers have issued decrees and employed rhetoric similar to those of their counterparts in Chile after the overthrow of President Allende in 1973; but thus far their actions have been much more moderate as they pursue their campaign against leftwing guerrillas. Particularly on the crucial labor front, Gen. Jorge Rafael Videla and his colleagues have behaved with relative restraint.

title: Summer Jobs: Where to Hunt
description: THE historic Towne of Smithville is looking for a blacksmith, a potter and a candlestickmaker. Great Adventure, the amusement park, needs people to play Hocken Switette and Wilder). Wooley, lifesized puppets that stroll Dream Street, amusing children. And the Steel Pier in Atlantic City is in the market for stablehands to tend horses trained to dive 40 feet into a large pool.

title: Parent and Child
description: Growing up in a society obsessed with measuring every aspect of its national life from toothpaste tubes to reading scores is often painful for children who happen to be unusually short or talland generally for their parents as well. Dr. Everett Dulit, director of adolescent psychiatry at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, contends size is such an important organizing principle in our society that being too short or too tall can be a real psychological hazard to be dealt with every bit as seriously as any physical handicap. There's a gutlevel association imprinted in our universal experience of growing up that big is powerful and little is weak; we see it with the giants and dwarfs of the fairy tales we read as children, and from then on that symbolism is constantly reinforced by all the growthoriented values of culture.

title: An Economist Who Outsells Samuelson
description: To the students in his introductory PconomicF classes at the University of Nebraska In Lincoln, Campbell R. McConnell, their bald, bespectacled professor, is nothing out of the ordinaryan energetic instrucor, a knowledgeable economist and an affable conversationalist.

title: Heat and Dust
description: Ruth Prawer Jhabvala is an enviably productive writereight novels, three books of stories in two decadeswhose seemingly inexhaustible subject is contemporary India. Yet she was born in Europe of PolishJewish parents, educated in England, lived in New Delhi after her marriage to an Indian architect 25 years ago and recently settled in New York. Unlike any other foreign novelist in English, Mrs. Jhabvala writes from within the extended Indianfamily structure, an affectionately satiric observer of the conflict between traditional passivity and Westernized ambition within individuals battered by the indifferent tides of change in presentday Indian life. Though there are inescapable echoes of Forster when she writes about the reckless English innocents who these days come no longer to conquer but to be conquered, her sharpest and most fully realized portraits are those of Indian parents and children, masters and servants, husbands and wives, whom she knows with the unthinking familiarity of an insider, but scrutinizes with the frequently amused detachment of a privileged stranger.

title: 40th Masters: Play Starts Thursday in Golf's Challenging Rite of Spring at Augusta
Soviet Ships Will Join July 4 SailIn
description: The Soviet Union will send two squarerigged sailing ships to Operation Sail, the July 4 nautical parade in New York Harbor commemorating the Bicentennial.

title: GARDENING Garden a Lemon? Try Lime
description: THE soils of Long Island have their origin in the rock that was crushed and pulverized as it was pushed ahead of the Wisconsin glacier of the last ice age. The southern advance of the glacier terminated at Long Island.

title: Beame Will Vote for Jackson; Says He Will Do Most for Cities
description: Mayor Beams announced yesterday that he would vote for Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington in the New York Democratic Presidential primary this Tuesday.

title: Waiting for the ConRail Express
description: THE advent of ConRail, the giant new governmentaided railway that has replaced the Penn Central and other bankrupt carriers in the Northeast, is viewed with considerable anxiety by most Long Island rail shippers.

title: Clarion State Takes Women's Gym Title
description: BOONE, N.C., April 3 (Al')  Clarion State College of Pennsylvania posted a score of 107.95 today and won its first Association of Intercollegiate Athletics for Women national gymnastics championship at Appalachian State University.

title: TEAMSTERS AGREE ON NEW CONTRACT TO END WALKOUT
description: ARLINGTON HEIGHTS, April 3The teamsters union and the trucking industry agreed today on a settlement that, if ratified by union members, would protect them against inflation and increase their wages and benefits by about 30 percent over three years.

title: What is is
description: Every two or three years during the past decade and a half we have been inundated by the noisily announced presence of a new system of therapy, a new technique for gaining spiritual and emotional wisdom, a new method that promises to put us in touch with our very own selves and to deliver us from the nearly monumental sense of loneliness and isolation from which the American middleclass suffers. Each one of these therapies and spiritual systems comes complete with a prophetteacher and an amalgamated variant on the psychoanalytic, Easternwisdom, selfrealization jargon; each one of themwith amazing rapiditydevelops an institute or an organizational structure through which the converts and the profits are shuffled with the expert efficiency of the shrewd American businessman who says to himself They're buying today, but tomorrow, who knows?

title: Hatcher Asks Democrats to Give Blacks 25% of Convention Seats
description: Mayor Richard T. Hatcher of Gary, lnd., in a letter to the Democratic Party's presidential aspirants and state chairmen, has urged their to support the concept that blacks should constitute 25 percent of the party's voting delegates to the national convention in July.

title: Letter From San Francisco
description: Hello, out there, you who do not live by bread alone. Remember that rich and yeasty San Francisco Renaissance? Where has all the flour gone?

title: D.A. INVESTIGATES SUFFOLK PROJECI
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., April 3The Suffolk District Attorney is investigating the role of Republican leaders and other public officials in the county In the development of the controversial $700 million Southwest Sewer District.

title: Upsets Mark Title Bridge Play
description: BRIDGE experts from North Jersey, successfully fighting heavy odds, spent last weekend at Montvale's High School repelling invading armies from other parts of New Jersey, Westchester, the Hudson Valley and the Albany area.

title: Notes: Tourists Make Waves Along the Nile
description: Along the Nile, tourists are making waves these days, and some of the biggest fish in the travel industry are snapping them up. Giants like American Express, Hilton, Club Mediterranee, Marriott and Lars Lindblad have taken to the river to provide the hordes of sightseers descending on presentday Egypt with vessels that outdo, at least in most creature comforts, Cleopatra's fabled barge, its sails so perfumed that the winds were lovesick with them.

title: When There's No Law To Break
description: THE HAGUEInevitably the absence of a code of international law will destroy civilization's fabric if such a code is not first written and then accepted by the major nations, which, despite their numerical inferiority, can still impose a majority consensus on the world.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: ONLY a few months after their firm proclamations of confidence and solidarity on monetary matters at two historic meetings in Rambouillet, France, and the island of Jamaica, the Western world's political and financial leaders have been confronted with a new, and potentially serious, threat to international economic stability, trade patterns and Europe's goal of greater unity.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: China, in all likelihood, was the first nation In the world to record the discovery of petroleum. It happened 18 Centuries ago, when the famous historian, Pan Ku, wrote of oil discoveries in his History of the Han Dynasty. However, the recorded discoveries have largely antiquarian value, for significant consumption of petroleum and petroleum products postdates an American shipment of kerosene to Canton in 1876.

title: The Amateur Trail: Hurdles and Barriers
Small Is Beautiful on Wheels
description: Big cars may be selling, but Detroit still rushes to brine out smaller models.

title: Big Mac
description: McDonald's, whether one likes to eat its hamburgers or not, is a frightening example of free enterprise (another vanishing local tradition) gone wild. Boas and Chain's informal history of the McDonald company sets forth the outrageous details of a cautionary tale. Often the authors write as if they thought it all was merely preposterous, all those billions of burgers and hamburgerologists. But, in the end, they have shaped  their reportage into blithely cutting satire. Their art is in the deadpan delivery of dozens of devastating facts. McDonald's, write Boas and Chain, bought I per cent of all the beef wholesaled in the United States. The billion burgers it sold every four months required that 100,000 head of cattle be fed, slaughtered, processed, frozen into patties and distributed across the country. . . . McDonald's was also the country's biggest buyer of processed potatoes for making French fries and the top purchaser of fish. It was also the nation's leading employer of young people, some 150,000.

title: Only in Jersey, Bagels and Sympathy
description: LEONIA RECENTLY, several things happened to this New Jersey resident that are directly related to our bountiful state, and I want you to know about them. In order of consequence: I lost 40 pounds, I ate my first bagel and I wrote a book.

title: A subtle rite of spring
description: When he complained that April is the cruelest month, T. S. Eliot may have made points with poetry lovers, but he certainly blew it with trout fishers. For April marks the longawaited beginning of the trout season in both turope and America, and right now, lifegiving sap is once again starting to flow through the veins of (routers as surely as it is ascending the trunks of trees. Here in New York State, last Thursday marked the Opening Day (a date infamously labeled April Fools Day), and little noticed among the shivering ranks of urchins and village idlers hurling worms into our creeks and rivers these early spring days are the advance guard of nature's noblemen: the serious flyfishers.

title: Correction
description: In the Review of March 28, a story stated that the ratio of Jews to Arabs in Jerusalem was one to three. That was in error; there are 267,000 Jews and 93.000 Arabs, a ratio of approxi mately three to one.

title: Forest Hills Greets `Scarsdale Tennis
description: Perhaps 1,000 chilled devotees of this nascent sport gathered around the center court at Forest Hills yesterday for what was billed as the first world platform tennis championships.

title: Democrats Urged to Adopt Jobs Plank
description: NEWPORT, April 3 (AP) Labor and municipal leaders, testifying to the growing needs of the nation's cities and unemployed, urged the Democratic Party today to adopt a full employment plank in its platform.

title: Letters: Sunday Drivers
description: To the Editor:

title: But Justice Stewart Has Warned That the Constitution Establishes the Contest, Not Its Resolution
description: When The Village Voice reprinted portions of the Pike Committee's secret report on the Central Intelligence Agency in a special supplement in midFebruary, it introduced the section to its readers with an opening disclaimer. These are not the Pentagon Papers, it said, but there are points of similarity. The ensuing public turmoil over the origin of the copy reproduced in The Voice, reports of Justice Department concern over the disclosure of possibly classified documents, and the recent announcement that the House Committee on Standards of Official Conduct will be investigating Daniel Schorr, the CBS reporter who is the proclaimed source, bring to mind the extensive constitutional battles that preceded and followed the 1971 publication of the Defense Department's Vietnam study.

title: Betty Geoghegan, Teacher, Bride
description: Betty Anne Geoghegan, daughter of Nr. and Mrs. Arthur J. Geoghegan of White Plains, was married there yesterday morning to William Michael Weldon, an investment analyst with the First National Bank of Chicago.

title: DINING OUT
description: AS we pulled into the parking lot, I wondered why The Dining Car 1890 wasn't at Lake Buena Vista, Fla., along with the Hall of Presidents, Enchanted Castle and Monorail. The Dining Car 1890 consists of several railroad cars of post 1890 vintage connected to a central structure. Unlike Disney World, where everything is a facsimile, this rolling stock is authentic, having been brought to its present site by the restaurant's owners who had this unusual concept in mind. Some of the decor is Victorian and every inch of wall space has been hung with interesting railroad artifacts and memorabilia. The place is fun.

title: Mets: New Faces and Old Problems
description: Through time, trade and attrition, the New York Mets have undergone a dramatic change in the cast during the last two years. And as they turn into their 15th season as the sometimes wonders of baseball, they have new performers in key roles but are still groping for a solution to old problems.

title: Low Noon For the G.O.P.
description: IN the law enforcement business; in which Sheriff Philip F. Corso of Suffolk County has spent the last 30 years, it is called copping a plea. It is also called, although not for the record, making a deal.

title: Churches in 2 Germanys Maintaining Secret Ties
description: EAST BERLIN  Officially, East Germany is an atheist Marxist society. Officially, both the Protestant and Roman Oatholic churches in the East are cut off from official support from the church in the West.

title: HearingAid Rules Urged on Senators As Inquiry Begins
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (AP) Many of the hearing aid systems now in use in the United States are of little or no help to those who wear them, Mayo Clinic official says.

title: Does the Fed Bend in an Election Year?
description: WASHINGTON  The oracles trying to divine the course of Federal Reserve monetary policy this year hay, had to ask themselves unavoidably, though ??? ably unfairlywhat difference it will make that 1976 is an election year.

title: Parade Supports Harlem Crime Fight
description: They marched through Harlem lyesterday, up its most depress ing thoroughfare, over rubbish and past addicts to showed they cared.

title: Ballet: Rock Around the City Center
description: Three ballets with a wide range of rock music made up the rock evening that the City Center Joffrey Ballet put together Friday night at the City Center. Deuce Coupe II, set by Twyla Tharp to the Beach Boys, has already been reviewed, but Margo Sappington's Weewis and Gerald Arpino's Trinity were performed for the first time this season.

title: French Set Off Atom Blast Underground on Pacific Isle
description: PARIS, April 3 (AP)France announced today that it had set off a nuclear explosion at its underground testing station In the Pacific, and cources familiar with the French nuclear program said it probably involved equipment resistant to antimissile devices.

title: Island Trees: Rebuttal Time
description: JOHN CARR drives a tractortrailer truck in the Bronx. He wears his green uniform to a public meeting, and his hands can't quite lose the grit and grease of his rugged job.

title: DINING OUT
description: IT gets to be more obvious all the time. The Spanish restaurants in New Jersey are among the state's best. They may not always be in the best locationsfrom a suburban point of viewbut their standards of excellence are uniformly high, their menus are original and, top anyone accustomed to bored, Indifferent service, the Spanish dining room crews are a delightful surprise.

title: JEWISH HOSPITAL AGREES TO A SALE
description: Long Island Jewish Hospital agreed to sell its South Shore. Far Rockaway division last week to a private group that plans to move the facility over the next five years from Queens to the Five Towns area of Nassau County.

title: A Defensible Border Is the Constant Goal
description: JERUSALEMIsrael'a settlement policy in the occupied territories is the source of controversy not only internationally but also within the country and the Government. Since 1967 Israel has set up 55 settlementsparamilitary, agricultural villages and urban centerson territory taken from the Arab states during the 1967 war.

title: Amniocentesis: Checking On Babies Not Yet Born
description: Many months before Isabel Ashton was born March 19. her parents and her sisters knew two things about her that most families have to wait until birth to find out. They knew she was a girl, and they knew she didn't have Down's syndrome, a common form of severe mental retardation, more generally called mongolism.

title: 101 IN G.O.P. DECRY RATINGS ON VOTES
description: WASHINGTON  One hundred and one members of the House of Representatives, nearly all of then Republicans, have joined in formally protesttag that it is unfair for citizen groups to rate them on the basis of their voting records.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: SEATTLESix years ago, Walter Schoenfeld quietly ran a profitable family necktie business with sales of about $1 million a year, sat on the boards of several corporations and no one ever heard of him.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: ONE of the easiest things to sow in the soil of Long Island is dissension, and it grows faster than potatoes when it comes to talking about North Shore and South Shore.

title: RECORDINGS VIEW
description: Whenever a conductor feels the need to create a major impression these daysto show off his orchestra, himself or possibly both he is likely to program Mahler. For one thing, Mahler's gigantic symphonies exploit practically every resource of a modern symphony orchestra. For another, the expressive content of the music is so explicit, intense and graphic, that audiences often transfer the heroic struggles of the work itself to the man on the podium who is making it all happen. I am Mahler, Leonard Bernstein was once quoted as saying and his close identification with the Austrian composer typifies the kind of personal impact his music makes on late 20thcentury audiences When performed by a thoroughly involved interketer. On a broader level, concertgoers seem to have accepted Mahler as the ultimate musical reflection of our age of anxiety. just as musicians 100 years ago regarded Beethoven as the personification of 19thcentury romantic idealism.

title: F.B.I.'S TARDINESS IS FACING INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 Justice Department lawyers, stung by the belated discovery that agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation had committed 92 burglaries at the Socialist Workers Party's offices, will take steps to find out why the bureau failed to produce the information sooner, a wellplaced department source said.

title: CORRECTION
description: An item in the Notes on People column in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly said that a motion picture about China would be shown toniglit for the benefit of Representative Bella S. Abzug's Senate campaign. The benefit will raise money for a delegate slate pledged to the Presidential campaign of Morris K. Udall.

title: Urban League Develops a HealthCare Project
description: With cartoons, videotapes, colored brochures and buttons featuring salmonella bacteria over the caption Guess Who's Coming to Dinner? the National Urban League has been attempting in recent months to reach lowincome minoritygroup consumers with preventive healthcare information.

title: The Reason Is Neither New Nor Complex: Americans Are Using More
Experts Discuss Mysteries of Shifting Ocean Floors
description: Indonesia is doomed to he crushed between Australia and Asia. South America is devouring its own west coast. And Japan, once attached to Asia, has been dragged out to sea.

title: YOUTHS MAY GET JAIL ALTERNATIVE
description: In the fall of 1973, on a visit to the Westchester County Jail with members of the Scarsdalel Friends Bail Project, Elizabeth Saenger met a 16yearold boy who had been in the jail for three weeks, charged with trespassing on high school grounds.

title: 6 Guards, 6 Others Accused of Looting Old Linco ln Hospital
description: Twelve persons, including six guards hired by Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx to protect its former home from looters and vandals, were arrested yesterday and charged with stealing from the old hospital, the police reported.

title: Beame Obiects to Any Delay in Balancing the Budget
description: Proposals that the city consider abandoning its threeyear austerity plan and try to stretch out its budgetbalancing schedule over a longer period are being criticized as impractical and illusory by Beame officials, the City Comptroller and the staff director of the Emergency Financial Control Board.

title: Senior Prom, With Dance Cards And Fox Trot, Is Back at Vassar
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y:, April 3It all began around 9:30 last night when the band broke into a spirited version Of the Marine Corps hymn. It was Grand March time. Two by two, the Vassar students and their dates, most of them in various degrees of formal dress, the women clutching dance cards, marched into the main lounge of the College Center here.

title: Paperbacks
description: THE COMPLETE STORIES, by Franz Katica. (Schocken, $5.95.) Stories, parables, longer talesall the narratives Kafka wrote except his three novels; this welltranslated collection demonstrates his versatility and meticulous attention to style. THE DARK IS RISING, by Susan Cooper. (Atheneum/Aladdin, $1.95.) Ancient images reverberate in this dramatic, richly conceived fantasy for 10 to 14yearolds; second volume in a projected cycle by a Newbery Prizewinner about a cosmic struggle between good and evil.

title: BRIDGE
description: All bridge contests, one might think, have some or all of the following features in common: There are at least eight contestants; every player has a permanent partner; and the opponents are physically present:

title: In Midtown, A Collision Of Planners And Planned
description: Frankly, we are damned if we do and damned if we don't, Deputy Mayor Stanley Friedman recently told a standingroomonly crowd of East Side residents, community leaders and elected representatives packed by the bus load into the Board of Estimate chambers at City Hall.

title: Injunction Issued to Close Queens Massaoe Parlor
description: The city has obtained a ternporary restraining order in State Supreme Court in Queens in an effort to close the Personal Touch, a massage parlor that opened recently at 9549 Roosevelt Avenue in the Corona section.

title: ART
description: LIKE many young artists living on Long Island, Susan Zises has been establishing a reputation by showing her work extensively in local museums and galleries. Her art has been seen at the Parrish Art Museum, the Yellow House Gallery in Huntington and the Graphic Eye Gallery in Port Washington, a cooperative of which she is a member. She now has a onewoman show at the Nassau County Center for the art.

title: The Woman Athlete: Struggle for Identity
description: Lynda Huey has taught at Oberlin College in Ohio, Federal city College in Washington, D. C.; California Poly, San Luis Obispo, and Mira Costa College in California. At age 28, she still runs occasionally for the California team known as Wilt's Wonder Women. This article is excerpted from the new book, A Running Start, by Lynda Huey. Copyright 1976 by Quadrangle/The New York Times Book Company.

title: How Great Are Those `Greatest Hits'?
description: The bestselling album in America today is The Eagles Their Greatest Hits 197175  Currently dotting the pop charts are 14 other Greatest Hits or Best Of collections, the most popular tracks culled from the hit records of such major performers as John Denver, Elton John and Simon and Garfunkel. Many of these disks have been bestsellers for two years or longerJohnny Mathis's Greatest Hits, for example, released in 1962, still sells 1,500 cop. week.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: IT was somehow to be expected that perhaps the state police would have set up roadblocks across Morris Avenue, that maybe even the Union County sheriff would have a posse on hand or, at the very least, that the local Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals would have rounded up a core of enforcers that Sunday morning.

title: This Week in Sports
description: Hockey

title: Why Me?
description: If wishes were good advice, we would not need parents. grandparents: teachers, ministers, doctors and guidance counselors. And if you believe Jenny, the heroine of Why Me? you do not really need any of these people in your life anyway because they are universally uninterested, unyielding, callous and/or insensitive. Of course, Jenny does not help matters any by being indecisive, inarticulate and terribly boring.

title: For young readers
description: If children could write their own books, we might have some idea of what they liked to read. As it is. however. they are the captive audience of grownup authors who must rediscover the child in themselves in order to communicate. The hard truth is that very few authors do this wellfor adults are the victims of formed attitudes about the world. They have messages to impart. They wish to teach.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Real World Of Real Estate

title: Helpful Hints for the Hopeful
description: LOOKING for a summer job? Can you make beds, wait on tables, change diapers or wash pots and pans?

title: Nigerian Demand That Britain Extradite Gowon, ExChief of State, Said to Produce Crisis in Relations
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, April 3A demand by the Nigerian Government that Britain extradite Gen. Yakubu Gowon, the former head of state, has brought relations between the two nations to a crisis, in the view of Western analysts here.

title: Loss of Home Deposits Stirs Action in State
description: Three years ago, Mr. and Mrs. James Richardson decided they were finally ready to build a house in the suburbs.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: There is more to being a photographer than merely having a camera and knowing how to manipulate its controls to get a satisfactory picture. A creative photographer should be able to concentrate on the picture, rather than the machinery and technology that makes It, so he or she must be familiar with the equipment; but the photographer has to understand his or her special way of seeing and then be able to use the craft of photography to express this idea.

title: Ron Lets the Ghosts Out
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., April 3The best hitter and finest outfielder in the long history of WCBSTV was standing on his head with his feet braced against the wire backstop of a baseball diamond on Payson Field, the complex where the New York Mets are training farmhands for service in Tidewater, Va., Jackson, Miss., Lynchburg, Va., Wausau, Wis., and Marion, v a. In  the two years I was away, he said, I was doing other things, stretching exercises, developing the upper body, like this. Pushing down with his palms, he hoisted his head off the ground, straightening his arms, lowered himself until his cap touched the grass, hoisted himself again. And pullups, he said, stepping over to chin himself on a bar above a gate in the backstop. Result, when I started working out here I didn't have the stiffness I used to have when I was playing. Doing a split, he bent at the waist, this way and that. I don't want to do too much of this now, he said, getting to his feet. because I'm going to swing at some live pitching.

title: Leslie Wingate Bride Of Conrad J. Markert
description: Leslie Joan Wingate and Conrad John Markert, 1974 graduates of Ithaca College, were married last evening in the Cotillion Room of the Prierre by Rabbi Eugene Sack of Garfield Temple in Brooklyn.

title: What Is Atlantic Richfield Up To?
Notes: Who Won The Primaries? NBCSort Of
description: Who won the New Hampshire, Massachusetts and Florida Presidential primaries? In the eyes of NBC, there was only one winner: NBC. After each state contest, the network claimed victory over its rivals in the 11:30 P.M. special reports of election results on primary night.

title: Editors'
description: Fiction

title: Breadth of Jewish Community Discussed by Rabbi and Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, April 3The head of the American Jewish Congress maintained yesterday that the American Jewish community, no longer forced into a physical or psychological ghetto, had stopped regarding antiSemitism as a problem.

title: Cyprus: Tourists Are Coming Back
description: On my first visit to Cyprus in June. 1974, I was staying at the ledra Palace Hotel in Nicosia, a lovely pile of warm yellow stone. One evening I wandered through the huge Venetian walls that ring the old city and ran into the green line, the border between Greek and Turkish quarters. Streets and buildings had been severed by barriers of wood, wire, barrels, sandbags and fear. The shock was like seeing a fresh, bleeding wound. I began to understand Cyprus.

title: Rising Electric Bills Drive Consumers to Organize
description: Sharply rising electric utility bills have produced a surge of consumer protests acrossi the nation, resulting in a number of organized efforts to achieve reductions.

title: Ellen Wilcox Engaged to Joseph Salvo
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Walter Wilcox 5th of West Hartford, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ellen Sanborn Wilcox, to Joseph Roy Salvo of Cromwell. Conn., a public relations representative with the Hartford Insurance Company. with which the bridetohe is a claims systems analyst.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: Andre Kertesz is the photographer who can make even New York City seem small, intimate and lovable. So it would be a mistake to expect the charming, innocent Paris of his photographs (currently on view at the French Cultural Services) to resemble the earthier Paris of Brassai or CartierBresson, much less the real Paris with its traffic jams and exasperating crowds.

title: The New York Primary
description: For the first time in modern history, the voters of this state have an opportunity to participate directly in the choice of a Presidential nominee. Changes in the law have enabled those seeking election as delegates to their party's national convention to list, below their names, the Presidential candidate whom they favor. This simple reform has altered the New York primary on Tuesday from an Easter egg hunt into a relatively rational political process.

title: Swede Wins Auto Race
description: ADENAU, West Germany, April 3 (UPI)  Conny Andersson of Sweden in a Mach 763won aFormula Three auto race today on the Tuerburgring. Riccardo Patrese of Italy in a Chevron B34 was second. Andersson covered the 90 miles in 40 minutes 16.8 seconds, averaging 92 miles an hour.

title: Who Moves, and Why?
description: JACK SMITH, who owns three McDonald's Restaurant franchises in Southeast Queens, is a new homeowner in Hewlett. He moved from Sheepshead Bay in Brooklyn, even though he estimated that his overall realestate taxes might go up 20 to 25 per cent.

title: Record Is Broken For 4Mile Relay
description: AUSTIN, Tex., April 3 (AP)  Wilson Waigwa lifted TexasEl Paso to a Texas Relays record in the fourmile relay today with a blistering 3:58.6 anchor leg and Arizona State stole part of the show with a recordsmashing sprint relay victory.

title: Protesters Occupy Hostos 10th Day to Bar Closing
description: The occupation of Hostas Community College by a faculty and student group went into its 10th day yesterday, with the protesters vowing to remain in the school until the Board of Higher Education agrees to keep it open.

title: For young readers
description: Little Sister's wicked stepmother and stepsister make her do all the housework and farmwork, and treat her terribly. She accepts her lot with irrepressible good spirits. As many small action pictures charmingly show, she devotes herself with touching absorption to each task, be it scrubbing, spinning, cutting hedges or milking the cow, which she never forgets to pat tenderly on the nose and gratefully say, Good Daisy! At one with herself and in tune with nature. Little Sister grows prettier every day.

title: Spray Painting Pointers
description: Spring Is traditionally paintup and fixup time around the house, and one tool that most people will find useful for many chores is a can of aerosolpacked spray paint. These spray paints now come in almost every conceivable finishenamel, flat, stain, varnish, shellac and lacquer  and they are made for use over almost every type of wood, metal or plastic surface (the label on the can will explain its limitations, if any).

title: West Europe Resents U.S. Pressure Against Cabinet Posts for Communists
description: LUXEMBOURG, April 3Al though none of the West European leaders who met at the Common Market Conference, here this week would welcome Communists into any of their governments, informal talks made it clear that the United States campaign against Cornmunist participation had only irritated the whole range of political opinion in Europe.

title: A Jazz Giant Explores Rock
description: At the beginning of the 1970's Miles Davis announced that he Intended to assemble the world's greatest rock and roll band. Coming from almost any other performer, this would have seemed an idle boast, but Davis was then and remains the single most influential Jiving musician in the field of modern jazz. During the course of his long career he has altered the direction of the development of jazz, not just once or twice but many times.

title: A Witches'
description: Bud Harrelson crossed the threshold into the New York Mets clubhouse in Florida the other day on one good and one bad knee, and shouted into the halfempty room: I'm not a free agent, anybody!

title: Senate Votes to Tighten Killer Whale Protection
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (UPI) The Senate has approved and sent to the house a bill to protect socalled killer whales that are neither killers nor whales.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Elmore Leonard's FiftyTwo Pickup was well received when it was published about two years ago. It was a tough blackmail novel, set in Detroit, that had critics making comparisons with Raymond Chandler and George V. Higgins. Leonard's new novel, SWAG (Delacorte $7.95), retains the Detroit locale, and this one too will have the critics mentioning Chandler and Higginsit's that good.

title: Black Cosmetics Lure White Producers
description: The black cosmetics market has grown big enough to lure the companies that had catered just to whites. Beauty preparations aimed at blacks are a $500 million a year business today, according to trade publications. Now Max Factor has its Beautiful Bronzes line of makeup, Revlon offers Polished Ambers, and Avon drops in with its Shades of Beauty makeup bases.

title: Decaying Facades A Latent Hazard To Pedestrians
description: Keeping up a good front, even in the best of times, is more than cosmetics in the real estate community: it is a matter of public safety.

title: Lynn Ann Vanderwist to Wed in August
description: Mr. and Mrs. Donald C. Vanderwist of Pepper Pike, Ohio, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lynn Ann Vanderwist of New York, to Frederick C. Kentz 3d, son of Judge Frederick C. Kentz Jr. of the Superior Court of New Jersey and Mrs. Kentz of Summit, N. J.

title: How to Live To Be 100
description: Scratch an Anthropologist and you will find, more often than not, beneath the surface armor of professional abstractions proclaiming the need for a science of man, a romantic visionary in search of a world more benign than our own. Sula Benet, anthropologist and author of How to Live to Be 100 is no exception to the tradition best exemplified by Ruth Benedict, whose Patterns of Culture extolled the way of life of the Pueblo Indians. Sula Benet's Shangrila is in the Soviet Caucasus where people not only appear to be more humane, serene and socially engaged than we are, but also where they live to great agesoften well beyond the 100 years of her title What's more, these vigorous mountain people enjoy good health and long lives without the benefits of modern medicine or the technological marvels of sanitation. Though they are of different, ethnic stocks, speak different languages and engage in a variety of occupations ranging from horticulture to horse raising, all of them appear to spend the years of their age in excellent health, participating fully in family work and community life.

title: Summer Jobs: Where to Hunt
description: There are only five or six openings on the boats that ply the waters of the Great South Bay for what some regard as the most prized summer job onor offLong Island. Although the Jobs pay only the minimum wage ($2.30 an hour) and require a good deal of physical work, hundreds of young people have applied for them.

title: Six Democrats to Be on Ballot In Connecticut Primary May 11
description: HARTFORD, April 3  Six Democratic candidates were left in the running today in the Presidential primaries scheduled in Connecticut for May 11, but it is a complicated affair in which all six contenders could be losers.

title: Pauline Kael, still going steady
description: If it were possible to choose a single characteristic that accounts for Pauline Kael's animation and charm as a movie reviewer, I would say it was her irrepressible enthusiasm. At a time when many critics of the arts are expressing feelings of dejection, even a sense of apocalypse about their subjects, Miss Kael continues to write about movies with the breathless delirium of one smitten with young love. Always poised to recognize achievement, she is as eager to embrace talent as some others are to revile it, and even when she dislikes a film, she still manages to convey her unshakable devotion to the movie medium.

title: 3 CRITICS IN BRAZIL CURBED BY GEISEL
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 3 Three opposition congressmen were stripped of their office and political rights this week by President Ernesto Geisel, sparking another round of debate among legislators and in the press about the president's promises to liberalize the rightwing military regime in Brazil.

title: What's Doing Around CHARLOTTESVILLE, VIRGINIA
description: TRADITION  Charlottesville is known chiefly as the home of Thomas Jefferson and the University of Virginia, which he founded. But the area's softly rolling hills in the shadow of the Blue Ridge Mountains were home also to other men who shaped the early United States. Presidents Madison and Monroe lived nearby. Albemarle County, in which Charlottesville lies, was settled by folk who left the security of Virginia's eastern shore in the 18th century. Their enterprising spirit was epitomized in the 19th century by native son Meriwether Lewis, Jefferson's personal secretary, who undertook with William Clark to find the Northwest Passage. The early tobacco plantations around Charlottesville vanished long ago, but the region's rural lifestyle remains. Even today the landscape is one of rustic beauty, of cattle and horse f arms, of stately mansions, of historic markers and of small country stores. The area around Charlottesville is particularly beautiful in the spring when the vast apple and peach orchards are in bloom, the dogwoods and magnolias flower and the smell of honeysuckle is in the air.

title: Murder in Philadelphia
description: When the Supreme Court heard arguments last week on the constitutionality of capital punishment, there seemed to be two basic questions: Is the death penalty cruel and unusual punishment and therefore unconstitutional in every case? If not, do the laws passed by the Federal Government and 35 states to make capital punishment mandatory in specified cases meet the test of cunstitutionality?

title: $7.5 Billion in Aid Is Urged For SubSaharan Countries
description: DAKAR, Senegal, April 31 (Agence FrancePresse)  The parched countries of subSaharan Africa will need $7.5 billion in aid to attain selfsufficiency in food production, according to United Nations experts.

description: And now for this year's trick that presto!, will win the pennant for the Yankees.

title: Insurance: A Variety Of Options
description: If a passenger's checkedin baggage is worth more than the basic $500 domestic and $9.07 per pound international liability limits, he can purchase extra insurance. The simplest of these is excess valuation, which can he bought at the ticket counter when he checks, in. However, this insurance can apply only to personal property as is necessary or appropriate for wear, use, comfort and convenience of the passenger for the purpose of the trip. It does not cover money, jewelry, silverware, negotiable papers, securities, business documents, paintings, antiques, artifacts, manuscripts, irreplaceable books or publications or other similar valuables.

title: GARDENING
description: APRIL is daffodil time. There are so many kinds of daffodils in so many sizes and colors that they can turn the April garden into an enchanted land. In New Jersey, however, a few, like the tiny trumpet Narcissus asturiensis from the Asturias Mountains in northern Spain, sometimes open at the beginning of March; some others, such:as the poet daffodils, bloom about May I.

title: National League: Pirates and Reds, 1975 Division Winners, Add More Strength
description: The East's answer to the Cincinnati Reds, they have won five division titles in six years. Pitching staff has not had a 20game winner since Vernon Law in 1960, but it was deep and now gains Doc Medich from the Yankees. And they hit like furies: 138 home runs, most in the league.

description: MONTCLAIR, N.J., April 3 San Jose State University successfully defended its team foil title at the 48th national Intercollegiate Women's Fencing Association championships which ended today at Montclair State College. The champion California team scored a record of 111 victories and had only five losses in the twoday meet.

title: If You Go .. .
description: ...anywhere in the eastern Mediterranean, you can include a stop in Cyprus along the way. Cyprus Airlines flies to Larnaca, on the Creek side, from Athens, Salonika, Boirut, Tel Aviv, Cairo and London. Olympic Airways also flies daily from Athens. Roundtrip fare from Athens is about $140; from London, about $415. Boats, which alcg carry cars, sail about once a we^k from Athens, Beirut and Tel. Aviv. If you want to enter on the Turkish sidewhich I do not recommendTurkish Cypriot Airlines flies regularly from Adana to Tymbou. Ferryboats also ply between the Turkish port of Mersin and Famagusta, on the east coast of Cyprus. Renting a car is the most convenient way of getting around the country. We rented a Mazda for about $11 a day plus gas from the Hilton.

An anonymous telephone caller told the Italian news agency ANSA that the fire had been started by the Red Brigades, an urban leftist guerrilla group that kbinapped and released a Fiat executive some months ago.

This was the mercy killing that led to the courtroom drama Paige Mitchell describes in a book full of Dostoyevskian psychological overtones and trial maneuvers reminiscent of the fictional best seller, Anatomy of Murder.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: In a way, Robert Conte was the dare, I don't expect to spend much time on the expansive, expostulating, enchantingly slowontheuptake Mr. Conte this morning, though paragraphs could be writtenno, sonnets should be written, he deserves better than proseon the manly pride he takes in serving as dressmaker's dummy for Eliza Doolittle's first fancyball gown, or on the resolute manner in which he twitches his mustache in order to stimulate his thinking processes while calling Scotland Yard. But when original producer Herman Levin decided upon a fullscale revival of My Fair Lady lust 20 years after its first breathtaking opening, and when he decided to recast Mr. Coote in the role he had created to begin with, he was in effect both symbolizing and adding to the risk he knew he was taking: the risk of jogging memory. Everyone was already asking if it wasn't a hit too soon to he renewing our acquaintance with a musicalcomedy masterpiece that had run forever in the first place, already wondering if we'd he able to erase the likes of Rex Harrison and Julie Andrews from our heads. And wouldn't putting Mr. Coote back in his old place, surrounded by new faces that might seem only substitutes, serve to accent. what was different, what was missing, what lost?

title: CALIFORNIA TO BAN GAS PILOT LIGHTS
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., April (AP)California has moved to ban pilot lights on new ranges and other appliances by 1978 in an action aimed at saving huge amounts of natural gas.

title: Voracious Olympics: Survival Problem
description: In the aftermath of that charming Winter Olympic spectacle that brought the Austrian Tyrol to the attention of the world, it is prudent to ask not only if the flame will burn. again at Lake Placid, N.Y., in 1980 but also if it will be proper to strike the match.

title: Yugoslav Chorus Warms to Task With 16 Languages and Dialects
description: Yugoslavia's Branko Krsnianovich Chorus, dating back to 1884, is making its sixth North American tour since 1960. But its appearance Friday evening in Carnegie Hall was only its first appearance in Manhattan in 11 years.

title: New &
description: The narrator of this truly epic voyage is a young Irish mess steward named Patrick, who ships out in a 1941 convoy of freighters bound from Liverpool to Halifax. On the passage westward, the convoy loses five ships to submarines. On the passage home, the flotilla is intercepted by a German pocket battleship. This is the crucial disaster in the novelPatrick loses his ship, the use of a leg and his memory.

description: Marina Wallach Stern and A. G. Newmyer 3d, both of Washington, plan to be married May 8 in New York.

title: Classic Use of Computers: Research in Greek
description: Research in the classics that once took months or even years can now be accomplished in minutes with the help of a computerized data bank of the classical Greek language. Eventually the system will store 90 million words to form the first thesaurus of the language.

title: America for the Future
description: An appropriate, imaginative and highly rewarding way to celebrate this country's twohundredth birthday is now available to Americans who are oppressed by the commercialisra of the Bicentennial, tired of television's oneminute scraps of history and a little put off by selfconscious reenactments, in full regalia, of local skirmishes against the troops of George III.

title: Bond Broker Jailed
description: ROCHESTER, April 3 (AP)Paul R. Dean, a former bond broker here, was given a prison term of up to seven years on charges of writing $2.5 million in worthless checks to buy 15,000 shares of Xerox Corporation stock. Mr. Dean, whose brokerage business collapsed in 1973, had been convicted on three counts of seconddegree grand larceny. Three other counts were dismissed.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor:

title: REV. JAMES M'GOVERN
description: The Rev. James J. McGovern, since 1966 pastor of St. Camillus Roman Catholic Church, 19915 Rockaway Beach Boule vard, Rockaway Beach, Queens, died Thursday in the rectory. He was 68 years old.

title: World News Briefs
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, April (UPI)President Idi Amin of Uganda said today that he planned to send troops to aid black guerrillas fighting Rhodesia's white regime, the official Uganda radio reported.

title: Talia Gulino Fiancee of S. J. Dillahey Jr.
description: Talia Clare Gulino of Plainsboro, N. J. a piano teacher at the Westminster Choir College in Princeton, N. J., and Samuel J. Dillahey Jr., a Europeanstudies teacher at the Peddie School in Hightstown. N. J.. plan to he married in June at the Princeton University Chapel.

title: Wild Beasts on Show
description: The exhibition that John Elderfield has organized under the title The Wild Beasts': Fauvism and Its Affinities, at the Museum of Modern Art, is an event to rejoice in It focuses on one of the happiest moments in the history of modern paintinga moment when happiness itself, le bonheur, loomed as an unashamed subject for artists of high ambition and high spiritsand it illuminates the vicissitudes of that brief, brilliant period with a scrupulous intelligence. Spring is unlikely to bring us many pleasures greater than those to be found in this delightful exhibition, which fills the eye with some of the freshest and most delectable images ever committed to canvas and et has the additional virtue, for those of us interested in the development of artistic ideas, of clarifying one of the legendary episodes in the annals of the French avantgarde.

title: A Thinker at the Keyboard
description: Eight years ago, Lorin Hollander, child prodigy turned adult virtuoso, made a recording of Schubert sonatas, listened to a playback, thought ill of it, and thereupon declared a moratorium on recordings. He has stuck to his renunciation, with the exception of a single live concert album documenting his 1969 appearance at the Fillniore East, at that time New York's headquarters far rock music. Recordings should be made, Hollander feels, only when the performer's views have crystallized to a point worth preserving. This, he admits, was hardly the case during his mid 20's a period of intense inward change.

title: Elegant Sea Pines Offshore and All But Broke
description: HILTON HEAD, S.C.Most of the spectators following Hubert, Green, Jack Nicklaus and other champions as they competed in the Heritage Classic golf tournament last weekend were unaware that they were treading on green acres of debt.

title: Privilege for the Multitudes
description: It looks like a credit card, it feels like a credit card,. and it takes up space in your wallet like a credit card. But Holiday Inn's new green and yellow cardwhich is being mailed to 2 million of what the company calls its Inner Circle  is a privilege card.

title: Faculty and Deans Assail Head of Boston University
At 100, West Sider Still Makes Them Laugh
description: Estelle Asiel Pollatschek, who celebrated her 100th birthday yesterday, sat quietly in a long black dress while friends and relatives made a fuss over her. But when it came to humor at the birthday party in her honor, she had the last word.

title: About New York
description: At 10:45 yesterday morning. 30 minutes before the start of the service, a line had already formed outside the Marble Collegiate Church.

title: Bicentennial Barge in Financial Fog
description: Even before its launching. the Bicentennial Barge, a $1.5 million historical showboat that will ply New York State's waterways this summer, has run into some heavy weather.

title: A Choice For Israel
description: Those who believe that Israel can gain security by holding on to occupied Arab territory indefinitely should have been shaken in that view by recent events. Disturbances in the West Bank were followed by the first serious incidents in 28 years among Arab citizens of Israel itself.

title: S.E.C, IS CRITICIZED BY OUTGOING AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, April 4  A smolderIng argument within the Securities and Exchange Commission flared up publicly over the weekend as a departing commissioner charged that the agency had exceeded its authority in handling the question of dubious corporate payments and had failed terribly in its responsibility by refusing to set standards of conduct.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said yesterday in Paris that he had canceled the Soviet navy's rights to use Egyptian ports and that he believed Moscow might be planning to establish bases in Libya. He disclosed this among other things at a meeting with Egyptian students and other Egyptians living in Paris, and later at a news conference. Mr. Sadat said that Libya had ordered $11 billion in arms from the Soviet Union and said that the accumulation of arms already stocked in Libya was impressive. He said that Egypt was now turning to France, among other countries, to build its own arms industry, and that Egypt had asked the United States for other weapons besides the six transport planes whose delivery is now being debated in Congress. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: UDALL GETS BACKING OF MISS HOLTZMAN
Jackson and Udall Push New York Drive
Doyle Dane Bernbach Likes Pyramid Motif
description: Doyle Dane Bernbach could never be accused of being square, but it does have a thing for pyramids.

title: Seaver Tunes Up; Salary Pitch Next
Zaire Relies on I.M.F. and Austerity to Get Moving
description: KINSHASA, Zaire  Economically, Zaire is in a state of suspended animation. work on tne nuge new TenkeFungarume copper field, a $700 million venture, has stopped. So has the construction of the world's largest powertransmission line, which a United States contractor was stringing up through 1,600 miles of forest and bush.

title: Nuclear Test Protested
description: TOKYO, April 4 (Reuters)The municipal government of Nagasaki, which was devastated by an atomic bomb in 1945, has protested to France about the French underground nuclear test in the South Pacific on Friday. The protest was made in a telegram lo the French ambassador here.

title: Ship Missing in Pacific
description: TOKYO, April 4 (Reuters)The Liberianregistered freighter Delphi was reported missing in the western Pacific near Okinawa today after three of its crewmen died in an engineroom fire yesterday. The Japanese Maritime Safety Agency said that an air and surface search had failed to find the 8,796ton ship.

title: Party in Germany Headed by Schmidt Loses a State Vote
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, April 4The Social Democratic Party of Chancellor Helmut Schmidt suffered a major setback today in elections in the southwestern German state of BadenWiirttemberg. It was the last such test of voter sentiment before national elections Oct. 3.

title: 20 Lengths Back, One on Aisle Wins
description: ARCADIA, Calif., April 4 (AP)One on the Aisle rallied from more than 20 lengths behind on the backstretch to capture the $125,000 San Juan Capistrano Handicap on a wet grass course at Santa Anita today.

title: Jobless Insurance Claims Filed by State Prisoners
description: Unemployment insurance benefits for state prisoners? Assemblyman Benjamirr P. Roosa Jr., Republican of Beacon, N.Y., was stunnedfirst when he heard that three prisoners at the Fishkill Correctioinal Facility in his district had applied for it, and then even more when he learned that one had actually collected.

title: Sihanouk Resigns
description: Prince Norodom Sihanouk, Cambodia's nominal head of state, resigned, a Phnom Penh radio broadcast announced. The Prince will live in Cambodia on an MOOGayear pension. Details on Page 13.

title: YUGOSLAV SOPRANO SINGS AIDA AT MET
description: The Metropolitan Opera introduced a soprano new to New York in the title role of Verdi's Aida in the performance of the work given Saturday night. She is Ljiljana MolnarTalajic, of Yugoslavia, who has appeared as Aida with European companies, including La Scala and the Vienna State Opera and, in 1969, with the San Francisco Opera. She replaced Montserrat Caballe, who was originally scheduled to appear.

title: Pope Paul Denounces Horrible Insinuations
description: ROME, April 4 (AP)Pope Paul VI declared today that a printed accusation that he was a homosexual was a horrible and slanderous insinuation.

title: Pledge by Kissinger
description: Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, speaking to the American Jewish Conference, pledged that the United States would never abandon Israel, and asked that the two nations not paralyze themselves through suspiciousness. Page 8

title: WESTERN EUROPE RECOVERING FAST
description: PARIS, April 4Despite the currency troubles that continue to plague Western Europe, economic activity is picking up even faster than government officials predicted several months ago, and some slight progress is being made in curbing unusually high unemployment and inflation.

title: Abacus Is Still Handy, Bank of China Finds
description: TIENTSIN, ChinaAny Westerner who needs a reminder of the changes wrought in his everyday life by computers would do well to wander into one of the bigger branches of the Bank of China.

title: Duncan of Orioles Promises Jackson Shirt Off His Back
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 4  Reggie Jackson wasn't here with the Baltimore Orioles today, but his uniform number was. And the man who was wearing that No. 9 said Jackson would not be far behind.

title: Udall, Baffled by Carter's Success, Tests His Campaign Style Tomorrow
description: MILWAUKEE, April 4At times Morris K. Udall has seemed to be annoyed by Jimmy Carter but, even more, the Arizona Congressman is baffled by the former Governor of Georgia.

title: Costs at Leading Colleges Going Over $7,000 a Year
description: The relentless increase in the cost of going to college will continue next fall as tuitions at many of the country's lead. ing private institutions climb over the $4,000 mark for the first time and total annual charges push above $7,000.

title: Senegal Frees Prisoners To Mark Its Anniversary
description: DAKAR, Senegal April 4 (Agence FrancePresse)Senegal's last remaining political prisonersbelieved to be fewer than 10  were freed today under an amnesty marking the country's 16th independence anniversary.

title: Rockefeller Returns From 6Nation Tour
description: Vice President Rockefeller returned from his sixnation tour yesterday, saying that the capitals he visited wondered if they could still count on America.

title: Byrne Tells Prosecutors They Have Organized Crime on the Run
description: TRENTON, April 4The state's 21 County Prosecutors received some glad tidings from Governor Byrne when they gathered in Atlantic City over the weekend for their annual conference.

title: OTB, 5, Hopes to Grow; Betting Stigma Persists
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation, which celebrates its fifth birthday on Thursday with dreams of enormous expansion into betting on baseball, football and basketball, has not yet shaken off the stigma born in the back rooms of furtive bookmakers that it is still somewhat sinful to wager on a horse away from the track.

title: Payoffs to U.S. Meat. Inspectors Are Found CommoninCity Area
description: Federal investigators have uncovered evidence of widespread payments by meat packers and processors to Agriculture Department food inspectors in the New York area a corrupt practice that apparently has been going on for years.

title: Scheinblum Connects
description: TOKYO, April 4 (UPI)Richie Seheinbhun, former Kansas City player, hit his first home run of the season for Hiroshima in a 44 tie with Hanshin in the Central League today.

title: Bergson Trio Offers Unfamiliar Pieces
description: The quality and diversity of American music were exceld lently set forward Saturday night at Alice Tully Hall in a concert of unfamiliar pieces played by the Bergson Trio. The trio (Toni Rapport, violinist; Leshek Zavistovski, cellist; Martin Katz, pianist) is a firstrate ensemble, combining big, warmtone string playing with the crisp articulation of Mr. Katz's playing. The trio plays with individuality and oneness, with an ability to adapt its style to the piece at hand and, most welcome, ,a flair for deadpan musical humor.

title: Auto Race Won By Yarborough
description: NORTH WILKESBORO, N. C., April 4 (AP)  Cale Yarborough, enjoying a comfortable lead from the early stages of the race, set a sizzling pace today and held off Richard Petty for victory in the 16th annual Gwyn Staley 400 stock car race.

title: MOYNIHAN TESTS POLITICAL WINDS
description: BUFFALO,April 4Daniel P. Moynihan stumped exuberantly across upstate New York today, extolling the Presidential qualifications of Senator Henry M. Jackson in Tuesday's primary and testing his own potential as a candidate.

title: Medical Society of Illinois To Start Insurance Concern
description: CHICAGO, April 4 (AP) board of trustees of the Illinois State Medical Society has voted at a special meeting to start its own insurance company to provide malpractice insurance for doctors.

title: Quiet Is Out and Jazz Is In at Library
description: SHREWSBURY, April 4John H. Livingstone Jr., the director of the Monmouth County Library system, ordinarily looks forward to Sundays  particularly the Sundays he isits the library system's Shrewsbury branch. rolls up his sleeves and starts converting the main reading room into a music room, which is usually packed with people.

title: Statewide Festival Urged
description: PRINCETON, April 4 (UPI)New Jersey's Commissioner of Labor and Industry, Joseph A. Hoffman, this weekend proposed a statewide 10day gala festival in 1977 to publicize the state's tourist industry. Mr. Hoffman said the festival, to be called, the 10 Days of New Jersey, would involve all residents and would attract thousands of tourists to the state.

title: Carter Takes the Lead in Delegate Selections in Kansas Counties
description: TOPEKA, Kan., April 4 (AP) Jimmy Carter took the lead in delegate selections in yesterday's Democratic caucuses in Kansas counties, but the biggest bloc of delegates elected is uncommitted.

title: CUBANS REPORTED IN RED SEA AREA
Caroline Poplin Wed To Martin Ira Slate
description: At Temple Reyim in Newton, Mass., last evening, Caroline Mary Poplin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mark Poplin of Concord, Mass., was married to Martin Ira Slate, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Slate of Quincy, Mass. Rabbis Samuel Chiel and Phillip Kieval officiated.

title: Issues 76: Cities
description: Although it lacks the drama of the arson and rioting that focused national attention on the plight of the cities during the 1960's, New York's battle to stave off bankruptcy illuminates a fundamental urban crisis in America that requires priority consideration in this Presidential year.

title: SHOWS Al APOLLO ARE TAPED FOR TV
Banners, Cheers Mark a Happy End to an Unhappy Season
FIREMAN RESCUES GIRL, 8, IN BLAZE
description: A fire lieutenant carried an 8yearold girl through a ring of fire in her blazing South Bronx apartment yesterday afternoon and then collapsed in a smokefilled stairwell when he paused to restore her breathing through mouthtomouth resuscitation..

title: Vorster to Pay a Visit To Rabin in Israel Soon
description: JERUSALEM, April 4 (AP) Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa will visit Israel as the guest of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rubin, it was announced today. No date was given.

title: Cooke Leads Salute to Nuns and Priests
description: Terence Cardinal Cooke was the headliner at Broadway's Imperial Theater yesterday afternoon as the Roman Catholic !Archdiocese of New York sponsored a jazzfilled salute to Ipriests and nuns.

title: The Fletchers: Family That Heard The Silent Thanks
Sports News Briefs
description: Fullerton Women Win A.A.U. Title

title: Israeli Cabinet Will Review Policy in Wake of Arab Riots
description: TEL AVIV, April 4The Israeli Cabinet endorsed today police action against rioting Israeli Arabs in Galilee last, week, but also decided to reexamine Israel's policy toward its Arab citizens.

title: Court Economies
description: The decision by the Court of Appeals in Albany upholding the right of the Administrative Board of the Judicial Conference to dismiss sixty confidential attendants in the Supreme Court and ninety law secretaries in the Civil Court should serve as a signal to various state and city agencies that exceptions cannot be made keeping down the costs of government.

title: Lebanese Leftist Charges Syrians Take Over Ports
A Training and Job Plan For Convicts Is Proposed
description: ELIZABETH, April 4  A program that would bring industrial activities into the state's prison system will be presented tomorrow night to religious and community leaders at the Elizabeth Presbyterian Church here.

title: Quotations From Kissinger on His World View
Chairman of New York Republicans Calls Rockefeller Party's Best Choice for Vice Presidentat Least
description: Richard M. Rosenbaum, the New York Republican state chairman, has resurrected Vice President Rockefeller as a possible running mate for President Ford. I'd like to see Mr. Rocke feller be his running mate; in fact like him to be the candidate for the top spot. said Mr. Rosenbaum, an unabashed Rockefeller fan. He conceded, however, that Mr. Rockefeller is supporting President Ford for the top spot and that the President would have the final say on his running mate.

title: Two Babies Dropped To Rescuers in Fire
description: HARTFORD, April 4 (AP)Two infants were dropped safely from a burning building today Into the hands pf a policeman and a civilian rescuer three floors below, authorities reported.

title: STATE HOSPITALS, PRISONS SCORED
description: PRINCETON, April 4About 50 student volunteers and adults concerned with mentalhealth issues yesterday criticized mental institutions and prisons in New Jersey for subjecting patients and inmates to dehumanizing conditions.

title: Advertising
description: Although it is not rare for advertisers to ask agencies to work on newproduct assignments without compensation, the situation, in these days of declining profit margins, has apparently become serious enough to rate a position paper from the American Association of Advertising Agencies.

title: Saco, Me., Is Angered By Loss of a Gun Contract
Lebanese Leftist Charges Syrians Take Over Ports
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Monday, April 5Kamal Jumblat, standard bearer of the Lebanese left, accused Syrian troops last night of occupying Lelpanese ports in what he implied was an effort to keep arms and munitions from reaching his forces.

title: Books of The Times
description: The literature on the Rockefellers is basically Manichean, point out the journalists Peter Collier and David Horowitz in a Bibliographic Note at the end of their captivating biography, The Rockefellers: An American Dynasty. And: Those who find it profitable to exaggerate the family's hidden empire are as firmly imprisoned in the Rockefeller myth as the kept biographers. It is therefore with some pride that Messrs. Collier and Horowitz explain that When [George Taylor Jr., the current head of public relations for the Rockefeller familyi asked us what our `thrust was,

title: CARTER AND UDALL VIE IN WISCONSIR
description: MILWAUKEE, April 4For a time last week it seemed the 1950's were being replayed in Wisconsin and Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona was trying to make some hay among this state's politically divided farmers.

title: NEW PREMIER DUE FOR BRITAIN TODAY
Gerulaitis Captures Towson Tennis Final
description: TOWSON, Md., April 4 (AP)  Vitas Gerulaitis of Howard Beach, Queens, posted a 63, 64 victory over Sherwood Stewart of Goose Creek, Tex., to win the $9,000 first prize today in the $30,000 Towson Tennis Classic.

title: Senate Democrats Emerging as a Cohesive Force
City School Windows to Go Unwashed
description: The outlook for the city schools will be getting dimmer. As an economy measure, the school system has directed that no windows be washed this sorine.

title: ASPIN REBUTS DATA ON SOVIET DEFENSE
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, in a study presented to his Congressional colleagues, argued today that the Administration was using distorted, largely meaningless statistics about the growth in Soviet military nower.

title: Recital: Miss Chung on the Violin
description: Whatever happened to those pessimistic experts who used to go around forecasting the death of the violin? Far from being headed for oblivion, the instrument seems to be making a comeback, perhaps for no better reason than that many extraordinarily talented young violinists have come into prominence in recent years. KyungWha Chung. for one.

title: Kissinger Tells Jewish Group U.S. Will Never Abandon Israel
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger pledged today in an address to the American Jewish! Congress that the United States will never abandon Israel.

title: King of Sweden Given A Tour of Washington
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP)King Carl XVI Gustaf arrived here today on the second stop of a 27day visit to the United States.

title: 30 Years of Leadership
description: Prince Sihanouk led Cambodia through nearly 30 turbulent ears during which he sought to keep his poor and powerless country together, until his DyerThrow in March 1970 in a coup ??? by Marshall Lon Nol.

title: Talks Seek to Curb I.R.A.
description: LONDON, April 4 (Reuters)A group of American customs agents arrived here today for talks with British and Irish officials on how to stop the flow of arms and money from the United States to Irish Republican Army guerrillas.

title: Paper Reports Offer by Shapp To Halt Suit in Deal With Bank
description: PITTSBURGH, April 4 (AP)A top official of the Mellon Bank confirmd a newspaper report today that Gov. Milton J. Shapp offered to withhold legal action against the bank in exchange for a $61 million loan to the state's housing agency.

title: DR.CHARLESCHURCH, NUTRITIONIST,WAS73
description: Dr. Charles F. Church. a fellow of the American College of Nutrition long engaged in research and practice in New Brunswick, N.J., died Saturday at Cape Cod Hospital in Hyannis, Mass. He was 73 years old and had lived since 1974 in New Seabury, Mass.

title: Art Student Recreating An Original 1720 Piano
description: Bartolomeo Cristofori inyented the piano in 1709, and only three of them have survived to this day. Soon there will be a fourthor a reasonable facsimile.
