description: George L. Perry, an economist with the Brookings Institution, yesterday called the wage contract won by the teamsters union last weekend a bad settlement and criticized President Ford for not denouncing the contract as inflationary.

title: Ford Opposes Breakup Of Big Oil Companies
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (UPI)  The White House said today that President Ford opposed legislation that would force big oil companies to become smaller.

title: Lisbon Eases Code On Foreign Capital
description: LISBON, April 7Portugal published today a new and fairly liberal foreign investment code aimed at attracting foreign capital while protecting national interests.

title: G.O.P. CROSSOVER A HELP TO CARTER
description: Jimmy Carter won three votes for every two gained by Morris K. Udall among Republicans who crossed party lines Tuesday TO vote in the Wisconsin Democratic primarya factor that may have given the former Georgia Governor his razorthin margin over the Arizona Congressman.

title: TV Truman in Potsdam, or Interpreting History
description: At the close of Truman in Potsdam, tonight's Hallmark Hall of Fame production on NBCTV at 8 o'clock, David Schoenhrun the narrator, says: The viewer is reminded that recent history such as that dramatized tonight is subject to individual interpretation. All names and events are factual and have been carefully researched. But not all historians agree on the reconstruction of history.

title: Hua Is Now Viewed As the Heir Apparent
description: WASHINGTON, April 7The selection of Hua Kuofeng as First Deputy Chairman of the Chinese Communist Party today appears to designate him as the successor not only to the late Chou Enlai but eventually the party's aging Chairman, Mao Tsetung.

title: Missionaries Die in Angola
description: ROME, April 7 (Reuters)Two Roman Catholic missionaries, Dutch and Portuguese, have been killed in Angola a man in uniform who fired on them with a machine gun, the international Cath,olic news service, Fides, reported today.

title: IRAN CUTS CUBA TIES OVER INTERFERENCE
description: TEHERAN, Iran, April 7 (AP) Iran broke diplomatic relations with Cuba today, charging interference in Iran's internal affairs by Prime Minister Fidel Castro.

title: Alodex Millionaires Pitfall
description: MEMPHIS, April 6Ketnmons Wilson and Wallace E Johnson, Memphis businessmen who made a fortune with the Holiday Inns, have lost millions on a lesser known projectthe Alodex Corporation, a real estate development company here that is in the final stages of voluntary liquidation.

title: ... the Harris Diversion
description: Former Senator Fred Harris of Oklahoma meanwhile has apparently decided to abandon his active candidacy because he has not been able to raise sufficient funds. Mr. Harris's candidacy may prove to have been costly to Senator Humphrey's hopes. Surveys of .voters in New Hampshire and Massachusetts suggested that if Mr. Harris had not been on the ballot, those who voted for him would have supported Mr. Udall and made him winner in both states. He, not Governor Carter, would have become the frontrunner and the whole pattern the early primaries would have been altered.

title: Fiscal Board Chief Scores Unrealistic City U. Plan
description: The staff director of the Emergency Financial Control Board accused the Board of Higher Education yesterday of creating a desperate situation by failing to produce a realistic budgetcutting plan and by provoking City University faculty members and students to resist austerity controls.

title: Aid for Cubans Urged
description: WASHINGTON. April 7 (AP)Senator Richard Stone, Democrat of Florida, urged today that Congress make it easier for elderly Cuban refugees in this country to obtain United States citizenship. He proposed allowing such Cubans aged 50 or older, in this country 10 years, to obtain citizenship without passing tests in English.

title: State Senate Returns to Its Place of Birth in Kingston
description: KINGSTON, N.Y., April 7The State Senate feturned today to its birthplace here, where 199 years ago the first Senate gave New York its first government, its first constitution and its first governor.

title: City Plan to Put Rinks on Ice Protested
description: Several hundred hockey players ranging in age from 5 to 19 rallied with their friends and parents in the Coney Island section of Brooklyn last night to protest against the city's plan to close, for the first time, Its two indoor ice skating rinks for the spring, summer and fall months,

title: Fiscal Board Chief S	cores Unrealistic City U. Plan
Business Briefs
description: The Southern Railway announced yesterday a $179.2 million capital expenditures budget for 1975, a record for the carrier, and one of the largest budgets within the industry. It will cover the company's acquisition of 30 new locomotives and 2,912 new freight cars as well as the expenditure of $48.3 million for roadway structures and signals.

title: Drop in Market Is Linked to Dispatch
description: A press dispatch that described a Washington meeting of New York City business executives to discuss the city's future contributed to a sharp drop in stock prices late yesterday.

title: TROOPS ON GUARD
description: PEKING, Thursday, April 8The Chinese leadership, moving in a deteriorating political situation: deposed Deputy Prime Minister Teng Hsiaoping last night and appointed Hua Kuofeng as Prime Minister and First Deputy Chairman of the Communist Party.

title: Columbia Netmen Get OnCourt Lessons
description: George (Butch) Seewagen, the 29yearold Columbia tennis coach who was once ranked 14th in the country, still competes in tournaments. And he still is serious on the court, especially when he faces one of his varsity players.

title: Bridge
description: The domination of the New York experts was a surprising feature of the Cavendish Invitation Pairs tournament last weekend.

title: 90 CADETS FACING CHEATING CHARGES
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., April 7A United States Military Academy spokesman said today that more than 90 cadets would be charged next week with violating the cadet honor code by cheating on an electrical engineering examination last month.

title: BRITON AFFIRMS ULSTER POLICY
description: LONDON, April 7Merlyn Rees, Britain's secretary for Northern Ireland, said today that there was no question of withdrawing British Army units from Ulster and insisted that the British Government would govern the province until Protestants and Roman Catholics forged a settlement.

title: Sign Man at Shea Set to Toss Curves
description: I've always been zinging them, way back to 1963, then as the years went by I became mellow, the Sign Man said. But this spring I decided they weren't doing anything and weren't going anywhere, so I decided to get nasty.

title: Burger Urges New Ways to Resolve Court Disputes
description: ST. PAUL, April 7Chief Justice Warren E. Burger called today for the creation of new ways to resolve many of the disputes that are now disposed of in the courts through lawsuitsincluding medical malpractice and other personal injury cases, child custody fights, many environmental cases and claims involving small amounts of money.

title: British to Sell Gas to U.S.
description: LONDON, April 7 (AP)A British subsidiary of Shell Oil has landed a big 10year contract to sell liquified gas from the North Sea to the United States. Shell International Gasi said it expected the contract to be worth $1 billion, with deliveries to begin in 1979. The company said about six million tons of liquified propane and butane gas would be sold to Northern Liquid Fuels International of Omaha, Neb., a subsidiary of Northern Natural Gas of Nebraska.

title: Cunningham Drops Motion
description: Justice Leonard H. Sandler of State Supreme Court has directed Patrick J. Cunningham to appear before a special grand jury investigating the possible safe of judgeships in the Bronx.

title: Rx for Stagflation
description: At first sight, the budget that Chancellor of the Exchequer Denis Healey has presented to the British Parliament appears contradictory.

title: HeartImplant Patient Dies
description: CAPE TOWN, April 7 (Reuters)Hennie Goosen, 46 years old, the sixth person in South Africa to have a second heart implanted, died in the Groote Schuur Hospital here today.

title: Sign Man at Shea Set to Toss Curves
description: I've always been zinging them, way back to 1965, then as the years went by I became mellow, the Sign Man said. But this spring I decided they weren't doing anything and weren't going anywhere, so I decided to get nasty.

title: Paris and Bonn Socialists Act to Align Their Policies
description: PARIS, April 7The French and West German Socialist Parties, long at odds, have established joint working groups in an effort to bring their policies into closer alignment.

title: Black Injured at Boston Rally Plans Action Against Officials
description: BOSTON, April 7  I was just out there walking to City Hall in my threepiece suit, Theodore Landsmark was saying. I was anyone.

title: It's the Last Masters for the Master
description: AUGUSTA, Ga April 7Clifford Roberts, the crusty 82yearold investment banker. who has run the Masters golf tournament with an iron hand since its inception in 1934, finally called it quits today. He announced his retirement, to take effect with the completion of this year's Masters Sunday afternoon.

title: HUGHES IS BURIED IN BRIEF CEREMONY
description: HOUSTON, April 7Howard Robard Hughes Jr. was buried net to his parents this morning after a simple, eightminute graveside ceremony.

title: Reilly Detective Seized On a Weapons Charge
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn. April A private detective who was instrumental in winning a new trial for. Peter A. Reilly last month was arrested here today on a weapons charge stemming from the controversial case.

title: G.O.P. CROSSOVER A HELP TO CARTER
description: Jimmy Carter won three votes for every two gained by Morris K. Wall among Republicans who crossed party lines Tuesday to vote in the Wisconsin Democratic primarya factor that may have given the former Georgia Governor his razorthin margin over the Arizona Congressman.

title: MetrOpolitan Briefs
description: Vincent Papa Sr., a major figure in the socalled French Connection heroin theft of 398 pounds of narcotics from the Police Department property clerk's office, pleaded guilty yesterday to contempt and other charges after winning assurance from Justice Leonard H. Sandler of State Supreme Court that his prison sentence would run concurrently with a Federal prison term he is now serving. Mr. Papa is serving a 20year sentence on a Federal narcotics conviction.

title: It's Batter Up, With a Few Changes Like Free Agents and Local Ball Girls
description: Baseball returns to the national scene today for the first time in six months, and not much has happened to change the old ball game, unless you consider the following:

description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Hijackers at Manila Release 70 In Exchange for Airline Official
description: MANILA, Thursday, April 8 (Reuters)The three hijackers; of a Philippine Air Lines jetliner today released all its passengers after receiving assurances that four prisoners they wnated the Government to release would not be harmed, it was officially announced.

title: ackson on in New York By Narrowly Based Voting
description: Henry M. Jackson's capture of 104 of the New York delegates to the Democratic National convention, a comfortable 38 percent that lost luster primarily because of his own preelection predictions of landslide. was built on a narrow geographical and ethnic base, post election studies showed yesterday.

title: Swedesboro Eagerly Awaiting a Visit by King Carl XVI Today
description: BUDD LAKE, April 7Excitement is mounting among the state's SwedishAmericans over tomorrow's visit by the King of Sweden to Swedesboro.

title: SCHOOL DISTRICT DISPUTES ANKER
description: Despite a warning of possible disciplinary action from School Chancellor Irving Anker, the local board of a West Side school district ordered its schools yesterday to restore a full instructional day for pupils.

title: Sparkle, a Sob Story With Its Moments of Force
The Pop Life
description: A slew of records has come out recently to deepen our notions of progressive country music and its antecedents. The term progressive country normally applies to a Texasbased coterie around Willie Nelson and such Nashvillecentered innovators as WayIon Jennings and Tompall Glaser.

title: S .L .A . Ruling Perils Club Plans Of Restaurant in Trade Center.
description: The scheduled Monday opening of a private luncheon club, atop the! North Tower of the World Trade Center was jeopardize yesterday when the State Liqour Authority ruled! that the public must he admitted to a substantial portion, of the premises at all times if a liquor license is granted

title: Nassau Is Ordered By Court to Grant Its Police a Raise
description: MINEOLA LI., April 7A State Supreme Court justice today ordered Nassau County to pay the members of its Parolmen's Benevolent ASSOCiaLion the $3 million it had provided for them in its 1975 budget.

title: Spain to Pension the Disabled On the Losing Side In Civil War
description: MADRID, April 7The Spanish Government decreed pensions today for those disabled veterans of the Civil War who fought against the forces of Franco four decades ago.

title: Hughes Estate Fight Seen As Doubts Rise About Will
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 7 There appears to be a growing feeling among knowledgeable associates of Howard R. Hughes that the eccentric billionaire left no will to guide the disposal of his great estate.

title: Five Men Arrested for Prostitution by Police Decoys
description: Police officers answering advertisements in a homosexual newspaper have arrested five men on charges of prostitution ,after making dates with them in an undisclosed West Side hotel.

title: Deferring Stavisky
description: Following the override last week by the State Assembly of the Governor's veto of the Stavisky bill, pressure has been building for similar action in the Senate. The heavy lobbying to overturn the veto ignores the disastrous impact a precipitate enactment of this measure would have on the city.

title: '76 Plates Make Money for State
description: The special license plate that New Jerseyans can put on their cars to commemorate the Bicentennial is a $650,000 winner.

title: F.D.A. Urges Grand Jury Study Of G. D. Searle's Drug Reports
description: WASHINGTON, April 7The Food and Drug Administration has recommended to the Justice Department that a grand jury be convened in Illinois to investigate charges that a major drug firm, G. D. Searle & Company, has falsified data and reports submitted in connection with new drug applications.

title: Canucks Put Rookie in Goal Again
description: VANCOUVER, British Co. lumbia, April 7For years they've called Phil Maloney the Silver Fox, but the wily and moody coach and general manager of the Vancouver Canucks suggests this season another name might be more appropriate.

title: House Adopts a 5Year Census, But With Redistricting Every 10
description: WASHINGTON, April 7The House, after allaying fears that its members might face more frequent redistricting, approved today a bill that in effect would authorize a census of the country's population every five years instead of every 10.

title: A Caravaggio For Cleveland
description: A lost painting by the major 16thcentury Italian artist Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio has been acquired by the Cleveland Museum of Art. The 7footby5foot canvas depicts the martyrdom of St. Andrew the Apostle. After the 17th century it had dropped out of sight for sonic 300 years, but it surfaced unexpectedly in a Spanish collection in 1973. It is one of only five Caravaggins in the United States.

title: Dead Heat ...
description: Voters in New York and Wisconsin produced a perfectly balanced political result in Tuesday's primaries. Each of the three active Democratic candidates achieved something and so did the fourth, shadow candidateSenator Hubert H. Humphrey.

title: Padres Bid Rejected
description: SAN DIEGO. April 7 (AP)  The freeagent pitcher, Andy Messersmith. rejected an offer tonight from the San Diego Padres. The Padres general manager, Peter Bavasi, said Messersmith and his agent. Herb Osmond. had met for four hours with the Padres officials before turning down the San Diego offer. Bavasi said Osmond called it the highest hid made for Messersmith.

title: Soviet Warns U.S. on a Lebanon Move
description: MOSCOW, Thursday, April 8The Communist Party newspaper Pravda today warned against any United States military intervention in Lebanon.

title: Text of I.R.S. Questions to Companies
description: WASHINGTON, April (AP)The text of the 11 questions that the Internal Revenue Service said today that it had posed to 1,260 major United States corporations follows:

title: JAILED IN ERROR, YOUTH IS SUICIDE
description: YONKERS, April 7A 20yearold man who according to the Westchester County Sheriff's Department records was arrested by mistake hanged himseif in his cell today in the Yonkers City Jail.

title: Unelected City Power
description: For more than two decades, public references to William A. Shea have usually noted his close association with the Mayor. In that period, the Mayor's office has been occupied by tnree different men, but the Shea in question is the same. The 68yearold lawyer is one of the more durable power brokers among those in New York who mix their business with their politics.

title: JACKSON, CARTER AND UDALL TURN TO PENNSYLVANIA
Giants Sign Csonka To a Multiyear Pact
description: The Giants last night signed Larry Csonka, the big fullback who twice helped the Miami Dolphins win the Super Bowl.

title: Moscow Is Said to Propose New Spanish Red Leaders
description: MADRID, April 7 (AP)Soviet officials in Moscow have uggested changing the leaderhip of the Spanish Communist Party if that would make the party legal in Spain, a high Govrnment source said today.

title: KIBBEE IS WARNED ABOUT FISCAL PLAN
description: Two members of the Board of Higher Education said yesterday they that they would call for the resignation of Dr. Robert J. Kibbee, chancellor of City University, unless he produced specific recommendations to resolve the university's fiscal crisis.

title: Common Cause and 45 Representatives Petition the House to Investigate Sikes for Conflict of Interest
description: WASHINGTON, April 7The House of Representatives was petitioned today to investigate complaints that one of its members has a conflict of interest between his legislative activities and his outside business ventures.

title: Some Leaders in Community Mental Health Ask Changes in Psychiatric Care Provided in Program
description: WASHINGTON, April 7  A number of leaders in the community mental health movement have concluded that changes are needed in the psychiatric care provided under such programs.

title: Daily Output of Oil In April May Reach 8.15 Million Barrels
BattleScarred Lebanon a Patchwork of Ancient Sects
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 8The yearold Lebanese civil war has been pictured, with some reason, as a conflict of Moslems and Christians, left and right, a minority of haves versus a majority of havenots. But underneath these familiar characterizations lies a bedrock of ancient sects, whose loyalties are far more real and commanding and complex than a clash of two great religions or social philosophies.

title: U.S. FOREIGN POLICY CRITICIZED IN STUDY
description: A twoyear study of the United States' role in world affairs has concluded that the country lacks two elements essential to a sound foreign policy: inspired leadership and informed public opinion, and that these denote failures of the Government, of the media and of the institutions of learning.

title: Air Force Grounds Jets
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (Reuters)The Air Force grounded today 97 of its F111 fighter bombers after the crash yesterday of an aircraft while on a training flight in Nevada. The Air Force said cause of the crash was not known. The Air Force has approximaitely 400 F111 craft.

title: Stage: Williams Night
description: STAMFORD, Conn., April 8  The Hartman Theater Company, now in the final laps of its inaugural season, is making most encouraging progress. It has played to an average of 70 percent capacityan excellent figure for a new resident theater. It has a new studio theater, in addition to its major auditorium, all but completed, and its subscription plans for next season are welladvanced. Its penultimate offering (the season ends, by the way with Larry Arrick's adaptation of Catch22) is a triple bill of Tennessee Williams plays, all early works, staged by one of the company's producing directors, Del Tenney.

title: Albany Reports Disparity In Home Insurance Rates
description: Rates for homeowners and tenants insurance in New York State can vary by as much as 80 percent for the same coverage, according to a shoppers' guide just released by the State Insurance Department.

title: E. Alice Austen Photographed Earlier Gracious Days of S.I.
description: The history of photography has harbored many strange and poignant careers, but few have been strangerand none more poignantthan the one honored last night in the dedication of a public school in Graniteville, S.I.

title: Dave Anderson
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 8When he was 14 years old, Hubert Green, the mannerly son of a Birmingham, Ala., physician, visited the Augusta National Golf Club for the first time and watched golfers practice for the Masters that year. He and a few other teenagers had been flown over in the private plane of Hall Thompson, an Alabama millionaire.

title: SCHMIDT STRESSES DOMESTIC ISSUES
description: BONN, April 8Chancellor Helmut Schmidt, who is facing an election Oct. 3, seems to be turning inward to domestic political problems and away from a European leadership role in speeches, private talks, and recent interviews.

title: Philippine Hijackers, in Bangkok, Aiming for Mideast
description: BANGKOK, Friday, April 9A hijacked Philippine Air Lines jet carrying three Moslem gunmen along with two hostages and 10 airline staffers, flew here today from Kuala Lumpur on the way to the Middle East.

title: Albany Reports Disparity In Home Insurance Rates
description: Rates for homeowners and tenants insurance in New York State can vary by as much as 80 percent for the same coverage, according to a shoppers' guide just released by the State Insurance Department.

title: high Court Record Onlndividual Rights Defended by Burger
description: ST. PAUL, April 8In a rare public response to criticism of the Supreme Court and its rulings, Chief Justice Warren E. Burger contended today that the socalled Burger Court's record on protecting individual rights was at least as good as the record of any earlier Court.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Robert Helstoski, brother of Representative Henry Helsotski, Democrat of East Rutherford, was sentenced yesterday to 18 months in prison and a $10,000 fine for filing false income tax returns. The prosecution charged during his trial that some of the $348,000 involved in the scheme had gone to his brother's political campaigns, falsely written off as taxdeductible corporate expenses. Henry Helstoski has not been charged with any crime, although he is reportedly the target of a Federal investigation and has made more than half a dozen appearances before a Federal grand jury. Robert Helstoski's attorney, Herald Fahringer, filed a notice of appeal shortly after the sentencing.

title: Meriden Schools on Strike
description: MERIDEN, Conn., April 8 (AP)  Public school classes were canceled for a second consecutive day today as teachers continued their contractrelated strike.

title: Wood,Field&Stream
description: GRAND CAYMAN ISLAND, British West IndiesA stiff easterly wind moaned along, the north side of Grand. Cayman Island, but the shallow water before me was fairly calm and clear, being protected by a barrier reef only a few, hundred yards offshore.

title: PEUGtOT RAISES CITROEN HOLDING
description: The Peugeot automobile and industrial group announced in Paris yesterday that it had increased its holdings in Citroen, S.A. by 90 percent through the purchase of the Michelin tire group's majority interest. Peugeot, in an agreement concluded in 1974 was due to extend its 38.2 percent interest in Citroen, S.A. to 51 percent this month. At Michelin's request, Peugeot acquired all of Citroen's shares constituting 53.2 percent of the total.

title: Leftists in Lebanon. May Agree to Extend CeaseFire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 8Leftist leaders implied today they would favor an extension of the shaky armed truce if Parliament met as scheduled on Saturday bo begin the process of ousting President Suleiman Franiieh from office.

title: Police Simulate La Guardia Bombing
description: A hundred yards downrange the charge of dynamite erupted into an orange ball of flame in a simulation yesterday of the explosion that killed 11 persons and injured 75 at La Guardia Airport last December.

title: 100,000 Hail Peking Leadership Change
description: PEKING, Friday, April 9More than 100,000 people marched in Tien An Men Square in the heart of Peking yesterday with red flags, banners and pennants in an organized display of support for the shakeup of the Chinese leadership.

title: Some Young People Are Tightening Belts For New Careers
description: They do without sleep, scrimp on food, and rarely go to the movies. Some have to find time to raise children as well, and others have had to move back in with their parents to make ends meet.

title: Aaron's 2 Hits Help Beat Yanks, 50
description: MILWAUKEE, April 8The Yankees unveiled their new offense todayit was invisible. The Milwaukee Brewers showed off their old offenseHenry Aaronand his very visible offense produced a 50 victory on opening day of baseball, 1976.

title: POUND HITS A LOW ON WAGE DISCORD
description: BRUSSELS, April 8 (UPI)The pound declined to a new low on European money markets today, induced by doubts among traders about the British Government's ability to avert an economycrippling struggle with labor.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 2 MORE ARRESTED IN BOSTON ATTACK
description: BOSTON, April 8 (UPI)The police charged two Charlestown youths today in connection with attacking a black lawyer at an antibusing demonstration outside City Hall this week.

title: Abducted Basque Industrialist Found Dead in Northern Spain
description: MADRID, April 8The body of a 58yearold Basque industrialist kidnapped by the Basque nationalist group E.T.A. three weeks ago was found early this morning on a highway near the town of Elgoibar.

title: Crisis Over Silber Presidency Grows at Boston U.
description: BOSTON, April 8A succession of noconfidence votes in the administration of Dr. John R. Silber, the president of Boston University, and a demand for his ouster by 10 of the university's 15 deans have brought a crisis to the 18,000studenf campus.

title: About New York
description: A drive on a recent Saturday through the byways of the Bronx that began amid the devastation and squalor of Mott Taven and Hunts Point brought an urban explorer at last to higher ground and then, quite by chance, to a modest fieldstone house of obvious antiquity on Bainbridge Avenue in the Gun Hill section.

title: Carter Issues an Apology On Ethnic Purity Phrase
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 8Jimmy Carter apologized today for using the phrase ethnic purity in his pledge two days ago to defend the stability of established neighborhoods. But he stuck to his original basic position, saying he would not arbitrarily use Federal force to change a neighborhood's ethnic character.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 9, 1976

title: Ruling on Utility Ads
description: The New York State Public Service Commission announced yesterday that customers of an upstate utility must bear the company's advertising expenses promoting the use of nuclear power, regardless of whether they agree with the company's position. Page 61.

title: Tonight's Yonkers Entries
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

description: FRIDAY, APRIL 9, 1976

title: Mrs. Ryan Is Out on Bail In Trial in West Germany
description: DUSSELDORF, West Germany, April 8 (AP)A New York City woman on trial on charges of having murdered Jews at a Nazi concentration camp in Poland has been: freed on $17,000 bail provided by her husband, a defense attorney said today.

title: Oil Company Taxes To Rise 100 Million Under I.R.S. Plan
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Internal Revenue Service announced today its decision to issue a ruling that is expected to cost American oil companies with overseas operations more than $100 million in additional taxes this year and could cost them $1 billion or more a year in the future.

title: NETTIE F. GOLDMAN
description: Nettie F. Goldman, formerly of Hartford, died yesterday in Jerusalem at the age of 82.

title: Official Urges National Assessment as HispanicAmerican Population Rises Sharply
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The nation's HispanicAmerican population, increasing sharply in the last two decades, is approaching 20 million, raising broad and complex implications for the society that planners and policy makers have scarcely begun to assess, according to the Community Relations Service.

title: SERIOUS DRINKING IN ARMY REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (AP) Twenty percent of all Army officers and 32 percent of enlisted men are either heavy drinkers or binge drinkers who become intoxicated for more than one day at a time, Congressional auditors said today.

title: NEW YORK COURT UPHOLDS CONCEPT OF REVERSE BIAS
description: The New York State Court of Appeals ruled unanimously yesterday that reverse discriminationthe practice of giving special treatment in education and employment to minoritygroup memberswas constitutional in proper circumstances.

title: Aides Say Ford Will Clinch Nomination Despite Some Gains by Reagan Forces
description: WASHINGTON, April 8President Ford's campaign aides conceded today that Ronald Reagan would score some, coups as the battle for the Re publican Presidential nomination moves west and south, but they said Mr. Ford would still clinch the nomination in early June.

title: Ford, Nixon and 1976
description: WASHINGTON, April 8  In the new movie, All the President's Men, there is a film clip showing Gerald R. Ford, then a member of Congress and chairman of the 1972 Republican National Convention, announcing that Richard M. Nixon had won the party's Presidential nomination

title: N.C.A.A. Restponds to Critics
description: CHICAGO, April 8  The way John Fuzak and Walter Byers told it today, the President's Commission on Olympic Sports should stand up and salute the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, April 6, 1976

title: Cappelletti's Brother Dies
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 8 (AP)Joey Cappelletti, the 13yearold brother of the Los Angeles Ram football star, John Cappelletti, died of leukemia at his home in suburban Upper Darby today. John, who won the Heisman Trophy as college football's outstanding player in 1973, dedicated the award to his younger brother in his acceptance speech.

title: Pele Scores 4 Goals as Cosmos Win
description: HONOLULU, April 8 (UPI)Pelscored four goals to lead the New York Cosmos to a 50 victory over Team Honda of Japan last night in the first Aloha Soccer Festival. Despite rainy weather; 21;705 fans turned out to see six hours of soccer. The Philippines defeated China, 10, in another game.

title: Air Force Grounds Jets
description: WASHINGTON, Apri 8 (Reuters)The Air Force grounded today 97 of its F111 fighter bombers after the cvrash yesterday of an aircraft while on a training flight in Nevada. The Air Force said cause of the crash was not known. The Air F orce has approximately 400 F111 craft.

title: Carey Drops Opposition To SchoolAid Proposal
description: ALBANY, April 8  Under heavy pressure from legislative leaders, Governor Carey agreed today to sign a school aid formula bill identical to the one he vetoed last week on the ground that it generated a $37 million cost overrun.

title: Books of The Times
description: At the beginning of Richard Price's Bloodbrothers, a Coop City resident named Tommy De Coco takes his wife and two sons to visit a New Jersey cemetery in which he has just bought a plot through the electricians' union he belongs to. (I figure I'll be here. Marie, you'll be next to me. Then Stony right under me and Albert next to him under you, over there. I wanna be next to Stony, said Albert.) At the end of the novel, Tommy has inadvertently made certain that there is not much for his family to look forward to before it makes final use of his purchase. What happens in between marks a large step forward for Mr. Price beyond his promiswork of fiction, The Wanderers. For while in The Wanderers Mr. Price interlinked 12 stories to form a lively caricature of a teenage Bronx housingproject gang, in Bloodbrothers, his first novel, Mr. Price has turned his caricatures into fullblooded and interesting people.

title: About Real Estate
description: Among certain forces in Congress there is an attack on the use of tax shelters to produce housing. A bill to this effect has already paSsed the House of Representatives  H.R. 10612, sponsored by the Ways and Means Committeeand the subject is under consideration in the Senate Finance Committee.

title: U.S. and Canada
description: In the following record of observations yesterday at weather stations in the United States, high and tow temperatures given are for the 20hour period ended at 8 P.M.; precipitation totals given are for the 24 hour period ended at 8 P.M. Weather descriptions are forecasted conditions for today. (All times are in Eastern Daylight Time.)

title: BRITAIN'S PREMIER SELECTS CROSLAND AS FOREIGN CHIEF
description: LONDON, April 8  Prime Minister James Callaghan announced his Cabinet tonight, naming Anthony Crosland Foreign Secretary.

title: DOW FALLSBY 9.13 ON GLUM FORECAST
description: Stock prices dropped again yesterday, partly in response to predictions by a leading analyst that the market faces the possibility of a substantial setback during coming weeks.

description: Periods end Feb. 29 unless otherwise Indicated. Restated for LIFO

title: Prospect of U.S. Trade Deficit Called a Healthy Sign
description: The prospect of a trade deficit this year after a record $11.1 billion trade surplus in 1975 is regarded by trade analysts of banks as a healthy sign for the world and, paradoxically, for the United States.

title: Vorntor in Israel For Visit
description: TEL. AVIV, April 8 (Reuters) Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa arrived by air tonight for a fourday visit to Israel as guest of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin.

title: Radio
description: 67:25 A.M., WNYCFM. Fatum. Symphonic Poem, Tchaikovsky; Violin Concerto, Brahnis; Symphony No. 6, Sibelius.

title: All Defendants in Quinlan Case Decide to Forgo Any Appeals
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., April 8The final potential legal barrier to the disconnecting of the respirator that is keeping Karen Anne Quinlan alive was removed today when her attending physicians said they would not appeal a ruling by the New Jersey Supreme Court that authorizes her father to seek such action.

title: LEWIS CURTIS, 75, HISTORIAN AT YALE
description: Lewis Perry Curtis, the former Colgate Professor of History at Yale University, died yesterday at his home in New Haven of a chronic bonemarrow disorder. He was 75 years old.

title: ESTHER ALIX BILSKI
description: Esther Alix Bilski, a social worker with the Jewish Child Care Association and former president of the Parent's Association Hebrew School of the Society for the Advancement of Judaism, 15 West 86th Street, died Tuesday of cancer at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. Her age was 10, and she lived at 275 Central Park West.

title: Switzerland Expelling Spinola On Charge of Political Activity
description: GENEVA, April 8The Swiss Government today ordered the expulsion of Gen. Antnio de Spinola, the former Portuguese President, on the ground that he had violated his pledge not to engage in political activity while on Swiss soil.

title: Rioting Extremists In Rome Assault Government Offices
description: ROME, April 8 (AP)Persons described by the authorities as leftist extremists rampaged through downtown Rome today, throwing firebombs at Government offices, police stations and offices of the Christian Democratic Party. The violence heightened tensions caused by Italy's political and economic turmoil.

title: N. F. L. College Draft Picks
description: FIRST ROUND

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The residents of 63d Street between Park and Third Avenues awoke yesterday to find the London plane trees on their street threatened by the construction of a subway station. Save This Tree! signs were taped to the trunks of the trees that were just budding along the block, whose residents include State Attorney General Louis J. LefkoWitz.

title: EXSTEWARDESS WINS PAY CLAIM
description: BRUSSELS, April 8The European Court of Justice, an arm of the Common Market based in Luxembourg, ordered Sabena Airlines today to give an exstewardess back pay on the basis of the Market's longignored equal pay rule.

title: King of Sweden Helps Swedesboro Celebrate
description: SWEDESBORO, April 8KIng Carl XVI Gustaf came to this small Gloucester County farming community today to commemorate its founding more than 300 years ago as one of the first Swedish settlements in America.

title: Physicians Install President
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 8 (AP) Dr. Jack D. Myers, a professor of medicine at the University of Pittsburgh, was installed today as president of the 33,000member Amercan College of Physicians. Dr. James Cifton of Iowa City was chosen as presidentelect of the college for the coming year.

title: WeekLong Advance in Credit Markets Gains Strength
description: The credit market's weeklong climb picked up strength yesterday, pushing yields on some American Telephone and Telegraph Company bonds below 8 percent for the first time in two years. The Federal Reterve's weekly report of banking statistics loans down and money supply up provided no surprises, and fixedincome securities prices remained at their highs after the data were published.

title: CAREY IS UPHELD ON SCHOOL FUNDS
description: ALBANY, Friday, April 9The State Senate failed early today by two votes to override Governor Carey's veto of the Stavisky city school aid bill.

title: Death, Wheelock Poems Toll for Thee
description: John Hall Wheelock, an 89yearold man in a position to know, was asked about old age.

title: Costly Veto
description: It is hard to imagine a veto less defensible than President Ford's rejection of a bill that would have provided the states with the money required to bring their daycare programs up to Federal standards. The President vetoed the bill on the ground that he opposed burdensome Federal restrictions.

title: Statue on Common Stolen
description: BOSTON, April S (AP)Thieves using a cutting torch stole a 4foot bronze statue from Boston Common today as hundreds of people strolled in bright sunshine. Alan Austin, assistant commissioner for the Boston Parks and Recretation Department, said he understood that two men cut down the statue, which weighed about 100 pounds, wrapped in a blanket, threw it in a station wagon parked nearby and drove away.

title: Exporting Watergate
description: Whatever the convoluted legal and diplomatic rationalizations, the Administration win only fan suspicions of United States Government complicity in corporate bribery practices overseas if it hesitates much longer in opening up all the relevant official records.

title: People in Sports
description: Cornell University yesterday appointed Richard D. Schultz of the University of Iowa as athletic director. The 46yearold Schultz will succeed Robert J. Kane, who will retire July 1 after 37 years in administrative posts at the Ivy League school.

title: Elizabeth Tower Halsey, Educator on Euthanasia, 72
description: Elizabeth Tower Halsey, executive director of the Euthanasia Educational Council for eight years, died Wednesday at Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 72 years old and lived at the Cambridge House Hotel, 333 West 86th Street.

title: U.S SEEKS TO BAR BIAS BY SCHOOLS
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Justice Department urged the Supreme Court today to outlaw racial segregation in allwhite private schools, many of them in the South.

title: Hearing on City Is Scored as Political
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 While leaders of the New York City Congressional delegation explained their absence fromi yesterday's hearings on New York City business, saying that Representative Peter A. Peyser, Republican of Westchester County, was conducting a political operation, Mr, Peyser said that he had merely tried to help the city.

title: NEW YORK COURT UPHOLDS CONCEPT OF REVERSE BIAS
description: The New York State Court of Appeals ruled unanimously yesterday that reverse discriminationthe practice of giving special treatment in education and employment to minoritygroup memberswas constitutional in proper circumstances.

title: Money Supply Up $1.2 Billion in Week
description: The money supply rose $1.2 billion in the United States in the week ended March 31, according to Federal Reserve Board data released yesterday.

title: In Memoriam
description: BLOGMay. In lving memory of a devoted wife, mother and grandmother.

title: 100,000 Hail Peking LecZerealp Change
description: PEKING, Friday, April 9More than 100,000 people marched in Tien An Men Square in the heart of Peking yesterday with red flags, banners and pennants in an organized display of support for the shake up of the Chinese leadership.

title: Galindez Triumphs In Nontitle Bout
description: COPENHAGEN, April 8 (UPI)Victor Galindez of Argentina, scored a split decision tonight in a 10round nontitle match with Jessie Burnett, an American. Galindez is the World Boxing Association's light heavyweight champion.

title: The Other News
description: International

title: Dutch Fix 6Year Terms For 7 Who Held Consulate
description: AMSTERDAM. April 8 (AP) A Dutch court today imposed sixyear jail terms on seven activists who held hostages in the Indonesian Consulate last December.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: The Burden on Carter
description: The Wisconsin and New York primaries seem to have sent Jimmy Carter of Georgia a little further along the road to the Democratic Presidential nomination. But his remarks on the ethnic purity of neighborhoods may prove more important than either primary; and although he has apologized for those remarks, they still could destroy his carefully built but exceedingly fragile political position.

title: GOTBAUM SCORES BEAME ON CONTRACT
description: Victor Gotbaum, executive director of District Council 37 of the State County and Municipal Employees, last night criticized remarks made by Mayor Beame after the transit workers settlement as in extremely bad taste.

title: Carter Issues an Apology On Ethnic Purity Phrase
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 8Jimmy Carter apologized today for using the phrase ethnic purity in his pledge two days ago to defend the stability of established neighborhoods. But he stuck to his original basic position, saying he would not arbitrarily use Federal force to change a neighborhood's ethnic character.

title: Backers of Migrant Workers Charge Farm Bill Undermines Court Ruling
description: BRIDGETON, April 8Organizations representing migrant farm workers charged today that pending legislation would undermine a New Jersey Supreme Court ruling that allows visitors to enter farms to aid migrants.

title: Dead L.I. Man and Wife Arrested in Insurance Fraud
description: BABYLON, L.I., April 8A man who was officially dedared dead two years ago and his wife, who had reportedi This death in a boating accident here, have been arrested in Ohio and charged with attempting to swindle insurance companies out of more than $60,000 by faking the mishap.

title: Assembly Delays Bill for SavingsBank Checking
description: ALBANY, April 8The Assembly, in an unusual move, today amended on the floor of the house a bill granting savings banks checking account privileges and as a result slowed the progress of the bill significantly.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, April 8Fees for motor vehicle inspections may be proposed in the State Legislature to help close budget gaps, Assembly Speaker Joseph A. LeFante said today.

title: A LAWYER ADMITS 2.5 MILLION THEFT
description: A lawyer who had been charged with stealing more than $2.5 million from two prominent Wall Street law firms where he was a partner pleaded guilty yesterday to forgery in the second degree.

title: Amex and Counter Lower for 2d Day; Trading Moderate
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market finished sharply lower yesterday for the second consecutive session in moderate trading.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Flu Experts Urging Vaccine Production To Stop New Strain
description: GENEVA, Feb. 8The World Health Organization said today that influenza experts had urged vaccineproducing countries to begin making vaccines to combat a possible outbreak of flu caused by the strain dis. covered at Fort Dix, N.J.

title: PHILLIPS WILL RAISE TUBULAR PIPE PRICES
description: Phillips Products Inc. announced yesterday that it planned to raise prices on May 15 by approximately 5 percent on most of its tubular products due to continued increases in the cost of raw materials and services.

title: Sketches of Callaghan Ministers
description: Representative of intellectual center of Labor Party, a socialist theoretician...Son of a senior civil servant, an Under Secretary for War... Entered House of Commons in 1950... has held several important ministerial posts since 1964...As Foreign Secretary, his hosts abroad will doubtless see him as typical Englishman, a bit aloof, selfassured and calm ...57... Took up Labor Party politics while at Oxford, where he received a firstclass honors degree in politics, philosophy and economics...the author of highly regarded The Future of Socialism, published in 1956, and several other books Wife, Susan, is an American.

title: Market Place
description: Managers of pension and profit  sharing funds have been impressed by the potential in real estate, call options and oil and gas royalties despite the fact that recent market experience has dramatized the risks in these areas.

title: Hard Work Pays Off for Delegate Candidates
description: The statewide voter turnout in the New York Democratic Presidential primary last Tuesday was a low 20 percent. But, in the 16th Election District in upstate Scotia, 53 percent of the 139 enrolled Democrats turned out after considerable prodding by the Democratic county committeeman and woman in that district.

title: CLIMB CONTINUES IN COCOA FUTURES
description: Cocoa futures continued their recent climb yesterday, with the May delivery closing at 73.75, up from 72.80 cents a pound Wednesday on the New York Cocoa Exchange. A week ago, on April 1, the same Conn tract traded at 70.40.

title: Jets Pick Another Quarterback From Alabama in N.F.L. Draft
description: From the balcony overlooking the ballroom where the National Football League staged its college draft yesterday, a roarthe type of roar Joe Namath used to hearwent up when the Jets announced they had taken a quarterback out of Alabama named Richard Todd.

title: U.S. SEEKS TO BAR BIAS BY SCHOOLS
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Justice Department urged the Supreme Court today to outlaw racial segregation in allwhite private schools, many of them in the South.

title: Abroad
description: Ended 1 P.M. lowest temperature in last 12hour period; highost temperatures in 24hour period.

title: Amex Lists Net Income Of $316,000 for 1975
description: The American Stock Exchange reported yesterday a net income of $316,000 for 1975, following a net loss of $1.1 million in 1974. It was the first profitable year for the Amex since 1972.

title: Puerto Rican Fishermen Battle Pollution's Threat
description: BARCELONETA, P.R.Ferdinand Perez has been fishing in the Manati River for 40 years. He makes about $3,840 a year selling his catch and is president of the Fishermen's Association in Barrio La Boca, a community on Puerto Rico's northwestern coast where the lazy Manati River greets the tranquil Caribbean Sea.

title: SENATE APPROVES FOOD STAMP BILL
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Senate reached final agreement today on a food stamp reform bill that, for the first time, would set a gross income ceiling for participants in the program and standardize the way they qualify for benefits.

title: Manufacturer of Fireworks in Paris Returning a Compliment to Jefferson
description: WASHINGTON, April 8In the autumn of 1786, Thomas Jefferson and Maria Cosway visited Ruggieri's, a popular Paris pleasure garden. On June 1, 1976, courtesy of the National Gallery of Art, Ruggieri's will return the compliment with an 18thcentury fireworks display to Mark the opening of the gallerv's Jefferson show

title: Betty Ford Crosses NBC Picket Line to Accept an Award on Television
description: While striking technicians of the National Broadcasting Company stood barricated on a side street, Betty Ford went through the main entrance of a Broadway theater last night for the taping of a television show that honored her and nine others as Women of the Year.

title: Westinghouse's McGannon Hits TV Industry Code
description: Donald H. McGannon received the distinguished service award of the National Association of Broadcasters in 1964, the industry's highest honor. But last week, he and the five television stations he oversees for the Westinghouse Broadcasting Company were expelled from the association for refusing to subscribe to the industry's television code.

title: Joan Kennedy's Mother Dies
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., April 8 (AP)Virginia Bennett, mother of Joan Kennedy and motherinlaw of Sen. Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, was found dead in her Cocoa Beach apartment today, the police said. She was believed to be in her 60's.

title: Shots Called by Gould On Big Market Turns
description: When the stock market fell sharply on Wednesday, word spread rapidly that Edson Beers Gould might have had something to do with it.

title: Floyd's 65 Leads Masters
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 8Ray Floyd is the expert witness on misspent youth and the little No. 5 wood. He says his nights as a playboy were fun, but not exactly good preparation for the winning of golf tournaments. Family responsibility and the newly acquired 5wood, on the other hand, do help his game.

title: Poland Stuns Soviet In Title Hockey, 64
description: KATON,VICE,. Poland, April 8 (AP)Poland built a 52 lead in the first two periods and scored a 64 upset victory over the Olympic champion Soviet Union today in the first round of the world ice hockey, championships.

title: A Class of PretzelMunchers Wanders Into Food Day Event
description: Claire Mendelson's thirdgrade class from Public School 47 in the East Bronx had walked to Bryant Park for an openair lunch after watching an African dance troupe at Town Hall.

title: Harris Quits Active Role In Presidential Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 Fred Harris exited laughing today.

title: New Bond Issues
description: UTILITIES

title: KISSINGER PRODS SEALAW SESSION
description: Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger warned yesterday that the United States would proceed to explore the ocean floor and mine its Inineral wealth unless international agreement was reached soon on a new law of the sea.

title: $50,000 Mellon Award To Pierre Alechinsky
description: PITTSBURGH, April 8The $50,000 Andrew W. Mellon Prize of the Museum of Art of the Carnegie Institute has been awarded to Pierre Alechinsky, French painter. Leon A. Artus, director of the museum, said the prize is the largest ever given to a painter or sculptor.

title: Yonkers Raceway Results
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% state tax).

title: 8 G.O.P. Assemblymen Call for Reid's Dismissal
description: ALBANY, April 8Eight up state Republican Assemblymen called today for the dismissa of Ogden R. Reid, the Commissioner of Environmental Con servation, whom they accused of being such a bad administra for that he was rapidly bringing the department into a state of chaos.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 2.3 From WeekAgo Leve
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 199.6 from 197.3 last week.

title: VENEZUELA BEGINS TALKS WITH OWENS
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, April 8 (AP)OwensIllinois Inc. began formal talks here today with the Venezuelan Government about the announced takeover of the company's holdings in a dispute over a kidnapped American executive, officials said.

title: New Tampa Club Takes Leroy Selmon First
description: Leroy Selmon, the defensive lineman from Oklahoma, was predictably the first player selected in the National Football League draft of college athletes yesterday. The Tampa Bay Buccaneers, the expansion franchise putting together a team for its first season next fall, selected Selmon, a 260pound performer who was described by their coach, John McKay, as the best available athlete in the draft.

title: DRUG UNIT SEEKS TO CHECK TESTING
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Food and Drug Administration is planning a system to audit all animal test facilities that are used in drug research.

title: LONG TALKS SEEN ON PANAMA CANAL
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (AP) Ambassador at Large Ellsworth Bunker indicated to a House subcommittee today that there was no immediate prospect of completing negotiations with Panama over a new treaty governing the Panama Canal, according to the subcommittee's chairman.

title: Northwest Pipeline Seeks Alaska Gas; 3d Route Proposed
description: The Northwest Pipeline Corporation announced yesterday that it had offered to buy one to two trillion cubic feet of natural gas owned by the State of Alaska in Prudhoe Bay, and if successful, to sponsor a third pipeline route to.transport it to customers in Pacific Northwest and Intermountain states.

title: Dismay in India
description: NEW DELHIMany Indians supported Prime Mirjster Indira Gandhi when she declared a state of national emergency last June aid sent tens of thousands of her critics to prison. They evidently felt, that her conviction earlier by the Allahabad High Court on charges of electoral corruption and the consequent loss of her parliamentary seat for six years would deprive India of her strong leadership and weaken the democratic fabric.

title: Senator Williams Plans to Run On Uncommitted Slate in Jersey
description: TRENTON, April 8 Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. announced tonight that he would run as an uncommitted delegate to the Democratic National Convention, thus joining the state party organization in New Jersey in its covert support of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota.

title: Consumer Buying Found More Strength in March
description: The steady upward pace of consumer buying continued last month across the nation despite the adverse effect of this year's late Easter, according to March sales reports issued yesterday by 11 of the country's largest retail chains.

title: Court Seeks Names in CableTV Case
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The Federal Communications Commission has been ordered by a Federal Court to prepare a list of all persons who made off  the  record presentations about cable television while the commission was drafting rules that sharply restrict the cable industry.

title: Black and Puerto Rican Leaders Score Cuts in State Budget
description: TRENTON, April 8  I'm tired of hearing that women have babies to go on welfare, Anna M. Sample of Camden told Governor Byrne today as she and a score of leaders of the black and Puerto Rican communities met with him to demand that money for programs for the poor be restored to the state budget.

title: Hua's Rise Blurs Division of Peking Leaders Into Radicals and Moderates
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The swift rise of Hua Kuofeng to a position in the Chinese hierarchy that places him only notch below Chairman Mao Tsetung blurs the division of the Chinese leadership into two irreconcilable factions, the radicals and the moderates.

title: Women in Industry to Be Honored
description: CRESSKILL, April 8The second annual Tribute to Women and Industry by the Ridgewood Y.M.C.A. will be held tomorrow night at the Tammy Brook Country Club here.

title: New Wing of Junior High for the Deaf Dedicated
description: Eric Regan, 9 years old, bounded into the small playground where dedication ceremonies were being held yesterday, shimmying and shaking to the rhythmic sounds of drums and maracas, performing with graceful abandon an Africaninspired dance that he had improvised for the occasion.

title: Maybe We're Not So Bad
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The United States is not the only country in the world trying to pick new political leaders these days, and if it crosses your mind occasionally that the American primary election system is not exactly ideal, you might consider some of these other systems for passing power from one person or faction to another.

title: Rosewall Is Victor In Houston Tennis
description: HOUSTON, Texas, April 8 (UPI)Ken Rosewall of Australia defeated his veteran adversary, Rod Laver, 36, 64, 63, today to begin defense of his River Oaks tennis tournament title.

title: HUMPHREY AIDED IN PENNSYLVANIA
description: PITTSBURGH, April 8Ostensibly committed to the candidacy of Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington, Pennsylvania's most powerful labor leaders are nevertheless trying to enhance Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's Presidential aspirations by thwarting Jimmy Carter's campaign for the Democratic primary here on April 27.

title: CORRECTION
description: In the caption provided by The Associated Press for a photograph that appeared in The Times on Thursday, the names of Pauline FeIngold and Roz Lichter were transposed. Miss Feingold was also incorrectly identified as chairman of the New York Urban Coalition. She is chairman of the New York Women in Criminal Justice.

title: Anker Supersedes Local School Board in Dispute
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker yesterday superseded a Manhattan school board in a move to force principals in the district to comply with citywide policy on shortened school days.

title: Dividends
description: IRREGULAR

title: Hydrogen Extraction Methods Growing
description: Extraction of hydrogen fuel from water by using heat and chemical catalysts, instead of relying exclusively on electricity, is becoming a laboratory reality, scientists from several industry and government research centers reported here yesterday.

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: Cleveland vs. New England Threeoffive series

title: Right Move
description: Patrick J. Cunningham, the Democratic state chairman, has apparently decided to end his stubborn holdout against appearing before a special grand jury investigating charges that he was implicated in the sale of judgeships. Whether taken in deference to Governor Carey's openly voiced irritation or in belated realization that he was damaging both his party and his own credibility, the Cunningham decision is unquestionably the right first step toward clearing himself of the accusations brought by Special State Prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari.

title: 4 HOUSE MEMBERS BALK ON CITY AID
description: Members of the House of Representatives from four of the city's more impoverished districts said yesterday that they would oppose any further Federal loan assistance to New York City unless the money was intended for the city's residents rather than its Bankers.

title: Louise Huger, Former Editor Of Letters to Times, Is Dead
description: Louise Huger Beaver, retired Letters to the Editor editor of The New York Times, died of cancer yesterday at the North Adams (Mass.) Regional Hospital. She was 73 years old and lived in Williamstown, Mass.

title: Mystery Force on Moon May Run Apollo Station
description: A mysterious force on the moon has been perplexing space scientists in recent months by making one of the remotecontrolled scientific stations set up by Apollo astronauts behave peculiarly.

title: Moderator of Law of the Sea Conference
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 8  When Hamilton Shirley Amerasinghe of Sri Lanka was elected president of the United Nations' Law of the Sea Conference in 1973, friendly diplomats jested that he had won a lifetime job because the ambitious undertaking of drafting a global treaty for the uses of the oceans surely would drag on for decades.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, APRIL 9, 1976

title: A School on S.I. Named to Honor Native Daughter
description: Public School 60 on Staten Island became the Alice Austen School last night as parents, pupils, teachers and 500 others gathered for a dedication ceremony in tribute to a photographer of the city's yesteryear.

title: CONGRESS IS URGED TO EASE AIR CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board said today that its regulation of the nation's airlines probably had forced air fares up unnecessarily and it urged Congress to cut back its control over air travel.

title: ExStockbroker Accused Of Robbing Retired Judge
description: A 49yearold former stockbroker was accused yesterday of stealing more than $32,000 in stocks from Louis A. Pagnucco, a retired Family Court fudge.

title: Grins And Grits
description: FROGMORE, S. C. A few years ago in a small South Carolina town where I lived, a man named Gene Kneece announced that he was going to run for the job of superintendent of schools. Although Gene was a nice fellow, he did not have any apparent qualifications for that post. But he went out knocking on doors.

title: Dublin Frees I.R.A. Chief; Rise in Violence Expected
description: DUBLIN, April 9 (Reuters)David O'Connell, regarded as one of the most active leaders in the Irish guerrila movement, was released today after nine months in jail, arousing concern about imminent new bloodshed.

title: Advertising
description: Ten years ago, Louis T. Hagopian was sitting on top of the world. Just 40 years old, he had risen from the bluecollar town of Pontiac, Mich., and at Chrysler at the age of 31 had been ad and sales promotion director of Plymouth, running a $25 millinn budget.

title: Historian Challenged on Report That Hiss Lied About Chambers
description: ST. LOUIS, April 8Prof. Allen Weinstein was sharply challenged today on his assertion that documents in the Alger Hiss case of some 25 years ago convincingly demonstrated his guilt on the charge of passing Government documents to Whitaker Chambers, a professed Soviet agent.

title: Islanders Oust Canucks, 31
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, April 8The New York Islanders scored two goals within 32 seconds of the third period tonight and eliminated the Vancouver Canucks from the National Hockey League Stanley Cup playoffs with a 31 victory. After a sloppy contest and a 53 triumph at the Nassau Coliseum on Tuesday, the team offered the kind of tight hockey a playoff game should be.

title: Fisher Hall Tries Again for Sound of Perfection
description: Immediately after the New York Philharmonic's last subscription concert of the current season May 15, Lincoln Center crews will begin stripping Avery Fisher Hall of its seats and other salvageable items.

title: Injunction Bars Seizrue Of NursinaHome Records
description: The owners of two nursing homes on Long Island yesterday won a temporary restraining order in Federal District Court in Brooklyn to prevent the state's special prosecutor for cursing homes, Charles J. Hynes, from moving in State Supreme Court in Suffolk County to have their records subpoenaed.

title: Udall Wins All 5 Places On 23rd District Ballot
description: Final returns from Tuesday's Democratic convention delegate election in New York's 23rd Congressional District showed yesterday that the slate pledged to Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona had won all five seats.

title: Mr. Callaghan's Cabinet
description: Prime Minister Callaghan's designation of Anthony Crosland as Britain's Foreign Secretary places in that important office a stout defender of the Atlantic Alliance, an early supporter of British entry into the European Common Market, and a modern, pragmatic politician whose economic and social views closely resemble those of his Social Democratic counterparts in Western Europe. This is an appointment certain to be well received by Britain's NATO allies and European Community partners.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: High Court Record Onlndividual Rights Defended by Burger
description: ST. PAUL, April 8In a rare public response to criticism of the Supreme Court and its rulings, Chief Justice Warren E. Burger contended today that tho socalled Burger Court's record on protecting individual rights was at least as good as the record of any earlier Court.

title: 3 Hughes Aides Quizzed About Customs Matters
description: WASHINGTON, April 8A State Department official said today that three aides to the late Howard R. Hughes were being questioned by a Mexican prosecutor about a customs matter involving the Hughes group in Acapulco.

title: DR. S.W. BLIZZARD JR. OF PRINCETON DEAD
description: The Rev. Dr. Samuel Wilson Blizzard Jr., who retired last July as holder of the Maxwell M. Upson Chair in Christianity and Society at the Princeton Theological Seminary, died of pneumonia Tuesday in the Princeton Medical Center. He was 61 years old.

title: SINGER CHARGED IN DEATH OF SKIER
description: ASPEN, Colo., April 8 Claudine Longet, a French singer and actress, was charged today with manslaughter in the shooting death of Vladimir Sainch, twice the world professional ski racing champion.

title: Bonn Magazine Views. the U.S. at 200
description: BONN, April 8 (AP)Stern, West Germany's largest illustrated magazine, put on sale today a 116page, twopound supplement appraising the United States on its Bicentennial. Its conclusion: one American era has passed, but a new one lies ahead.

title: BRITAIN'S PREMIER SELECTS CROSLAND AS FOREIGN CHIEF
description: LONDON, April 8  Prime Minister James Callaghan announced his Cabinet tonight, naming Anthony Crosland Foreign Secretary.

title: The Ballet
description: The Pennsylvania Ballet from Philadelphia is pushing 13 (years, that is) and in that relatively shirt time, it has accomplished a great deal. Most balletgoers would rank it as the. No. 4 company in the country, and its New York following has increased with its every visit, especially during its recent and regular engagements at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Business Briefs
description: VIENNA, April 8 (UPI)Oil ministers of the 13member Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries will meet May 27 at Bali. Indonesia, to discuss another oil price increase after July 1, an OPEC spokesman said today. The May 27 meeting was originally scheduled for Jakarta, Indonesia, but it was transferred to Bali because of better facilities there, the spokesman said.

title: Utility Customers Must Bear Ad Costs
description: In an action likely to have national implications, the New York State Public Service Commission announced yesterday that customers of an upstate electric and gas utility must bear the company's advertising expenses promoting the use of nuclear power regardless of whether or not they agree with the company's position.

title: College, School Results
description: BASEBALL

title: COMMODORE PLAN IS CALLED UNFAIR
description: A city plan to forgo $4 million a year in property taxes to entice a private developer to rebuild the Commodore Hotel into a luxury tourist facility was attacked yesterday by rival hotel operators who charged unfair competition.

title: House Approves Funds for Production of $21 Billion B1 Bomber
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The house, in the first major test of Congressional sentiment on military spending, approved today funds for production of the Air Force B1 strategic bomber that will ultimately cost $21 billion.

title: Swedish Monarch Helps Swedesboro to Celebrate
description: SWEDESBORO, N. J, April 8King Carl XVI Gustaf came to this small Gloucester County farming community today to commemorate its founding more than 300 years ago as one of the first Swedish settlements in America.

title: Donovan Is Singing At the Bottom Line With a 60's Flavor
description: The 60's are gone, thank goodness. It was difficult to shake them, murmured Donovan in a resonant stage whisper, during his opening, show Wednesday night at the Bottom Line, the beginning of a fivenight run at the club.

title: Okker, Drysdale Gain Semifinals
description: JOHANNESBURG, April 8 (AP)Tom Okker of the Netherlands, seeded third, beat Geoff Masters of Australia, 63, 64, today in a quarterfinal match of the South African Classic tennis tournament.

title: Events Today
description: Films

title: Udall Office Pilfered
description: WASHINGTON. April 8 (AP) The staff of Representative Morris K. Udall's national campaign headquarters told the police today a radio and a tape recorder had been stolen from the Udall offices near Capitol Hill. The Police said that there was no sign of forcible entry

title: Washington's Fiscal Role in New York
description: WASHINGTON, April 8If Mayor Beame doesn't want Governor Carey to run his city, does he want the President of the United States to be Acting Mayor of New York City? The question was asked by President Ford during a speech at the National Press Club last October. He added: I see a serious threat to the legal relationships among our. Federal, state and local governments in any Congressional action which could lead to disrupting of this traditional balance. He was citing such a threatened imbalance as one of the major reasons he then opposed Federal aid to avert default by the city.

title: TV Review
description: The first half of The Story of David, called David and King Saul, can be seen on ABCTV tonight at 9 o'clock. I watched the installment on a large screen at the studios of Columbia Pictures television division, and I now believe that was a mistake. A production designed for a small television screen frequently  in fact, nearly always  does not work in giant blowup.

title: San Franciscans Soured By City Workers' Strike
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 8 Residents of this hilly city by the bay are disturbed and divided by an eightdayold strike of nearly 1,900 Municipal craft workers that threatens to become a general strike by all union workers.

title: Braves Top Knicks, Gain On 76ers
description: The Knicks went from fair to had to worse last night and the Buffalo Braves from horrid to good.

title: Sadat Affirms That He Wants Weapons From U.S.
description: ROME, April 8President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said today that he would like to obtain more arms from the United States beyond the six transport planes that Washington has already agreed to sell him.

title: HUMPHEY AIDED IN PENNSYLVANIA
description: PITTSBURGH, April 8Ostensibly committed to the candidacy of Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington, Pennsylvania's most powerful labor leaders are nevertheless trying to enhance Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's Presidential aspirations by thwarting Jimmy Carter's campaign for the Democratic primary here on April 27.

title: City U. Union Head Named
description: Dr. Irwin II. Polishook, a vice president of the American Federation of Teachers, has been elected president of the Profes Sienal Staff Congress, the union representing the 17,000member instructional staff of City University. Dr. Polishook, a professor of history at Lehman College who has been the union's vice President since 1973, succeeds Dr. Belle Zeller.

title: Choice for Seat on S.E.C. Apparently Is Down to 2
description: WASHINGTON, April 8The choice to fill the newly vacant seat on the Securities and Exchange Commission appears to have narrowed to two men, both of whom have a strong background on Wall Street, sources close to the situation said today.

title: An Interior Wherein to Look and to Listen
description: The lesson behind the new design for Avery Fisher Hall is that classicism still holdstremendous power as a general design approach. The first Philharmonic Hall, as Avery Fisher Hall was originally named, as well the redesigned hall that exists now,: were the most selfconsciously modern auditoriums of the major buildings of Lincoln Center. Their oddly curved shape proved disastrous acoustically, and so now the architects Philip Johnson and John Burgee are about to bring us back to the straight, rectangular shape of classical halls of old.

title: PORTUGAL REFUSING TO EXTRADITE CUBAN
description: LISBON, April 8Portugal will refuse Havana's request for the extradition of a Cuban soldier who defected in Angola, according to highlevel Portuguese, sources.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: A child swallows rose seeds. Are they poisonous? You doubt it, but you don't really know. You do know that the most innocuousseeming substances can turn out to be dangerous, so as your heart rate starts to accelerate you pull the phone book down from the top of the refrigerator, whip it open to the New York City emergency numbers and dial 3404494.

title: Further Political Fund Delay Likely
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 Campaign subsidies for Presidential candidates may not be resumed until May too late to help finance the next half dozen primaries, including key contests in Pennsylvania and Texas.

title: Memo by Butz Is Said to Indicate He Was Asked to Aid Callaway
description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (UPI) A Senate investigator said today he had found a memo that indicated Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz was asked to help Howard H. Callaway win an addition of Federal land to Mr. Callaway's Colorado ski resort last year.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing.

title: Notes on People
description: After 22 years of inside information about who the Pulitzer Prizewinners will be, John Hohenberg will retire as administrator of the prizes at Columbia University on June 30. He will spend the 197677 academic year in Knoxville as the second Edward Meeman Distinguished Professor of Journalism at the University of Tennessee. The first was Turner Catledge retired executive editor of The New York Times.

title: E. Alice Austen Photographed Earlier Gracious Days of S.I.
description: The history of photography has harbored many strange and poignant careers, but few have been strangerand none more poignantthan the one honored last night in the dedication of a public school in Graniteville. S.I.

title: Rookies to Call Shots In MetExpo Opener
description: The Mets open their 15th National League season at 2:05 today against the Montreal Expos at Shea Stadium, with Tom Seaver, who has never lost as a firstday pitcher, opposing Steve Rogers who has never started an opening game in his threeyear major league career.

title: The Limits of Attrition
description: The city's new financial plan recognizes an unpleasant reality that has been largely ignored in the recent pastthat is, that attrition cannot always substitute for layoffs as a means of reducing the municipal work force.

title: Money

description: Operating earnings of the Chemical New York Corporation in the first quarter dropped by 23,7 percent, to the equivalent of $1.42 a share, compared with $1.86 in the 1975 period, the parent concern of the Chemical Bank reported terday.

description: WASHINGTON, April 8 (AP) The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation told Senate investigators today that it would comply with a subpoena demanding the names of officials in Japan and other countries who were paid millions of dollars in bribes by the company's sales agents.

description: CINCINNATI, April 8 (AP) Tony Perez drove in lour runs and Gary Nolan won his first season opener in seven years today as the Cincinnati Reds scored an 115 victory over the Houston Astros in the National League opener.

title: Peyser Complains of Gift To Buckley by Party Group
description: WASHINGTON, April 8Representative Peter A. Peyser the Westchester County Republican who is a candidate for his party's Senate nomination. filed a formal complaint today with the Federal Election Commission protesting a $5,000 campaign contribution from the National Republican Senatorial Committee to his opponent. Senator James L. Buckley and denying Mr. Peyser's request for funds.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: The Empire Diner, 210 10th Avenue at 22d Street, is open 24 hours a day seven days a week. Never having sat it out for more than two hours at a time, we are unable to report whether the place ever quiets down. Between the hours of 6 and 10 P.M., the span of our visits, it has been on two occasions the noisiest of the 300 New York restaurants we have visited since Jan. 1, 1974. Early one Sunday evening it wasn't too bad.

title: Bridge:
description: Only a tiny minority of American enthusiasts will be able to travel to Monte Carlo next month to support their representatives in four major international events the Ber muda Bowl, the world team championship by zones; the Venice Trophy, a women's challenge match between British and American teams; the World Olympiad open team championship, and the World Olympiad women's team championship.

title: Bostonians Play Wagner, Sibelius With Colin Davis
description: A symphonic progrm consisting entllely of music by Wagner and Sibelius is rare enough nowadays to constitute a novelty. Therefore the Boston Symphony Orchestra concert at Carnegie Hall on Wednesday night qualified as something special even before it was played. Colin Davis, guest conductor, had scheduled excerpts from Wagner's Der Ring des Nibelungen ("Forest Murmurs, Siegfried's Rhine Journey and Siegfried's Funeral March) and Sibelius's Symphony No. 2.

title: Western Envoy Criticizes Israel on Aid Campaign
description: TEL AVIV. April 8 (UPI)A Western diplomat accused Israel today of playing dirty pool by putting pressure on Congress to approve more foreign aid than requested by President Ford.
