title: Boston Marathon Runners Go Out in Noonday Sun Today
description: BOSTON, April 18The train that carried Paul Heyer here from New Jersey yesterday was airconditioned, so Heyer did not know how hot it was outside. But when he saw the girls in their bikinis, wading in the Charles River, he knew that it was too hot for comfort. And he knew that tomorrow's running of the Boston Marathon would be a run for the hoses.

title: A SPECIAL SCHOOL WORKS ON READING
description: Rol Crlchlow was in that half of his 10thgrade class at Automotive High School that always failed. He got into a fight once and eventually was expelled from the Brooklyn school.

title: A Green School Brings Harmony in Japan
description: NARA, Japan  When little Kazuhiro Sugiyama and the 719 other pupils of this city's newest elementary school donned their canvas slippers and shuffled down the shiny halls for the start of the new academic year here recently, they could sense something different about the yearold building.

title: IntermediateSize Autos Lead Sales Toward Third Best Year
description: DETROIT, April 18Though some are tempted, no one is willing just yet to say that the auto business is booming. But clearly it has surged in the last three months well beyond the point of mere recovery from the worst recesstpn since World War II.

title: High of 96 in New York Melts Quite a Few Records
description: Young women discarded their shoes and men took off their jackets and ties, babies cried, outdoor water fountains drew long lines and midsummer lassitude fell over New York City yesterday as the temperature climbed to 96 degreesthe warmest for an April day, any April day, ever recorded in the city.

title: Abigail Cantwell Wed to John Girr
description: Abigail Margaret Cantwell, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. William Cantwell of New York, was married yesterday afternoon in Saugerties, N.Y., to John Charles Girr. He is a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. August Girr of New York and Bay Shore, L. I.

title: Close Friends in A Chorus Line Competed for Tony
description: Kelly Bishop believedcross my heart, hope to die that her good friend Priscilla Lopez would win the Tony award for best featured actress in a musical. Both, appearing in A Chorus Line, had ben nominated for the award and accepted it with delighted radiance, blowing kisses to the audience.

title: TRIDENT SUBMARINE IS OPPOSED BY UDALL
description: NEW HAVEN. April 18 (AP)  Despite possible political risks. Morris K. Udall, the Democratic Presidential hopeful, says he opposes development of the Trident nuclear submarine, a program already under way in Connecticut.

title: Market Chartists Influence Growing
description: Slightly more than a week ago, as the Dow Jones industrial average had struggled again above the 1,000 level, a wellknown market anayst surprised Wall Street and investors generally with his outoftheblue forecast that the Dow would drop 100 or more points within the near future.

title: NATO Tank Trap
description: In 1974, James R. Schlesinger, then United States Secretary of Defense, and West Germany's Defense Minister, Georg Leber, agreed on competitive trials of a new American tank vs. Germany's projected Leopard II. The general understanding was that the winner would be selected as the main battle tank for both countries.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, April 18Despite a hiring freeze and cutbacks in services, the state has been making significant progress through its affirmativeaction program in hiring women and minoritygroup members, according to Governor Byrne.

title: Connecticut Thread Workers Accept TwoYear Contract
description: WILLIMANTIC, Conn., April 13 (AP)Workers at the Amercan Thread Co. voted 295155 today to accept a twoyear contract that will give them a 50cent hourly increase in wages and fringe benefits.

title: Privacy or Pretense
description: WASHINGTON  Eunice Shriver, sister of John F. Kennedy, wrote a blistering letter to The Washington Star last week for publishing a United Press account of a story in The National Enquirer about her sisterinlaw, Joan Kennedy.

title: Saudis Adding to Military Might
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, April 14Saudi Arabia is reported fitting out its armed forces with large amounts of new military facilities and equipment and may make further substantial purchases of warWanes.

title: G. WALLACE CONOVER
description: G. Wallace Conover, editov of the weekly Somerset (N.J.) MessengerGazette from 1931 to his retirement in 1972 and a past president of the New Jersey Press Association, died yesterday at Hunterdon County Medical Center in Flemington, N.J. He was 74 years old and lived at 87 East Spring Street in Somerville.

title: Redford Burned in Effigy For Opposing Power Plant
description: KANAB. Utah, April 18 (AP) More than 500 local residents cheered as they burned a blondwigged effigy of Robert Redford, the movie actor who opposed construction of a $3.5 billion power plant that was dropped last week.

title: DR. JOHN E. BUHLER
description: Dr. John E. Buhler, dean emeritus of the school of dentistry of the Medical University of South Carolina, which he organized and led in its formative years, died yesterday in Charleston, S.C. He was 67 years old.

title: A Shiploading Fore'man is Convicted in Payroll Padding Inquiry
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 18A shiploading foreman at two grain elevators has been con: victed of theft for receiving pay for work that he did not perform.

title: Hitler's Birthplace Will Be School for the Retarded
description: BRAUNAU, Austria, April 18 (Reuters) The house where Adolf Hitler was born is to be converted to a school for retarded children, according to the deputy mayor of this border town.

title: Libertarian Candidate Would Burn Federal Check Providing Campaign Aid
description: WASHINGTON, April 18The Georgetown cocktail party, by now, is as much of a political clich as the rubberchicken dinner, but one held here last week was a little different: the candidate was a man who would not accept Federal matching funds for his campaign if he could get them.

title: Tracy Austin, 13, Takes Easter Bowl Tennis Title
description: Pigtails flying, squealing every time she hit a winner,Tracy Austin was the star of the Easter Bowl junior tennis finals here yesterday.

title: CHILD 3, SURVIVES A 12STORY FALL
description: A 3yearold boy fell out the window of a 12thfloor apartment in Coney Island last night and landed in a hedge.

title: Coast Victor May Miss Role in Kentucky Derby
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., April 18The Hollywood Derby, which was supposed to clarify the West Coast situation for participation in the Kentucky Derby, didn't prove anything yesterday except. for the umpteenth time, the greatness of Bill Shoemaker as a jockey.

title: By His Own Petard
description: At a low point in his years as Prime Minister, Harold Wilson was portrayed on the London stage as pudgy little man in a wrinkled Batman suit, telling everyone what wonders he could perform. That image is brought to mind by Henry Kissinger's current effort, in speeches around the country, to rally political support for his foreign policy.

title: Angolan Official in Cuba
description: HAVANA. April 18 (Retiterci) Angola's Public Health Minister, Dr. Marin Alfon,40 meicla, is visiting Cuba for talks on cooperation with Cuban health authorities the Athan press agency. Prensa Latina, reported.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: LES GIRLS A cabaret bill shared by two women singers, no longer young and both new to local bistros, works nicely at Once Upon a Stove, 325 Third Avenue (between 24th and 25th Streets). Taina Elg and Denise Lor are the first name booking in the restaurant's Valentine Room, where singing waiters and waitresses previously mounted the podium. There's now a $3.50 cover charge and a minimum of two drinks (most are $2).

title: EXPERT WARNS U.S. ON TIE WITH TAIWAN
description: WASHINGTON, April 18 (Reuters)A leading expert on the Far East says that unless the United States severs its formal ties with the Chinese Nationalists on Taiwan by next year there could be a deterioration of relations between the United States and China.

title: Personal Finance
description: When Mr. and Mrs. Lee Bogart moved into their newly built contemporary home in Virginia Beach, Va., last July, a lot of interior work remained to be done. Doors and closets were missing, the screen doors and windows were not installed and the stove and dishwasher were hanging out from their cabinetsplus more than 40 other unfinished items.

title: Dibiasi is Victor In Torono Diving
description: TORONTO, April 18 (Reuters)Klaus Dibiasi of Italy, winner of consecutive highboard gold medals at the Mexico and Munich Olympics, today captured the threemeter springboard event at the Canada Cup International Diving Tournament.

title: SCANDAL'S EFFECTS WIDENING IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, April 18The Lockheed scandal that has shaken and preoccupied this nation for more than two months has begun to have longterm and deepseated consequences for Japan's politics, economy, security and diplomacy.

title: 4 IN, ILLINOIS FACE CORRUPTION CHARGE
description: EAST. ST. LOUIS, III., April 18 (AP)The police chief, an administrative assistant to the Mayor, the director of public safety and a police officer have been arrested here and charged with protecting illegal gambling.

title: Israel Again Lowers Value of Its Currency
description: TEL AVIV, April 18 (AP)Israel announced today a 2 percent devaluation of the Israeli pound, lowering its value from 7.52 to 7.67 pounds to the United States dollar.

title: CAPITAL TOURISTS MAY FACE BAD AIR
description: WASHINGTON, April 18 (UP])Russell E. Train, the Environmental Protection Agency head, said today that he ??ed bad air alert situations in Washington as millions of tourists come here this slimmer for the Bicentennial.

title: SHAKTI IS HEARD IN INDIAN MUSIC
description: Weather Report has long been a leader of the jazzrock movement. But at the early show Saturday night at the Beacon Theater it was handily upstaged by the opening act.

title: Baltimore Rated Most Responsive City
description: A nonprofit research group's survey of 22 cities yesterday reported that Baltimore was most responsive to its citizens and Chicago the least so.with New York ranked 20th.

title: Connecticut Unions Endorse Carter On His Labor Record
description: HARTFORD, April IS (UPI)A 250,000member coalition of Connecticut labor unions praising Jimmy Carter for his progressive labor record, endorsed him today for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Voting for Literary Miss Rheingold; A Guide to the National Book Awards
description: This afternoon at 5 o'clock, in the New York State Theater at Lincoln Center, the 1976 National Book Awards will be announced. For the first time in weeks, the book community will have something else to talk about besides Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein.

title: Franco Restivo, 65, Dead; ExCabinet Officer in Italy
description: PALERMO, Sicily, April 18 (AP)Franco Restivo, a prominent member of the Christian Democratic Party who was a minister in several cabinets in postwar Italy, died Saturday. He was 65 years old.

title: 2 Twins Homers in 9th Top Hunter, Yanks 54
description: James Augustus Hunter has given up so many home runs in his glittering career it won't be long before he forgets the latest pair he allowed, even though it cost him a game.

title: Sports Today
description: Mats vs. Cardinals, at St. Louis (TelevisionChannel 7, 8:30 P.M.) (Radio  WNEW, 8:30 P.M.)

title: French Students in Appea
description: TOULOUSE, France. April 18 (Reuters)  Leaders of French university students, at a conference here, called upon labor unions today to join their battle against proposed reforms in higher education and to present a common front against a Government policy of repression and blackmail. The students say the reforms, scheduled to take effect in the fall, will give industry too big a voice in planning of university curriculums.

title: La Guardia School Taking Hispanic Radical's Name
description: The name of Mayor Fiorello H. La Guardia is to be removed from a Harlem public school in favor of the name of Pedro Albizu Campos, the Puerto Rican nationalist leader who turned to violence and terrorism in seeking Puerto Rico's independence.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor.

title: Neighborhood: Woodside Celebrates a Family Easter
description: Easter was observed in lowkeyed, neighborhood style yesterday in the Woodside section of Queens, with the emphasis on religion, family and old friendships. The fashion stars were little girls, frequently of preschool age.

title: SAMUEL BELKIN OF YESHIVA DIES
description: Dr. Samuel Belkin, chancellor of Yeshiva University, distinguished Hellenist and Talmudic scholar, died yesterday at the Albert Einstein College Hospital after an illness of sev{ eral months. He was 64 years old and lived at 101 Central Park West.

title: 30,000 Israelis Parade In Claim to the West Bank
description: TEL AVIV, April 18About 30,000 Israeli nationalists, some carrying weapons, marched 11 miles through the Israelioccupied West Bank to dramatize their belief in their historic title to the area and to demand the right to settle there.

title: Prisoners in U.S. Top 249,000, A Record, With Most Under 30
description: WASHINGTON, April 18 (UPI)Partly because of postWorld War II increase in population and a renewed emphasis on punishment, there are more men and women in state and Federal prisons today than at any other time in the don's history, according to a report in the April issue of Corrections Magazine.

title: MOSCOW CHARGES U.S. INTERFERENCE IN WEST EUROPE
description: MOSCOW, April 18Pravda, the official Communist Party newspaper, charged today that Washington was interfering in the internal affairs of Western European governments by warning them against allowing Communist participation.

title: CONSERVANCY GIVEN TWO TRACTS IN MAINE
description: AUGUSTA, Me., April 17Two major wilderness areas in northern Maine, totaling almost 5,000 acres and worth $500,000, have been donated to the Nature Conservancy by the J. M. Huber Corporation.

title: St. Louis Epitomizes Shift Of Federal Urban Funds
description: ST. LOUISA decade ago, Federal funds and attention in this Mississippi River city were aimed at deteriorated neighborhoods along streets that branch out from the downtown commercial areaWashington and Delmar boulevards and Cass Avenue.

title: RATES OF INTEREST NEARING 76 LOWS
description: A growing number of money market analysts believe that shortterm interest rates are very close to their lows for the year. Over the last several days this conclusion was stated in a number of market letCredit ters and talks as Markets analysts sought tc sharpen their views on the outlook. Few economists who specialize in credit market analysis apparently think that rates are about to climb sharply, but they do see a gradual upward movement in rates beginning in late spring.

title: Masked Robbers Steal $1,700 at Scout Dance
description: Six masked gunmen yesterday raided a Brooklyn dance held to raise money to send Boy Scouts to summer camp. They fled with $1,700.

title: SANFORD H. WENDOVER
description: MERIDEN, Conn., April 18 (AP)  Sanford H. Wendover, retired editor of The Meriden Journal, died yesterday. He was 81 years old.

title: 50 FAMILIES DRIVEN FROM HOMES BY FIRE:
description: More than 50 families were made homeless yesterday afternoon when a quickmoving fire swept through three Harlem apartment buildings, leading firemen to speculate that there may have been a delay in turning in the alarm.

title: Missing Pilot Backed As WriteIn Candidate
description: TURTLE CREEK, Pa., April 18 (AP)  The family of a Navy pilot shot down in Vietnam has declared him a writein candidate in Pennsylvania's Presidential primary to focus attention on veterans missing in action.

title: A Chorus Line Tops Tony Competition; Travesties Gets Award as the Best Play
description: Michael Bennett's A Chorus Line swept the honors as the best musical show of the 197576 season in the 30th annual Tony Awards last night in a glittering ceremonial production at its own house, the Shubert Theater.

title: TV Review
description: NBC's Saturday Night met the Ford Administration over the weekend, and the question of who used whom to what advantage provides a matter of intriguing debate. The program, televised live at about 11:30 P.M. on most Saturdays, has been unusually skillful, in terms of standard television, with political satire. And one of the more outstanding practitioners has been Chevy Chase, who happens to be especially successful with his interpretations of an incredibly clumsy and dense Gerald Ford.

title: 30,000 Israelis Parade In Claim to the West Bank
description: TEL AVIV. April 18About 30,000 Israeli nationalists, some carrying weapons, marched 11 miles through the Israelioccupied West Bank to dramatize their belief in their historic title to the area and to demand the right to settle there.

title: Javits, in Cairo, Praises Sadat's Sincerity on Peace
description: CAIRO, April 18 (Reuters)Senator Jacob K. Javits said today that he had been strong. ly impressed by the sincerity of President Anwar elSadat's search for peace in the Middle East.

title: Long Lunch Hours By U.S. Employees May Cost a Billion
description: WASHINGTON, April 18 (AP) Congress's General Account ing Office says that long lunches for Federal employees may be costing as much as $1.2 billion a year in lost production time.

title: Children Playing the Cruelest Game
description: In one corner of the room before the children's backgammon tournament started, a father sat across from his 11yearold son, drilling him in the best possible opening moves.

title: Denver Plane Hijacker Killed, Hostages Safe
description: DENVER, Monday. April 19 (Reuters)The hijacker of a light plane was shot to death early today inside a jet that he had demanded for a flight to Mexico.

title: CALLIOPE SINGERS ARE WELLSCHOOLED
description: The New Calliope Singers the name is derived not from the steamdriven musical instrument but from the muse of eloquence and heroic poetry gave their initial Carnegie Recital Hall performance Saturday.

title: Bouvier Gets 25th Top Prize
description: TIMONIUM, Md., April 18 The form held true on the Timonium Race Course today and a Bouvier des Flandres, Ch. Taquin du Posty Arlequin, was best of 2,293 dogs at the Baltimore County Kennel Club Show.

title: Messersmith Goes 4 Innings for Braves
description: Eight days after signing a threeyear contract worth $1 million, Andy Messersmith made his pitching debut with the Atlanta Braves yesterday.

title: Congress Goes Home; Tourists Fill Capital
description: WASHINGTON, April 18 (AP)Members of Congress are away for their EasterPassover recess, and President Ford is at his retreat in the Maryland mountains, but Washington far from empty over the holiday weekend.

title: Braves, Pistons Suns Win
description: John Shumate of the Buffalo Braves and George Trapp of the Detroit Pistons, unlikely candidates for the hero's role, played key roles yesterday as their teams defied the homecourt advantage and advanced in the National Basketball Association playoffs.

title: ChineseIndian Thaw
description: It was in July 1961, shortly before the brief but bloody border war between India and China, that New Delhi withdrew its ambassador from Peking. Now, a decade and a half later, the first important signs of a thaw have appeared in this long frozen and hostile relationship. The Indian Government has announced it will shortly send an ambassador to Peking and expects it will soon receive a Chinese ambassador in New Delhi. The Chinese Government has confirmed this announcement. In short, both regimes have reached agreement on the first major steps toward normalizing their diplomatic relationship.

title: Corrupt Construction
description: The City Council seems bent on killing or bowdlerizing a Building Code amendment aimed at curbing the corruption that has stigmatized New York's construction processes. This is a bill that the city cannot afford to sabotage; the alternative is perpetuation of a system that guarantees bribes and delays, with resultant higher building costs than anywhere else in the country.

title: Fumble on Malpractice
description: Governor Carey appointed last year a committee to seek an answer to the skyrocketing cost of medical malpractice insurance and its effect on the availability of medical care. That committee, headed by Columbia University's president, Dr. William J. McGill, reported some months ago, but the recommendations now put forward by the Governor bear so little relationship to those by the commission that Dr. McGill and his associates may well wonder why they bothered.

title: Bretons Claim Bombing Role
description: PARIS, April 18 (Reuters) I The nationalist Breton Liberation Front today claimed responsibility for two explosions in Paris yesterday, one of which badly damaged the offices of an insurance company.

title: Events Today
description: SHIRLEY MACLAINE AT THE PALACE, written by Fred Ebb with addl. tional material by Bob Wells; directed and staged by Tony [Benno, at 7:30, through May 1.

title: CONGRESS IS TOLD DEFENSE FORCES CAN'T BE REDUCED
description: WASHINGTON, April 18A civilian commission created by Congress to study the mounting costs of military manpower has concluded that over the next decade no significant reductions are possible in either the size or the cost of the armed services.

title: New Finds Suggest Mayas Originated in the Highlands
description: Archeologists digging in Guatemala have unearthed evidence that may shed light on one of the oldest mysteries surrounding the ancient Maya civilization: why such an advanced culture should have arisen in so inhospitable a place as the hot, tropical lowlands of northern Guatemala and Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula where most of their ruined cities are found today.

title: Amor Artis In B Minor
description: Bach's Mass in B minor is probably the most challenging work in the choral repertory, and few ambitious conductors in that field successfully fight off the temptation to try their hand at it.

title: Group is Formed to Save World War II Battleship
description: An organization formed to save the battleship New Jersey from destruction is seeking to bring back the ship. a veteran of three wars and the most decorated battleship of World War II, possibly to rest in Sandy Hook, as a memorial in her homestate waters, the group's director said yesterday.

title: Suffolk Sewer Project is Raising Public Ire as Damage Mounts
description: WEST ISLIP, L.I., April 18 Agnes Kutkiewicz, who has lived in this Suffolk County community for nearly 66 Years, was clearly annoyid.

title: Sex, Age and Work
description: DURHAM, N.C.High levels of unemployment have recently focused attention on the failure of the aggregate demand for labor to absorb all the workers seeking jobs. Laborsupply factors, equally important in their impact, tend to be overlooked. Specifically, changes in the sex, age, educational and marital status of the work force may produce significantly different attitudes toward work in the future.

title: Ebari, in Limbo Waiting for a Call, Says Time is Running Out for Israel
description: HERZLIYA, IsraelThe last 22 months, says Abba Eban, have been among the busiest of his busy life.

title: Congress Likely to Press Its Role in Foreign Policy
description: WASHINGTON, April 18Interviews with nearly two dozen members of Congress indicate they believe that changes of the last six years in Congress and the law make a continuing struggle with the Presidency over the formulation of foreign policy nearly certaineven if there is a new Secretary of State or a Democratic administration next year.

title: Ontario Town Fears Radioactivity of Past Will Hurt Tourism
description: PORT HOPE, Ontario, April 14  Green buds are beginning to clothe the bare old maples along the hilly streets of this little town where the Ganaraska River spills into Lake Ontario, 60 miles northeast of Toronto. Fat salmon are fighting their way up the Ganaraska to their spawning grounds. Shopkeepers are changing their sportinggoods displays, putting away the skis and bringing out the fishing tackle.

title: SOVIET EDGE SEEN IN NUCLEAR ARMS
description: OFFUTT AIR FORCE BASE, Nebraska  Improvements in strategic weapons give the So. viet Union the potential to alter the existing nuclear balance with the United States and achieve superiority in the next decade, according to Maj. Gen. James L. Brown, deputy chief of staff for Intelligence of the Strategic Air Command.

title: Inquiry Begun in Shooting Of Youth, 14 by Policeman
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Apra 18 (UPI)The Middlesex County, Prosecutor's Office is investigating a shooting in which a South Plainfield policeman wounded a 14yearold youth rang in an allegedly stolen car.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Central Railroad of New Jersey passenger train, carrying only its crew, derailed in Bound Brook. None the crew was injured, according to a railroad spokesman. The calige of the westbound derailment was under investigation.

title: CITY PLAN TO SHIFT STATIONS IS OPPOSED
description: A committee of the LaGuardia Memorial Association has bden formed to oppose plans for New York City to divest itself of three municipal broadcast stationsWNYCAM and WNYCFM, the radio stations, and WNYCTV/Channel 31.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Law of the Sea Conference 10 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Support for Homosexuals
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 18 (UPI)The police chief of San Francisco said this week there are 20 homosexuals on his force and urged them to come out of the closet and show that homosexuals can he good police officers. Fle promised them his full support. Chief Charles Gain said, The fact is that we will hire gays the same as we hire anyone else.

title: Frank Reilly, Schools Aide, Coached Hofstra Basketball
description: Frank Reilly, director of recreation and adult education in the Massapequa (I.J.) School District for 21 years and former Hofstra University basketball coach, died Saturday after a long illness at his home, 148 Fairview Road, Massapequa.

title: Urban Test Case
description: Over the years, most states have sought to devise financial aid formulas that would equalize perpupil school expenditures, only to find these formulas distorted by pressure from special interests. Instead being narrowed, the gap between rich and poor school districts is growing wider.

title: Mahler's Lied Played By American Symphony
description: It seemed as if the major effort in preparing for yesterday afternoon's American Symphony Orchestra concert in Carnegie Hall had gone into the final work, and no wonder. For all its familiarity these days, Mahler's Das Lied von der Erde still makes gargantuan demands on the orchestra, the conductor and especially the two soloists. Most of these demends were met yesterday, but unfortunately without any special vision.

title: Mets Fall, 75; 2 for Kingman
description: PITTSBURGH, April 18Dave Kingman and the New York Mets won the homerun battle today, but Willie Starbell and the Pittsburgh Pirates won the egg hunt and the baseball game, 75.

title: W. FRANK CORNELL
description: W. Frank Cornell, retired president of the International Printing Ink division of the Interchemical Corporation, now known as the Inmont Corporation, died yesteday in Delray Beach, Fla., where he had been living. He was 79 years old.

title: U.S. Investigation of Helstoski Is Said to Be in Critical Stage
description: NEWARK, April 18A Federal investigation of Representative Henry Helstoski, Democrat of Bergen County, was reported today by law enforcement officials to have reached a critical stage.

title: St. Louis Woman Robs Larry Doby
description: ST. LOUIS, April 18 (AP) Coach Larry Doby of the Montreal Expos was robbed of $189 in cash, his 1948 World Series championship ring and other jewelry early yesterday by a woman wielding a knife, the police reported today.

title: TV Networks Urged to Sell Prime Time to Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, April 18 (UPI)Two Democratic House subcommittee chairmen urged the three major television networks today to sell prime_television time to Presidential candidates who want to buy it to keep the American people informed of the views.

title: Books of The Times
description: At a dinner party in New Delhi just 10 years ago, half a dozen leading Indian editors and political commentators speculated about the future of their new Prime Minister, Indira Gandhi. They were in almost complete agreementa rarity in the egocentric top level of Indian journalismthat Mrs. Gandhi, who had been head of the Government less than three months, would soon be ousted.

title: Indonesian Soldiers Leave Eastern Timor Territory
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, April 18 (Reuters)Three hundred Indonesian soldiers have been withdrawn from eastern Timor because peace has been restored there, Foreign Minster Adam Malik said here.

title: H. E. W. In a Clarification, Says Bilingual Instruction is Optional
description: WASHINGTON, April 18 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare has affirmed that it is not mandatory for school districts to provide bilingual education for pupils whose primary language is not English.

title: Cairo Official in Peking
description: PEKING, April 13 (Reuters)Egypt's Vice President, Husnl [Mubarak, arrived here today on la visit heralding a new phase in relations between Cairo and 1Peking. He is expected to seek Chinese financial aid and a trade agreement, and military cooperation also is expected to be discussed.

title: Easter Sunday Respite in Beirut is Brief
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Monday, April 19Beirut's warring gunmen took Easter off yesterday, but as night fell the terror shelling of the city resumed. Clashes were also reported from the mountains east of the capital despite the ceasefire that is supposed to be in effect.

title: Memoriam Services
description: SULLIVAN Grace Brinier. An anniversary Mass will be offered at the Chapel of St. Froth. Hope end Charity at 9 A.M. on Monday, April 19. In memory of Grace Sullivan who died April 19; 1910.

title: Be Bold, Be Bold, Be Not Too Bold
description: All of a sudden, the field for the Kerrtucky Derby doubled in size. Just when they were picturing the first event in the Triple Crown series as a walkover for Honest Pleasure, down came Bold Forbes in the Wood Memorial Saturday, and Churchill Downs had an honesttoGodolphin twohorse race for May 1. He showed real speed and he carried his speed, said Steve DiMauro, whose Sonkisser finished third after pressing the winner's. Pace for a mile. He might just out a little spice in the Derby. He won like 2 to 5, said Laz Sports Barrera, trainer of Bold Forbes. With class and dignity. in the four weeks since of Bold Forbes set a stakes record of 1:20 4/5 The Times in the Bay Shore, Barrera had been trying to slow the colt down, and the Wood showed the effects of this schooling. To be sure, it was the fastest Wood ever run by something like seven lengths, but Bold Forbes let Riva Ridge keep his Aqueduct record for a mile and an eighth.

title: Advertising
description: Robert Blake, the short, muscular star of Baretta, television's No. 1 dramatic series, has taken on a new role  television spokesman for STP oiltreatment and gasolinetreatment products. It marks his debut in 30second commercial dramas.

title: Cubs Drop 4th in Row
description: CHICAGO, April 19 (AP)Pete Mackanin's tworun homer in the fourth inning and Mike Jorgensens runscoring double carried the Montreal expos to a 43 victory over the Chicago Cubs today. It was the Cubs fourth straight loss.

title: Futures in Pork Bellies Climb; Potato Prices Show Declines
description: Bacon prices went up and potato prices went down yesterday on two of the nation's more volatile commodity futures exchanges.

title: Bridge:
description: The European bridge scene in the 1930's was dominated by teams from Austria, and it is a matter for regret that the best Austrian team never met the Four Aces, who were equally dominant on this side of the Atlantic.

title: Saber Title to Hungarian
description: WARSAW, April 19 (AP)Gyorgy Nebald of Hungary has won the world junior fencing championship in the men's saber. Valery Todorov of the Soviet Union finished second and Franco Dalla. Barba of Italy was third. The Americans were eliminated in the third round.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article  No Title

title: MERCHANTS ASSAIL STADIUM PARKING
description: Merchants at the Bronx Terminal Market complained to the police yesterday that its operator was renting the grounds for Yankee Stadium parking without a license.

title: Denver Seeks U.S.Aid For a Transit System
description: DENVERHop a subway downtown and ride to the foothills of the Rockiesthat's the vision of transportation planners here who are determined to sell the Federal Government this week on the need to fund a subway and rapid rail system for Denver.

title: WEST BANK ARAB SLAIN BY ISRAELIS
description: TEL AVIV, April 19Israeli soldiers shot and killed one Arab today and wounded three others protesting a Jewish march through occupied Arab territory.

title: Man Talks So Oddly!
description: NORFOLK, Conn.In 1968, R. Allen Gardner's and Beatrice Gardner's infant chimpanzee said more in Ameslan, the American Sign Language for the deaf. Since that time, this chimp, named Washoe, has learned 180 other words, and a number of other chimpanzees have learned to communicate in this language as well.

title: WIRETAP DECISION SHUNNED BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, April 19 (AP)  The Supreme Court refused today to decide whether Government officials who act in good faith when authorizing an illegal wiretap must pay damages to the wiretap targets.

title: Boy Scouts Set Up a fund To Replace Stolen $1,700
description: A special campers fund has been established to replace $1,700 that six masked gunmen stole Sunday from a Brooklyn arty Scout troop's fundraising??.

title: Derby Pick Scares Off 3 Coast Colts
description: Despite the known vanity of horse owners at this time of year, the size of the field for the 102d Kentucky Derby continues to shrink.

title: Angels 9, Orioles 4
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., April 19 (AP)Bobby Bonds made his debut with California by drilling three singles and stealing a base tonight as the Angels erupted with a 13hit attack and routed the Baltimore Orioles, 94 in a game marred by a beanball war.

title: Northrop Corp. Raises Profits by 83% to Record
Tuning in the Public
description: During every Presidential election, the public becomes dimly aware that radio and TV stations supposedly are licensed and regulated by the Federal Government and are not the inalienable property of familiar soap and serial stars. Since this often comes as a surprise even to the regulatory agency that renews franchises unhesitatingly every three. years, it is little wonder that few people realize it is the public, rather than the commercial networks, that owns the broadcasting airwaves.

title: 1Low Living Standard in Soviet Rural Areas Drives Youths to Cities
description: MOSCOW, April 19Thel sleek train from Moscow to Warsaw glided through the Russian countryside and eased to a stop at the town of Vyazma, 125 miles west of the Soviet capital.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: Liverpool Nears Title in Soccer
description: LONDON, April 19 (UPI)Liverpool defeated Manchester City, 30, today and moved within sight of winning the English League soccer championship for a record eighth time.

title: Bonn Official Says Concern Over Communists is Real
description: BONN, April 19 (UPI)Foreign Minister HansDietrich Genscher said today that concern among countries of the Western alliance over the growing influence of Communist parties in Western Europe was legitimate.

title: Michael Greer, Decorator, is Dead; Police Checking for Murder Clues
description: Michael Greer, a prominent interior designer who had helped decorate a room in the White House during the Dwight D. Eisenhower and John F. Kennedy Administrations, was found dead yesterday in his apartment at 525 Park Avenue at 60th Street, his feet bound by a red sash.

title: Scottish Juniors Win
description: CANNES, France, April 19 (UPI)  Steve Boyd scored a 63dminute goal today in leading Scotland to a 10 victory over France and victory in the 25th international junior soccer festival. Brazil, the pretournament favorite, defeated Mexico, 40, in the match for third place.

title: MoscowLuanda Flights
description: MOSCOW, April 19 (UPI) The Soviet Union has begun a weekly air service to the Angolan capital, Luanda. The 18lhour flight will make four stops on the way, Tass reported.

title: Business Briefs
description: ROCHESTER, April 19 (UPI)The Eastman Kodak Company introduced a new line of microfilm products today and said several would be priced as mall as 40 percent below similar products on the market. The new line is based on the Oracle retrieval terminal and microfilmer, which, Kodak said, would provide rapid access to documents by means of digital code exposed on the film. Other products include the Starvue reader and readerprinter that are geared for highspeed retrieval and for automatic threading of most film thicknesses. The units can also use Kodak Ektamate magazines priced at about a quarter of the cost of conventional magazines, the company said.

title: Advertising
description: The latest contribution to the ongoing business effort to interest the American people in the freeenterprise system will be a series of five halfhour films underwritten by the Phillips Petroleum Company.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: It was incorrectly reported in The Times yesterday that Carlos Santana, the Latinrock musician, had broken with Sri Chinmoy, the Indian mystic. Mr. Santana is still a follower of Mr. Chinmoy.

title: Whalers Goalie Still Out
description: HARTFORD, April 19 (AP) Bruce Landon', the New England Whalers goalie, who suffered ligament and tendon damage to his right ankle last Friday, will remain out of action for at least one more World Hockey Association game, the team said today. The Whalers and the Indianapolis Racers each have won a game in their fourofsevengame series for the East Division title.

title: Justice Dept. May Create New CrimeReport Agency
description: WASHINGTON, April 19 (UPI) The Justice Department plans to create a neutral agency to Itake over the F.B.I.'s crime reports and statistical work to make sure that the figures are more credible and are put to hatter time.

title: TALKS ON RENEWAL OF PAKISTANI TIES PROPOSED BY INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, April 19India and Pakistan have taken a new step toward the resumption of normal relations, the Government announced today.

title: Temperature Sets A Record for April For 3d Straight Day
description: For the third straight day, temperatures set a record for April in New York City and along the Eastern Seaboard yesterday. The peak for the day in New York City was 92 at 11:50 A.M., below Sunday's April record of 96 but still a record for the day. The National Weather Service predicted readings in the 80's for today.

title: G.I. CHIEF RAISES SALES FORECAST
description: DETROIT, April 19Thomas A. Murphy, board chairman of the General Motors Corporation, today raised his forecast of 1976 domestic newcar sales to 10.5 million units, the most optimistic estimate yet by an auto industry executive and up 250,000 from his previous forecast.

title: DOW CLIMBS 7.63 ON G.N.P. GROWTH
description: The stock market, responding to an encouraging Government report on business activity in the opening quarter of 1976, posted a modest gain yesterday.

title: U.S. Confirms WaterTank Rupture Led to Blast That Tore Off Side of 45th St. Building
description: WASHINGTON, April 19 (AP) The rupture of an overpressurized water tank in a basement set off the naturalgas explosion that demolished one side of a 25story New York City building on April 22, 1974, the National Transportation Safety Board ruled today.

title: Negro College Fund Gets Grant From Mellon Group
description: The United Negro College Fund has acknowledged a $475,000 grant from the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

title: WEST BANK ARAB SLAIN BY ISRAELIS
description: TEL AVIV, April 19Israeli soldiers shot and killed one Arab today and wounded three others protesting a Jewish march through occupied Arab territory.

title: Steel Workers Begin Strike
description: PALMER, Mass., April 19 (AP)  About 90 steel workers at the Rathbone Corporation went on strike today in a dispute over costofliving protection.

title: Baseball Talks: Still No Progress
description: Unable to make any headway again with the baseball club owners yesterday in the negotiations over a new basic agreement, Marvin Miller, executive director of the Players Association, said he didn't expect the players play the entire season without a contract. Miller said he would discuss possible courses of action available to the players. He said there was neither a lack of progress, nor was there progress at yesterday's meeting with an owners committee. He said the two sides planned to meet sometime next week.

title: Concert to Celebrate Duke Ellington Day on April
description: By proclamation of Governor Carey and Mayor Bcame, April 29 will be Duke Ellington Day. A memorial concert to benefit Cuttington College of Liberia, the only independent liberal arts college in subSaharan West Africa, will feature Ellington's old orchestra, conducted by Mercer Ellington, his son, at 7:30 P.M. that day at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. Sarah Vaughan, Joe Williams and the Hampton choir will also perform.

title: Helping New York
description: The 95 children in the Queens Children's Shelter live there because they have no place else to go. Some were separated from their families by the courts because they had been beaten, neglected or abandoned, and some were voluntarily placed by their parents who could not take care of them. Others are orphans. All of the children are lonely and all need individual attention.

title: Music Studies Intensified In French Classrooms
description: PARIS, April 19All 12 million of the country's children are scheduled to receive a musical education under a program recently begun here.

title: CITY WAGE FREEZE POSES CHALLENGE FOR TRANSIT PACT
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that city and state counsel had offered legal opinions that the current emergency ban on wage increases might not permit approval of the pending transit workers agreement.

title: Harry Huntt Ransom, 67, Dies; Texas Educator and Bibliophile
description: Harry Huntt Ransom, chancellor emeritus of the University of Texas and a key figure in establishing its Humanities Research Center, died yesterday of a heart attack while visiting his wife's parents in Dripping Springs, Tex. He was 67 years old and lived in Austin.

title: At Intermission, Trappings of a King
description: Orange drinks and chocolates during theater intermission? They'll still be available after April 25 but, in one theater at least, the intermission offering will be considerably more glamorous.

title: Highs and Lows
description: AlaPw llof Allrgt Auto AMBAC Ind AMP Inc Ashland Oil Ashid Oil of Best Prod wi Chi Eastill ChiMilw Cp Clev Cliffs Conwood Co Deitec Int Dressr Ind Duo 2.10 pf Elgin Natl Handal Ind

title: Rising Pay an Australian Issue
description: CANBERRA, Australia  A remarkable rise. In wages, which have already well surpassed those in the United States, is causing serious concern about the future of this comfortable country, whose economy has long been thought to have great potential because of Australia's bourrtiful natural resources.

title: S.E.C. Ends Case Against Oppenheimer

description: It was incorrectly reported in The Times yesterday that Carlos Santana, the Latinrock musician, had broken with Sri Chinmoy. the Indian mystic. Mr. Santana is still a follower of Mr. Chinmoy.

LOUIS, Tuesday, April 20Rain delayed the start of last night's game between the New York Mets and St. Louis Cardinals, but both teams delayed the ending a lot longer, taking 4 hours 46 minutes to play 17 innings before the Mets broke the deadlock on Del Unser's home run to win, 43.

title: Marianas Hail U.S. With Bands and Feasts
description: SUSUPE, Saipan  When the local band strikes up America the Beautiful on the dirt basketball court near the legislature's Quonset hut, the people of the Northern Mariana Islands will officially begin a new phase in their long march toward becoming the first new United States territory in 51 years.

title: F. F. ROCKWELL, 92, A GARDEN EXPERT

title: La Guardia School
description: Fiorello H. La Guardia does not need to have a school named after him to insure the perpetuation of his memory in the hearts of New Yorkers, or in the history of this metropolis. He was without doubt one of New York's greatest mayors; he left far more imprint for the good than most, and during his three terms office strove mightily to bring all the inhabitants of this polyglot, polyracial city together irrespective of differences in creed, color or ethnic origin.

title: TURKEY BIDS GREEKS MEET ON AN ACCORD
description: IZMIR, Turkey, April 19 (Reuters)Foreign Minister lhsan Sabri Caglayangil proposed today that he and the Greek) Foreign Minister should meet to discuss a Greek offer of la nonaggression pact.

title: 200 Black Students at Cornell Riot Over Ouster of College Aide
description: ITHACA, N.Y., April 19About 200 black students rampaged through Cornell's administration building today, breaking several windows in the financial aid office before leaving.

title: David S. Gamble, 66, Dies; Bank of New York Officer
description: David S. Gamble, who retired in 1970 as a senior vice president of the Bank of New York, died Sunday on Hilton Head Island, S. C. He was 66 years of dand had moved there last year from Greenwich, Conn.

description: Katherine Urquhart Warren, founder in 1945 of the Preservation Society of Newport County and its president until her resignation last year, died Sunday at Paulholme, her home in Newport, R. I. She was 79 years old.

title: BELLO DECRIES NAME FOR SCHOOL

title: Colombian Leftists Kill A Rightist Labor Leader
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, April 19 (AP)A rightist labor leader was killed by his kidnappers today after an election in which voters rebuffed the hopes of President Alfonso Lopez Michelsen for strong endorsement of his harsh policies to control social unrest.

description: WASHINGTON, April 19 (AP) Senator Frank Church of Idaho said today if be were President he would stop paying big business to leave the country and stop United States intervention in needless foreign wars.

description: Several major chemical concerns, including the Monsanto Company and E. I. duPoni, de Nemours & Company. all reported higher first quarter earnings yesterday.

description: WASHINGTON, April 19The nation's economic recovery picked up speed in the first quarter after a modest pause in the final quarter of 1975,with a 7.5 percent real rise in the gross national product from January to March, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: JULES TILLES DEAD; AN EXPERT ON BRIDGE
description: Jules Tilles, a leading contract bridge player and administrator, died Sunday in Lebanon Hospital after a heart attack. He was 69 years old.

title: Warriors Reflect Image of Coach
description: During the 11 seasons Al Attles, the Golden State Warrior coach, played in the National Basketball Association with the Warrior franchises in Philadelphia and San Francisco, he became known as the Destroyer. Attles was a physical backcourtman, quick, tenacious and aggressive. The Warriors, who open defense of their N.B.A. title tonight against the Detroit Pistons at the Oakland Coliseum, reflect the image of their coach.

title: Sunday Comics Taken Seriously
description: If you want to reach 100 million people (65 million of them adults) with an ad in one day, try the Sunday comics.

title: FLOODING SUBSIDES IN NORTH DAKOTA
description: MINOT, N. D., April 19 (UPI),  The City of Minot appeared today to be winning its latest, battle with the Souris River. The Souris, which has flooded in five of the last seven years, has fallen six inches from its crest yesterday, seven feet above flood stage. But the 13,000 residents who were evacuated from the city of 32,000 will not be able to return to their homes until next weekend.

title: Red Sox's Jenkins Wins, 20
description: BOSTON, April 19 (UPI)Ferguson Jenkins, who is being relied on heavily in Boston's quest for a second successive American League pennant, pitched a fivehitter today as the Red Sox scored a 2.0 victory over the Minnesota Twins in a Patriot's Day morning game.

title: SAVING OF ENERGY GETS TOP PRIORITY
description: WASHINGTON, April 19The Energy Research and Development Administration said today that it would give the highest priority to conservation of energy, putting that on a par with development of new energy supplies.

title: Sugar Bowl Wants Day Game
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 19 (AP)The Sugar Bowl has decided that switching its annual football game to New Year's Eve was a mistake. It acted today to shift the game back to New Year's Day. The change to New Year's Eve 1972 was made in an effort to capture a bigger television audience by avoiding competition with other bowl games. A study showed that it hadn't worked out that way. So officials have asked the National Collegiate Athletic Association for approval to play the game in the Louisiana Superdome on New Year's Day.

title: JEANNE BOLAN
description: Jeanne Bolan, an actress and director, died Saturday of a heart ailment at the home of her mother, Lillian Bolan, in rhicago, where she was directing a musical comedy for the Chateau Louise Theater. Her age was 49. Miss Bolan was the wife of James B. McKenzie, a producer, and lived in Westport, Conn.

title: Dislike Foe's Ice
description: Denis Potvin said, Whatever they got, we gave them, as he assessed yesterday the New York Islanders Stanley Cup quarterfinal series with the Buffalo Sabres, which is tied at two games apiece.

description: SHORT HILLS, April 19Max Rudolf today assumed the leadership of a movement to raise the prestige of the New Jersey Symphony Orchestra.

title: Whites, Attacked in Boston 1 By Gangs of Black Youths
description: BOSTON April 19 (AP) A gang of black youths dragged a white man from his car and beat him severely tonight in (Boston's Roxbury section, while another gang about a mile away stoned railroad crewmen trying to clear the tracks of debris that halted a train, the notice said.

description: To the Editor: In remarks made before the New York Chapter of the American Jewish Committee Herbert Bienstock predicted an upsurge would occur in New York City's economy in the next decade. While it would be comforting to believe these predictions, a closer, more realistic examination casts shadows of doubt over this optimistic forecast.

description: Capt. Johnny Harms, veteran charter boat skipper and big game angler of St. Thomas, the Virgin Islands, writes let's put. the sport back in snort fishing.

title: Spring's Flowers Make Washington Rhapsody of Color
description: WASHINGTON, April 19  The flowers that bloom in the spring have everything to. do with the case for voting this one of the prettiest cities around in the spring  a town adrift in dogwood and with azaleas abounding, with tulips by the yard.

description: The General Electric Company announced yesterday Receipt of a $41.2 million Air Force contract for gun ammunition.

title: Wussler Names New Program Chief at CBSTV
description: Moving swiftly to put together his own team, Robert J. Wussler, who became president of the CBS television network eight days ago, yesterday appointed a new head of programs and a new head of sports. Last week, he named an executtve vice president from within the company, Robert A. Daly, to serve as his chief aide.

title: New Studies of the Dying Process Provide Impetus for Scientific Inquiries on the Question of Life After Death
description: The question of whether there is life after death, long the province of theologians, psychics and ordinary speculators, has recently become a subject of investigation among members of the scientific community.

title: Rail Strike Begins in Japan
description: TOKYO, Tuesday April 20 (Reuters)Japanese rail workers today began a threeday national strike that will affect millions of commuters and longdistance travelers. Two major unions of Japan National Railways ordered their members out at midnight after lastminute efforts by mediation teams failed to settle a wage dispute. Workers on private rail lines are expected to join the stoppage.

title: Italian Driver Victor
description: THRUXTON, England, April 19 (UPI) Maurizio Flammini of Italy broke the Thruxton Park Circuit record today with a lap of 119.92 miles an hour en route to winning the European Formula Two trophy race in an March BMW. Flammini's record lap was driven in 1 minute 10.73 seconds and he completed the 130mile race in 1 hour 6 minutes 51.54 seconds, with an average speed of 116.29 m.p.h.

title: Mexican Official Appeals Clearing of Hughes Aidel
description: ACAPULCO, Mexico, April 19 (AP)Mexico is renewing its attempt to prosecute Clarence Albert Waldron, private secretary to the late Howard R. Hughes, on a charge of forging Mr. Hughes's signature, a Mexican Federal prosecutor said today.

title: 76 Outlays to Rise At Public Service
description: INEWARK, April 19  The Public Service Electric and Gas (Company, the state's largest electric utility. plans to increase its capital spending this sear by $115 million to $372 million, shareholders were told here today at the company's annnual meeting.

A Committee in Beirut Decides On Plan to Enforce CeaseFire

title: Court to Hear Landmark Indian Suit
description: SQUAW LAKE, Minn.You have to drive by Russell Bryan's place to get down to the lakefront and the tourist lodges, but you probably would not notice it. You would be looking for the lodges, the Sportsman's Resort with yellow cabins under the fir trees, the Bright Star Resort with aqua cabins. The Bryan place is only a trailer on a rough plot of land, and there is no sign outside to tell you what it is  the trailer that started a landmark lawsuit on the rights of American Indians.

title: Dr. Marian Bruen Bride Of Dr. Charles Marrin
description: Dr. Marian Anthon Bruen, a descendant of Robert Livingston and John Jay, was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Charles Ainsworth Staveley Marrin, a greatgrandson of Admiral of the Fleet Sir Doveton Sturdee, who was victorious in the Battle of the Falkland Islands in 1914.

title: Justices Hear Views on Gag Orders Stemming From Trial in Nebraska
description: WASHINGTON. April 19 Lawyers representing many of the nation's news organizations urged the Supreme Court today to prohibit judges from imposing gag orders limiting press coverage, of criminal cases on the ground that the orders violate the First Amendment's free press guarantee and are neither necessary nor effective in assuring fair trials.

title: No Time Change in Israel
description: JERUSALEM, April 19 (Reuters)Israel has abolished daylight saving time for this summer, the Interior Ministry said. Israeli time will remain two hours ahead of Greenwich mean time, or seven ahead of Eastern Standard time.

description: WASHINGTON, April 19 (UPI) Two housing loan organizations accused the Justice Department today of failing to investigate before charging them in a lawsuit with illegally downgrading property values in in integrated neighborhoods.

title: CITY WAGE FREEZE POSES CHALLENGE FOR TRANSIT PACT
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that city and state counsel had offered legal opinions that the current emergency ban on wage increases might not permit approval of the pending transit workers' agreement.

title: Electrifying Pollitics
description: Dr. George Trot invented the public opinion poll in 1775 and brought it to Philadelphia the following spring to show it to John Adams. How does work? asked Adams.

title: Cutbacks in Italy
description: ROME, April 19Italy may be one of the few countries where construction workers sing aries from Aida as they labor, and parking attendants while away time whistling bars from a piano or violin concerto, but currently, culture here is

title: Court to Hear Appeal on Pollution Rules
description: WASHINGTON. April 19 (UPI)The Supreme Court today agreed to hear an appeal brought by eight major chemical companies contending the Environmental Protection Agency exceeded its powers by establishing nationwide standards for discharge of pollutants into 'the nation's rivers and streams.

title: Notes on People
description: His home state of Utah is going to pay Terrel H. Bell $11,000 a year more than his salary as United States Commissioner of Education, Mr. Bell said yesterday in announcing his resignation, effective Aug. 1. He has served less than two years in the $37,800 post in the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Nets Edge Spurs
description: UNIONDALE, L. L., April 19In a furious finish that saw Julius Erving playing volleyball under the San Antonio basket, the New York Nets emerged with a 110108 victory over the Spurs tonight and took a 32 lead in their American Basketball Association semifinal series.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NEW LEAF Most meetings of writing circles such as the New York Drama Critks Circle and the New York Film Critics Circle are private sessions. However, the National Book Critics Circle is inviting the public free to share its first symposium on criticism, Critics Confronted, this afternoon at 4:30 at Columbia University. The literary event, in which nine leading authors, reviewers and editors will participate, takes place in the faculty room of the Low Library, Broadway and 116th Street.

title: Newark's Fireboat Patrols the Passaic
description: NEWARK, April 19About 10 o'clock each morning, Capt. James McAlinden and his first mate, Joseph Smith, board the 47foot John F. Kennedy and begin cruising the Passaic River, keeping a close watch on the fireprone industries that line the banks along its 13 navigable miles.

title: High Court Bars Udall A ppeal In Bid to Get on Indiana Ballot
description: WASHINGTON, April 19 (AP) The Supreme Court declined today to decide by May I whether Representative Morris K. Udall is entitled to place on the ballot in the May 4 Indiana Presidential primary.

title: Ford, Answering Reagan, Says Talks on Panama Will Continue
description: WASHINGTON. April 19 (AP)  Answering Ronald Reagan, President Ford said today that it would be absolutely irresponsible to terminate the Panama Canal negotiations, which would turn all of Latin America against the United States.

title: A.M.C.3Month Earnings Lag Behind First Quarter
description: DETROIT, April 19  The American Motors Corporation: reported today net earnings of $1.2 million, or 4 cents a share,: for the second quarter of its fiscal year, which ended March 31in contrast to a net loss of $47.S million a year ago.

title: National Book Awards Go to Ashbery, Fussell, Gaddis, Edmonds, Arlen, Davis
description: J R by William Gaddis took the fiction prize yesterday when the National Institute of Arts and Letters named the six winners of the 27th annual National Book Awards. It was the first time that the awards were administered by the institute.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, April 19 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Skidding Into a Strike
description: Negotiations for a new wage agreement in the Big Four rubber companies are heading toward a midnight deadline, with little hope for a strikefree settlement. In any event, the unreasonably high pay increase just agreed upon in truckingamid expressions of delight from President Fordmakes it almost certain that whatever contract eventually emerges in the tire industry will contribute further to reviving inflationary pressures.

title: No Comment by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 19A State Department spokesman said tonight that the department had no immediate comment on Mr. Castro's attack on President Ford and his reported threat to cancel the antihijacking agreement.

title: Astros 8, Dodgers 3
description: HOUSTON, April 19 (AP) Jose Cruz belted a threerun triple to key a fourrun first inning and spark the Houston Astros to a 83 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers tonight.

title: Fultz Captures Boston Marathon Decisively in Field of 1,898
description: BOSTON, April 19At the start of the race, Jack Fultz was just one of 1,898 numbered runners, just another face in the crowd sweltering in the 93degree heat. The people gathered in the Hopkinton Green were busy pointing out the favorites: Jack Foster of New Zealand, Mario'Cuevas of Mexico, Jose DeJesus of Puerto Rico. Nobody pointed out Fultz. Nobody seemed to know him.

title: Temperature Sets A Record for April For 3d Straight Day
description: For the third straight day, temperatures set a record for April in New York City and along the Eastern Seaboard yesterday. The peak for the day in New York City was 92 at 11:50 A.M., below Sunday's April record of 96 but still a record for the day. The National Weather Service predicted readings in the 80's for today.

title: Jackson Leads Home State With 60% of the Delegates
description: SEATTLE, April 19 (UPI)Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington has won about 60 percent of the delgates to the Washington State Democratic convention. About onethird of the delegates are uncommitted and about 6.5 percent are commited to Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona, with a smattering, committed to Senator Frank Church of Idaho or Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota.

title: SAVING OF ENERGY GETS TOP PRIORITY
description: WASHINGTON, April 19The Energy Research and Development Administration said today that it would give the, highest priority to conservation of energy, putting that on a par with development of new energy supplies.

title: Hospital SitIns Given Noon Deadline
description: People from the community who have been sittingin at Fordham Hospital since last Tuesday have been told to leave by noon today or face the possibility of being removed by the police.

title: U.S. Will Send Indonesia Grain Worth $35.2 Million
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, April 19 (Reuters)  Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz today signed a loan agreement under which the United States will provide Indonesia with wheat and rice worth $35.2 million.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION ROSE 0.2% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended April 17 rose slightly, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Steps Taken by the Party To Let Cunningham Stay
description: Over chants of Dump Cunningham from about onefifth of a raucous crowd, Bronx, Democrats paved the way last night for the reelection of the embattled Patrick J. Cunningham as the party's county chairman.

title: Hermann Prey Sings Schumann and Brahms Lieder
description: Hermann Prey, that experienced opera singer and concert artist, sang a sturdy program of lieder last night in Carnegie Hall. He devoted his program to two composers. Schumann and Brahms. Schumann's Dichterliebe occupied the first half of the program, and 14 Brahms songs took care of the postintermission part. Leonard Hokanson was at the piano.

title: Picketing is Eased in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 19 (UPI)  Striking city craft workers today removed pickets from the opera house, school bus yards and the city hospital for the elderly, but refused to let municipal buses and streetcars resume operations in the 20day tieup.

title: Castro Threatens to End U.S. Hijacking Pact
description: HAVANA, April 19 (Reuters) Prime Minister Fidel Castro threatened tonight to call off the antihijacking agreement between the United States and Cuba if Cuban refugee groups based in the United States continued attacking Cuban fishing boats.

title: Hughes for Quicker Trials If Byrne Will Meet the Cost
description: TRENTON, April 19Chief Justice Richard J. Hughes of the State Supreme Court agreed today with Governor Byrne's call for speedier trials, and then gave the Governor the bill$18 million.

title: End of S.I.R.T. Strike Welcomed With Spirit
description: As champagne corks popped and passengers cheered, the Staten Island Rapid Transit system returned to service yesterday for the First time since the line was shut down by a strike last De:. I L.

title: ABRAHAM HERTZBERG
description: Abraham Hertzberg, a retired brewingindustry executive, died Sunday in White Plains Hospital. He was 62 years old and a resident of Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: SPEAKER IS CHOSEN BY THAI PARLIAMENT
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 19 (AP)Thailand's new Parliament today chose as Speaker a young politician who had been jailed for treason by the former military government.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: Article 9  No Title

title: Dave Anderson
description: In less than two weeks, Dave Kingman and Mike Schmidt have put baseball back into baseball. Never have so many fans owed so much to so few home runs.

title: Egypt Favors a Meeting On the Crisis in Lebanon
description: CAIRO, April 19 (Reuters) Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy said today that Egypt supported Iraq's request for an urgent meeting of Arab foreign ministers to discuss Lebanon.

title: Books of The Times
description: Teamwork is one of the purest forms of romance. In an age marked by egocentrism and interpersonal distrust, teamwork is one of the few surviving rituals of togetherness. The idea of a team is rich in associations; it suggests primitive kinship systems, knighthood, the guilds of the middle ages, the instinct of workmanship, the selflessness of patriotism. When the New York Knicks were at their best, their work resembled courtly love.

title: 2 MORE COMPANIES LIFT GAS PRICE BY IC
description: The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) and the Standard Oil Company (Ohio) yesterday raised their gasoline prices by I cent a gallon.

title: Music: Attractive Bach
description: Perhaps it was the hot Easter Sunday evening, but the first of the Netherlands Chamber Orchestra's two Bach concerts at Carnegie Hall was lamentably underattended. One hopes the second, tomorrow night, will be better patronized, because the performances by and large were most attractive.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The local board for Community School District 3 on the West Side has asked the central Board of Education to overturn its supersession earlier this month by School Chancellor Irving Anker. A three member subcommittee of the central hoard will meet on the appeal tomorrow. Mr. Anker superseded the district board for failing comply with a central hoard order to reduce school instructional time as an economy measure.

title: Cornell Lacrosse Leader
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., April 19 (UPI)For the first time this year, Maryland is not No. 1 in the United States Intercollegiate Lacrosse Association's Coaches majorcollege poll. Cornell, with four firstplace votes and 137 points, edged the Terps for the top spot this week.

title: Washington Star and Pressmen Reach an Accord
description: WASHINGTON, April 19Union pressmen and The Washington Star have reached tentative agreement on a new contract. The agreement came, according to union sources, after management said that the paper would close if the unions did not accept layoffs and wage freeze.

title: Model of Santa Maria Will Sail to Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, April 19 (PI)A reproduction of Columbus's flagship Santa Maria will sail here in July in a program designed to rebuild this city's historic waterfront, it was announced today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: National League
description: Montreal 4, Chicago 3. New York 4, St. Louis 3 (17 inn., 0.).

title: News Summary and Index
description: India and Pakistan, which broke off diplomatic relations in 1971 during the Bangladesh war of independence, moved closer yesterday to the resumption of normal relations. Prime Minister Indira Gandhi sent a letter to Prime Minister Zulfikar All Bhutto of Pakistan offering to resume discussions on such matters as air and surface communications and even to discuss measures for the restoration of diplomatic relations, spokesman said. Mrs. Gandhi had reached agreement with Mr. Bhutto, seven months after diplomatic relations were broken, to work to overcome the enmity between their countries, and some progress had been made. Mrs. Gandhi's new letter was the first diplomatic move toward Pakistan in more than a year. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
description: Today's Entries at Aqueduct

title: Colombia's Election
description: President Alionso Lpez Michelsen's Government cannot be entirely happy with the results of Colombia's midterm elections; but at least the widely anticipated gains for the parties of the far left failed to materialize. The three biggest leftwing parties appear to have polled together less than 7 percent of the total vote; and two Communist factions, which had expected to increase their representation on the Bogot City Council, barely retained the two seats they had previously held.

title: Navy Decision Linked to Texas Primary
description: WASHINGTON, April 19A multibilliondollar decision by the Administration on whether to build up to a 600ship Navy may depend in part upon the outcome of the Republican Presidential primary in Texas on May 1, Pentagon officials said today.

title: Concert: A Sonata Team
description: As the earlier three concerts in this season's Eastman Series have demonstrated, the famous music school in Rochester boasts many superlative performers on its artist faculty. Sunday night a fine sonata team came to Alice Tully Hall for the first time: Francis Tursi, Eastman's professor of viola, and Barry Snyder who has been a pianistteacher there since 1970.

title: New Threat to Wetlands
description: Last year the Army Corps of Engineers attempted discredit a Federal court's interpretation of the Water Pollution Control Act by reducing one of its major provisions to an absurdity.

title: G.E. Report Says Company May Be Able to Lower PCB Discharge Into Hudson
description: ALBANY, April 19The General Electric Company, filed with the state today an engineering report that indicates it may be able to lower to almost nothing its discharges of toxic polychlorinated biphenyls (PCB's) into the Hudson River, to comply with Federal orders that are to become effective July 1. 1977.

title: Mideast Undercurrents
description: Nine years of carefully nurtured coexistence between Israelis and Arabs on the West Bank of the Jordan River are under challenge by shortsighted zealots. An extremist fringe of Israeli society, which let the expansionist impulse overwhelm basic political sense, has combined with renewed militancy among Palestinian Arabs under Israeli occupation to turn the placid West Bank into a new front of IsraeliArab conflict.

title: A Japanese Photographer Reported Held by Cambodia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Tuesday, April 20 (AP)A Japanese photographer was seized by Cambodian soldiers when he crossed into that Communist nation at the frontier town of Poipet, a Thai official said today.

title: In Memoriam
description: MINTZERSylvia. Dearly lowed. Always our hearts, always with us.

title: Big Bear Stores to Sell Its Assets to Oppenheimer
description: The Big Bear Stores Company of Columbus, Ohio, announced yesterday that it would sell its assets to a group of investors headed by Oppenheimer and Company for about $4l.4 million. The deal calls for the purchase of about 1.25 million Big Bear common shares outstanding at $33 a share, a price that was raised from $31 a share in a tender offer first announced last January.

title: Colonels Down Nuggets, 126 to 114, Take 21 Lead.
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 19 (UPI)Bird Averitt scored 18 points in the last quarter and 40 points for the game tonight to pace the Kentucky Colonels to a 126114 victory over the Denver Nuggets and a 21 lead in their American Basketball Association semifinal playoff series points, respectively for the Nuggets. However, Thompson, the leading candidate for Rookie of the Year honors, was not a strong factor offensively after the first quarter when he scored 14 points.

title: At 90, Gardeners Should Play it Cool
description: A figurative yellow caution light was flashed yesterday by gardening experts at anyone with a greert thumb tempted to speed up normal procedures by believing the thermometer instead of the calendar.

title: Soliah Defense Says Miss Hearst Met Prosecutors
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., April 19Patricia Hearst began cooperating with the Federal authorities more than two weeks before she was convicted of bank robbery March 20, according to defense arguments made today in the bank robbery trial of Steven Soliah.

title: TODAY'S PROBA BLE PITCHERS
description: Chicago at New York (2 P.M.) Johnson (1.0) vs. May (00). Baltimore at California (n.)
