description: Rudolf Assumes Post With Jersey Symphony

title: Navy Decision Linked to Texas Primary
description: WASHINGTON, April 19A multibillion dollar decision by the Administration on whether to build up to a 600ship Navy may depend in part upon the outcome of the Republican Presidential primary in Texas on May 1, Pentagon officials said today.

title: Venezuela Bars a Ransom For Kidnapped American;
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, April 20The Government is opposed to paying ransom to rguerrillas for the return of an American businessman kidnapped more then seven weeks ago, according to Interior Minister Octavio Lepage.

title: New Books
description: Captains of Consciousness: Advertising and the Social Roots of the Consumer Culture, by Stuart Ewen (McGrawHill, $10).

title: Ford Paid $94,568 in 75 Taxes; Prods Rivals for Similar Detail
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The White House announced today that President Ford paid more than $94,000 in Federal income taxes for 1975 and received an $11,600 refund from the internal Revenue Service.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: In New Jersey, Connecticut and 47 other states in the country, it is possible to open the Yellow Pages, look at the listings of dentists and find a speialist like an orthodontist or a dental surgeon. But open the Yellow Pages for any part of New York States, with the exception of the area around Binghamton, and it is impossible to tell the general practitioners from the specialists.

title: Northwest Breeze Moves in and Routs Summery Weather
description: Summer heat began to give way to more springlike weather last evening as a front of cooler air from the northwest headed toward the New York City metropolitan region to bring temperatures down from their recordbreaking levels.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: All this hoopla about the Bicentennial may turn out to be illconceived. Instead of a hymn of celebration, perhaps more appropriate would be requiem for an ideal that seems to be dead a truly democratic society, with justice and fairness for all.

title: President Considers Veto Of Campaign Funding Bill
description: WASHINGTON, April 20President Ford is seriously considering vetoing the campaign bill now awaiting final approval in Congress, on the grounds that it deprives the Federal Election Commission of vital political independence.

title: PLANES OVER L.I. IN NEARCOLLISION
description: An Allegheny Airlines twin engine jet and an unidentified small pistonengine plane nearly collided yesterday as the jet was making an approach to land at MacArthur Airport in Islip, L.I.

title: Stock Prices Rise On Amex and OTC; Trading Volume Up
description: Buoyed by an optimistic economic outlook, prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market yesterday made abroad advance in accelerated trading.

title: Some Recipes Friends Love
description: 2 whole chicken breasts (see note) Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste  pound fresh spinach 4 tablespoons butter  cup finely chopped onion  pound twiceground lean veal  cup cooked rice  teaspoon crushed dried thyme 1 teaspoon crushed dried oregano 1 egg, lightly beaten Parsley sprigs for garnish Brown sauce (see recipe).

title: NEW YORK SCHOOLS PLAN GRADE SHIFT IN ECONOMY MOVE
Gadgets, Some Esoteric, For Cooks to Play With
description: Because it is at least part craft, cookery inspires a seemingly endless array of gadgets, most of which prove to be overdesigned, overspecialized and unworkable. The following, however, are exceptions, all well worth the cupboard space they occupy and the purchase prices they command.

title: Hollis Boy is Found Shot Dead, Handgun Lying Near His Head
description: A 12yearold Hollis. Queens, boy was found fatally shot in his bed yesterday, a 22caliber Saturday night special handgun lying near his head.

title: Liv Ullmann Signs For War Movie
description: Liv Ullmann has contracted to play the sole female starring role in A Bridge Too Far, a movie adapted from the late Cornelius Ryan's bestselling book about a vain Allied attempt to capture five bridges in the Netherlands during World War.

title: Despite SelfDeprecating Remarks, Udall Remains Optimistic
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., April 20Representative Morris K. Udall told an audience this week that if he continued to run just behind the winner in each Democratic Presidential primary, he may ask Barbra Streisand to sing Second Hand Rose from Second Avenue as his official campaign song.

title: CHINA ASSAILS U.S. ON ITS EAST POLICY
description: PEKING, April 20(Agencc FrancePresse)  China today labeled the socalled Sonnenfeldt doctrine a doctrine of superpower division of spheres of influence.

title: New Study: Brain Casts in Old Skull
description: Ralph Holloway cradled the ancient skull in his hands holding it upside down as he peered through a hole into the empty cranial vault. Somewhere between two and three million years ago it housed the living brain of an early form of human being.

title: Where Is Rockefeller?
description: WASHINGTON, April 20  Ever since Nelson Rockefeller withdrew from the 1976 VicePresidential race, he has seemed to drop out of the headlines almost as completely as Spiro Agnew. What has he been doing, and where is he going, if anywhere?

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Pilots Bid U. S. Ban Smoking in Cockpit As Aviation Hazard
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) A group of commercial airline pilots and two organizations concerned with the public interest petitioned the Federal Government today to ban stnoking in the cockpit as a panicular hazard in aviation.

title: WINE TALK
description: Each year some of the wine leading shippers prepare reports on the most recent vintage and the current market for French wines. Of them all, the best invariably is the report prepared by Peter A. Sichel, the head of the Bordeaux branch of the Sichel wine interests.

title: PARKING
description: Motorists will be able to park their cars today and tomorrow on both sides of those streets where alternatesideofthestreet regulations are normally in effect. The regulations have been suspended because of the last two days of Passover, flowever, other parking and standing restrictions still apply.

title: Bridge
description: The traditional Reisinger team championship, the prestige event of the New York tournament calendar, will have a new look next month a very new look.

title: Nevada Under Inquiry
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., April 20 (AP)The president of the University of Nevada at Las Vegas today confirmed that the National Collegiate Athletic Association is officially investigating the school's basketball oroaram.

title: Carter Says Ruling About Housing Aids Equal Opportunity
description: PITTSBURGH, April 20 Jimmy Carter, a candidate fort the Democratic Presidential nomination, said today that the Supreme Court's decision on public housing in the suburbs suits me fine.

title: GEORGE M'CAULEY, PHYSICIST,DEAD
description: George Vest McCauley, a Corning Glass Works research physicist who was in charge of the design and casting of the giant mirror disk for the 200inch telescope at the Mount Palomar observatory in California, died Monday at a nursing home in Corning, N. Y. He was 93 years old.

title: Screen: Vintage Felix
description: The most blithe and buoyant film show in town at the moment is at the Whitney Museum of American Art, where a program titled Otto Messmer's Felix the Cat opened a week's run yesterday It's a tribute not only to one of the first cartoon characters ever to become an international star, out also to Mr. Messmer, who created Felix but whose name never appeared on any of the hundreds of animated shorts that were always identified with Pat Sullivan, who was the producer.

title: Rhodesia Tightening Security A her 3 Killings
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April. 20 (Reuters)Rhodesian Cabinet ministers today pledged lighter security measures to protect tourists and a vital rail link with South Africa after attacks Sunday by African nationalist guerrillas in southeastem Rhodesia.

title: FORD PAID $94,568 IN 1975 U.S. TAXES
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The White House announced today that President Ford paid more than $94,000 in Federal income taxes for 1975 and received an $11,600 refund from the Internal Revenue Service.

title: More Recipes Of Nan Mabon
description: SOUTHERNSTYLE STUFFED TOMATOES AND GREEN PEPPER 1 large green pepper 6 mediumsize red, ripe tomatoes Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste 3 tablespoons butter  cup finely chopped onion  pound cooked ham, ground or finely chopped 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons very dry bread crumbs 1 large clove garlic, crushed 1 hay leaf.

title: SOME RENT CURBS ARE UNDER STUDY
description: The Beame administration is studying the possibility of removing from rent control apartments in the city that rent for, $300 a month or more.

title: Kitchen Adventurer: It All Began In the Fine Arts
description: Nan Mahon, whose adventures in cooking have taken her from London to Paris to New York, came by her professional involvement in food in a notably unexpected manner. It began, she recounted recently, about 10 years ago with a midday meal in London.

title: JUSTICES UPHOLD MINORITY HOUSING IN WHITE SUBURBS
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The Supreme Court ruled today, 8 to 0, that Federal courts can order the creation of lowcost public housing for minorities in a city's white suburbs to relieve racial segregation in housing within the city.

title: Harden Gets 3Year Pact
description: DENVER, April 20 (AP)The University of Denver has given Al Harden, the basketball coach, a new threeyear contract. Ron Oyer, the athletic director, said today the pact was part of a program to upgrade the university's basketball program.

title: Penske Enters Andretti at Indy
description: READING, Pa., April 20Marin Andretti, who had said he wouldn't be there this time, will return to the scene of his greatest auto racing triumph, Indianapolis Motor Speedway, it was announced today.

title: Study Urges Industrial Enclaves
description: Despite the loss of 14,000 factories and 477,000 manufacturing jobs from the metropolitan, area in the las t two decades, a study by the Port Auhority of New York and New Jersey has shown that the area's older cities still have a potential for industrial development.

title: About New York
description: Three men sat on adjacent benches on the promenade that runs along the Hudson in Riverside Park the other day, brought there in search of a breeze.

title: A Commuter Study Urges Gates For Rail Crossings
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) A Federal accidentinvestigating agency recommended today that the Federal Government require mandatory warning lights and crossing gates at railroad crossings used by commuter trains.

title: Rockefeller Asserts Banking is Strong
description: David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Corporation, chided critics of the banking system today and reassured shareholders about the condition of the Chase Manhattan Bank, the principal subsidiary of the corporation.

title: Pension "Ripoff"
description: There seems no end to the propensity of New York State legislators for giving away money New York City does not have.

title: CITY HALL TARGET OF COAST STRIKERS
description: SAN FRANCISCO. April 20, (AP)Municipal craft workers tried today to break an impasse in their threeweek strike by staging brief displays of strength at a suburban bus terminal and at City Hall.

title: Industrial Parks Planned To Bolster Jersey Cities
description: TRENTON, April 20  The New Jersey Economic Development Authority announced plans today to build multimilliondollar industrial parks in Jersey City and Elizabeth and sell or lease them to private interests.

title: Turn in India's Foreign Policy
description: NEW DELHI, April 20Behind a high and forbidding bright red gate in New Delhi's; elegant diplomatic enclave stands a squat stone building that has for years been a monument to a painful international estrangement  the all  but  deserted Embassy of China. A few hundred yards away, on the other side, of the embassy row, on a broad boulevard named Shantipath, (Road of Peace), stands another reminder of warthe purpledomed Embassy of Pakistan,I which now has the Swiss flag flying over it, since no Pakistanis were left in charge.

title: Ford Proclaims Earth Week
description: WASHINGTON. April 20 (AP)  President Ford proclaimed the week beginning Thursday as Earth Week and urged every American tn devote one day during this week to a significant activity which improves our environment.

title: INVENTORS
description: For a new productor a way to make an old product better, contact us. the idea people. We'll develop your idea, introduce it to industry, publicize it, negotiate for a cash sale or royalty licensing.

title: MRS. ABZUG ASSAILS ARMS SALE TO ARABS
description: Representative Bella S. Abzugl said yesterday that the United States should stop acting as the major arms seller to the. Persian Gulf nations and should drop its longrange plans to sell arms to Egypt.

description: First Period1, Buffalo, Martin 4 (Perreault, Shoenfeld, 5:37. 2, Buffalo, Gare 5 (Luce, Korab), 6:57. 3, New York, St. Laurent 1 (Howatt), 7:40. 4. New York, Parise 4 (Drouin, D. Poryin), 14:10. PenaltiesRobert, Buf, 12'20; Ramsay, Buf, 12:44; Lewis, NY, maiormiscondustgross m.scondurt, 13:20; Fosalin, Buf, majormisconduct, 16:20.

title: CAREY AMONG 2,000 AT BELKIN FUNERAL
description: Governor Carey and State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz were among 2,000 mourners who attended the funeral for Dr. Samuel Belkin yesterday.

title: Decorator Murdered, Autopsy Shows
description: Michael Greer, the prominenti interior decorator who was found dead Monday in his Park Avenue apartment with his feet bound, was murdered, according to an autopsy completed yesterday.

title: Saudis Putting a Billion Into Riyadh U.
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia Saudi Arabia, which has had Westernstyle collegelevel education only since 1957, is to spend well over $1 billion on expanding Riyadh University between now and late 1980, according to a university administrator.

title: A Pier Agency Lawyer Testifies On Lunch W ith Judge DiLorenzo
description: A short lunch in the Pub restaurant across the streeti from Manhattan Civil Court was described over and over again in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday at the perjury trial of Ross J. DiLorenzo, retired judge of Civil Court. But still in dispute at the end of the day was the purpose of the luncheon meeting.

title: I.T.T. PAID $300,000 TO ITALY'S TAX AIDES
description: Subsidiaries of the International Telephone and Telegraph. Corporation paid about $300.000 to Italian tax agents to facilitate negotiations over the taxes owed between 1969 and 1972, according to memo:randums from company auditors.

title: Moynihan Begins State Political Tour
description: Daniel Patrick Moynihan has begun a lowkey tour of Newl York State's political and civic power centers that his friends lexpect will end with a formal announcement of his longrumored candidacy for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator.

title: A Shaky New CeaseFire Begins in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Wednesday, April 21Lebanon's 28th ceasefire in a year started yesterday with shelling, sniping and a few ground attacks reported from the charred port area and eastern suburbs.

title: New 61 st St. Apartments Will Rent for $300 a Room
description: Apartments in the proposed 33story apartment building that has been designed to stand on the 61st Street site of the Dodge mansion will rent for $300 a room, the building's sponsors said yesterday.

title: In These Equations Lurks Lush Music
description: In a world increasingly dominated by science, Jannis Xenakis might well be considered the most technocratic of all musicians. The GrecoFrench composer, three of whose works will be featured on a Brooklyn Philharmonia program tonight at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, does enlist a fearsome array of mathematical formulas and computer programming in his compositions after all. His books are largely unreadable by even the most willing musician, unless that musician is also a trained mathematician or logician.

title: GUILTY PLEA MADE IN TANKER FRAUD
description: Stanley Farber, former board chairman of the Tidal Marine International Corporation, pleaded guilty yesterday to a Federal charge that he had fraudulently overstated the company's earnings in a report to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: WILLIAM SANSOM, 64,1 PROUST BIOGRAPHER
description: LONDON, April 20 (AP)William Sansom, whose account of what he saw as an auxiliary London fireman fighting the German bomber; blitz in 194041 began his career as a writer, died today, his publishers announced. He was 64 years old.

title: Horton Heads dh's Again
description: Willie Horton, the Detroit Tigers designated hitter who led the American League's dh batters in 1975, is in front again. Through Monday's games, Horton batted 333 with eight hits in 24 times at bat and had one home run and five runs batted in.

title: Wriston Cites Gains Abroad, U.S. Drop
description: Citicorp officials told shareholders at the company's annual meeting yesterday that operating earnings rose by percent during the first quarter to $90.8 million from $84.3 million a year earlier.

title: March and Quarter Loss Listed By T. W. A., National Airlines
description: Trans World Airlines and Na tional Airlines yesterday both reported deficit operations for March and the first quarter this year. MI a separate development, the Civil Aeronautics Board in Washington asked the Pan American World Airways to show cause why the airline's longstanding request for a $194 million annual subsidy should not be denied.

title: Melbourne Gaming Club Is Robbed of $2 Million
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Wednesday, April 21(Reuters)Six men armed with machine guns burst into a sporting club here today and took $2 million to $4 million in cash, some of it intended as bookmakers payouts on Easter horse races.

title: Chrysler, in Response to Shareholders, Acknowledges Profit Lag Continues
description: CENTER LINE, Mich., April 20Displaying much skepticism but little of the rancor of a year ago, stockholders of the Chrysler Corporation questioned sharply today their new topmanagement team, a team that last week tried to woo them by reporting the company was at last making money after 18 months in the red.

title: Profit Taking Cuts Strong Early Gains For Commodities
description: CHICAGO, April 20 (AP)Profit taking in the closing minutes on the Chicago Board of Trade caused heavy trims in strong, early gains today.

title: General Electric and 2 Unions Open Talks for Key Contracts
description: Two major electrical unions made demands for substantial wage increases, unrestricted costofliving adjustments and other benefit improvements as they opened national negotiad tions yesterday for new contracts with the General Electric Company.

title: STOCKS ADD 15.35; DOW AT 1,003,46
description: The combination of rising economic activity and a declining inflation rate ignited a dynamic rally in the stock market yesterday and sent the Dow Jones industrial average hurt]ing above the 1,000 barrier with a gain of more than 15 points.

title: Beame Considers Lifting Of Some Controls on Rent
description: The Beame administration is; studying the possibility of rei moving from rent control apartments in the city that rent for $300 a month or more.

title: U.S. WARNS CHILE ON A RIGHTS ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, April 20Responding to protests by members of the United States Congress about human rights violations in Chile, the State Department has called in the Chilean Ambassador to express grave concern about the arrest and deportation of a Santiago civilrights lawyer, Administration officials reported today.

title: Rockets Drop Egan and Hire Nissalke
description: Following the theory that it's always easier to dismiss the coach, rather than the players, the financiallytroubled Houston Rockets discharged John Egan yesterday and replaced him with Tom Nissalke, The 36year old Egan, once the youngest and shortest (6 feet) coach in the National Basketball Association, is the second pilot of a team failing to make the playoffs to lose his job. The Atlanta Hawks dismissed Cotton Fitzsimmons before the end of the season. More coaching changes are expected among teams that were shut out of the playoffs.

title: TRANSIT OPINION SLOW IN COMING
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yesterday that he would be unable to issue an opinion on the controversial wage rise in the transit workers agreement until he had obtained a copy of the proposed contracta document that the Transit Authority said did not yet exist in final form.

title: 4 Big A Winners Ridden by Maple
description: Eddie Maple rode four wirrners yesterday at Aqueduct, including Quiet. Little Table, the 1110 favorite in the featured $15,000 allowance race. Quiet Little Table a 3yearold son of Mr. owned by the Meadow Hill. Stable, defeated Balancer by. 1 lengths in the sixfurlong race and paid $4.20 for $2 to win. Maple, who had seven mounts for the day, also scored aboard Financial Whiz ($19.20 in the first), Klondike Charger ($7..60 in the filth) and Crab Grass ($8.40 in the sixth).

title: 3 Craftsmen View Reality and Appearance
description: It's just a coincidence that there are three different Deborahs (no matter how you spell it) currently being shown at the Nadler Galleries. They work in quite different media. Yet, there is a certain similarity of concerns.

title: F.B.A. Asks Medical Exam Before Getting Hearing Aid
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration proposed today rules that would require most persons to undergo a medical examination before they could buy a heating aid.

title: Carter Emerging as Indiana Favorite
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 20When Senator Henry M. Jackson made his first Indiana appearance of the 1976 Presidential campaign on April 11, fewer than 400 people turned out for a rally in an auditorium at the state fairgrounds that holds about 3,500.

title: Gulf Stresses Credibility Need
description: PITTSBURGH, April 20The new chairman of the Gulf Oil Corporation said today that the greatest challenge facing the company was to restore our confidence in ourselves and our credibility with others. The chairman, Jerry McAlec, was alluding to Gulf's involvement in illegal domestic and foreign political payments that led to the ouster three months ago of his predecessor, Bob R. Dorsey, and two other top company officials. Mr. McAfee announced that girlquarter earnings rose 1.5 percent to $198 million, or $1.02 a share, from $195 million, or Si a share, in the yearago period. Revenues increased 8 percent to $4.3 billion from $4 billion.

title: Yanks Top White Sox, 54, As Shirt Dispute Flares
Infant Has Heart Surgery
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 20 (AP)Doctors at St. Christopher's Hospital here have successfully operated on a baby girl born with a growth in the right side of her heart that blocked blood flow. Doctors said that such growths were rare and were almost usually found in adults. Less than 26 hours after the girl was born, she underwent surgery and the growth was removed. She is now recovering at home.

title: EXCHANGE URGED TO SPUR INTEGRITY
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The Securities and Exchange Commission is urging the New York Stock Exchange to adopt rules requiring companies to submit to greater supervision by independent directors as a condition of listing their securities.

title: Truck Rate Rise Approved
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission said yetsterday it had approved an average 6 per cent freight rate increase for the nation's common carrier trucking lines, effective April 12. The commission's order affects all freight moved across state lines by regulated carriers, except for raw agricultural products.

title: White Stag Pleads Guilty
description: PORTLAND, Ore., April 20 (AP)White Stag Manufacturing Company pleaded guilty in Federal District Court yesterday to 150 counts of failure to report the entire cost of its imported clothing from the Far East to the United States Customs Bureau.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
description: Today's Entries at Aqueduct

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Republican State Committee endorsed David F. Norcross, a candidate in the United States Senate primary elections on June 8. While Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., the Democratic incumbent, is regarded by political leaders from both parties as an overwhelming favorite to win a fourth term, Mr. Norcross said, There's a chance I'll win and I'm glad to have the chance to have the opportunity to make the race.

title: Mostly About Home Run Hitters
description: When Mike Schmidt hit four consecutive home runs and helped the Phillies win a pitcher's battle with the Cubs the other day, 1816 in 10 innings, the papers dutifully cited precedents: Only nine other batters hat ever cleared the fence four times in one game, only three of these did it on consecutive times at bat; only two besides Schmidt had four homers in an extrainning game. One the latter was Chuck Klein, of sainted memory in Philadelphia because he had two comings. In the fall of 1933 after Chuck had batted 368 for the Phillies, Sports Gerry Nugent sold him to the Cubs for of $65,000a gang of money thenplus Mark I'he Times Koenig, the oid Yankee shortstop; Ted Kleinhans, a pitcher, and Gink Hendricks, an outfielder who had once hit 354 for Brooklyn and was famous in literary circles for the immortal Dodger battle cry: From now on it's every man for theirself. Two seasons later the Cubs paid Nugent 11 10,000 to take Klein hack along with Fabian Kowalik, the pitcher, in exchange for Curt Davis, pitcher, and Ethan Allen, outfielder.

title: Pilots Bid U. S. Ban Smoking in Cockpit As Aviation Hazard
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) A group of commercial airline pilots and two organizations concerned with the public interest petitioned the Federal Government today to ban smoking in the cockpit as a particular hazard in aviation.

title: CHARLES MINOFF
description: Charles Minoff, an inventor and businessman, died yesterday in South Nassau Communities Hospital, Oceanside, L.I. He was 82 years old and lived at 490 Atlantic Avenue, East Rockaway, Queens.

title: Mets Behind Matlack, Brush Back Cardinals, 80
description: ST. LOUIS, April 20Frustrated by Jon Matlack's sixhit shutout pitching, aggravated by three New York Met home runs in the first two innings and still upset over their 17inning loss early this morning, the St. Louis Cardinals started a brushback battle tonight that nearly turned into a war.

title: Richard Burton to Begin Heretic Filming May 17
description: Richard Burton scheduled to end his stint on Broadway as the analyst in Equus on May 8, will begin working in the movie The Heretic, formerly known as Exorcist 2, in Hollywood on May 17.

title: JUSTICES UPHOLD MINORITY HOUSING IN WIIITE SUBURBS
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The Supreme Court ruled today, 8 to 0, that Federal courts can order the creation of lowcost public housing for minorities in a city's white suburbs to relieve racial segregation in housing within the city.

title: G.M. Vauxhall Strike Ends
description: ELLESMERE PORT, England, April 20 (Reuters) A weekold strike by 1,400 assembly workers at the General Motors Vauxhall plant in central England ended early today when the men voted to return to work after management promised suspensiort of the unboxing of Germanmade components.

title: Market Place
description: A tabulation of the performance of leading mutual hinds over the most recent doublemarket cycle clearly indicates that the funds and stocks generally have not kept pace with inflation. A market cycle is the span of time over which the stock market, as measured by a representative market average, moves from a peak to a trough and back to a peak again.

title: India's Peace Drive
description: By this time there can hardly he any doubt that India's Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has embarked upon a major peace drive, an effort to improve her country's relations with all the significant nations whose ties with India have been scarred by major tensions in recent years.

title: FASHION TALK
description: He's as original, in his way, as Holly Harp is in hers, out in California. Or Zandra Rhodes, in London. His name is Yuki, he was trained as a textile engineer in his native Japan, he studied the history of architecture in Chicago for a while, and he was in his middle 20's before he started to think about designing clothes.

title: SCHOOLS IN CITY FACING U.S. CUTS
description: The New York City school system is in danger of losing more than $125 million in Federal aid it receives for the education of the disadvantaged and for adult and vocational education in the coming year because of cuts in the city's current spending for schools, according to state and Federal officials.

title: Closing College Doors
description: In announcing his intention to leave his post of United State.; Commissioner of Education on Aug. 1 Terrel H. Bell cited as a major reason for his departure he imminent prospect of having to support three sons in college. Mr. Bell's new position as Commissioner of Higher Education and chief executive of the Board of Regents in his home state of Utah will pay $11,000 more than his present salary of $37,800.

title: WILLIAM G. COSTIL JR.
description: WASHINGTON, April 20William Gilmor Coil Jr., a backer of Broadway and other theatrical enterprises, died at Doctor's Hospital here yesterdcy. He was 63 years old.

title: Eastman Kodak Demonstrates System for Instant Pictures
description: The Eastman Kodak Company, entering the instantpicture field after seven years of development work, yesterday displayed two lowprice instantpicture cameras and a highprice film for use in both.

title: Smith's Sculptures In Photo Show
description: More than 100 photographs of the late David Smith's sculptures will be displayed at the Bolton Free Library in Bolton Landing, N.Y., from May 1 through the summer.

title: Islanders Lead by 32 After Two Late Goals
description: BUFFALO, April 20Bert Marshall, the New York Islanders senior defenseman, scored his first goal of the season with 19 seconds remaining tonight to give his team a 4.3 victory over the Buffalo Sabres. The goal came on a shot from just inside the blue line and enabled the Islanders to gain a 32 edge in the fourofsevengame Stanley Cup quarterfinal series.

title: Gromrko to Visit France
description: PARIS. April 20 (UPI)Foreign Minister Andrei A. Grornyko will make a fourday visit to France On April 27 to 30, le Foreign Ministry announced today.

title: SYRIAN BLOCKADE AT SEA REPORTEC
description: Between 3,000 and 4,000 regular Syrian troops are now deployed in Lebanon and most of the Syrian fleet of 30 ships is engaged in an arms blockade of Lebanese ports, according to United States and West European military sources.

title: C. Schmidt Brewery Sold
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 20 (UPI)Officials of C. Schmidt dnd Sons Brewery today confirmed the sale of the 116yearold concern to a local beer distributor, William H. Pflaujmer, for $15.9 million.

title: Pro Transactions
description: FOOTBALL

title: U.S. Says That Cuba Has Been Informed Of Inquiry on Raids
description: WASHINGTON, April 20The White House and the State Department said today that the United States had informed Cuba last Friday that it was trying to learn the identity of raiders who attacked Cuban fishing vessels off Florida on April 8 and was taking steps to deter further such attacks.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Portugal is caught up in another frenzy of rallies, marches and interparty violence with the approach on Sunday, on the second anniversary of the revolution that threw out the old rightwing dictatorship, of the vote for the first freely elected Parliament in half century. Only four parties are expected to obtain a significant vote: The Socialists are believed to be in first place, about equal to the liberal Popular Democrats and conservative Centralists combined, with the Communists forming a strong minority. [Page 1, Columns 13.]

title: CITIZEN'S SUIT FILED AGAINST MRS. PERON
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 20 (AP)A citizens suit accusing the deposed President, Isabel Martinez de Peron of fraud involving misuse of public funds was filed today in federal court, authorities announced.

title: POINTER OF TOY GUN AT REAGAN IS GUILTY
description: MIAMI, April 20Late last year Michael Lance Carvinl pulled out a toy gun in thel presence of Ronald Reagan and wrote letters threatening the lives of President Ford, Vicel President Rockefeller and Reagan. Today, he was found guilty by a Federal jury here on seven counts of an eightcount indictment related to these incidents.

title: Beame to Ignore Subpoena On PoliceFire Cutbacks
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday; that he would ignore a subpoena and would not testify today at a State Senate subcommittee hearing on legislation to protect Police and Fire Department budgets from cuts.

title: Leyland Lifts Capital Outlay
description: LONDON, April 20 (AP) British Leyland Ltd. Plans to spend a further 10 million pounds on expanding its bus and truck plants, reflecting the success of this division of the stateowned vehicle maker.

title: Issues in Rubber Strike
description: CLEVELAND, April 20Following are the issues in the rubber industry contract strike.

title: Thais Bar Vietnam Refugees
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 20 (AP)A hundred and fifteen refugees who escaped from South Vietnam in four fishing boats last week will not be allowed to come ashore in Thaiand, officials said today. The Interior Ministry said the boats arrived last Wednesday, Friday and Saturday. It said some of the refugees indicated they wanted to go to the United States.

title: A Cruising Schooner Aids Disadvantaged
description: HIGHLANDS, April 20, A MiamitoBoston Bicentennial Sail stopped in New Jersey today, with happy results for eight children from lowincome neighborhoods of East Orange.

title: My Fair Lady Lead, Hit By Piaster, Misses Show
description: Christine Andreas, the female lead in the Broadway musical My Fair Lady, had to forgo last night's performance because a piece of plaster from her dressing room ceiling fell on her while she was making up, a spokesman for the St. James Theater on West 44th Street reported.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Portugal is caught up in another frenzy of rallies, marches and interparty violence with the approach on Sunday, on the second anniversary of the revolution that threw out the old rightwing dictatorship, of the vote for the first freely elected Parliament in half a century. Only four parties are expected to obtain a significant vote. The Socialists are believed to be in first place, about equal to the liberal Popular Democrats and conservative Centralists combined, with the Communists forming a strong minority. [Page 1, Columns 13.]

title: Manhattan String Quartet Shows Flair
description: The Manhattan String Quartet is a young group that plays with ensemble sense and makes up programs with flair, Anchored at one end by the forceful if wiry first violin of Eric Lewis and at the other by the mellow tone and superior musicianship of Judith Glyde on the cello, they presented, at town Hall on Monday night, a program of an early Haydn quartet (Op. 20, No. 4), Respighi's Il Tramonto for quartet and metzosoprano, and Beethovon's major quartet Opro.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, April 20, 1976 (In bushels, 000 omitted) Mon.

title: Dr. Franklin J. Keller, 88, Dies; Pioneer in Vocational Education
description: Dr. Franklin J. Keller, a pioneer in New York vocational education, died Monday at Riverside Hospital, Columbus, Ohio. He was 88 years old and a resident of Worthington, Ohio.

title: RUBBER WORKERS BEGIN WALKOUT
description: CLEVELAND, Wednesday, April 21 The United Rubber workers begin a nationwide strike against the Big Four rubber companies early today.

title: The Forest Hills Coop, From Anger to Acceptance
description: On the night of Nov. 18, 1971, hundreds of angry, shouting Forest Hills residents stormed the site of a proposed housing project in their Queens neighborhood.

title: Study Urges Industrial Enclaves
description: Despite the loss of 14.000 factories and 477,000 manufacturing jobs from the metropolitan area in the las t two G Ecades,..a study by the Port Auhority of New York and New Jersey has shown that the area's older cities still have a potential for industrial development.

title: The New York Times/Paul Hoselros
description: The New York Times/Paul Hoselros

title: About Real Estate
description: LAKE SUCCESS, L. I.After a long drought, office construction has resumed in western Nassau County.

title: Radioactive Water Leaks At Japanese Atomic Plant
description: TOKYO, April 20 (AP)About 960 tons of radioactive water that had been used for cooling a nuclear reactor leaked into the Pacific Ocean from January to March after a coolant tank developed a footlong crack at a nuclear power plant 80 miles northeast of here officials said today.

title: ABC News Offers Barbara Walters $1 Million a Year
description: ABC News has offered Barbara Walters a fiveyear contract paying $1 million a year to become coanchor of The Evening News With Harry Reasoner.

title: SOLIAH REQUEST FOR DATA DENIED
description: SACRAMENTO Calif., April 20The Federal District Judge in the Steven Soliah bank robbery trial denied today a defense motion that would have forced Federal prosecutors to disclose what Patricia Hearst told them about the robbery of the Crocker National Bank in Carmichael, Calif., on April 21, 1975.

title: Memorial for Albers Set
description: A memorial service will be held for Josef Albers, the artist, on Friday at 2 P.M. In the lecture hall of the Yale Art Gallery, Weir Court on High Street, New Haven. Mr. Albers, formerly head of Yale's design department, died on March 25.

title: Flartke, Refuting Charge, Calls Trip to Africa in 1974 Justified
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 20 (AP)Senator Vance Hartke said today that he visited four African countries in 1974 as chairman of the Senate Vetlerans Affairs Committee even though an expense account he filed in 1975 listed only a trip to the Ivory Coast.

title: Some Find Keynes Policies Outmoded;
description: Following the first quarter's strong gain, with the real gross; national product rising at an annual rate of 7.5 percent, the United States economy has just about made it up the other side of the valley into which it began sliding during the fourth quarter of 1973. This economic recovery provides cause for celebration, especially when one recalls the grim warnings in some circles That this nation and perhaps the world, were in danger 01 falling into another great depression like that of the 1930's.

title: In Memoriam
description: O'MEARAMargarat Achar. A Mrrnorial Mass will offirad al St. Plus Church. Fairfield, Conn., on Thuridav evening, Aorli 22 at S P.M.; in.memory of Maroare O'Meara, who died on Argil 12, 1976.

title: Books of The Times
description: The rather majestic title of Harry Levin's collected essays on Shakespeare and other Elizabethan dramatists does the author a disservice in a way. It suggests a volume of narrow scholarly concerns, perhaps a ponderous investigation of the upheavals in Shakespeare's day and his place in them. Mr. Levin, who teaches at Harvard, makes clear that the revolution refers to the changes wrought by time, and that his aim is to see Shakespeare in his time, to see him in ours, and to follow his progress from one to the other.

title: Chrysler Still Lags
description: Under sharp questioning by shareholders at the Chrysler Corporation's annual meeting, John J. Riccardo, its chairman, acknowledged that the company's profit margin on higher auto sales was so far unsatisfactory. Page 62.

title: 100 Black Students Stage SitIn at Cornell Building
description: HACA, N.Y., April 20 One hundred black students in at the Cornell University administration building late today, evicting Date R. Corson, Cornell's president, and several other administrators. They demanded the rehiring of Herbert Parker, a black financial aide officer dismissed a month ago.

title: 20,000 Phones Go Out Asa Computer Balks
description: A computer program went awry in a New York Telephone Company switching facility cutting off service to 20,000 East Side telephone customers for 12 hours. Technicians had the system working by 10 A.M. yesterday.

title: Torture in Iran: It is a Hell Made by One Man for Another Man
description: He looked at my wife. Madam, he said. we'll bring the professor back in two hours. Nobody said a word.

title: Industry Calls Proposed Rules Blow at the American Funeral
description: Funeral directors yesterday came out against a proposed Federal regulation for their industry as an effort of a small group of people out to change the nature of the American funeral,' as their general counsel nut it.

title: Sun Oil is Now Sun Co. Inc.
description: Shareholders at the Sun Oil Company annual meeting yesterday approved a change in the company's name to the Sun Company Inc.

title: Schmidt Connects, Ties Another Mark
description: I didn't even know they kept records for that, said Mike Schmidt, when told yesterday that his sixth home run in three games had earned him another line in baseball's annals. It also helped the Philadelphia Phillies defeat the Pirates, 51, in Pittsbureh.

title: Federal Agency to Revise 200 to 250 Safety Rules
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) The Occupational Safety and Health Administration said yesterday that it was going to revise from 200 to 250 standards adopted when it was founded in 1970. It said it would hold public hearings around the country to provide business, labor and the general public a chance to comment on how to improve the rules.

title: N.Y. Rugby Union
description: N.Y. Rugby Union

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, April 20, 1976 Peillion tiled by.

title: WEST VIRGINIA HEAD PUT ON TRIAL BY U.S.
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., April 20 (AP)A list of potential jurors to hear extortion charges against Gov. Arch A. Moore Jr. was reduced t 45 today on the first day of the Federal trial.

title: Democrats Found More Conservative Than 4 Years Ago
description: In the absence of such a galvanizing political issue as the war in Vietnam, Democratic voters this year, at least insofar as they are typified by the small minority of voters, who have turned out in the early primaries, appear to have a more conservative hue than they did in 1972.

title: PRISON IS OPPOSED ON STATEN ISLAND
description: Citing fear of escapes by convicted felons and the resuiting danger to neighborhood residents, a number of Staten Island officials yesterday denounced plans to turn a 650bed drugrehabilitation center in Charleston into a mediumsecurity state prison early next month.

title: SCHOOLS IN CITY FACING U.S. CUTS
description: The New York City school system is in danger of losing more than $125 million in Federal aid it receives for the education of the disadvantaged and for adult and vocationall education in the coming year because of cuts in the city's current spending for schools, according to state and Federal officials.

title: Flyers, Bruins Go Up, 32
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 20 (AP)  Three goals, two by Don Saleski, in a 1minute33second span of the seccond period, triggered the Philadelphia Flyers to a 7victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs tonight in a National Hockey League quarterfinal playoff game. Saleski had three goals.

title: FIRES THREATEN STATE'S FORESTS
description: BLAIRSTOWN, April 20Flames fed by tinderdry brush and woodland bottom debris swept through more than 500 acres of prime forest in the Kittatinny Mountain range near this Warren County community today and posed a threat to further thousands of acres.

title: Court Finds Sexual Bias In Dismissal of a Woman
description: WASHINGTON, April 201 (UPI)A Federal judge ruled today that the Justice Department was guilty of sex discrimination in the dismissal of a woman employee who lost her job after she rejected her supervisor's sexual advances.

title: Pele's Leg in Cast With Minor Sprain
description: Pete, the Cosmos star, will have his left foot in a soft cast for several days after tests on Monday disclosed that he had sprained the foot during the game against the Toros on Sunday in Miami. Pele was limping f slightly on SunSoccer day night and the limp was more noticeable after he arrived at LaGuardia Airport Monday. Pele told a concerned teammate, It's nothing, it will be O.K.

title: 10 COMPANIES SUED ON DISPUTED DRUG
description: BOSTON, April 20 (AP)Three Massachusetts women whose mothers took a drug during pregnancy to prevent miscarriage filed a multimilliondollar class action suit today in Federal court against drug companies that produced and marketed diethylstilbestrol.

title: Elizabeth II, at 50, is a Symbol of Stability
description: LONDON, April 20Queen Elizabeth 11, who celebrates her 50th birthday tomorrow, remains an enduring symbol of stability after the decline of Britain as a colonial power and the erosion of the nation's economic strength.

title: Labor Leader Aids Jackson But Likes Humphrey Best
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 20A week before the Pennsylvania Presidential primary, Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington won today an endorsement from a union leader who prefers Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota as the Democratic nominee.

title: F.D.A. Asks Medical Exam Before Getting Hearing Aid
description: WASHINGTON, April 20 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration proposed today rules that would require most persons to undergo a medical examination before they could buy a hearing aid.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Gaylord Anguish, a 33yearold Californian who allegedly commuted to New York to commit five Long Island bank robberies, went on trial in Federal court in Brooklyn on charges of taking $S,400 at gunpoint from a Bankers Trust Company branch in Commack, L.I. The defendant's lawyer, John Corbett, argued before the jury that Mr. Anguish was not responsible for any criminal conduct because he was mentally ill at the time, and now has amnesia which blocks off any memory of the event. A group of Harlem residents, seeking, to prevent the closing of Sydenham Hospital on May 21. for economy reasons, were granted a showcause order yesterday in State Supreme Court. The city, the state and the Health and Hospitals Corporation must explain in court next Monday why the hospital, at 123d Street and Manhattan Avenue in central Harlem, must be closed.

title: Geneva Parley to Revise. Code of War Opens Today
description: GENEVA, April 20 (Reuters) Diplomats from 150 countries gather here tomorrow for an eight  week conference to modernize the code of conduct of war and bar inhuman treatment of civilians.

title: Bell Issue Sells Well
description: The Southern Bell Telephone and Telegraph Company's big $450 million debenture issue yielding 8.293 percent  the lowest rate for such an issue in more than two yearssold relatively rapidly yesterday despite the lower interest rate, and a spokesman for Salomon Brothers, the leading underwriter in the sale, estimated that the issue was probably 90 percent sold by late afternoon.

title: Portugal is Hectic as Vote Nears
description: LISBON, April 20After two years of political convulsion, Portugal is again caught up in a frenzy of rallies and marches, motorcades and interparty violence, with the approach of national legislative elections.

title: Running of the Bulls
description: Politicians like to run for reelection in rising markets. This has become such a truism that business cycle theorists can chart a predictable relationship between the coming of a national election every four years and the incumbent Administration's expansive fiscal and monetary policies. With the exception of 1960, every postwar Presidential election year has seen at least a mild economic boom.

title: oston Marathon Proves Fun Event for Tennis Pro
description: BOSTON, April 20The annual madness is past; the Boston Marathon is run, and the city is back to normal. Traffic flows over the streets of the 26 mile 385  yard course again. People have put down their garden hoses and returned to work because there are no more overheated runners to cool off. The runners are gone.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, April 20 (Reuters)Japan's overall balanceofpayments surplus rose to $660 million in March from $619 million in February and $298 million in March last year, Finance Ministry figures showed today.

title: Sun That Set on the Empire Casts a Shadow on Gurkhas
description: KATMANDU. NepalLance Cpl. Dhyan Rai, a tough little soldier from the eastern Himalayas, is serving in a long and proud tradition that he fears may be fading away.

title: Monday's Fight
description: New Orleans  Tony Licata, 163 pounds, New Orleans, knocked out Jose Duran, 16 Spain. 10 rounds to retain the U.S. middleweight title.

title: Long Island Lighting
description: HICKSVILLLLE, L. I., April 20The Long Island Lighting Company, one of the largest electric utilities in the state, informed its shareholders at the company's annual meeting today that it would increase its capital spending to $320 million this year and spend at least $300 million each year on construction through the end of the decade.

title: Convicted Slayer Enters Guilty Plea in 2d Murder
description: Charles Yukl, who went In prison for more than five years for the murder of a young woman and who was paroled in 1973 because he was ai model inmate, pleaded guilty yesterday to the nearly identical slaying of an aspiring actress 20 months ago.

title: ClayCourt Tourney Adds a Golden Touch
description: With the outdoor season under way, there are changes oh the tournament scene.

title: A State in India Proposes Compulsory Sterilization
description: NEW DELHI, April 20 (UPI)The government of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's home state has formally proposed compulsory sterilization, with noncompliance carrying a prison term for husbands, officials said today.

title: ManySided Economic Crisis Attracts As Many Cures as Lisbon Has Parties
description: LISBON, April 20The key issue in the Portuguese elections next Sunday is what to do about the economy.

title: The Forest Hills Coop, From Anger to Acceptance

A series of energy conservation programs is now to be assigned the same high priority in Administration planning that formerly went only to industrybacked measures to develop new energy supplies.

Finley's continuing attempt to regain the rights to Jim (Catfish) Hunter. In the fall of 1974, an arbitrator, Peter Seitz, had ruled that Hunter's contract with the Oakland A's was broken because Finley had not paid $50,000 in the agreed'manner as deferred income. As a free agent, Hunter signed a fiveyear agreement with the New York Yankees worth $3.75 million, and has pitched for the Yankees ever since.

Members of the union on five private bus lines also approved similar pacts, a spokesman said.

title: Film: Crime and Passion:Passer Movie Is Based on Novel by Chase
description: The talent of Ivan Passer, the Czechoslovak director-writer who has been living in this country in recent years, is very real but so finely tuned that it can be thrown off by mundane things, like a magnetic compass disoriented by a passing garbage truck. Though Mr. Passer has a poet's eye for unexpected details and associations, and though he's a risk-taker, his is not a fragile talent. When he makes a mistake, it's a whopper."Crime and Passion," which opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters, is such a film, a grossly disoriented and disorienting shaggy-dog of a movie that seems to have no point, and no point of view, whatever.Based on a James Hadley Chase novel that I haven't read, it's a somewhat black comedy about a neurotic international financial consultant (Omar Sharif), who, when things are going bad for him, has seizures of sexual passion the way other men get sweaty palms. It's also about his loyal assistant, played by Karen Black, whom he marries off to an eccentric German millionaire in a scheme to defraud the bridegroom.The settings include a posh European ski resort and an ancient German castle, while the ghost of a headless knight and an elaborate television monitoring system (in the castle) are among the props.What it's meant to be, I cannot tell. A comedy, melodrama, spoof? There are moments when you might think you are watching one of those stateless exercises that Roman Polanski likes to make occasionally, a movie that seems peculiarly decadent because it has no discernible national identity. This I suspect to be a false reading because everything that Mr. Passer has ever done, including his American-made "Born to Win" and "Law and Disorder," is the work of a director of profound sensitivity. In "Crime and Passion" the talent has been thrown offwildly.

title: Rescuing WNYC
description: The nation's only noncommercial municipal radio station, WNYC, has become a possible victim of the fiscal crisis in New York City. It will either falland if it does, probably will never be put together againor be rescued by a plan combining a viable new structure with outside public support, or be sold off to become just another space on the dial filled with raucous sounds.

title: News Summary and Index

The protocol was understood to cover spare parts for Egypt's Soviet supplied MIG fighters. The SovietEgyptian rift has been greeted with thinly disguised delight in Peking. and Mr. Mubarak's delegation received an unusually lavish welcome. [Page 1, Column 3.]

description: Egypt and China signed a military protocol in Peking, saying it heralded a new phase in their relations. A toast was drunk at the final dinner of Egyptian Vice President Husni Mubarak's visit, hailing the closer cooperation since Cairo scrapped its friendship treaty with the Soviet Union last month. The protocol was understood to cover spare parts for Egypt's Sovietsupplied MIG fighters. The SovietEgyptian rift has been greeted with thinly disguised delight in Peking, and Mr. Mubarak's delegation received an unusually lavish welcome. [Page 1, Column 3.]

title: Soviet Test Blast Recorded
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, April 21 (AP)An underground explosion in the 100kiloton range was recorded today from the Soviet Union's nuclear testing area in Siberia, the Uppsala seismological institution reported. The explosion registered 6.2 on the Richter Scale, the Institution reported.

title: TWO AGED SISTERS DIE OF STARVATION
description: The bodies of two elderly sisters, senile and starved, were fotind in a Brooklyn apartment that was littered with money and uncashed. Social Security checks.

title: TV: Scottsboro Boys, Quality Show
description: Tomorrow Entertainment returns to television this evening with every encouraging indication that it will continue to deal in quality Productions. Past credits have included The Autobiograuhv of Miss Jane Pittman. Tell Me Where it Hurts, Larry and I Heard the OWl Call My Name. Last year, however, the company ivent out of business. Now, beginning again with Thomas W.. Moore as executive producer, it offers Judge Horton and the Scottsboro Boys, which can be seen this evening at 9 on NBCTV.

title: Gasoline Output Up; Motor Fuel Supply Continues to Drop
description: Gasoline production in the United States increased but stocks of motor fuel continued to drop as good weather encouraged greater automobile use.

title: Stocks Up on News Of Economic Gains
description: The stock market, with good news on the inflation rate and corporate earnings, surged yesterday to its highest level in nearly 39 months.

title: People and Business
description: Bob R. Dorsey, who was ousted as chairman of the Gulf Oil Corporation earlier this year because of the scandal involving illegal political and foreign contributions by the company, has been ordered to appear before Federal magistrate in Pittsburgh on April 29 to answer questions received from a Bolivian Court about Gulf's political payments in that country.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Notes on People
description: Thrown by her horse in a competition yesterday, Princess Anne suffered a cracked vertebra and spent the night in a Dorset hospital for observation.

title: J. & L. and Youngstown Join In Pipe and Tubular Price Rise
description: The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation and the Youngstown Sheet and Tube Company joined other steel companies yesterday in raising prices for certain pipe and tubular products. Jones & Laughlin, a subsidiary of the LTV Corporation, said its new prices would be competitive with these announced previously by the United States Steel Corporation. The in creases will be on seamless oil country pipe, seamless standand pipe, line pipe, mechanical tubing, coupling stock and electric weld pipe. It will also reduce by 1.8 percent its price on seamless drill pipe.

title: Kelly Garrett
description: Kelly Garrett says she can sing anything, a contention to which she gave some validity when she sang one of the songs nominated for Oscars on the Academy Awards show, Richard's

title: PROTESTERS WARN HOSPITAL IN BRONX
description: Community residents who have been sittingin at Fordham Hospital for more than a week threatened to step up their protest against plans to close that Bronx municipal institution because they said hospital officials were not taking them seriously.

title: SIX FORD RIVALS FILING FUND SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, April 21Six candidates for the Presidency will join forces tomorrow in requesting the Supreme Court to free amost $2.4 million in Federal matching campaign funds to ease their financial problems.

title: Knoxville Honors Dr. King
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., April 21 (AP)  The City Council has designated the second Sunday in January as a city holiday in honor of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., the slain civil rights leader. The council approved the holiday resolution last night but specified that city employees would not i receive pay for the holiday.I An earlier proposal that the council adopt a paid holiday honoring Dr. King was rejected on the ground that it would cost the city too much money.

title: Police Auxiliaries Told by Association Not to Make Arrests
description: John Hyland, president of the Auxiliary Police Benevolent Association, urged the 5,000 members of the city's auxiliary police yesterday not to make arrests under any circumstances because the city will not back you up.

title: Western Union in a Deal for CPI Units
description: The Western Union Corporatoe. announced yesterday that It had signed a contract with Communications Properties Inc., of Austin, Tex., to acquire all capital stock of CPI Microwave Inc. and certain assets of CPI Satellite Television Communications Inc., for about $13 million in preferred stock and notes.

title: Witness Tells of DiLorenzo's Reaction to Inquiry
description: Two witnesses at the perjury trial of Ross J. DiLorenzo, a retired Brooklyn Civil Court Judge, testified yesterday that his reaction to news that he was being investigated by the Appellate Division was that a person can't do a favor for anyone anymore.

title: Honest Pleasure in Derby Prep Today
description: LEXINGTON, Xy., April 21 Folks who do their horseplaying in this bourbonflavored racing center are too smart to say, He can't lose.

title: Court Fight Opens on L.I. Over State School Funds
description: MINEOLA, L. I., April 21A test case challenging the state's use of the property tax to finance public education went to trial in State Supreme Court here today.

title: Teamsters Defeat Suit
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (UPI) A Federal judge dismissed today a dissident's suit charging the International Brotherhood of Teamsters with trying to conduct an illegal contract ratification vote. The ruling by Judge William B. Bryant of Federal District Court allowed the union to mail ratification ballots to 450,000 members to vote on a new threeyear master freight agreement reached with the trucking industry earlier this month after a threeday nationwide walkout.

title: Sotheby's Auctioneer: A PearShaped Gavel And Standing Tall
description: For weeks Lorna Clare Kelly had rehearsed.

title: Czech Sextet Wins Championship
description: KATOWICE, Poland, April 21 (UPI)An upset victory by Sweden over the defending champion Soviet Union made Czechoslovakia the new world hockey champion today.

title: LaosSoviet Talks End
description: MOSCOW, April 21 (Agence FrancePresse)  Visiting Laotian Prime Minister, Kaysone Phomvihan, and the Soviet Prime Minister, Aleksei N. Kosygin, wound up two days of talks here today on relations between the two countries, the Tass press agency reported.

title: INDIA CITES CLASH WITH BANGLADESH
description: NEW DELHI, April 21India charged today that Bangladesh, soldiers fired across the border with mortar and automatic weapons yesterday in an unprovoked attack on an Indian patrol. The Indians fired back in selfdefense, the Government statement said, and there were casualties on both sides in heavy fire. The number of casualties was not disclosed.

title: F.P.C. WELCOMES PUBLIC TO SESSION
description: WASHINGTON. April 211 The Federal Power Commission met today for the 7,375th time and for the first time opened its meeting to the public.

title: Joseph Goldston, 84, Doctor; Made House Calls Until 81
description: Dr. Joseph Goldstone, an East Side physician who continued to make house calls until he retired at the age of 81, died Tuesday in his residence at 1230 Park Avenue. He was 84 years old.

title: CBS Lists Record Profit, Rejects an InHouse Critic
description: CHICAGO. April 21 (AP)CBS Inc. reported record firstquarter profits at the Company's annual shareholders meeting today, where most of the discussion centered on accuracy and responsibility in broadcast news coverage.

title: Western Oil Group Reopens Iran Talks
description: TEHERAN, Iran, April 21Talks were resumed today between Iran and Western oil companies that have been seeking a revision of the 1973 agreement under which they buy most of Iran's oil.

title: Negotiator in 75 Kidnapping Installed as Envoy to Liberia
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (Reuters)W. Beverly Carter, who ran afoul of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger last year for negotiating with kidnappers in Tanzania, was sworn in today as Ambassador to Liberia.

title: G.T.E. Chief to Resign
description: Leslie H. Warner, 64. chairman and chief executive of the General Telephone and Electronics Corporation, told shareholders at the company's annual meeting that he planned to resign his posts on May 31. He will be succeeded by Theodore F. Brophy, who will retain his position as president. Page 50.

title: A METEOR SHOWER HITS RURAL CHINA
description: HONG KONG, April 21A meteorite weighing 3,894 pounds, the heaviest stone known to have fallen on earth, and a shower of more than 100 other meteorites fell on farm land in Manchuria last month, the Chinese Press Agency, Hsinhua, said today.

title: Sports Today
description: Yonkers Raceway, Central and Yonkers Avenues, 8 P.M. Freehold (N. J.) Raceway, 1 P.M. Monticello (N. Y.) Raceway, P.M.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: This fall the United States may face an epidemic of a severe influenza known as swine virus that resembles the strain that killed more than twenty million people in 191819, of whom 550.000 were Americans.

title: EGYPT AND CHINA SIGN ARMS PACT, HAIL CLOSER TIES
description: PEKING, April 21Egypt and China signed a military protocol today, saying it heralded a new phase in relations betwcen the two countries.

title: REYNOLDS TO LIFT ALUMINUM PRICES
description: The Reynolds Metals Company announced price increases for aluminum ingot and some fabricated products at its annual meeting yesterday in Richmond.

title: Gotbaum Scores Board Proposal To Halt TakeHome Pay Clause
description: Victor Gotbaum, chairman of the Municipal Labor Committee, charged yesterday that recommendations to eliminate a provision for increasing municipal employees takehome pay would abrogate union agreements.

title: RentControl Tenants May Get Redactions
description: Tenants in 360,000 rentcontrolled New York City apartments are likely to see their rents reduced by up to $9 a month beginning July I, the City Council leadership indicated yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: A great deal of attention has been given recently to governmental retirement programs. The Shinn study of New York City's municipal systems as well as other recent studies offer temporary panaceas rather than permanent corrections to a political porkbarrel system. To talk in terms of employee contributions today where such contributions represent aftertax dollars while the selfemployed can provide their benefits using pretax dollars is incomprehensible. The real reason for the municipal pension plans problems is the fact that they are subject to the whims of legislators.

title: JACKSON HEDGING ON PENNSYLVANIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 21Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington conceded today that despite his previous pre dictions of victory he could lose Pennsylvania's preferential contest in next Tuesday's Democratic Presidential primary to Jimmy Carter, the former Governor of Georgia.

title: BROWN SEES CHANCE TO WIN NOMINATION
description: LOS ANGELES, April 21 (UPI)Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California, insisting he is a serious candidate, says he is one of five Democratic, candidates with a chance for the Presidential nomination.

title: My Fair Lady Lead To Return Tomorrow
description: A chunk of plaster fell from her dressingroom ceiling five minutes before curtain time Tuesday night and hit Christine Andreas, forcing her out of the role of Eliza Doolittle in the revival of My Fair Lady,

title: The Wind Of Change: I
description: BOSTON, April 21As a convenience, the Rhodesian Government now sells air letter forms with the letter already written. Dear, it begins, no doubt you are worried.

title: Lottery Winner to Get $10,000 Denied Him
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., April 21 (UPI)  The State Gaming Commission today authorized a $10,000 payment to Barry Brunelle of Stafford, who won the money in a state lottery but was denied the winnings because he was a minor.

title: Indictments Charge 11 With Falsifying UsedCar Mileage
description: Eleven persons and two corporations have been Indicted on charges of using fraudulent newspaper advertising to sell cars on which the odometers had been turned back to show they had low mileage, District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn announced yesterday.

title: Miki to Send Envoy to U.S.
description: TOKYO, April 21 (UPI) Prime Minister Takeo Miki announced today that he would send a special envoy to Washingtion soon to try to clear up the $12 million Lockheed paynftscandal, which has thrown Japanese politics into turmoil for months. Mr. Miki, who has staked his political life on a resolution of the crisis, bowed to the demands of Japan's four opposition parties.

title: Kittatinny Forest Fire Appears Under Control
description: A fire that has engulfed nearly 1.000 acres of prime forest in the Kittatinny Mountain range in Warren County seemed to be under control ycslcrdry, although firefighters were hoping for a predicted rainfall to aid their extinguishing operations.

title: MISS HEARST GETS NEW TRIAL DELAY
description: LOS ANGELES, April 21 (UPI)A second trial of Patricia liearst was put off today for weeks, perhaps months, because of her illness and a Federal court order that she undergo at least 90 days psychiatric examination.

title: F.B.I. Intensifies Inquiry Into Udall Ballot Petitions
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 21 (UPI)The Federal Bureau ol Investigation has intensified ar inquiry into the shortage ol signatures that knocked Representative Morris Udall of Arizona off the May 4 Indiana Presidential primary ballot.

title: Issues in Rubber Strike
description: The United Rubber Workers are negotiating for a new threeyear master contract with the Big Four rubber comparriesthe Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company, the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company, the B. F. Goodrich Company and Uniroyal Inc.but are concentrating their efforts on Firestone to make it set the pattern for the industry. The union represents 70,000 workers at the four companies, 10,000 of whom have not been recalled from layoffs that started during the recession.

title: Pennsylvania to Test Carter's Momentum
description: PITTSBURGH, April 21 Jimmy Carter has entered the second phase of the Presidential campaign in the anomalous position of a frontrunner still searching for a solid base in the Democratic Party.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, it was incorrectly stated in The Times yesterday that Wilma Soss attended The New York Times Company stockholders meeting. She was represented by another stockholder.

title: Cardinals Pops Drop in fora 74 Victory
description: ST. LOUIS, April 21The New York Mets and St. Louis Cardinals played a plain old ordinary game of baseball today, and the Mets lost, 74. Maybe it was because the Mets played rather plain and ordinary compared to their first two games here, which they won, one a 17inning thriller and the other a beanball war.

title: JOSEPH WALKER JR., INVESTMENT BANKER
description: Joseph T. Walker Jr., who retired in 1963 as a limited partner in Hornblower & WeeksHemphill, Noyes Inc., investment house, died of cancer Tuesday evening in New London (N. H.) Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived in New London.

title: F.T.C. PLANS SUIT TO DEMAND DATA
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission said today it would file suit to force 180 of the nation's largest manufacturers to provide information about their financial performance.

title: Court Fight Opens on L.I. Over State School Funds
description: MINEOLA, L. 1., April 21A test case challenging the states use of the property tax to finance public education went to trial in State Supreme Court here today.

title: CALIFORNIA QUAKE IN YEAR PREDICTED
description: LOS ANGELES, April 21A California Institute of Technollogy geophysicist, who accurately predicted an earthquake near here two years ago, alerted Southern Californians today to the possibility of a severe earthquake during the next 12 months.

description: BUSINESS RECORDS

title: Shakespeare Anatomized in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, April 21Alas poor Shakespeare, a fellow of infinite tests, and now submitted to the final dignity of an international congress.

title: LOS ANGELES STRIKE HITS 3 HOSPITALS
description: LOS ANGELES, April 21 (UPI)  Resident interns and doctors went on strike today at three county hospitals despite threats that they could lose certification in their spe cialties.

title: U.S. Sees Aid for MIG's
description: China will apparency supply spare parts for Egypt''s MIG17 and MIG21 squadrons since these are Sovietdesigned fighters common to both ccuntries' forces, according Lo United States Air Force officials.

title: Law Permits Municipalities To Have PetSpaying Clinics
description: ALBANY. April 21 (AP)Local governments are authorized to set up and finance clinics to spay or neuter cats and dogs under a bill signed by Governor Carey.

title: Pennsylvania to Test Carter's Momentum

title: Byrne Drive to Put Leone at the Helm Of Port Authority is Said to Falter
description: TRENTON, April 21A drive by the Byrne administration to have State Treasurer Richard C. Leone become the executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey was reported tonight to have faltered.

title: PRESIDENT SCORES REAGAN ON ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, April 21President Ford accused Ronald Reagan today of making preposterous and demagogic statements that the United States was slipping behind the Soviet Union in military preparedness.

title: Bridge
description: The biggest event of the year for Long Island bridge players begins tonight at the Belmont Park race track.

title: TOP OIL EXECUTIVE IN ITALY IS SHOT
description: ROME. April 21One of Italy's leading oil executives was shot and seriously wounded today in an attack that underscored the rising level of political violence here.

title: Saudis Aid Agricultural Fund
description: ROME, April 21 (Reuters)Saudi Arabia today became the first oilproducing country to announce a contribution to new international fund for agricultural development. The Saudi representative to the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization. said his country would give 50 million to the fund.

title: Horne Debuts Oct. 10
description: Pro football's regular season will not return to New York (or debut in New Jersey) until Oct. 10. The Giants are scheduled to open the new stadium in the Meadowlands against the Dallas Cowboys that day while the Jets face the Buffalo Bills at Shea Stadium.

title: 33 Sold Half a Ton Of Drugs Since 68, U.S. Indictment Says
description: Federal authorities charged 33 defendants yesterday with operating a huge narcotics ring that allegedly imported and sold more than 900 pounds of cocaine and about 80 pounds of heroin since 1968.

description: The following article was written by John M. Crewdson and is based on reporting by him and Lawrence K. AltMAN Nicholas M. Horrock and James P. Sterba.

title: She Wants Her Gallery To Shake People Up And That it Does
description: All over the neat gray carpet in the Theo Portnoy Gallery right now there are garbage cans overflowing with the jetsam of contemporary societyeverything from empty beer bottles to overripe banana peels.

title: NEVADA BANK TO ACT FOR HUGHES ESTATE
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., April 22 (UPI)The State Gambling Commission gave emergency approval today to the First tional Bank of Nevada to he the special administrator for the Nevada estate of Howard R. Hughes, whose seven casinos made him the state's biggest gambling operator.

title: U.P.I. Names Coast Aide
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 22 (UP)The appointment of Clarence Zaitz as San Diego bureau manager of United Press International was announced today by Reeve HenInion, U.P.I. California editor, Mr. Zaitz, 45 years old, succeeds Lawrence T. Olsen, who iis being transferred to Pittsburgh as a regional executive.

title: Subway Riders Caught In Maze of Faulty Signs
description: I'm not really lost, I'm just trying to find out whether I want the IRT, the BMT or the shuttle, said an I.B.M. executive from San Francisco.

title: Talks Slated on Commodore Hotel Deal
description: In a lastditch effort to get the best possible deal for the city, the Beame administration will negotiate with Donald Trump, a developer, to reduce his proposed 50year.taxabatement deal to 35 years to reconstruct the Commodore Hotel.

title: Cahn is Under Inquiry in Case Involving False Severance Pay
description: William Cahn, the former Nassau County District Attorney who will be retried next month on Federal fraud charges, is under Investigation for an alleged conspiracy involving falsified severance payments to 12 former aides.

title: Ford Says Reagan's Position on Canal Could Lead to a Blood Bath in Panama
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 23President Ford, campaigning in Indiana today, stepped up his counterattack on Ronald Reagan, accusing him of advocating an irresponsible position on the Panama Canal that could produce a blood bath in the Canal Zone.

title: Iceberg Patrol Carries Out A Hazardous, Tedious Task
description: The squat HC130 aircraft of the United States Coast Guard crossed the 55th parallel over the Labrador Sea, headed north on a course off bleak Labrador, flying low and slow over a sea of ice.

title: Sales to Other Utilities Lift American Electric's Profit
Money Supply Rose 3.4 Billion in Week
description: The nation's money supply rose by an extraordinary $3.4 billion during the week ending April 21, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Radcliffe Alumna, 81, is Grandlady Of University Women's Book Sales
description: MONTCLAIR, April 22"l can't see how we'll be ready in time, Katherine Lyman said, as she struggled to open a carton of books at the College Women's Club here. But then, it's the same each year. We can't seem to get all the books ready for the sale, but somehow we manage.

title: COURT VOIDS LAW THAT WAS THREAT TO CUNNINGHAM
description: A New York State election law that would have removed Patrick J. Cunningham from his leadership posts in the Democratic Party was declared unconstitutional yesterday in unanimous decision by a special threejudge Federal court.

title: Hawley: Four Winners
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., April 22 (AP)Sandy Hawley captured both ends of the $35.20 daily double today at Hollywood Park and went on to win the third and seventh races as well.

title: REAL ESTATE MOUP DENIES BIAS CHARGE
description: CHICAGO, April 22 (AP)A professional real estate appraisal society, said today, that it did not require or advise its members to consider racial factors in setting property values for home mortgakes.
