title: Hospital Emergency Cases Said to Wait 4 to 7 Hours
description: Enfergencyroom patients atl Kings County Hospital now have to wait four to seven hours for treatment, members of the hospital's community board of directors said yesterday. The community board and former members of the hospital's medical boardwho resigned in protest against budget cuts last Januaryheld a news conference at the hospital to protest further budget cuts planned for the institution under the Health and Hospitals Corporation's financial plan.

title: AIR FORCE JET TAKES BUTZ PARTY ON TOUR
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (UPI)  Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz and a party of 25 other persons, including wives of department officials, are using an Air Force jet on a globe girdling trade tour that will cost $1,800 more per person than commercial airfare.

title: The American University Hospital in Beirut Carries On Amid the Shells and Chaos
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 22  Dr. Samuel P. Asper, a courtly Texan, runs an excellent hospital that is guarded by Palestinian guerrillas, overflowing with war casualties and operating with a third of its normal staff memhers, who have not been paid in two months.

title: Transkei Farming Limited by Traditional Land Use
description: UMTATA, South AfricaThis city is something of a laboratory in paternalism.

title: Seoul Jails 2 Politicians
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 22 (UPI)The Seoul District Criminal Court has sentenced dwo opposition politicians to prison on charges of violating President Park Chung Nee's ban on antiGovernment activities. Kim Duk Yong. 36 years old, secretary to Kim Young Sam, head of the opposition New Democratic Party, received a sixmonth sentence and Kim Yong Ju a New Democratic member of The National Assemhly, was given a oneyear term.

title: Islanders Eliminate Sabres in Game 6 As Gullies Goal Fashions a 3 2 Victory
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., April 22 Bill Smith gloved the final shot as it sailed the length of the rink, and then jumped high. The Nassau Coliseum crowd roared so loudly that the final buzzer was inaudible. All because the New York Islanders beat the Buffalo Sabres, 32, tonight and advanced to the semifinals of the Stanley Cun playoffs.

title: Ingmar Bergman Decides To Move Out of Sweden
description: STOCKHOLM, April 22 Ingmar Bergman, beset by tax problems, announced today that he could no longer live in Sweden and was leaving the country to continue his film work abroad.

title: Wood,Field&Strearn
description: At the close of World War IL those who enjoyed a wilderness backpacking trip had to content themselves, for the most part, with equipment left over from the conflict.

description: Following are excerpts from the decision of a threejudge Federal panel and the concurring opinion of Judge Irving R. Kaufman holding unconstitutional the section of New York State election Idly requiring a party officer to he removed from his post if he refuses to waive immunity and testify before a grand jury.

title: Major League Baseball
description: American League LAST NIGHT'S GAME Kansas City 2, Milwaukee 1.

title: Cairo Bids Envoy Yield Gun
description: CAIRO, April 22 (Reuters)Egypt today asked the Liban ambassador, ask Milod elSeydik Ramadan, to surrender immediately a submachine gun he used to break up an occupation of the embassy by Libyan students last Monday, the Foreign Ministry announced.

title: Hudson Valley to Get a Cleaning Sunday
description: ALPINE, April 22Shoulder to shoulder with likeminded comrades, William Wurst, his wife, Toy, and their 5yearold son, Jimmy, will be on the shoreline trail in the Palisades Interstate Park here Sunday, filling plastic trash bags with litter and other debris left by man and nature.

title: Price Shifts Small On Amex and OTC As Trading Declines
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market closed with minor price changes yesterday in slower trading.

title: Volkswagen Said to Plan Assembly Plant in U.S
description: BONN. April 22After years of financial crisis and bitter internal debate, the supervisory board of Volkswagenwerk A.G. was reported today to have decided to invest $250 million in, an automobile assembly plant in the United States.

title: Sephardic Jews Temple on L.I. To Mark Its Own Coming of Age
description: On May 8 a building in Cedarhurst, L.I., will have a Bar Mitzvah a ceremony that will be more significant than a simple recognition of its 13 years.

title: Cherry Blossom Fete. Begins at Branch Brook Park
description: NEWARK, April 22A 10day Cherry Blossom Festival got under way today at Branch Brook Park here to help celebrate Earth Day in New Jersey and the sixth anniversary of the State Department of Environmental Protection.

title: Guarantees by Spain of Minimum Working Conditions Become Law
description: MADRID, April 22  Guarantees of minimum working conditions, including continuing protection against discharge, became law today despite strong opposition from most of Spanish management.

title: Librarian Questions France's Gift Copy Of Washington Talk
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (AP) An American history expert, contradicting the French Ambassador, says George Washington did not sign the engraved copy of his 1796 Farewell Address that France has offered as a gift to commemcirate the American Bicentennial.

title: BOARD REAFFIRMS NAMECHANGE AIM
description: Community School Board 5 reaffirmed yesterday its plan to rename a Harlem elementary school for Pedro Albizu Campos, rejecting criticisms that the revolutionary Puerto Rican nationalist had hailed terroristic tactics in seeking the island's independence.

title: A STONY BROOK UNIT HIT BY 2 MORE FIRES
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., April 22 The sixth and seventh fires in two months occurred this morning in the Cardozo College, dormitory at the State University Center here.

title: Prosecutor Proposes Clemency For Some Convicted on Attica
description: The special Attica prosecutor; has recommended executive, clemency for some of the eight inmates convicted of crimes committed during the 1971 riot at the upstate prison in which 43 inmates and guards died.

title: Bronx Democrat Indicted In Inquiry on Cunningham
description: A Bronx district leader was indicted yesterday op charges of destroying records a special grand jury Had subpoenaed to determine whether he and Patrick J. Cunningham, the Democratic state chairman and Bronx County leader, accepted a bribe from a judge for his seat on the criminal court bench.

title: DR. JOSEPH M. BEATTY
description: Dr. Joseph Moorhead Beatty of Rockport, Mass., chairman of the department of English at Goucher College, in Townson, Md., who retired in 1956, died on April 16 in Addison Gilbert Hospital, Gloucester, Mass., after a long illness. He was 85 years old.

title: COURT VOIDS LAW THAT WAS THREAT TO CUNNINGHAM
description: A New York State election law that would have removed Patrick J. Cunningham from his leadership posts in the Democratic Party was declared unconstitutional yesterday in a unanimous decision by a special threejudge Federal court.

title: ARABAFRICAN PACT ON COOPERATION SET
description: DAKAR, Senegal, April 22 (Agence FrancePresse) The AfricanArab ministerial conference ended here today withl publication of an eightpoint charter of cooperation between delegations from the Organization of African Unity and the Arab Leazue.

title: Franjieh's Foes Threaten To Set Up Rival Regimes
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 22The Beirut radio declared today that if President Suleiman Franjieh did not resign, Moslem and leftist forces would establish a revolutionary government in areas under their control and liberate strongholds of the Christian rightists.

title: Liguori Victor in Fast 5,000
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 22 Marty Liguori of the New York Athletic Club, running his last good race until the Olympic Trials, scored an impressive 5,000meters victory as the Penn Relays track program opened today in the twilight at the University of Pennsylvania's Franklin Field.

title: ABRAHAM D. GOLD
description: Abraham D. Gold, who retired in 1960 as principal of Public School 184, which was at Lenox Avenue and 116th Street, died yesterday in New York Hospital. He was .82 years old and lived at 290 Ninth Avenue.

title: 2 Lead Democrats
description: Something approaching a consensus has been emerging among Democratic Party leaders over the last month, to the effect that only Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota and former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia retain significant chances of winning the party's Presidential nomination.

title: PAYMENTS STUDIED BY BRISTOLMYERS
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The BristolMyers Company has informed the Securities and Exchange Commission that it hegan an investigation late last year to determine the extent to which it may have made questionable or allegedly improper Payments.

title: Layoff Ban in Parks Won With. Some 3Day Weeks
description: In exchange for a promise of no layoffs during the 1977 fiscal year, the union representing Park Department employees has agreed to a threeday work week for seasonal employees and to the use of volunteers to keep parks and beaches operating throughout the summer, city and union officials disclosed yesterday.

description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (AP) An American history expert, contradicting the French Ambassador says George Washington did not sign the engraved copy of his 1796 Farewell Address that France has offered as a gift to commemorate the American Bicentennial.

title: Fields Stores Ltd. Offers Grant $32.6 Million for Zeller's Unit
description: Charles G. Rodman, trustee for the bankrupt W. T. Grant Company, announced yesterday that he has received an offer from Fields Stores Ltd. of Canada to buy Grant's 50.1 per. cent interest m the Zeller's chain for $32.67 million in cash. Grant's holdings in Zeller's consists of about 6.4 million shares of common stock and $6.06 million principal amount of Zeller's 51/2 percent subordinated debentures.

title: NBCTV Plans a Special Of Beauty and the Beast
description: A new adaptation of the classic fairy tale Beauty and the Beast has been scheduled for next season on NBCTV with George C. Scott and Trish Van Devere in starring roles.

title: Of Jobs and Deficits
description: The persistent disagreement between the Ford Administration and the Democraticcontrolled Congress over legislation to provide public jobs for the unemployed and financial assistance for hardpressed cities has broken out again. Despite renewed threats of a Presidential veto, the Senate last week passed a $5.3 billion public works bill that contains two major provisions that were in a bill that Mr. Ford rejected in February.

title: REVIEWS STARTED IN CADET CHEATING
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., April 22 West Point officials began today to review preliminary verdicts of guilty reached by cadet honor boards against 50 thirdyear cadets charged with cheating. Appeals before boards of officers are likely to begin next week.

title: Jones Disillusioned With San Antonio
description: SAN ANTONIO, April 22Rich Jones got on the plane carrying the New York Nets home today with something between a sigh and a smile of relief.

title: Trial Opens on Suit on State School Aid
description: MINEOLA. L.I., April 22You walk into my school and the corners are dirty, the principal if one of the Levittown School District's 10 elementary schools said today. And, he added. the corners are getting bigger.

title: When the Past Has No Future
description: I am sitting on the 7:37 out of Tarrytown bound for New York City. The day is bright and dazzling, with sunlight dancing on the Hudson beyond my window. My eyes dip periodically into the newspaper on my lap. They try to absorb some meaning but are unable to do so. Again and again my gaze turns back to the river, to the billion gold coins glittering on its surface.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Kansas City Royals, at Yankee Stadium. River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M.

title: Notes on People
description: The title of Sir Harold is in store for Harold Wilson, the former Prime Minister and Labor Party leader, Buckingham Palace announced yesterday. Queen Elizabeth II has named him a Knight Companion of the Most Noble Order of the Garter, one of Britain's highest order of chivalry. The title is nonhereditary.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Italian newspapers, citing United States documents, asserted yesterday that an unidentified former Prime Minister was involved in the scandal over bribes by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation. They named as prime suspects Giovanni Leone, now Italy's President; Aldo Moro, who is also Prime Minister now, and Mariano Rumor, now Foreign Minister. Each man issued strong denial of the allegations. The Christian Democratic Party, in which the three men are leading figures, was stunned. The newspaper reports arose from documents sent to Italy last week by the Senate subcommittee on multinational corporations. [Page 1, Column 4.]

title: John A. Tiester, ExDirector Of State Thruway Authority
description: John A. Fiesler, who retired last July as executive director of the New York State Thruway Authority, died Wednesday in his home in Loudonville, N. Y., a suburb of Albany. His age was 70.

title: Pistons Top Warriors; Playoffs 11
description: OAKLAND, Calif., April 22 (AP)Curtis Rowe and Bob Lanier, on target, combined for 64 points as the Detroit Pistons beat the Golden State Warriors tonight, 123111, in the National Basketball Association playoffs.

title: Books of The Times
description: Anyone who has ever attended one (or even two) of Prof. Peter Schickele's mockconcerts, An Evening With P.D.Q. Bach, will understand at once when I say giggled throughout The Definitive Biography of P.D.Q. Bach (18071742)? But how can I explain to outsiders the humor so delicate, the mirth evanescent, the je no oafs quoi of this handsome and hilarious book? it simply won't do to describe it objectively, as a parody of biography, scholarship, musicology, language, the 18th century, the 19th century, the Baroque, Germany and Germans, or as a series of gags inspired by Edward Lear, James Joyce, Groucho Marx and Gerald Gardner (the man who used to supply the only genuinely funny captions to contemporary, news photographs)  because such objectivity leaves everything out.

title: Mountain Fuel Dissidents Ask Aid
description: The battle for control of the Mountain Fuel Supply Company announced by dissidents last week is unlikely to foster complacency in the executive suites of wellmanaged companies.

title: Ford Asks Senate Select Panel Not to Reveal Intelligence Costs
description: WASHINGTON. April 22President Ford has sent a letter to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence urging the committee, on the ground of national security, not to publish the aggregate cost of the United States intelligence system in its final report, which is expected to be made public next week.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Despite its long benign neglect of black Africa and its apparent bias in favor of whiteruled minority regimes in southern Africa, the United, States still possesses ample potential for exercising crucial influence in this important region and for regaining the diplomatic initiative needed to defuse the ticking time bomb of possible race war in southern Africa.

title: BOMB INJURES 21 Al BOSTON COURT
description: BOSTON, April 22This tense and racially divided city was rocked again today when a bomb exploded at the county courthouse, injuring 21 persons, seven of them seriously.

title: KISSINGER LEAVING ON AFRICAN TOUR
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that hel was leaving for Africa tomorrow committed to a policy of promoting black majority rule in Rhodesia and of furthering African political unity and economic development.

title: PANEL FINDS F.B.I USED JOURNALISTS AS ITS INFORMERS
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 The Federal Bureau of Investigation has maintained a network of confidential informers inside major news organizations, universities and charitable foundations, according to documents and other evidence obtained by the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence.

title: A Definitive Henry V on Our Shores
About Real Estate
description: ALLAMUCHY, N.J.From the proper elevation, the Delaware Water Gap is visible to the west from the Allamuchy Hills through a stretch of land called Panther Valley in northwest New Jersey. It is rolling countryside of farm, state parks and private estates north of Hackettstown and just south of Interstate 80.

title: International Paper Stock
description: Holders of International Paper Company's cumulative $4 preferred stock voted yesterday at a special meeting here to authorize issuance of new serial preferred stock ranking on a parity with the outstanding preferred with respect to dividend payments and rights in event of dissolution. Common stockholders had approved at the annual meeting on April 13 an amendment enabling creation of the new class of preferred.

title: LEICHTER SCORES DAYCARE LEASES
description: The city entered into a lease agreement for a Mott Street building for use as a daycare center and elderlycitizen facility at a cost of $98,560 for 20 years and then agreed to a milliondollar rent increase, apparently without detailed cost justification, Senator Franz S. Lelchter charged yesterday.

title: Why the Fight for Deplorable Fordham Hospital
description: For years State Health Department inspectors have found conditions less than adequate at Fordham Hospital in the Bronx. In 1966 a Health Department report said the situation at the aging municipal hospital was deplorable with intolerable fire hazards, grossly inadequate facilities for anesthesia and improper sterilizing procsedures.

title: Short Interest Decreased on the Big Board and Amex From March 15 to April
JURY EXONERATES 3 POLICE OFFICER
description: Three police officers once assigned to an elite narcotics unit were acquited yesterday in State Supreme Court in the wiretapping, grand larceny and conspiracy in an alleged plot to steal $16,000 from a suspected drug peddler.

title: Caramanlis Initiative
description: The festering troubles between Greece and Turkey are highly perilous for both countries, for stricken Cyprus and for the West's defense posture in the Mediterranean. Recognizing this fact, Greece's Prime Minister Caramanlis has now taken the initiative to ease the situation by proposing a nonaggression pact with Turkey, agreement to settle all differences through peaceful means, and an end to the arms race between the two countries.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 23, 1976 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Commodity Price Index Up 3.1 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 204.8 from 201.7 last week.

title: Barbara Walters Accepts ABC's Offer
description: Barbara Walters yesterday accepted an offer of $1 million a year over the next five years to become a major personality of ABC News and the coanchor, with Harry Reasoner, of The Evening News.

title: Boesman and Lena is at Film Forum
Park Department Plants Tree to Mark a Beginning
description: The Park Department held a treeplanting ceremony yesterday in front of the building at 330 West 48th Street, where a concretecutting saw was presented to the department to help what the department called its first inhouse treeplanting program. The saw was used to cut through the pavement.

title: Dance: Lynn Seymour Stars as Royal Ballet Juliet
description: Mention the name Lynn Seymour to any balletgoer and the automatic response should he, great dramatic ballerina. Certainly, it is easy to see how Miss Seymour earned this reputation when she gives the kind of triumphant performance she offered with David Wall in the Royai Balict.'s Romeo and Juliet on Wednesday at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: BarreraTrained Barrera Triumphs
description: Laz Barrera, the commuting trainer whose plans call for his Bold Forbes and Life's Hope to aim for big purses on the same day in the Kentucky Derby and Illinois Derby respectively, was at Aqueduct yesterday to saddle his unbeaten 3yearold namesake. Barrera the colt exceeded expectations. Made the $3.60for$2 choice by the crowd of 17,923, the son of Raise a Native not only won the $15,000 Indulto, but also won it in unexpectedly fast time.

title: South Africa's Transkei Plan is Stirring Controversy
description: UMTATA, South AfricaThere is an air of urgency to the preparations that are moving ahead speedily for the independence of the Transkei territory, a move that the South: African Government hopes may yet persuade the world that it Is sincere about separate development of black Africans.

title: Iceberg Patrol Carries Out A Hazardous, Tedious Task
description: The squat HC130 aircraft of the United States Coast Guard crossed the 55th parallel over the Labrador Sea, headed north on a course off bleak Labrador, flying low and slow over a sea of ice.

title: Cubs Defeat Expos With Run in 11th
description: CHICAGO, April 22 (UPI)Mike Adams's single with two out in the 11th inning today scored Jerry Morales and gave the Chicago Cubs a 54 victory over the Montreal Expos. The triumph broke a fivegame losing streak.

title: 3 VICE PRESIDENTS APPOINTED AT WNET
description: Stuart F. Sucherman, a program officer at the Ford Foundation, has been named to the new position of vice president and director of planning for WNET/Channel 13, it was announced yesterday.

title: Kodak and Polaroid: Color Systems Differ
description: Engineers and researchers at the Eastman Kodak Company, struggling to develop a competitive camera system, had to overcome a wall of patents around the Polaroid Corporation's system for developing instant color prints outside the camera. Led by Dr. Albert Sieg, Kodak technical people in several countries tested their ingenuity for seven years to find a system that did not infringe on Polaroid's, did not appear to ape Polaroid's technologically elaborate style, and which fitted Kodak's practice of marketing solid, safefeeling, reliable and exhaustively tested cameras.

title: Futures in Potatoes Continue to Decline; Grains Are Steady
description: The slide in potato futures prices continued yesterday, with the May contract closing at 9.86 cents a pound, down from 10.12. That brings the drop to 2.09 cents since the close of Trading April 15. Commodity futures markets were closed on Good Friday, April 16.

title: Music: Xenakis Stars
description: Despite the presence of Georges Aperghis and Theodore Antoniou on the Brooklyn Philharmonia's Meet the Moderns program Wednesday night at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, it was clearly Iannis Xenakis who dominated the affair.

title: MISS DEARIE SINGS WITH OSCAR BROWN
description: Although both Oscar Brown Jr. and Blossom Dearie have been close to jazz throughout their careers, they have built performing styles that use jazz as a coloration rather than a foundationMr. Brown as a witty, rhythmic, outgoing, souloriented commentator, Miss Dearie with stylish wit and sophisticated reserve. They were together Wednesday evening in a Voices of Jazz program presented 4:3/ Jack Kleinsinger at New York University's Loeb Auditorium.

title: PORT UNIT TO GIVE MASSTRANSIT AID
description: Governor Carey and Governor Byrne of New Jersey announced yesterday that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey would commit $240 million to longdelayed masstransit projects in both states.

title: About New York
description: When the Colonials face the Redcoats in another of those Bicentennial mock battles on Governor's Island on Sunday, don't bet against the Redcoats.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: The New York Times/William E. Sauro

title: How Election Poll Was Conducted
description: The New York Times/CBS News survey is based on telephone interviews conducted from April 10 to April 15 with 1.464 adult men and women across the continental United States.

title: STOCKS PULL BACK ON PROFIT TAKING
description: The stock market pulled back yesterday on normal profit taking after having climbed to a 39month high in the previous session.

title: Excerpts From Bergman Letter on Quitting Sweden
description: On Friday, April 2, my legal representative, Rolf Magrell, was invited to a meeting at the Income Tax Bureau with Bengt Kjallen, an assessor, and Hins. Svensson, head of the department Following are excerpts from the text of a letter to the Stockholm newspaper Expressen by Ingmar Bergman, the film director, on his decision to leave. Sweden, as translated by The New York Times.

title: Japan's Opposition Agrees to Call Off Parliament Boycott
description: TOKYO, April 22A 43day boycott of Parliament by opposition political parties angered over the Government's handling of the Lockheed bribery, scandal ended today with the resumption of normal proceedinza.

title: Albany Ends Ten $50,000 Chairs at Colleges in State
description: All 10 academic chairs enTowed by the state since 1964 o honor the names of Albert Einstein and Albert Schweitzer will end in June as a result of budget cuts by the State Legislature.

title: Ford Promises Usery To Keep Hint in Cabinet
description: MILLEDGEVILLE, Ga., April 22 (UPI)  President Ford told Labor Secretary W.J. Usery Jr. over an amplified telephone at a banquet yesterday, You'll be Secretary of Labor as long as I am President.

title: M. A. C. TO OFFER 2D BOND EXCHANGE
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation announced yesterday that it intended to make a second offer to exchange its bonds for up to $500 million of outstanding New York City notes.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: Foster parents have always had to be ready for some hardship. You never could know how had a time that child had experienced before he got to you and how difficult to live with he might he as a result.

title: Ugly Business
description: In a private meeting with a group of Georgia Republicans last week, Vice President Rockefeller reportedly made derogatory comments about certain members of Senator Henry M. Jackson's staff, imputing to them past or present Communist associations.

title: City College May Cut Layne, Others
description: Because of a proposed City College retrenchment that calls for trimming the athletic budget by $270,000 and the coaching staff by 30 percent, the jobs of the athletic director, his assistant, live varsity coaches and one junior varsity coach are in dancer.

Bach, will understand at once when I say I giggled throughout The Definitive Biography of P.D.Q. Bach (18071742)? But how can I explain to outsiders the humor so delicate, the mirth evanescent, the je ne sais quoi of this handsome and hilarious book? it simply won't do to describe.

title: BOMB INJURES 21 AT BOSTON COURT
description: BOSTON, April 22This tense and racially divided city was rocked again today when a bomb exploded at the county courthouse, injuring 21 persons, seven of them seriously.

title: U.S. Climber Killed in Nepal
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, April 22 (Reuters)An American mountain climber has fallen to his death in Nepal, according to reports reaching here. Doran Lyons, 23, from Hingham, Mass., was climbing the 19,300foot Khumhila Peak in the Everest region last Thursday when he lost his footing.

description: Incoming

title: The Will To Resist
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Before he left on a twoweek mission to Africa, Secretary of State Kissinger issued another strong warning to the Soviet Union. This is becoming a regular affair, but it seems to be having more effect on the Presidential campaign than on the Soviets.

title: Alan Howard the Man Who Would Be King Henry
description: Alan Howard comes from acting families on both sides. But neither his father nor his mother wanted him to be an actor, and he never thought much about it until he was 11 or 12 years old and met a girl named Bella MacNeil.

title: General Mills Outlays Set
description: General Mills Inc. announced yesterday that it planned to invest about $125 million in the, 1977 fiscal year for fixed assets, most of which will be to expand its Red Lobster Inn seafood restaurant chain. The company added that the funds would be henerated internally.

title: UDALL STEPS UP TVRADIO EFFORT
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 22Representative Morris K. Udall has contracted for $80,000 worth of television and radio advertising in the closing days of the Pennsylvania Presidential primary election campaign, and may be able to increase the figure to more than $100,000, sources in the Udall campaign organization said today.

title: POUND ENDS DAY Al A RECORD LOW
description: LONDON, April 22  The $pound touched $1.80 today, 5 cents under its level Tuesday. before recovering to close at 51.8280. The pound now costs 20 cents less than it did in January and nearly 60 cents less than it did a year ago.

title: Memorial Services
description: MORRISETTEWilliam L. A Memorial Service will be held at St. Mark's Church, New Canaan, Connecticut on Saturday; April 24 at 4 P.M. Mr. Morrisetie passed away on January 14 in Coral Gables, Florida.

title: BOCKEFELLER GIVES A REPORT ON TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Vice President Rockefeller, recently returned from a sevenration, fourcontinent official ourney, says that America's friends are gravely concerned about the reliability and consistency of United States foreign policy.

title: Giscard Attacks Left Opposition Leaders
description: PARIS, April 22  President Valery Giscard d'Estaing attacked the French Communists and Socialists today for the first time since the leftist opposition parties began to show increasing political strength last month.

title: Meter Maid Unfazed By NJ 12 Gov. License
description: A unimpressed meter maid ticketed the limousine of Governor Byrne of New Jersey as he was having a conference with Governor Carey in the latter's office at 1350 Avenue of the Americas yesterday.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: Let Our Children Go, by Ted Patrick with Tom Dulack (Dutton, $8.95). Mr. Patrick's crusade against cults.

title: ALCOA ALSO LIFTS ALUMINUM PRICES
description: The Aluminum Company of America, the world's largest aluminwn producer, decided yesterday to go along with thel Reynolds Metals Company in raising prices on primary aluminum and mill products. The National Aluminum Corporat ion, a subsidiary of the National Steel Corporation, took similar action and other major producers, including Alcan Aluminium Ltd., indicated they were still studyfng their pricing.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, April 22Industries seeking to delay enforcement of stronger cleanair laws are taking unjustifiable chances with the people's health, state environmentalist groups said today.

title: Baer Announces He Will Seek:, Nomination to Helstoski's Seat
description: Assemblyman Byron M. Baer of Englewood announced last night that he had decided to seek the Democratic nomination for the Ninth Congressional District seat held by Representative Henry Helstoski. Mr. Helstoski, fellow Democrat, has been under investigation on charges that he took in an immigrant shakedown scheme.

title: 2 Protests Rejected in Yanks Favor
description: American League President Lee MacPhail rejected yesyesterday two protests against the New York Yankees MacPhail refused to uphold the protest of the Milwaukee Brewers, who had an apparent gamewinning grand slam against the Yankees by Don Money called hack when Umpire Jim McKean ruled he had called time a moment before the pitch was delivered. MacPhail also turned down a protest by Chicago over the demand by the Yankees that White Sox pitchers not be allowed to wear white sleeves on their sweatshirts.

title: U.N. BIDS INDONESIA LEAVE EAST TIMOR
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 22The Security Council called on Indonesia today to withdraw its forces without further delay from eastern Timor, a remote scrap of the defunct Portuguese colonial empire that it has been controlling since early December.

title: Campaign for Brooke Candidacy For Vice President to Be Started
description: A national campaign to promote Senator Edward W. Brooke of Massachusetts as the Republican VicePresidential nominee will be initiated in Pittsburgh tonight.

title: While Udall Aide Seeks Fishing Hole, Carter's Looks for a Place in the Sun
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., April 22The sun had not quite cleared the Allegheny Mountains this morning when Gary T. Mitchell awoke with one thought on his minda fishing spot for Morris K. Udall.

title: Conviction in Gang Slaying
description: MERCER, Pa., April 22 (UPI) A motorcycle gang member, Clary Roman of Perth Amboy, N.J., was convicted today of seconddegree murder in the 1973 death of Mark A. Chancellor. Mr. Chancellor was murdered in October 1973 while being Initiated into the Breed Motorcycle gang. His body was food cm a farm in Shenango To.

title: Advertising
description: McGrawHill, the country's largest publisher of trade publications, is about to get its foot in the door of China. McGrawHill's International Management magazine, which is published in English, Spanish, Arabic and Farsi.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Thursday. London: Morning fixing $127.40, UP $0.15; afternoon fixing $127,30, UP $0.05.

title: Cairo Pact Caps Successes for Peking
description: HONG KONG, April 22The signing of a military protocol yesterday between China and Egypt caps an unusual series of recent successes for Peking in its diplomatic rivalry with the Soviet Union.

title: Barbara Walters Accepts ABC's Offer
description: Barbara Walters yesterday accepted an offer of $1 million a year over the next five years to become a major personality of ABC News and the coanchor, with Harry Reasoner, of The Evening News.

title: People and Business
description: Richard D. Abelson has resigned as chairman and chief executive officer of the Maremont Corporation, a leading maker of automotive parts.

title: Albany Ends Funds For $50,000 Chairs At Colleges in State
description: All 10 academic chairs endowed by the state since 1964 to honor the names of Albert Einstein and Albert Schweitzer will end in June as a result of budget cuts by the State Legislature.

title: 2 Lead Democrats
description: Something approaching a consensus has been emerging among Democratic Party leaders over the last month, to the effect that only Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota and former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia retain signifiicant chances of winning the ,party's Presidential nomination.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates Thursday.

title: Carey Forms Unit to Spur Economy of New York City
description: A Council for the Economy of New York that will pull together and direct all the scattered public and private efforts to rebuild the economic strength of the city and the state was formed by Governor Carey yesterday with himself as chairman.

title: Edward C. Delafield, 98, Dead; Donated Estate to Columbia U.
description: Edward C. Dalafield, a retired banker, horticultural enthusiast and a member of one of New York's oldest families died Wednesday at his home in Sarasota, Fla. He was 98 years old.

title: PANEL FINDS F.B.I. USED JOURNALISTS AS ITS INFORMERS
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The Federal Bureau of Investigation has maintained a network of confidential informers inside major news organizations, universities and charitable foundations, according to documents and other evidence obtained by the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence.

title: Penalty for Harder Try
description: There is a disconcerting contradiction between the legitimate aims of school decentralization and Chancellor Irving Anker's action to force Community School. District 3 to conform to the citywide policy of a reduced school week. In this controversy the Board of Education seems to us to be in the wrong.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Fderal Appeals Court in Philadelphia for the second time has upheld th campaign fundraising conviction Nelson Gross, former New Jersey State Republican chairman. Mr. Gross, 44, of Saddle River, was sentenced in June 1974 to two years in prison and fined $10,000 in Federal court in Newark.

title: Red Smith
description: Jerry Perenchio, who is trying to promote a fight between Joe Frazier and George Foreman, said yesterday he would select a site this weekend and if it isn't in New York, I'm going to hold a press conference and explain why. ['II let it all hang out. His aggressive tone, not to say threatening, implied that if he told all, somebody would he embarrassedmaybe the city officials, proprietors of a $110 million facility, who assured me the facility would available, but more likely George Steinbrenner and his gardener, who will not approve our going in there, although there have been something like 37 fights in Yankee Stadium. Beyond saying that he had half a dozen sites in mind, Perenchio refused to discuss other details, like the report that he and his financial angel, Caesar's World, have guaranteed to pay Frazier his SI million purse even if the promotion falls through.

title: Disavowal by Rockefeller Fails to Mollify Jackson
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Vice President Rockefeller denied today making any charges that Communists had, infiltrated the staff of Senator Henry M. Jackson, a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Reagan and Udall Plan Talks on TV Next Week
description: Ronald Reagan and Repred sentative Morris K. Udall, Democat of Arizona, will deliver fiveminute paid political talks over the CBS television network next week in their search for the Republican and Democratic Presidential nominations.

title: TALKS CONTINUE IN RUBBER STRIKE
description: CLEVELAND, April 22Negotiators for the United Rubber Workers and the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company met for three hours today in an effort to end the nationwide rubber strike, but no progress was reported on any of the major issues.

title: Leafs Tie Series
description: TORONTO, April 22 (AP) Darryl Sittler, a center who had scored six goals in a regularseason game, scored five tonight to tie National Hockey league playoff record and lead the Toronto Maple Leafs to an 85 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Playoff Results
description: N.B.A. Playoffs

title: ARMY ADMONISHES 3 ON ROCKWELL VISITS
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (AP) The Army issued letters of admonition today to three officers, including a retired lieutenant general, for going hunting at a Chesapeake Bay lodge used by the Rockwell International Corporation, a major defense contractor.

title: SOLIAH TESTIFIES ON MISS HEARST
description: SACRAMENTO, April 22Steven Soliah says that Patricia Hearst, while an underground fugitive in Sacramento 18 months ago, told him that she hated her parents, that she felt abandoned by them and did, not want to go back.

title: TWO TRUCKERS TAKE BANKRUPTCY STEP
description: Eastern Freight Ways. Inc., and Associated Transport, in which it holds a 46 percent stock interest, yesterday filed for reorganization under Chap ter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: Many in Audit by H.E.W. Are in Wrong Job Grades
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The Department of Health, Education and Welfare said today that it had found, in a review of upperechelon civil servicei jobs, that one in four employees it had examined in the, department here and half those examined in 10 regional offices were not doing work sophisticated enough to merit their job gerades.

title: Newell Jenkins Gives Americana Program
description: In his final concert of the season Wednesday night in Alice Tully Hall, Newell Jenkins introduced one of the several works he has commissioned for his Clarion Concerts Orchestra in honor of the Bicentennial. This was Humphrey Searle's Contemplations for MezzoSoprano and Orchestra. IL is a setting of a long poem by Anne Bradstreet, one of America's earliest poets, who settled in Massachusetts in 1628.

title: Post Wins in 9th
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., April 22Bob DeBonis hit a basesloaded single with none out in the bottom of the ninth inning to drive in two runs and give C.W. Post a 76 victory over Seton Hall in a Metropolitan Intercolllegiate Conference baseball game today.

title: Million Reported Needed
description: GENEVA, April 22A representative of Oxfam, the private British aid agency, said today that one million dollars was required to meet the immediate needs of 120,000 Ethiopian refugees in the Sudan if disaster is to be avoided.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Loris Azzaro has some novel ideas about fashion, For a fashion designer, that is.

title: EXITALIAN CHIEF LINKED TO BRIBES FROM LOCKHEED
description: ROME, April 22Italian newspapers, citing United States Senate documents, asserted today that a former prime minister was involved in the scandal over bribes by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation. The identity of the prime minister was not specified, however.

title: BIG DROP SHOWN IN CREDIT PRICES
description: Prices dropped sharply in the credit markets late yesterday afternoon in a pronounced reaction to the news that the nation's money supply had expanded sharply. Treasury bill rates rose as much as 20 basis points, a big oneday move, and corporate bond prices fell as much as a point or more. It was the most sweeping drop in the credit markets since early March.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Italian newspapers, citing United States documents, asserted yesterday that an unidentified former Prime Minister was involved in the scandal over bribes by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation. They named as prime suspects Giovanni Leone, now Italy's President; Aldo Moro, who is also Prime Minister now, and Mariano Rumor, now Foreign Minister. Each man issued strong denial of the allegations. The Christian Democratic Party, in which the three men are leading figures, was stunned. The newspaper reports arose from documents sent to Italy last week by the Senate subcommittee on multinational corporations. [Page 1, Column 4.]

title: Bronx Democrat Indicted In Inquiry on Cunningham
description: A Bronx district leader was indicted yesterday on charges of destroying records a special grand jury had subpoenaed to determine whether he and Patrick J. Cunningham, the Democratic state chairman and Bronx County leader, accepted a bribe from a judge for his seat on the criminal court bench.

title: McGlothen Suspended
description: ST. LOUIS, April 22 (AP)Lynn McGlothen, the pitcher who was ejected for his part in a beanball battle Tuesday night against the New York Mets, has been suspended for five days and fined $300 by the National League, the St. Louis Cardinals said today. The action by Chub Feeney, the league president, came 24 hours after New York filed an official protest against the 26yearold McGlothen, who hit two Mets batters in the game.

title: Volkswagen Said to Plan Assembly Plant in U.S.
description: BONN, April 22After years of financial crisis and bitter internal debate, the supervisory board of Volkswagenwerk A.G. was reported today to have decided to invest $250 million in an automobile assembly plant in the United States.

title: Chairman Cunningham
description: There appears to be no legal obstacle to the expected reelection today of Patrick J. Cunningham as chairman of the Democratic State Committee. The moral obstacles will, as usual, be disregarded.

title: Sephardic Jews Temple on L.I. To Mark Its Own Coming of Age
description: On May 8 a building in Cedarhurst, L.I., will have a Bar Mitzvah' a ceremony that will be more significant than a simple recognition of its 13 years.

title: Republic Steel in Accord On Ohio Air Quality Rules
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, April 22 Ohio,. April 22 AP)The Republic Steel Corporation has agreed to make million in improvements at four Ohio plants to comply at air quality regulations, the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency said today.

title: Suffolk Studying Possible Link Of Contributions and Sewer Job
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., April 22Law enforcement authorities here are investigating allegations that the engineering concern in charge of the Southwest Sewer District made large political contributions and provided jobs for friends and relatives of Suffolk politicians in order to obtain and keep the contract for the $700 million project.

title: Energy Device Stirs Questions
description: LOS ANGELES, April 22A controversial machine, said by its developers to extract cheap energy from water, has triggered an unusual scientific analysis by the Securities and Exchange Commission and has evoked the cautious patronage of Senator Barry M. Goldwater, Re. publican of Arizona.

title: Doctors Strike in England
description: LONDON. April 22 (Reuters) Groups of doctors began a 48hour strike at hospitals In central England today to protest the Government's plane to curtail private medical treatment.

title: Ford Nominee for No. 2 C.I.A. Post
description: Washington, April 22Despite the view of some novelists and movie makers, the fact is that most of the people who work for the Central Intelligence Agency have never fired a poison dart gun, parachuted into the darkness over Albania or plotted the kidnapping of a Chilean general.

title: Statewide Criteria For Public Schools Debated in Jersey
description: TRENTON, April 22 The Senate Education Committee today opened what promises to he a long and emotional debate over establishing statewide minimum education standards.

title: Despite the Success of A Chorus Line, Papp Says He Still Needs Financial Aid
description: Joseph Papp's New York Shakespeare Festival, New York's largest nonprofit institutional theater, is the producer of A Chorus Line, Broadway's biggest commercial success. As a result, when Mr. Papp solicits money for his various noncommercial interests, such as his current $800.000 project to rehabilitate the Delacorte Theater in Central Park, prospective donors ask questionsquestions such as, What are you doing with the millions of dollars you are raking in, and will 4ontinue to rake in, because of Chorus Line'?

title: 2 Cubans Die in Bombing Of Embassy in Portugal
description: LISBON, April 22A powerful bomb shattered the Cuban Embassy here today, killing two Cubans and wounding at least four other persons.

title: Gen. Walters Quits C.I.A.; Bush Wants Own Team
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (UPI)The White House announced today the resignation of Lieut. Gen. Vernon A. Walters as Deputy Director of Central Intelligence. General Walters was a key Watergate witness who testified that he had tried to stop the F.B.I. Watergate investigation on President Nixon's orders.

title: C.A.B. Asked to Impose Stiff Curbs On Operators of Air Charter Tours
description: Complaints by air travelers about the abuses of freewheeling charter tour operators have mounted to the point that the consumer protection arm of the Civil Aeronautics Board petitioned the agency yesterday for tough new controls, including national licensing of tour organizers.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: U.N. Experts Warn of a New Famine in. Ethiopia
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 22On the basis of a new survey of droughtsensitive areas in Ethiopia, United Nations authorities warned today that insect infestation of croplands and uncertain weather could create another general famine emergency.

title: Port Unit Allots Funds for Mass Transit
description: Governor Carey and Governor Byrne of New Jersey announced yesterday that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey would commit $240 million to longdelayed masstransit projects in both states.

title: New York and Washington Lead National Ches League
description: The New York Threats and the Washington Plumbers remained deadlocked for the lead of the National Chess League Wednesday night as both teams won their semifinal matches in the nineteam round robin.

title: Honest Pleasure Wins Blue Grass
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., April 22 Would you believe a sevenhorse race in which the second choice goes to the post at 171?

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: In a state of bepuzzlement as to how to report this week on Le Deauville, a new restaurant at 408 East 64th Street between First and York Avenues, and the Bar Espanol, which has been operating for a year or so at 318 West 23d Street between Eighth and Ninth Avenues, we sort of got to thinking and realized, one thing having led to another, that it has been 650 years now since Dante completed his guide to purgatory and so far as we know it has never been undated.

title: Ingmar Bergman Decides To Move Out of Sweden
description: STOCKHOLM, April 22 Ingmar Bergman, beset by taxi problems, announced today that he could no longer live in Sweden and was leaving the country to continue his film work abroad.

title: ZARB HOPES TO END SOME OIL CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Frank G. Zarb the Federal Energy Administrator, disclosed today that he hoped to suspend by July 1 the price controls on a major category of oil products used widely by business and homesheating and diesel fuel and other similarly refined Petroleum products.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A request to allow normal school hours to continue at seven West Side schools, which have been maintained against orders from School Chancellor Irving Anker for a shorter day in a citywide economy move, has been denied by the Board of Education'. Resistance by Parents and Community School Board 3 to orders to cut the day by 45 minutes had led to numerous sitins and clashes with officials from the central board. Chancellor Anker, West Side political figures and local hoard members held a previously scheduled meeting in search of a compromise.

title: Murder While in Jail
description: WOODSTOCK, Vt., April 22 (UPI)A Superior Court jury has convicted Gerald Max Ryan. 33 years old, of Fletcher, of ??? murder even though he was in jail on an??? at the time of the the 974 slaying. Mr. Ryan was ??? of counseling and inciting his former girl friend, Bonnie Lee King, 20, to shoot ?? Juaire Jr. to death ?? a shotgun. Mr. Ryan's first trial coded in a hung jury.

title: EXITALIAN CHIEF LINKED TO BRIBES FROM LOCKHEED
description: ROME, April 22  Italian Senate citing United States renate documents, asserted today that a former prime minister was involved in the scandal over bribes by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation. The identity of the prime minister was not specified, however.

title: WITNESS AT TRIAL NAMES GOV. MOORE
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., April 22The prosecution's major witness in the extortion trial of Gov. Arch A. Moore Jr. pointed a finger across a crowded courtroom today and identified Mr. Moore as the person to whom he gave envelopes stuffed with cash in an effort to obtain a state bank charter.

title: The Last Of Marple Due in Fall
description: Dodd, Mead & Company has received the manuscript of the late Agatha Christie's last Jane Marple mystery, Sleeping Murder, which it plans to publish this fall. The publisher refuses to confirm that, as in the last Hercule Poirot whodunit, Curtain, the sleuth meets her death, although her demise has been widely rumored.

title: CashIns of Mutual Funds At Record Level in March
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Investors in mutual funds took advantage of rising stock prices in March to cash in a record $676.4 million of fund shares, according to figures released today by the Investment Company Institute, a trade association.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, April 22, 1976 (In bushels, 000 omitted) Wed.

title: Waterless Dye Method
description: A new, compact dyeing system for yarn and textiles, using organic solvent dyes without water, was presented by Martin Processing at its annual meeting. Page 49.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, April 22The United States auto industry is scheduled to build 197,640 cars this week, up 34.9 percent from the 146,559 cars built last week when all plants were down for Good Friday.

title: Polish Sextet Leading Group
description: KATOWICE, Poland, April 22 (UPI)West Germany tied East Germany, 11, today in a Group B match in the final round of the world ice hockey championship. Earlier this evening, Poland and Finland also tied, with 5 points each, to put the host team at the top of the group standing with 18 points. Finland and West Germany are tied in second place with 6 points each and East Germany is trailing with 5. The final matches for Group B are scheduled for Saturday.

title: A. M. WENDELL MALLIET
description: A. M. Wendell Mallet, a journalist and former foreign news editor of The Amsterdam News here, died April 10 in the Beth Abraham Hospital, the Bronx. He was 79 gears old.

title: Transkei Independence Now Urgent for South Africa
description: UMTATA, South Africa There is an air of urgency to the preparations that are moving ahead speedily for the independence of the Transkei territory, a move that the South African Government hopes may yet persuade the world that it is sincere about separate development of black Africans.

title: A Compact New System Dyes Yarn and Cloth Without Water
description: A new, compact dyeing system for yarn, fabric andl carpets, utilizing organic solvent dyes without water, was presented yesterday by Martin, Processing Inc. at its annuall meeting.

title: H. H. H. Underground
description: WASHINGTON, April 22  Maybe Hubert H. Humphrey can win the Democratic Presidential nomination by following his present strategy, but if so it is hard to see how he could unify the Democratic Party and go on to defeat President Fordif he is the Republican nomineein the fall campaign.

title: 7 CANDIDATES URGE COURT TO FREE FUND
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (UPI)All the major Presidential candidates except President Ford asked the, Supreme Court today to order the release of $2.2 million in Federal campaign funds blocked by Congressional bickering over the powers of the Federal Election Commission.

title: MAJOR GAIN SEEN IN CHINAARAB TIES
description: CAIRO, April 22The ChineseEgyptian military protocol signed in Peking yesterday is a direct consequence of Egypt's abrogation a month ago of a friendship treaty with the Soviet Union.

title: JOHAl V. GRAUMAN
description: John V. Grauman, chief of the population trends and tructure section of the United structure Secretariat, died Monday at his home in Tuckahoc, W. Y. He was 57 years old.

title: Opera: Two OneAct Works Fall Flat
description: Two oneact operas new to this city were somewhat less than enthusiastically received last night at the JuilHard American Opera Theater. Both works were composed by men of reputation. But the two composers represented a dated era of music, and the scores gave the impression of having more manner than substance. The best thing about the evening was the singing. Some fine talent appeared in both operas.

title: Pakistan and the Atom
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y.Nuclear energy, uncontrolled and unleashed, can extinguish man and all his works. Hence the heightened concern over nuclear proliferation after the Indian explosion of a nuclear device in 1974.

title: Notes on People
description: In Hartford, Ellen B. Burns of Hamden was sworn in yesterday as Connecticut's first woman Superior Court judge by Gov. Ella T. Grasso, who promoted her from Common Pleas Court. Mrs. Burns was first appointed to the Circuit Court in 1973 by Thomas B. Meskill, then Governor. The new appointment for Mrs. Burns, who is 52 years old, was approved unanimously by the Senate and by a vote of 110 to 6 by the House. Among those attending the ceremony for Mrs. Burns were her husband, Joseph, and her three teenage children.

title: PALME REQUESTS BERGMAN RETURN
description: STOCKHOLM, April 23 (UPI)  Prime Minister Olof Palme, saddened by Ingmar Bergman's decision to leave Sweden because of tax difficulties, appealed today to the film director to come home.

title: KISSINGER ARRIVES IN AFRICA TODAY
description: NAIROBI Kenya, April 23 The major question that African leaders are waiting to ask Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, who begins a tour of Africa here tomorrow night, is just how far he is prepared to go in offering tangible support for African nationalist movements in Rhodesia and SouthWest Africa.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Heavy selling depressed wheat futures prices on the Chicago Board of Trade, as traders reacted to the Government's stocksonhand report issued after the close on Thursday. The report indicated adequate wheat supplies avail. able in farmers hands, at grain elevators and export terminals. Recent rains in winter wheat growing areas and the prospOct of large plantings of summer wheat have influenced prides downwards.

title: 15 Held in Jersey Drug Case
description: NEWARK, April 23 (UPI) Essex County authorities have charged 15 suspects with operating a multimilliondollar suburban heroin ring with connections to organize crime. Richard M. Roberts, assistant Essex County prosecutor, said that the ring had been in operation for it least six months. importing hundreds of thousands of dollars of heroin each week from New York and doing millions of dollars in sales.

title: Daylight Saving Time To Begin Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI)This weekend will be an hour shorter than any other weekend of the year. It's time for the annual change to daylight saving time Sunday morning.

title: Mike Hole Found Dead in His Car
description: Michael Hole, the Englishborn jockey riding at Aqueduct, was found dead Thursday afternoon In the front seat of his automobile in a parking lot at Jones Beach on Long Island.

title: KISSINGERARRIVES IN AFRICA TODAY
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, April 23The major question that African leaders are waiting to ask Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, who begins a tour of Africa here tomorrow night, is just how far he is prepared to go :n offering tangible support for African nationalist moveHints in Rhodesia and SouthWest Africa.

title: Public Advocate Is Seeking Voting Rights for Retarded
description: TRENTON, April 23  The New Jersey Public Advocate has begun a legal drive to obtain full voting rights for as many as possible of the 8,000 inmates of state mental institutions and residents of schools for the retarded.

title: Indians Seek Reservation
description: INDIAN ISLAND, Me., April 23 (UN)  Stanley Neptune, nne of the Indians who took part In an illegal occupation in part of Baxter State Park for nearly a week, says his group wants the state to provide land for a new Indian reservation. We're trying to save our culture, he said as the encampment broke up peacefully yesterday. Not Inn far in the future, there won't he any more Indian people.

title: When Tigers Act Strangely in the Zoo
description: PARISA few weeks ago the Chinese delegation to a UNESCO conference on earthquake risks fascinated an international assemblage of scientists by explaining how the People's Republic mobilizes the masses to note hints of approaching temblors. As a consequence, Peking's representative claimed, destruction and loss of life were demOnstrably limited when disastrous quakes recently shook China.

title: Samuel A. Blank, 65, Dies; A Lawyer in Philadelphia
description: Samuel A. Blank, who retired in 1972 as a senior partner in the Philadelphia law firm of Blank, Rome, Klaus & Comisky, died Wednesday at his home, 7900 Old York Road, Elkins Park, Pa. He was 65 years old.

title: TWO BEHAVIORISTS WIN KITTAY PRIZE
description: Two scientists whose pioneering research has helped explain how the mind and body respond to and act on their environment were named yesterday as winners of the annual $25,000 International Kittay Award.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A charge of criminally negligent homicide has been dismissed against Roy Tate, 42 years old, who was the engineer of a Long Island Rail Road train that crashed into a freight train in March 1973. A woman died of a heart attack in the crash and 27 persons were injured. Acting Justice Paul D'Amaro said in State Supreme Court in Riverhead, LI., that the prosecution, during a 15day trial, had not proved that Mr. Tate had been negligent,

title: Mansfield Calls on Rockefeller To Clarify Remarks on Jackson
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 Mike Mansfield, the Senate Democratic leader, said today that Vice President Rockefeller should verity or refute suggestions attributed to Mr. Rockefeller that Communists had penetrated Congressional staffs.

title: Students Free 14 Trustees Held At a College for Black Women
description: ATLANTA, April 23 (AP) Spelman College students released 14 college trustees they had locked in a room for 26 hours after the trustees agreed today to discuss student demands for a black woman president.

title: Volvo, Too, Will Build Cars in America
description: DETROIT, April 23 While Volkswagen announced plans today to build an assembly plant in the United State to bolster its share of the American market, Volvo was quietly pushing ahead with constructimi of a plant at Chesapeake, Va.. near Norfolk.

title: Just Plain Richard Joins the Jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., April 23 For the New York introduction of Joe Namath as a rookie, Sonny Werblin, then the Jets entrepreneur, tossed a cocktail party at Toots Shors saloon. Between sips of scotch, the $427,000 quarterback limped on a left knee about to be sliced in surgery. That prompted a skeptic to ask, What happens to all the money, Joe, if you don't make it? Joe Namath quietly replied, I'll make it. But today Richard Todd, another rookie quarterback from Alabama, was introduced as only one of 63 players attending the Jets orientation weekend. Richard Todd preferred it that way. Richard Todd understands that a comparisons with Joe Namath are inevitable. Except for his blond hair and unscarred knees, he resembles Joe Namath; he even, somebody joked, has a Beaver Falls accent. Actually it's a natural Alabama accent. That's where Richard Todd grew up watching Joe Namath on TV and later worked out with him on the Tuscaloosa campus. Now he has hired Joe Namath's agent, Jimmy Walsh, to negotiate his contract. And he even has a possible knee problem.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The New York Times/April 24, 1976

title: 2 Noted Spaniards Return From Exile
description: MADRID, April 23  Two of Spain's most distinguished figures from the past have returned from long exile.

title: PENDING STRIKE HELD PROVOKED
description: The State Health Commissioner, Dr. Robert P. Whalen, assailed the Metropolitan Nursing Home Association yesterday, charging that the association had purposely invited strike action against its member facilities to put pressure on the state to increase Medicaid rates.

title: Dance: Lar Lubovitch
description: Of all the young hopefuls around the dance world, Lar Lubovitch has just got to be the most puzzling. He has ideas in abundance, but somehow they are never ideas that agglomerate into that mysterious thing, an artistic statement. You are never quite sure where Mr. Lubovitch isand if that were his particular purpose, and artists do occasionally use ambiguity as a form of personality, that would probably be fine. Yet his lack of positioning his absence of attitude, is beginning to look dangerously like vacuity.

title: Transit Authority Board Approves T.W.U. Pact
description: The board of the New York City Transit Authority last night approved the contract negotiated just before dawn on April 1 with the Transport Workers Union and said that the $57 million in costofliving raises negotiated would be financed by increased productivity.

title: DiLorenzo Testifies in His Own Defense
description: Ross DiLorenzo, a retired Brooklyn Civil. Court judge, took the stand in his own defense yesterday in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn, where he is on trral on perjury charges in an indictment obtained by Maurice H. Nadjari, the state's special anticorruption prosecutor.

title: Judge Doing Good Deeds, Assaulted
description: A State Supreme Court justice who tried to do two good deeds late Thursday night was rewarded for the second with abuse and a beating in Ozone Park, Queens.

title: REVERE RAISING ALUMINUM PRICES
description: Price increases spread further yesterday across the aluminum industry. Revere Copper and Brass Inc., the aluminum division of the Anaconda Company and the Howmet Aluminum Corporation followed Thursday's moves by the nation's largest aluminum producer. the Aluminum Company of America. Both Revere and Anaconda raised their prices for primary aluminum by 3 cents to 44 cents a pound, effective June 1, and for extrusion billet by 3.8 cents a pound. These are Iidentical with Alcoa's prices as are the effective dates for the revised higher prices. The Reynolds Metals Company, which instituted the higher prices, made its effective dates on orders as of Wednesday and on shipments of May 17.

title: Corporate Editor Is Named For Time Inc. Publications
description: The appointment of Ralph Graves, associate publisher of Time magazine, as corporate editor for all Time Inc. publications was announced yesterday by Medley Donovan, editorinchief of Time Inc.

title: Sam Pope Brewer Service
description: A memorial service for Sam Pope Brewer, foreign correspondent of The New York Times for many years until his retirement in 1972, will be held Thursday at 11 A.M. at the First Presbyterian Church, Fifth Avenue at 11th Street. Mr. Brewer died Wednesday at the age of 66.

title: Violent Crimes Drop 0 .4%, Latest Police Data Indicate
Beirut Violence Goes On; Envoy Seeing Kissinger
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 23 L. Dean Brown, the special American envoy to Lebanon, flew to London today to meet with Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger as Lebanon itself stumbled through the fourth day of its latest ceasefire.

title: In Prise of Frank Sullivan (Chuckle)
description: SLINGERLANDS, N.Y. Kindly spend the enclosed on some fripperies, and oblige.

title: Koosman Bows to Cosgrove of Astros by 31
description: HOUSTON, April 23 Despite an eightgame hitting streak, Cesar Cedeno was mad at himself. With the score tied, 11, in the seventh inning of tonight's game with the New York Mets, the star centerfielder of the Houston Astros had twice failed to bunt a teammate to second base.

title: Art: French Neoclassicism Without the Arguments
description: French painting between David and Delacroix has been one of the hottest things in art history since the beginning of the present decade. Revisionism is rampant in respect of a period that was once thought to be characterized above all by painting which, though undeniably learned, was glacial, overcalculated and underfelt.

title: Jersey Forest Fires Create Emergency; Woods Are Closed
description: TRENTON, April 23 Governor Byrne late today declared a forestfire state of emergency in New Jersey and ordered much of the forest land and adjacent fields in the southern and central parts of the state closed to the public.

title: House on the Block Opens Doors
description: WILTON, Conn., April 23 Shortly before the visitors arrived, a seou4ity man carefully removed the gold hooks and gold scalloped soap dishes from the bathrooms and cupboards.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON. April 23 The flu vaccination program that began Wednesday with ceremonial, but real, shots in the arm for two ranking, Federal health officials will be larger and more intensive than any other in the nation's history.

title: Thousands Rally in Saigon In Election Demonstration
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 23 (Agence FrancePresse)  Thousands marched through the South Vietnamese capital today in a mass rally before the general elections Sunday.

title: Physicians on Coast Vote To End Strike at Hospitals
description: LOS ANGELES, April 23 (UPI) Intern and resident physicians at three county hospitals voted overwhelmingly today to end their threeday strike and return to work while contract negotiations continue.

title: THOUSANDS MARCH IN BOSTON RALLY AGAINST VIOLENCE
description: BOSTON, April 23 Tens of thousands of people marched in the sunshine through the center of Boston today in a Procession Against Violencd that sought to ease the city's racial tensions.

title: Budget Cuts Curbing Consumer Agency
description: The New York City Department of Consumer Affairs, struggling to stay within a reduced budget;has curtailed major parts of its law enforcement operations and is depending on consumer complaints rather than its own initiatives for information about violators of consumerprotection laws.

title: House on the Block Opens Doors
description: WILTON, Conn., April 23 Shortly before the visitors arrived, a security man carefully removed the gold hooks and gold scalloped soap dishes from the bathrooms and cupboards.

title: O'Dwyer Formally Enters Race For Nomination for U.S. Senate
description: Describing himself as the most likely Democrat to bring unity and enthusiasm to the diverse elements of the party, Paul O'Dwyer plunged yesterday into the crowded race for United States Senator from New York.

title: Giants Rookies No Surprise to Coach
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., April 23 What Bill Arnsparger probably liked most about the 31 free agents and draft.,Ohoices who showed up at the New York Giants car* for the first time today was the fact that there were no surprises.

title: Books of The Times
description: Nearly half the cities in Latin America have neither piped water nor sewage systems; in Africa and Asia the proportion is even higher. In many of the world's cities, shantytown squatters represent onethird to onehalf of the population. Eighty percent of the eight million people in Calcutta live on the basis of one room per family.

title: John Graham Offers a Sonata For Violin in His Viola Recital
description: Most viola players begin on the violin and keep up their proficiency on the violin in private. This season John Graham has added some violin pieces to his programs, and Thursday's recital at Alice Tully Hall was the first time he had done so in New York.

title: U.S. Convicts Reputed Leader Of Crime Group in Shakedown
description: The reputed head of the Joseph Bonanno crime group, Philip Rastelli, and two associates were found guilty yesterday of Federal charges of extortion in a protection racket involving mobile lunch wagons.

title: Work Relief Employment Project Ends As a Casualty of City's Fiscal Crisis
description: Jose Lopez spent three years in the artillery in Vietnam and also earned his high school equivalency diploma, hoping I could come out and do something with it, he recalled the other day.

title: RIGHTWARD TREND SEEN IN PORTUGAL
description: LISBON, April 23 The campaign for Portugal's first free Parliament elections in half a century ended tonight, with the armed forces placed on full alert in case of violence during the voting Sunday and in the immediate postelection period.

title: ISSACHAR HAIMOVIC
description: Issacher Haimovic managing director of American Israeli Mi!is Ltd., died of a heart attack yesterday at his home in Tel Aviv. He was 57 years old.

title: Copter Carrying Oil Crew Crashes; No Survivors Seen
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 23 (AP)  A helicopter flying workers to an offshore drilling rig went down in the Gulf of Mexico today with 12 persons aboard. Four bodies were picked up, and there was no indication of survivors, officials said.

title: Man Gets Two Life Terms
description: SEATTLE, April 23 (UPI) Edward A. Mead, 34, has been sentenced in King County Superior Court to two consecutive life terms for shooting at policemen in the attempted robbery of a bank in Tukwila last January. The robbery was attempted by a group that called itself the George Jackson Brigade.

title: Prohibition of Love
description: The case of the four young sisters, ranging in age from 9 to 13, who were forced by court order to leave the home of their foster parents of more than five years, is a shocking reminder of the inhumane and irrational treatment of foster children under New York State law.

title: Mapping the Capitalist Road. A Peking Political Glossary
description: HONG KONG, April 22As part of a nationwide effort to explain to the Chinese people why Teng Hsiaoping, their former senior Deputy Prime Minister, was suddenly stripped of his official posts earlier this month, the official daily, Jenmin Jih Pao, said in an editorial this week that he is the archunrepentant capitalistroader in the party and the behindthescenes promoter of the right deviationist wind to reverse correct verdicts.

title: Barbara Walters, NBC to Meet on Time of Departure
description: Barbera Walters said yesterday that she would meet Monday with Richard Wald, president. of NBC News, to discuss the timing of her departure fromihe network following her acceptance of a milliondollar contract from ABC. Miss Walters's current contract expires in September, but there has been speculation that she may leave NBC within the next few weeks. She says, I'll stay as long as they want me to.

title: Marathon Extending Offer On Pan Ocean Till Monday
description: Marathon Energy, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Marathon Oil Company, said yesterday it was extending its tender offer for Pan Ocean Oil Corporation common stock until I P.M. New York time next Monday,

title: SlushFund Inquiry Debated
description: An Investigation into illegal corporate slush funds was debated yesterday by an overflow crowed of more than 300 corporate tax specialists.

title: Progress Is Sinking French Fishermen
description: HONFLEUR, FranceEvery morning about 100 obstinate men still sail out of this calm old port in woodenhulled boats trying to make a living pulling scallops, whiting, shrimp and sole out of the waters of the Seine Estuary and the English Channel beyond.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia is the top choice of New Jersey Democrats among the announced candidates for the party's Presidential nomination, according to the latest poll by the Eagleton Institute of Politics. However, the poll found that Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota would be the overwhelming first choice of state Democrats if he entered the campaign, Mr. Carter was the first choice of 33 percent of those Democrats surveyed, followed by Governor George C. Wallac,, of Alabama with 17 percent and Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington with 15 percent. Sixtyone percent of New Jersey Democrats said Senator Humphrey would he their top choice if he declared his candidacy.

title: Penney Reported Studying Payoffs To Its Executives
description: The J. C. Penney Company, the nation's secondlargest retail chain, is conducting an investigation of alleged payoffs and mishandling of internal funds involving a number of its midmanagement executives, it was reliably reported yesterday.

title: PARE REQUESTS BERGMANRETURN
description: STOCKHOLM, April 23 (UPI)  Prime Minister Olof Palme, saddened by Ingmar Bergman's decision to leave Sweden because of tax difficulties, appealed today to the film director to come home.

title: Antiques: Small World
description: WESTPORT, ConnEnthusiasts of miniatures, those compulsive collectors of Lilliputian antiques and the doll houses to frame them, have had an excellent opportunity to exercise their eagleeyed perception here this week at the SouthportWestport Antiques Show.

title: Zeckendorf Negotiating to Buy the McAlpin
description: William Zeckendorf Jr., the real estate developer, is negotiating on behalf of a group of investors to buy the McAlpin Hotel on Herald Square for conversion to rental apartments.

title: Two Noted Spaniards Are Home From Exile
description: MADRID, April 23  Two of Spain's most distinguished figures from the past have returned from long exile.

title: Big Grain BuildUp Seen In Tentative U.S. View
UNIT TO RECONSIDER INTELLIGENCE MOVE
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI) The Senate Select Com mittee on Intelligence said today that, as a result of a lastminute appeal by President Ford, it would reconsider its decision to publish the Intelligence community's multibilliondollar budget.

title: Honest Pleasure: A Few Questions
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., April 23  Did Honest Pleasure run like a tired. horse in yesterday's Blue Grass Stakes? Or was he just kidding around?

title: STUDENTS IN PARIS STAGE NEW PROTEST
description: PARIS, April 23Thousands of students protesting Government changes in the educational system marched through the streets of Paris again today.

title: AIR FORCE CENSURES 10 FOR LODGE VISITS
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (Reuters) The Air Force today admonished 10 officers and civilian employees for accepting hospitality from Nortkirop and Rockwell International, two Imajor defense contractors.

title: RCA and Corning In Polish TV Deal,
description: The RCA Corporation and the Corning Glass Works announced yesterday the signing of contracts with Poland for construction of an integrated facility costing some $121 million to produce color television picture tubes.

title: Memo Says F.B.I Sought Cambodia Article's Source
description: WASHINGTON, April 23J. Edgar Hoover, the late Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, ordered the bureau in 1969 to use its confidential informants within news organizations to determine the source of an article in The New York Times reporting secret American bombing raids on Cambodia, according In a memorandum from Mr. Hoover tu his top associates.

title: Rep. Daniels Will Retire; Hudson Picks Successor
description: JERSEY CITY, April 23 Representative Dominick V. Daniels, Democrat of Hudson County, announced today that he would not seek a 10th term In Congress because my personal and family responsibilities, at this time in my life, must dictate the course of my future.

title: Women Social Workers Decry Diminished Power in Settlement Houses
description: It was at the end of the last century that women like Jane Addams, Ellen Gates Starr, Jane Robbins and Jean Fine ventured into the desperate neighborhoods of the nation's large cities, attempting to improve the lives of their residents through charitable work and the establishment of public homes or settlement houses.

title: Rain in Soviet Arid Area
description: MOSCOW, April 24 (Reuters) The normally arid central Asian republic of Turkmenia is experiencing its heaviest rain of this century, the Tass press agency said today.

title: Miss Niska to Do Pag and Cav
description: Traditionally known as the ham and eggs of opera, Mascagni's Cavalleria Rusticana and Leoncavallo's Pagliacci are customarily presented together in that order. Tonight at the New York. State Theater, they will become eggs and ham"Pagliacci' will be given first. Why the sudden and almost unknown reversal? Because the leading soprano roles in both will be sung by the same singer, a feat that is also fairly rare.

title: Church Pins Hope on Nebraska Primary
description: AURORA, Neb., April 23 It was a dreamlike spring day in this town of 3,180 people in the wheatfields of the Great Plains. The sky was blue, the trees were budding, the bricks of the Victorian courthouse glowed in the sunand there, was a Presidential candidate on the bandstand.

title: HIGH COURT DENIES VOTE FUND PLEAS,
