description: Where have all the building systems gone? They had such lovely names. There was the Jesperson system, the RouseWates system, the Camci system, the DesconConcordia system, the Shelley system, the F.C.E.Dillon system, the Bison system, and more.

title: Senate Acts to Renew Science Advisory Post
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP)  The Senate today passed and sent to the House a bill reestablishing the post of While House science adviser.

title: Nassau Coliseum Beats City On FrazierForeman Fight
description: The Nassau Coliseum was awarded the Joe FrazierGeorge Foreman bout yesterday, while public and private officials argued over who was to blame for the city&s losing the prestigious tight to the suburbs.

title: Food Costs Down slightly Despite Rise in Beef Prices
description: Retail food prices in general dipped a little last week but beef prices continued to soar, two of the leading cuts advancing 6 cent a pound.

title: 12 Die on Egyptian Trains
description: CAIRO, April 27 (AP) trains collided about 90 miles northeast of Cairo today, killing 12 people, the police reported. Fifty  three were reported injured.

title: Farm Editors Select Woman
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP) Audrey Mackiewicz of The Sandusky (Ohio) Register is the first woman to become president of the Newspaper Farm Editors of America since the association was formed 26 years ago. Mrs. Mackiewicz was elected at the group&s annual twoday meeting that ended here today.

title: RICE RATION IS CUT IN 3 CUBA PROVINCES
description: MIAMI, April 27 (AP)Faced with production and import problems, the Cuban Government is cutting the monthly rice ration for people in three provinces and substituting corn meal.

title: NEPHEW RECOUNTS ROCKINIIER OFFER
description: Vice President Rockefeller confirmed yesterday that he had in 1968 offered to appoint his nephew John D. Rockefeller 4th to the United States Senate seat left vacant by the assassination of Robert F. Kennedy, but only if he returned to New York from West Virginia and became a Republican.

title: Lisbon Navy Chief Is Looking to Full Role in NATO
description: LISBON, April 27 The Navy chief of staff said today that he expected Portugal to be fully yeintegrated into the Atlantic alliance in the aftermath of Sunday's elections, which will lead to a new civilian government almost certainly excluding the Communists.

title: WORK TO RESUME WATER TUNNEL
description: A limited resumption of work on the city's longstalled. Third Water Tunnel beginning next fall was voted yesterday by the Board of Estimate, promising return to work for 400 laidoff sandhogs and other tunnel draftsmen.

title: 4 Die in Iran Pipeline Blast
description: TEHERAN, Iran, April 27 (AP)A pipeline that supplies gas to the Soviet Union exploded during welding operations, killing four workers and severely injuring six, officials here announced today. The explosion, they said, occurred yesterday while welders were working on pipe that is part of the network supplying 30 Soviet Union each year. The blowup took place in the Chit. Boland region in southwestern Iran.

title: Concerts Of Mahler In Festival
description: A Mahler Festival of nine concerts will be presented by the New York Philharmonic at Carnegie Hall beginning Sept. 26 and ending on Oct. 25. The programs will include all nine of Mahler's Completed symphonies plus the uncompleted Symphony No. 10, the Songs of a Wayfarer and selections from the Ruckert Lieder and Des Knaben Wunderhorn.

title: Rites Held for Man Killed on Nuptial Day
description: EAST MORICHES, L.I., April 27Joseph Horn Jr. was buried here this morning, quietly and simply, on what would have been his fourth day as a married man.

title: Panel Trims Intelligence Oversight Plan
description: WASHINGTON, April 27The key proposal of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities to establish a new intelligence oversight committee with broad legislative and budgetary powers was watered down by the Senate Rules Committee today.

title: Buffs Are Still Singing The Trolley Song
description: EAST HAVEN, Conn., April 24It was 10 A.M. and trolleycar school was starting.

title: Reds Score Five Runs in First As15Hit Attack Beats Phils,73
description: Ted Kluszewski was talking recently about some of the hitters on the Cincinnati Reds. Sometimes a guy looks like he&s listening. You worry about him.

title: Barrera&s Son, 16, Is Assigned Task of Tending Bold Forbes
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 27 He&s gotta be sharp, Laz Barrera was saying today at Churchill Downs before catching a noon plane to Chicago. I&m counting on him!

title: Congress Ignores Ford VOte Bill Plea
description: WASHINGTON, April 27President Ford challenged Congress today to agree on a short, simple bill reviving the Federal Eleption Commission that he could sign into law immediately, but the only response on Capitol Hill was negative.

title: BEIRUT SETS VOTE ON NEW PRESIDENT
Emile Griffith In SexaPoppin
description: Emile Griffith, a fivetime world boxing champion in the welterweight and middle weight divisions, has been signed to appear in SexaPoppin, a musical compilation of top burlesque skits put together by the comedian Jackie Mason and Looney Lewis, burlesque performer.

title: PROSECUTION RESTS IN GOV. MOORE TRIAL
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aprill 27 (UPI)  The Government,1 after presenting testimony that Gov. Arch A. Moore was sympathetic to a bank charter for a bank with ties to a financially troubled loan company, rested its case in Federal Court today.

title: Ford, at Air Base, Vows to Keep U.S. in Military Lead
description: BOSSIER CITY, La., April 27 President Ford carried his campaign to northwestern Louisiana today with a lowkeyed appeal on breadandbutter issues and a promise of military leadership.

title: Top Leaders Said to Gain Victories in Vietnam's Vote
description: BANGKOK Thailand, April 27 (AP)North and South Vietnam announced today that their top Communist leaders had gained major victories in the general election Sunday for a joint National Assembly.

title: Ghana Cancels Kissinger Visit, Saying Its Leader Is Not Well
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Wednesday, April 28The Ghanaian Government has canceled the visit of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger to Accra, which was scheduled for tomorrow.

title: DUPING OF JOHNSON ON G.I.'S IS DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (UPI) That story about President Johnson bidding an emotional farewell to the wrong unit leaving for Vietnam was incorrect, according to Armed Forces Journal, which carried it originally.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, April 27Gov. Byrne announced today his support for a proposal to split the Department of Institutions and Agencies into two cabinetlevel departments.

title: Miss Hill, Defender, Loses at Pinehurst
description: PINEHURST, N.C., April 27 (UPI)Mary Gale of Rochester, N.H., defeated the defending champion, Cindy Hill of Colorado Springs, 4 and 3, in the opening round today of the North and South women's amateur golf championship.

title: Soliah Acquitted in Coast Bank Robbery
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., April 27 (AP)A jury in Federal District Court here found Patricia Hearst's former boyfriend, Steven Soliah, not guilty of bank robbery charges today. The verdict came only minutes after officials disclosed evidence apparently contradictLing his alibi witness.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Iberia Air Lines Accused by U. S. In Case Involving Reduced Fares
description: Iberia Air Lines of Spain and two of its employees were charged with criminal contempt yesterday, accused of violating a court injunction against giving fare rebates to passengers.

title: Ashton Comes Back to His Factory
description: With A Month in the  Country, whose New York premiere was given last night by the Royal Ballet at the Metropolitan Opera House, Sir Frederick Ashton has returned with his first major ballet since the 1969 Enigma Variations.

title: Text of the Speech by the Rhodesian Prime Minister
Portuguese Parties Start Drives to Form a Cabinet
description: LISBON, April 27Portugal's political leaders opened rival campaigns today for the formation of a future civilian government in the wake of Sunday's inconclusive parliamentary elections.

title: Physicists Now Confront Possibility That Natural Action Is Ever Complex
description: WASHINGTON, April 27After 25 centuries of search for an underlying simplicity in nature, it may turn out, as one theorist put it here this week, that natural phenomena, even at their most fundamental level, are as complex as a painting by Jackson Pollock.

title: Polaroid Sues Kodak
description: Polaroid. has filed suit against Eastman Kodak, charging that Kodak's new instantpicture system infringed on 10 Polaroid patents. Page 57.

title: Cruise Missile Passes Test
description: POINT MUGU, Calif., April 27 A Navy Tomahawk cruise missile has flown nearly 305 nautical miles over the Pacific Ocean in a successful tactical test, flying for 41 minutes and performing right and left turns at varying altitudes. The missile, powered by a turbojet engine, was launched yest..rday from an A6 Intruder aircraft at an altitude of 11,500 feet.

title: An American Proponent of Ecumenism
description: When William Wakefield Baum was created a Bishop of the Roman Catholic Church in 1970, he chose as his motto a phrase inspired by Paul's words to the Christians in Corinth, Ministerium reconciliationis. The e motto reflected the new bishop's years of work in the ministry of reconciliation, meaning the Church's ecumenical movement.

title: Bettors Balk on Wager
description: LITTLETON, Colo., April 27 (AP)A $2 bet on Bambi Charger to win would have returned more than $2,000. But nobody bet it. The result yesterday was a record place payoff of $495.40 on the 3yearold quarterhorse filly on the last day of the Centenniai Race Track spring meeting. She paid $18.20 to show.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: The telephone number for Village Visiting Neighbors Inc. was listed incorrectly in The Times yesterday. The correct number is 9295889.

title: Big Victory by Bentsen Called Vital to Reelection
description: HOUSTON, April 27Senator Lloyd M. Bentsen, seeking his second sixyear term, is expected to win easily over his rivals in next Saturday 's Democratic primary. But some supporters say he needs an overwhelming victory to forestall defections of supporters and contributors in November to Representative Alan Steelman, his likely Republican foe.

title: B'nai B'rith Says U.S. Will Identify Arab Boycott Cases
Israel Confirms New Mayors In the Occupied West Bank
description: TEL AVIV, April 27 (Reuters) Israeli military occupation authorities have confirmed several new Arab mayors in the occupied West Bank of the Jordan after recent elections.

title: Carter Tells Followers New Goal Is to Reunite Party
description: PHILADELPHIA, AprilJimmy Carter spoke in victory tonight of healing and uniting the Democratic party. He Seemed to share the sense among his top staff and cheering supporters that the Pennsylvania primary has almost sealed his Presidential nomination.

title: In Memoriam
description: KLOTZMinnle. Words at this time seem to fall us. All we can say Is that our love and thouehts of you, are never felling. YOUR LOVING FAMILY.

title: Prospects for Port Authority MassTransit Programs
description: For the second time in less than four years, the Governors of New York and New Jersey have announced a masstransit construction program involving heavy financing by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. Only the most optimistic, however, will be expecting sleek new trains to materialize rapidly.

title: George Abbott, at 88, With 63 Years On Broadway, Looks to the Future
description: On Sunday night George Abbott will be honored at gala at the Shubert Theater commemorating his 63 years as a Broadway producer, director, playwright and actor. Two weeks ago, at the Tony Awards ceremony, Mr. Abbott received the first annual Lawrence Langner Award for his distinguished long service to the American theater.

title: WILLIAM H. CRAMER
description: William H. Cramer, former chief of the Federal Aviation Administration's operations evaluation branch in New York City, died April 14 in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 72 years old and lived in Ridgway, Pa.

title: Bomb Near Belfast Hurts 5
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 27 (Reuters)Five workmen suffered face and leg inplosion on a construction site just outside Belfast. They were taken to a hospital and discharged.

title: POPE PAUL NAMES 19 NEW CARDINALS
description: ROME, April 27The Vatican announced today the appointment of 19 new cardinals, including one American, Archbishop William Wakefield Baum of Washington.

title: Business Briefs
description: Pound, Lira and Dollar Gain in Europe

title: Mr. Kissinger in Africa ...
description: In the major policy address of his first southern African tour, Secretary of State Kissinger has gone far to restore the traditional American commitment to selfdetermination, majority rule, racial equality and human rights. Speaking in Zambia, Mr. Kissinger said with force and clarity a great many things President Kaunda and other African leaders have long been waiting hear convincingly from the United States Government.

title: False Tax Filing Alleged
description: LOS ANGELES, April 27 (UPI)A Federal grand jury yesterday indicted Lydia E. Tombacco on charges that she filed tax returns under 15 false naMeS, claiming more than $11,000 in refunds. Mrs. Tombacco is a former employee of the Internal Revenue Service

title: Notes on People
description: A new Howard A. Rusk fund was announced last night by the World Rehabilitation Fund, marking its 20th anniversary with a $150aplate dinner for 750 persons at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: Drug Convictions Upheld Even if Police Set Up Sale
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 The Supreme Court ruled today, 5 to 3, that it is constitutional to convict a person for selling contraband such as drugs even when undercover agents or government informers initially supplied the seller with the drugs and other undercover agents were the purchasers.

title: WINE TALK
description: People who drink wine have a tendency to forget that it is a farm product, just like .tomatoes or beef. They really should keep wine's agricultural origins in mind: Those origins play a major role in its price.

title: EXCITEMENT IN JAZZ BY HANNIBAL GROUP
description: Marvin Peterson, the trumpet player who calls himself Hannibal, and Michael Carvin, the drummer, are one of those rare combinations that occur in jazz only occasionally. Mr. Peterson, whose unflagging energy and enthusiasm must wear out many musiCians who perform with him, has met his match in Mr. Carvin, whose ferocity is matched only by his musicality.

title: British Aircraft Crashes
description: LONDON, April 27 (Reuters)Two British airmen died and a third was Injured today when their Argosy transport aircraft crashed at the topsecret experimental base at Boscombe Down in southwest England. The Ministry of Defense in London said the fourengined aircraft burst into flames after overshooting the runway.

title: 8 Killed, 7 Hurt in Crash; Most Called Illegal Aliens
description: WARNER SPRINGS, Calif., April 27 (UPI)A pickup truck loaded with 15 persons, most believed to be illegal alliens slammed into a concrete culvert and toppled end over end today, killing .eight men and seriously injuring seven others.

title: Business Records
description: BUSINESS RECORDS

title: Carey Rebuffs City U. Board on Meeting About Tuition
description: Governor Carey yesterday rebuffed an attempt by the Board of Higher Education to shift. to him the question of whether tuition must be imposed for the first time at financially pressed City University.

title: Dow Sags Amid Concern Fed May Tighten Credit
description: Stock prices dropped yesterday amid Wall Street's nagging worry that the Federal Reserve Board might be tightening credit conditions a notch.

title: Israeli Expects Damascus To Extend U.N.&s Mandate
description: TEL AVIV, April 27 (UPI)Defense Minister Shimon Peres said today that Syria had no choice but to renew the mandate of the United Nations peacekeeping force on the Golan Heights. But he cautioned that Israel would have to wait until the last moment to find out.

title: W.T.T. Unveils New Look With a Multicolor Court
description: It was something to see, World Team . Tennis&s no. lines, fourcolor court, which the league unveiled yesterday at the Felt Forum. But that wasn&t the only innovation for the start of the league&s third season on Saturday.

title: SWEDISH TAX AIDE ASSAILS BERGMAN
description: STOCKHOLM, April 27One of the tax officials criticized by Ingmar Bergman in his farewell letter to Sweden last week today issued a fourpage rebuttal lo the film director's charges.

title: Bus Crash Kills On
description: MACDOEL. Calif., April 27 (UPI)A Greyhound bus and a big truck collided early today. killing a visitor from Wales and injuring 23 passengers. six seriously. The crash on t 977 killed Diiys Jones, of Maesgwin Llanarmon, Wales.

title: CONVENTION SEAT TO MISS KRUPSAK
description: Lieut. Gov. Mary Anne Krupsak has been quietly added to the New York delegation to the Democratic National Convention in an effort to quell a growing controversy over the asserted underrepresentation of women on the delegation.

title: Wheat Futures Decline in Heavy Selling
description: Heavy selling, including sales by Cargill, a major exporter, depressed wheat futures prices yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. July wheat closed at $3.37 a bushel, down from $3.43.

title: Soccer Game Put off
description: SALT LAKE ,CITY, April 27 (AP)Tomorrow night&s American Soccer  League game between Tacoma and Salt Lake :City was postponed today because of heavy rains and flooding. Officials said the field had also been drenched by water from a broken wittt main.

title: Fiscal Irony
description: It would be the ultimate in irony if New York City's painful struggle to avert bankruptcy collapsed because court interpretation turned an arbitration award won by the city into a ruinous new source of financial distress.

title: Signal Turns Down Dresser on Merger
description: The board of the Signal Companies yesterday unanimously rejected the proposal of Dresser Industries to merge the two companies. Forrest N. Shun. way, president, said that he wouldn&t consider $22 a share, the, value of the Dresser offer, a very attractive offer. Dresser had informally offered. to exchange 13/10th of a share of its stock for each of the 19,748,536 outfunding common shares of Signal Companies. At Dresser&s closing price of 75% a share on the New York Stock Ex. change Monday, the value of the Dresser proposal was estimated at $448.7 million.

title: RUBBER BOYCOTT MAY BE WIDENED
description: GENEVA, April 27American labor's consumer boycott of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company may be extended next week to the products of th eGoodyear Tire and Rubber Company, Peter Bommarito. president of the striking United Rubber Workers, said here today.

title: Gromyko Arrives in Paris For a 3Day Official Visit
description: PARIS, April 27 (Reuters)Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko arrived here today on a threeday official visit after a cool period in normally good FrenchSoviet relations.

title: Papua For National Dress
description: PORT MORESBY, Papua, New Guinea, April 27 (Reuters) Town dwellers are to be encouraged to discard their colonial style shorts, shoes and long socks and wear national dress to work at least once a week, Prime Minister Michael Somare said today. He himself has given up Western clothing for a Melanesian lap lap, a calflength skirt, and sandals.

title: 2 Late Canadiens Goals Beat Islanders by 32 for 10 Lead
People and Business
description: Auto company chairmen seem to have found a new field of competition in topping themselves and each other with almostweekly optimistic forecasts of new car sales for both 1976 and 1977.

title: Breakthrough for Carter
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 27Jimmy Carter's decisive victory in the Pennsylvania primary today established him, at least for the moment, as the most likely Democratic nominee for President. Althciugh the results of the separate delegate races were still unclear, the Georgian's success in the preferential vote g??ve him the breakthrough in industrial state he had sorely needed.

title: Montreal Police Arrest 2; Deny Link to the Olympics
description: MONTREAL, April 27 (Reuters)The Canadian police today announced the arrest here of two men found in possession of stolen guns and other equipment.

title: Company Names Changed
description: At their annual meetings yesterday shareholders of both the Continental Can Company and Liggett & Myers approved changes in their company names. Continental Can is now the Continental Group and Liggett & Myers was renamed the Liggett Group.

title: Ottawa Asks South Vietnam If It Will Accept Ex.General
description: OTTAWA, April 27 (AP)Canada has asked the Communist Government of South Vietnam if it will accept the return of former Gen. Dang Van Quang, according to Immigration Minister Robert Andras.

title: Parolee in a Homicide Case Convicted On a Gun Charge
description: A parole violator has been convicted in State  Supreme Court in the Bronx of illegal possession of a deadly weapon, exactly 10 years after he had shot and killed a Bronx youth in a dispute.

title: CHARLES BRAVE
description: Charles Brave, a pianist, conductor and musical director who had been associated with Broadway musicals of half a century and more ago, died yesterday in the Florida Hospital in Orlando. He was 81 years old.

title: Legislators Begin Voting On 500 Budget Proposals
description: TRENTON, April 27  The Joint Appropriations Commit tee of the Legislature began today the arduous task of voting on more than 500 resolutions proposing additions to or deletions from the Governor's $2.76 billion budget.

title: POPE PAUL NAMES 19 NEW CARDINALS
description: ROME, April 27The Vatican announced today the appointment of 19 new cardinals, including one American, Archbishop William Wakefield Baum of Washington.

title: Reporters As U.S. Agents
description: WASHINGTON, April 27In its censored report on the overseas operations of the Central Intelligence Agency, the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities confirms that the C.I.A. has been using United States reporters, academics, and even religious leaders as paid spies, but refuses to disclose the names of those Involved.

title: Sorcery From an Oven in Bensonhurst: Challah at Its Best
description: We know a man of unimpeachable taste, a distinguished figure in medicine, who exercises restraint in his spoken enthusiasms. But when he speaks of Sarah Schee.ht's challah, he rhapsodizes with vigor.

title: Playoff Results
description: N.B.A. Playoffs

title: 36 REPORTEDDEAD AS JET CRASHES IN VIRGIN ISLANDS
description: An American Airlines jet with 88 persons aboard crashed yesterday on landing at Charlotte Amalie in the United States Virgin Islands, hitting a service station off the end of the runway, rolling up an embankment and bursting into flames.

title: A U.S. Judge Assails Proposals For Tougher Criminal Sentences
description: A Federal judge warned yesterday that current proposals for tougher sentencing of crimjnals represented an ostrichlike and overly harsh response Co the crime problem.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, emphasized that no fare increase was being considered for the authority's PATH rapidtransit line between Manhattan and New Jersey, although operating deficits have doubled to nearly $40 million a year in the last few years. The fare is 30 cents.

title: In Shift at Stock Exchange
description: William M. Batten

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MY FAIR GREENERY This year's 30th annual Gramercy Park Flower and Horticulture Show has a Bicentennial theme for the displays of greenery and blooms filling the galleries of the stately landmark National Arts Club, the former residence of Samuel J. Tilden, at 15 Gramercy Park South. Under the heading of American Legends, visitors will see floral and plant arrangements grouped by such labels as Betsy Ross, Molly Pitcher, Paul Bunyan, Baby Doe, the Gold Rush and China Clipper, in depictions of some facet of legend or history. There will also be a Bicentennial salute in a replica of a Colonial herb

title: From a School of Design, Budget Cooking With Style
description: All too often, socalled budget recipes are either depressingly drab or so gaffedup with clever trickery they prove to be inedible. Among artists, however, this is rarely the case, a result, no doubt, of their creative imaginations plus the exigencies of life on a. shoestring, a combination that usually leads to food both stylish and delicious, more of a treat than a deorivation.

title: Needham Move: Change and Dissension
description: It was not much more than a decade ago that one of the most controversial items on the desk of the president of the New York Stock Exchange was the not especially highoctane issue of the double taxation of dividends. Backed by a comparatively united membership, the then incumbent, Keith Funston, spent much of his time selling the idea of stock ownership. His objective was to bring Main Street to Wall Street. He lasted 15 years in the job. In the nine years since the unflappable Mr. Funston retired from the Big Board seismic changes have shaken the neoRenaissance facade of the exchange.

title: Consolidated Edison Asks New Rochelle To Take David's I.
description: Consolidated Edison has offered to return David's Island to the City of New Rochelle, without charge as a result of, mounting losses that have already totaled more than $5million on the 80acre tract in Long Island Sound on which, the company had planned to build a nuclear power plant.

title: Judge Curbs Pickets
description: NAUGATUCK, Conn., April 27 (AP)Superior Court Judge Luke F. Martin issued a restraining order today against mass picketing by striking employees of Uniroyal Inc.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Albany Passes Measure On Police Heart Attacks
description: ALBANY, April 27The Assembly gave final legislative passage tonight to the socalled heart bill a measure strongly opposed by Mayor Beame that would put into permanent law the presumption that a New York City police or fire officer's heart disease is jobrelated and entitles the officer to a disability benefit of threequarters of his salary.

title: China&s Top Liaison Officer. Returning to Post in U.S.
description: PEKING, April 27 (Reuters Huang Chen, chief of the Chinese liaison office. in Washington, left today to return to his post after more than six months in Peking.

title: Stonehouse Goes on Trial On Theft, Fraud Charges
description: LONDON, April 27 (UPI)John Stonehouse, a Member of Parliament, went on trial at the Old Bailey Court today on 21 charges of forgery, theft, conspiracy and fraud involving $250.000.

title: Gov. Grasso Signs Austere Budget Increasing Gas Tax and Road Tolls
description: HARTFORD, April 27Gov. Ella T. Grasso today signed $1.8 billion budget, not the one she had asked for, but one that was just as austere and rather like it in its approach to taxation and government spending.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, speaking in Zambia in what was billed as the major policy speech of his African visit, advanced a program of American actions aimed at forcing the white minority Government of Rhodesia to accept majority rule. He said he would urge Congress to repeal the legislation permitting importation of Rhodesian chrome in contravention of United Nations sanctions. Many African leaders were most impressed by his aim of urging other industrial nations to comply strictly with the sanctions. [Page 1, Columns 13.]

title: POLICE CRITICIZED FOR JAIL SUICIDE
description: YONKERS, N. Y., April 27The jail suicide of 20yearold Steven Karagianis was the result of inefficiency by the Westchester County Sheriff&s Department and insufficient training of Yonkers Police Depeiffitent employees, according to na report released today by Yonkers Corporation Counsel Eugene Fox.

title: MAN OF 82 LOCKED IN CLOSET 1 DAYS
description: An 82yearold Queens man, locked in his bedroom closet by burglars Saturday night, spent 36 harrowing hours trying to claw his way out.

title: Most of Funds for Zumwalt Obtained Outside Virginia
description: RICHMOND, Va., April 27 (AP)Most of the $66,000 that retired Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr. has raised in his Virginia campaign for the United States Senate comes from out of state, records showed yesterday.

title: West Point Cadet Faces New Charges
description: WEST POINT, April 27Cadet Steven Verr faced new disciplinary charges at the United States Military Academy today as Senator Adlai Stevenson 3d and Representative Edwardl Derwinski, both of Illinois, demanded an investigation into the case, which involves the West Point honor code.

title: Rutgers Faculty May Vote On a Plan to Give All F's
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., April 27 (AP)Rutgers University professors reportedly will soon vote on whether to give all undergraduates temporary failing grades to pressure the school into coming to a contract agreement with the teachers union.

title: Rockefeller Apologizes for Remark on 2 Jackson Aides
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 Vice President Rockefeller formally apologized in the Senate today tor engaging in unsubstantiated speculation that two members of the staff of Senator Henry M. Jackson had Communist ties.

title: Polaroid Sues Kodak
description: Polaroid has filed suit against Eastman Kodak, charging that Kodak&s new instantpicture system infringed on 10 Polaroid patents. Page 57.

title: People in Sports
description: Muhammad All joked about a romance with Susan Ford yesterday. The President&s daughter showed up at the packed hotel suite in New Carrollton, Md., where All was preparing for his heavyweight title defense Friday night against Jimmy Young. All hugged her, bantered about a romance and drew howls of laughter by saying: If you knew Susan like know Susan.

title: U.S. JUDGE ACCEPTS OMAHA BUSING PLAN
description: OMAHA, April 27 (UPI)United States District Court Judge Albert G. Schatz today accepted the Omaha School District&s plan for integrating Nebraska&s largest school system. Implementation of the plan will mark the first use in Nebraska of busing for courtor dered desegregation.

title: Geoffrey M. Shurlock, ExHead Of Motion Picture Code, Dead
description: WOODLAND HILLS, Calif., April 27 (UPI)  Geoffrey M. Shurlock, a former head of the motion picture Association Production Code, died yesterday at the Motion Picture Country Home and Hospital, where lived here. He was 81 years old.

title: Her Honor, Elizabeth's Mayor for a Day
description: ELIZABETH, April 27Maria Batista, 17 years old, became Mayor of this Union County community today.

title: Court Names S.I. Mall Receiver As Mortgage Foreclosure Starts
description: A courtappointed receiver, has been named to take over responsibility for the Staten Island Mall, a shopping center,1 and mortgage foreclosure pro, ceedings were brought against its owners.

title: Drug Convictions Upheld Even if Police Set Up Sale
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 The Supreme Court ruled today, 5 to 3, that it is constitutional to convict a person for selling contraband such as diugs even when undercover agents or government informers initially supplied the seller with the drugs and other undercover agents were the purchasers.

title: Law Agencies Held III Prepared For Complaints About Doctors
description: CHICAGO, April 27 (UPI)Licensing and prosecution agencies in most states find it difficult to cope with professional medical problems according to an article in the American Medical Association's weekly newspaper.

title: JERSEY BELL CUTS RATE RISE REQUEST
description: NEWARK, April 27 (AP)The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company says it will trim an additional total of $4.4 million from its initial rate increase request of $174.6 million.

title: Bridge
description: The Spring National Championships of the American Bridge Association, which provides primarily for black players, were played last week in Memphis.

title: DECISION ON MISSILE NOT DUE UNTIL FALL
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (Reuters)The Ford Administration will not decide till September on production of 60 more Minuteman missiles even though it asked Congress yesterday to provide the necessary money, the Defense Department said today.The White House yesterday requested $322 million more for the 60 Minuteman III multiplewarhead missiles because of the slow pace of the talks with the Soviet Union on nucleararms limitation.

title: Washington Star and Unions Agree on 200 Layoffs
description: WASHINGTON, April 27The financially distressed Washington Star reached an agreement today with 10 .unions that will eliminate 200 jobs and save about $6 million a year. The publisher, Joe L. Allbritton, later said he would inject $6 million in new capital in the paper.

title: Brazil Central Bank Chief Cites Economic Gains Since Late 60's
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., April 27 The head of Brazil&s central bank said today that despite heavy growth in the foreign debt in the last two years. Brazil was in a stronger financial position now than when its rapid growth and rising foreign borrowing began in the late 1960s.

title: Communists in Italy: Europe Debates the Warnings of Kissinger
description: ROME, April 27 Italians in all political parties, diplomats and others here have now had time to assess the implications of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's tough words on the possible role or Communists in Italy's Government and have come to some general conclusions. The consensus emerging is i that the secretary's warnings are cutting two ways, with some damage to both the CornInunist Party and the be; leagured Christian Democrats. The feeling among many here Is that as a result the threats from Mr. Kissinger to reassess relations if the Communists share power should have little impact on the outcome of the forthcoming elections.

title: A Big Night for Fashion, Italian Style
description: New Yorkers have had a chance to discover Italy in the last week without leaving their city. Mayor Beanie proclaimed April 22 to April 29 Italian week in front of Alitalia the other day. Some 35 stores along Fifth Avenue filled their windows with Italian fashions and home furnishings and, if nothing more, Italian flags.

title: Wallace, Running Low on Cash, Prepares for Drive in Georgia
description: ATLANTA, April 27George C. Wallace's fourth quest for the Presidency has seemed a highly, improbable political exercise ever since his stinging primary defeats in Florida and North Carolina, but still the Alabama Governor continues, day after weary day.

title: Angola Halts Some Visas

The report said the decision had taken effect On Monday, the Government decided , to close Angola House In Portugal, which with its brapches was the source of visas

title: So Long, 174th Street Is New Musical at the Harkness
Ford Takes Credit for Peace
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 President Ford tested a campaign theme of peace and prosperity at a news conference with a group of farm writers today.

title: SoIsezt'im, Whafacks?
description: PETERBOROUGH, N. H.Much has been said in recent years about the deterioration of the written word in this country, but now that we are approaching a national election and I find myself listening to the crankedup voices, lockerroom inflections and haphazard pronunciation of many of the wouldbe leaders of our nation, I begin to wonder whether we have ever paid enough attention here to the deterioration of the spoken word.

title: CHROME BAN ASKED
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, April 27Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger today advanced program of American actions intended to force the white minority Government of Rhodesia to accept majority rule.

title: Anker Orders Closing or Conversion of 37 Schools After June
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker announced yesterday that 37 school buildings would be closed or converted to other uses after the current term ends in June, forcing the shift of 20,000 pupils from their existing schools.

title: 47 REPORTEDDEAD AS JET CRASHES IN VIRGIN ISLANDS
description: An American Airlines jet with 88 persons aboard crashed lyesterday on landing at Charlotte Amalie in the United States Virgin Islands, hitting a gas station off the end of the runway, rolling up an embankment and bursting into flames.

title: PoliceWage Ruling Affects Only 75'76
description: Beame administration offidais said yesterday that the new court mandate for wage Increases for police officers would affect only the current budget, but that it could cause much more serious fiscal and labor pmblems,

title: BEAME IS CRITICIZED ON SOCIAL SECURITY
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (UPI) Jerry Wurf, president of the State, County and Municipal Employees Union, charged today that Mayor Beame of New York City had overestimated by $100 million the amount of money the city could save by withdrawing its employees I from Social Security.

title: Panel Trims Intelligence Oversight Plan
description: WASHINGTON, April 27The key proposal of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities to establish a new intelligence oversight committee with broad legislative and budgetary powers was watered down by the Senate Rules Committee today.

title: Nuclear Plant Shut Down Near Rochester Alter Leak
description: ROCHESTER. April 27 (AP) A minor leak representing, no danger to plant workers or the public has closed a nuclearpowered electricitygenerating plant owned by Rochester Gas and Electric, a company spokesman said

title: Long Opposes Outlawing Tax Shelters
description: WASHINGTON, April 27Senator Russell B. Long, Democrat of Louisiana, who is chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, made clear today his opposition to legislation that would outlaw the devices wherby highincome individuals reduce their Federal income taxes by making investments that, on naner. at least, lose money.

title: Concert
description: L'Ensemble, that adventuresome series devoted to the presentation of concerts in the two stately East Side mansions now owned by the Convent of the Sacred Heart, came up with a charming Haydn program Monday night at the Otto Kahn Mansion, 1 East 91st Street.

title: 6 Jersey Women Hunted After Reformatory Escape
description: CLINTON, N. J., April 27 (UPI)The state police said today they were conducting widespread search for six inmates who escaped from the Clinton Reformatory for Women.

title: Market Place
description: Management of the Marquette Company may have hit a snag in current efforts to reduce chances of takeover.

title: Chase Takes Anytime, Anywhere
description: When Chase Manhattan made its prediction that unless something is done there will be a massive capital shortfall by 1985 in an ad in Business Week last Sept. 22 and ended it with And [we] will argue the point. Anytime. Anywhere. probably few at the bank or at the Doremus & Company, its agency. thought anyone would call them on it.

title: Yanks Deny Side Pact Charge
description: George Steinbrenner 3d. principal owner of the Yankees, denied yesterday that there was anything illegal about a side letter they included in their planned contract with Andy Messersmith.

title: Butler Defeats Romandino In Queens Assembly Vote
description: Denis J. Butler, a Democrat, defeated his opponent, John F. Romanclino, in a special election in the 36th Assembly District in Queens.

title: 6 in Thai Army Patrol Slain By Terrorists in the North
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 27 (AP)Terrorists killed an army lieutenant and five members of his patrol in northern Thailand, the Interior Ministry reported today.

title: Ford Indicates He May Veto Bill on Foreign Aid
description: WASHINGTON, April 27President Ford, in a surprise move, told several Republican Congressional leaders this morning that he was inclined to veto a pending foreign aid authorization bill because of concern the act would unduly restrict his powers.

title: Sales Dip Disclosed at Annual Meeting
description: WILMINGTON, Del., April 27Firstquarter earnings of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation plunged 64.6 percent from the yearearlier level on slightly lower sales, the company announced at its annual meeting here today.

title: Pardon for Kerner Urged
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., April 27 (AP)The Illinois Senate passed without debate today a resolution urging President Ford to grant a pardon to Otto Kerner. The 67yearold Democratic former Governor and Federal judge was convicted in 1973 of bribery, mail fraud and conspiracy involving a rare track stock scandal while was in office.

title: 3 Recipes From the Book
description: Most people have no conception of how much better liverwurst is hot than cold, says Robert Motherwell in his contribution to the book.

title: Polaroid Is Suing Kodak, Charges Patent Violation
description: NEEDHAM, Mass., April 27The Polaroid Corporation announced today that it had filed suit yesterday against the Eastman Kodak Company, charging that Kodak&s new instantpicture system infringed on 10 Polaroid patents.

title: CARTER IS VICTOR IN PENNSYLVANIA, BEATING JACKSON IN PIVOTAL TEST; UDALL IS NEXT, AHEAD OF WALLACE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Wednesday, April 28Jimmy Carter won the pivotal Pennsylvania Democratic Presidential primary yesterday with a sweeping victory over the state's traditional political machinery.

title: Amex Value Index Off 0.54 to 102.82; OTC Also Declines
Clean Air Victory
description: The unanimous ruling by the United States Court Appeals for the Second Circuit that New York must put into effect major portions of a clean air plan approved almost three years ago by the Federal Environmental Protection Agency ought to be viewed as good news both for the city's inhabitants and its treasury.

title: Guilty Plea Made in Killing
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., April 27 (AP)Jose Solis, 38 years old, an unemployed father of four, has pleaded guilty to seconddegree murder In the shooting in January of Maria Marrero, 30, a barmaid, in the Old Havana Tavern here where she worked. Judge Cuddle Davidson Jr, of Superior Court set sentencing for May 28, Mr. Soils could receive a 40year sentence.

title: TV: A Superb Production of Albee&s All Over
description: Edward Albee&s All Over, In a Hartford Stage Company production, is the Theater in America offering on public television tonight at 9. This is a superb production of a flawed but intriguing play.

title: President Asks Congress To Stiffen Antidrug Laws
Guatemalans and Brtish End Discussions on Belize
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 27Representatives of Guatemala and Britain today ended two days of discussions here on, the future of Belize, which is claimed by Guatemala.

title: MRS. ALBERT SCHUSTER
description: SPOKANE, Wash., April 27Myra Schuster, widow of Albert Schuster, a former member of the board of trustees of the ViIlage of East Rockaway, L. I., died last night of a heart attack while on a visit here. She was 84 years old.

title: SelfService Stations. Banned in Manhasset
description: MANHAS SET, L. I., April 27 (UPI)The five members of the North Hempstead Town Board unanimously approved a local ordinance today banning any more selfservice gasoline stations on the ground that they are a safety hazard.

title: Police Decision Affects Only the 75'76 Budget
description: Beame administration officials said yesterday that the new court mandate for wage increases for police officers would itself have only a oneyear budget impact, but could trigger much more serious fiscal and labor problems.

title: N. B.A. Gets A. B. A. Plan For Merger
About New York
description: Tomorrow marks the 65th anniversary of the founding of Tsing Hua University in Peking, an occasion that would be of only marginal interest to this column were it not for the fact that there is a large and active alumni association here.

title: About Education
description: Getting eligible students to apply is one thing, but getting the successful applicants to actually matriculate at a college or university is often quite another.

title: State Relives Its Early Film Glory
description: Before Hollywood, before the giant studios, before the glitter and glamour surrounding the multimilliondollar productions, New Jersey was the film capital of the world.

title: MARGARET BANNERMAN
description: Margaret Bannerman, an actress, died Sunday in Englewood (N.J.) Hospital. She was 79 years old.

title: Connecticut Senate Votes Bill to Curb Auto Pollution
description: HARTFORD, April 27 (AP)A measure that would require autoemission inspections each year at a cost of as much as $10 a car was passed Tuesday by the State Senate and sent to the House of Representatives.

title: A. H. ROBINS CO. TELLS OF PAYMENT ABROAD
description: RICHMOND, April 27 (AP)The president of A. H. Robins Company, a Richmondbased pharmaceutical concern, said today that the company had made questionable foreign payments totaling $130,000.

title: Bechtel Defends Its Role In Arabs Boycott of Israel
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 27 (AP)Bechtel Corporation, the heavy construction contractor, has formally denied that it violated Federal antitrust laws by taking part in the Arab boycott of Israel.

title: CHROME BAN ASKED
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, April 27Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger today advanced program of American actions intended to force the white Tainority Government of Rhodeo accept majority rule.

title: U.S. Navy Sets Israel Visit For First Time Since 1963
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP) A United States warship will dock at an Israeli port tomorrow for the first time since 1963, a Pentagon spokesman said today.

title: Intelligence Report
description: The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities correctly perceived that the basic issue it faced was strike an appropriate balance between the precepts American democracy and the secrecy requirements twentiethcentury power politics. The committee's recommendations tilt away from secrecy and toward controls over intelligence activities which, if enacted, would bring this country's secret foreign policy machinations somewhat more into line with what Americans want believe about their country and themselves.

title: Senate Panel Approves New Envoy to Lebanon
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (Reuters)The Senate Foreign Relations Committee today approved Francis Meloy, a 59yearold career diplomat, as the new United States Ambassador to Lebanon.

title: NIGERIA PRESSES BID FOR GOWON'S RETURN
description: LONDON, April 27 (Reuters) The former Nigerian head of state, Gen. Yakubu Gowon. who has refused to return home from Britain for questioning, will lose his allowance from the Nigerian Government, the Lagos radio reported today.

title: Envoy's Resignation A White House Error
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP)The White House mistakenly announced the resignation of the American Ambassador to Zambia just as Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger flew into that .country during his African trip. officials said today.

title: TRUSTEES SUPPORT BOSTON U. CHIEF
description: BOSTON, April 27Boston University's trustees offered a compromise today to save the presidency of John R. Silber.

title: CORRECTION
description: The telephone number for Village Visiting Neighbors Inc was listed incorrectly in The Times yesterday. The correct number is 9295869.

title: DEMOCRATIC VOTERS INTERVIEWED IN POLL
description: The New York Times and CBS News polled 1,506 Democratic voters in Pennsylvania yesterday as they left the polling places. Thirty voting precincts were chosen in the state, and, within each precinct, each voter had an equal chance of selection.

title: REPAIRMAN SUING THE AUTO INDUSTRY
description: ALBANY, April 27 (UPI)Spokesmen for the autorepair industry said today that the public was being victimized by the auto industry by inflated crash parts prices reflected in higher insurance premiums.

title: Peace Corps Bill Passed
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP) The Senate passed and sent to the President today a bill to authorize appropriations of $81 million for the Peace Corps in the current fiscal year.

title: Nyquist Studying Swedish
description: ALBANY, April 27 (UPI)The State Education Commissioner Ewald B. Nyquist, is tutoring himself in Swedish, a department spokesman said today, so that he can accept an award as Swedish American of the Year this summer in Sweden.

title: Hearst Lawyer Assails Shift From Hospital to Jail
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 27Patricia Hearst was booked into a Federal prison in San Diego this afternoon despite a quarrel here between her lawyers and the United States marshal aver her removal yesterday from hospital in Redwood City.

title: An Energy Aide Tells of Three Rebuffs By White House in Conservation Plea
description: WASHINGTON, April 27Roger W. Sant, for two years the Government's energy conservation chief, said in an interview that the White House had rebuffed three attempts by him to have President Ford give more conspicuous, personal support to the conservation of energy.

title: Music: Barenboim in Mozart Cycle
description: Lincoln Center's summertime Mostly Mozart festival Is still two months away, but a totally Mozart celebration got under way last night at Carnegie Hall for those who like their Mozart in the spring. The English Chamber Orchestra presented the first of a nineconcert series there that will embrace all the piano and violin concertos and, for topping, finish with the Jupiter Symphony. There are only a handful of composers who could stand such intensive scrutiny, but Mozart is one of the elect few.

title: ZIONISM ATTACKED IN THE U.N. AGAIN
description: The Syrian representative, Riad Siage, told the Economic and Social Council that the ties between the racist regimes of Pretoria and Tel Aviv proved that last November's General Assembly resolution equating Zionism With racism was justified.

title: G.I.'S, FOREIGNERS USED INLSD TESTS
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 Army officers gave LSD to unsuspecting American soldiers, Europeans and Asians in the late 1950's and early 1960's Li a series of military intelligence experiments that flagrantly disregarded moral and ethical Standards as well as the military's own policies and regulations, according to an internal Army report made public today.

title: Con Edison Reports 10% Profit Increase For First 3 Months
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York, the principal supplier of electric and natural gas power in the Metropolitan area, said yesterday that its profits rose 10.1 percent during the first quarter, compared with a year ago.

title: Text of Kissinzer's Address in Zambia on U.S. Policy Toward Southern Africa
description: WASHINGTON, April 27Following is the text of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's speech in Lusaka, Zambia, today on American policy toward southern Africa. The text was made public in advance by the State Department.

title: 2 Endowments Get House Approval
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (UPI)The House has voted 279 to 59 to extend both the National Endowment for the Arts and the National Endowment for the Humanities for another four years.

title: Schools Hurt by Disasters To Get Aid More Easily
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (UPI)In a reversal of previous policy, the Federal Office of Education said schools destroyed or damaged by floods,I fires or other catastrophes would be eligible for Federal aid without a Presidential declaration of a major disaster.

title: Henry St. Theater Is Now the De jur
description: The Henry Street Playhouse celebrated its 60th birthday yesterday as one of the city's oldest and busiest Centers of the performing arts with the unveiling of two plaques, fond reminiscences of a great choreographer, Anna Sokolow, and a performance by the Ballet Hispanico before several hundred neighborhood children.

title: ...a Forward Policy
description: These are major strides forward for an American policy on southern Africa that has seemed for the last seven years to favor in many ways the bolstering white supremacy, for all the official statements to the contrary. And on this occasion, Mr. Kissinger did not fry, as he had during Angola's civil war, to frighten the Africans with the specter of Soviet hegemony. He confined himself to a brief warning against any outside interference in Africa or the pursuit of bloc policies.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Carey Names Dr. Kilcoyne For HigherEducation Unit
description: ALBANY, April 27 (AP)Governor Carey has named Dr. Francis P. Kilcoyne, former president of Brooklyn College, to the Board of Higher Education in New York City.

title: AUTO CLUB ATTACKS BRIDGETOLL ORDER
description: The Automobile Club of New York has assailed the Federal Environmental Protection Agency and the Clean Air Act of 1970 in a new 16page report that denounces the agency for ordering the city to charge tolls on free bridges over the East and Harlem Rivers.

title: C.I.A. LOSING CHIEF FOR COVERT ACTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP) The head of covert operations for the Central Intelligence Agency is leaving the agency in the wake of the Senate intelligence committee report that criticized covert activities as selfdefeating and recommended a sharp cutback in their future use.

title: East Liberty, Pa. Salutes 200 Years
description: The WPA Theater will salute the Bicentennial with the production of a new American play, East Liberty, Pa., by Alan Bates. Described as a satire with an irreverent look at the American dream, East Liberty, Pa. will give previews on May 5 and 6 and open to the critics on May 7. Performances will be given from Wednesdays through Sundays until May 30. Richard Gaffield will direct.

title: Rep. Green Wins Race, In Bid to Succeed Scott
description: PHILADELPHIA, Wednesday, April 28Representative William J. Green of Philadelphia easily won the Democratic nomination yesterday for the United States Senate seat held by Hugh Scott, the minority leader.

title: Breakthrough for Carter
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 27Jimmy Carter&s decisive victory in the Pennsylvania primary today established him, at least for the moment, as the most likely Democratic nominee for President. Although the results of the separate delegate races were still unclear, the Georgian&s success in the preferential vote gave him the breakthrough in .1 industrial state he had sorely needed.

title: NEEDHAM RESIGNS AS EXCHANGE HEAD
description: James J. Needham, the first fulltime chairman of the New York Stock Exchange; resigned under pressure yesterday, almost two years before his con:tract with the .exchange was due to expire.

title: The Old, Cold Tide?
description: WELLESLEY, Mass.  Historians spend much of their time looking back and telling us which events and dates mark significant turning points in history. In retrospect it usually seems so apparent. But we live in the present and as we move from one seemingly random event to the next it is seldom that we are able to discern those turning points as they occur.

title: Allan Jackson. 60, Is Dead; ExCBS News Broadcaster
description: NORMAL. Ill., April 27 (AP Allan Jackson. a former CBS News correspondent, died last night of complications following gall bladder surgery. He was 60 years old.

title: Bicentennial Citizens Are Sworn In on S.I.
description: A flagdraped platform in the gymnasium of Staten Island Community College yesterday temporarily replaced the Federal District Courthouse in Brooklyn as 376 immigrants from 56 countries were granted citizenship at a Bicentennial celebration in their honor.

title: Advertising
description: Cue magazine under its new ownership has begun to do what it never did during its first 43 yearsentertain groups of advertisers and Potential advertisers.

title: PRICES OF BONDS STAGE RECOVERY
description: The Federal Reserve twice injected money into the banking system yesterday in an. action that stemmed the recent rise in interest rates and brought about a quiet recovery in the bond market. To many bond traders, the action signaled that the Federal Reserve had decided last week to engineer a strictly controlled rise in shortterm rates.

title: Rockefeller Apologizes for Remark on 2 Jackson Aides
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 Vice President Rockefeller formally apologized in the Senate today lor engaging in unsubstantiated speculation that two members of the staff of Senator Henry M. Jackson had Communist ties.

title: City Estate Tax
description: In its desperate search for additional revenues, New York City last November entered the estate tax arena by levying a 50 percent surtax on the state's tax on estates. This surtax, scheduled to go into effect on May I, was expected to produce $35 million In revenue.

title: 2 Major Food Companies Leaving New York City
description: Two major food companiesthe General Host Corporation, which manufactures Bond Bread, and Vita Food Products, which processes fishhave decided to move from New York City to Connecticut.

title: Thomas Moore, Doorkeeper For Four Vice Presidents
description: PORTLAND, Ore., April 27 (UPI)Thomas A. Moore, a former Kansas and Missouri publisher who was a doorkeeper for four vice presidents, died here Monday. He was 96 years old.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Most Americans met the April 15 deadline for filing Federal income tax returns, but if past experience is any indication, thousands of people who are entitled to refunds won't get them.

title: 51 ShotWinsTrial
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 27Justa Bad Boy, a colt with no victories in three previous starts this season, won the 49th running of the Derby Trial today at Churchill Downs.

title: J. Kenneth Loughry Is Dead; Met Museum ExTreasurer
description: J. Kenneth Loughry, who retired in 1969 after 20 years as treasurer of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, was killed in an automobile accident lase Friday near Idaho Springs, Colo. He was 71 years old and lived in Fort Collins, Cola.

title: Sorcery From a Kitchen in Bensonhurst: Recipes at Their Best (Cont'd)
description: FAMILYSTYLE SWEET AND SOUR STUFFED CABBAGE

title: Gertrude Ederle All Aglow In Sports Spotlight Again
description: Yesterday morning the windows were shut tight and the shades were drawn in the threestory house on 41st Road in Flushing. Queens, where Gertrude Ederle lives.

title: PINBALL MEASURE FAILS IN COUNCIL
description: The principal sponsor of pinball licensing bill moved too slowly yesterday and tilted legislation that the City Council was ready to pass.

title: Soviet Team Leads In Zone Tennis, 20
description: MOSCOW: April 27 (AP)Teimuraz KakiIlia and Vadim Borisov of the Soviet Union, scored victories today over: Monaco to take a 20 lead in the Davis Cup European Zone A preliminaries in Soviet Georgia, Tass, the Soviet press agency reported.

title: Stonehouse Goes on Trial On Theft, Fraud Charges
description: LONDON, April 27 (UPI)John Stonehouse, a Member of Parliament, went on trial at the Old Bailey Court today .011 21 charges of forgery, theft; conspiracy and fraud involving $250,000.

title: WORK TO RESUME ON WATER TUNNEL
description: A limited resumption of work on the city's longstalled Third Water Tunnel beginning next fall was voted yesterday by the Board of Estimate, promising a return to work for 400 laidoff sandhogs and other tunnel craftsmen.

title: Wheat Prices Dip
description: Wheat futures ptices at Chicago were depressed yesterday by heavy selling. July wheat closed at $3.37, down from $3.43. Page 65.

title: Israelis Commemorate Jews Who Perished Under Nazis
description: JERUSALEM, April 27, (Reuters)Sirens walled for two minutes tday and all traffic came to a standstill as Israelis stood with heads bowed in remembrance of six million Jews who died at the hands of the Nazis.

title: Irwin Segelstein Leaves CBS for Position at NBC
description: Irwin Segelstein, for the last three years president of the CBS Records Division, has been hired by NBCTV as executive vice president for programs. He will report to Robert D. Howard, the network president.

title: Basketball Recruiters Bagging Local Schoolboy Coaches, Too
description: Basketball recruiting is in full swing, but three of the most interesting signed recruits in New York are coaches, not players. Mark Reiner of Canarsie in Brooklyn, Brendan Malone of Power Memorial in Manhattan and Ron Kestenbaum of Stevenson in the Bronx have decided to leave the schoolboy level and become assistant coaches in the college ranks.

title: Byrne Backs Use Of Wasted Steam
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., April 27 Governor Byrne ordered the State Departments of Labor and Industry, Public Utilities and the Treasury today to determine the potential for saving energy by using steam now wasted by manufacturing plants.

title: Something Out of Nothing
description: PARISHenry Kissinger is now engaged in a longoverdue restructuring of United States African policy and he will require all his energy, humor and vision to accomplish this. He will also need modesty because, in that area, neither his wisdom nor his timing have so far been exceptional. The job is really to make something out of nothing, for the United States has been remiss on Africa for twenty years.

title: Mexico a Haven for Latins in Exile As Rightist Regimes Tighten Control
description: MEXICO CITY, April 27 We knew Mexico's tradition on asylum and we remembered the way Mexico helped the Chileans, recalled a Uruguayan doctor and Communist Party militant, now a political exile, so I grabbed my wife and children and we headed for the embassy.

title: 3 Relatives of Hughes Join Will Dispute
description: LOS ANGELES, April 27The emerging battle over the estate of Howard R. Hughes intensified today when three distant cousins joined Los Angeles County to try to wrest administration of the estate here from 12 other cousins and executives of Mr. Hughes's business organization.

title: Arol Is Accused of Political Influence
description: City and state authorities are Investigating allegations that contributions to the 1972 Presidential campaign of former Mayor John V. Lindsay played a role in the leasing of the Bronx Terminal Market.

title: Animated Version Of Dracula Is Set
description: Orsatti Productions Inc. will begin production of featurelength animated version of Dracula, according to Dominic Orsatti, president of the company. An original screenplay based very closely on the original Brain Stoker novel has been completed by George Greer.

title: Thai Defense Chief Objects To Loss of U.S. Radar Post
description: BANGKOK, Thailand. April 27 (UPI)Thailand&s new Defense Minister says he disagrees with a plan for a United States radar station near the ThaiLaotian border to be moved out of Thailand.

title: Computer Seen as Life Buoy in Legal Sea of Paper
description: WASHINGTON, April 27A Government antitrust official suggested today that the answer to the snow job, the blitz and the counterattack"all techniques he said were used by antitrust defendantsmay lie in the use of computers.

title: Humphrey Pressing for Food Stamp Funds to Prevent Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, April 27The food stamp program may temporarily run out of money this year, according to Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, but the Ford Administration has not vet asked for additional funds.

title: Iran Reports 3 Extremists Die in Teheran Gun Battle
description: TEHERAN, Iran, April 27 (Reuters)Two men and a woman, identified as members of an IslamicMarxist extremist group, were killed in a street gun battle with security forces here last week, the Iranian Government reported today.

title: Publication of the Answers Cancels Swedish Math Test
description: STOCKHOLM, April 27 (Agence FrancePresse)Swedish officials have been forced to cancel tomorrow's nationwide mathematics examinations because a leftist newspaper has published the answers to the itests.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: 2 Held in Mugging of Hamill's Mother

title: There's One of Them Every Year
description: LOUISVILLE, April 27 The field for the Kentucky Derby had dwindled to eight, and in the early betting line there wasn't a single 1001 shot. Almost every year there is something called Oneeyed Tom or Gift Silver or Snuzzle or A Dragon Killer who qualifies for America's most famous horse race only by having a leg at each corner. This time, however, the presence of Honest Pleasure and Bold Forbes had frightened the dreamers away, and in the Churchill Downs press box guys were asking what kind of show they were putting on here without even one entry that was in because of his owner's deathbed wish or because the trainer's aunt had visions. Then over the public address system came the accents of Raymond Johnson, the Downs press relations chief: Attention press box. We have a new starter in the DerbyBidson, BIDSON. He is on the way from Florida. We understand he broke his maiden on March 31.

title: Texaco, Mobil and Phillips Increase Net
Bomb Threat Adjourns Eastern Air's Meeting
description: Eastern Airline? annual meeting was abruptly adjourned yesterday after the police received a telephoned threat that a bomb would go off at the Chemical Bank building at 55 Water Street, where the airline's executives and shareholders were gathered.

title: Justices Say Indians May Fight State Taxes in Federal Courts
description: WASHINGTON, April 27The Supreme Court upheld unanimously today the right of an Indian tribe to go to Federal court rather than to state court to challenge state taxes on Indians and Indianowned property within a reservation.

title: St. Paul Elects Mayor
description: ST. PAUL, April 28 CAP) George Latimer, an attorney, has been elected Mayor of St. Paul. Mr. Latimer, 40 years old, ran on the DemocraticFarmerLabor ticket yesterday against George Vavoulis, IndependentRepublican, who was Mayor from 196066. Complete but unofficial returns from the city's 160 precincts showed Mr. Latimer with 36,193 votes and Mr. Vavoulis with 33,984. The term is two years.

title: Swedish Consortium to Back America's Cup Challenge
description: A group from Sweden presented that nation's plans for its challenge next year for the America's Cup at a luncheon in the New York Yacht Club yesterday.

title: LOS ANGELES FILES ITS BID FOR 81 FAIR
Third World Complains of Lag in Trade Talks
description: PARIS, April 28 Thirdworld countries expressed dissatisfaction today with what they termed the slow pace of progress in a threemonthold conference with industrial countries aimed at achieving a better sharing of the world's wealth.

title: Dropouts Mar Connecticut Caucuses
description: HARTFORD, April 28 Caprice and the complications of the system seemed to conspire last night to keep some of the Democratic Presidential candidates from getting cheir names on the ballots in., all the towns in Connecticut far the Presidential VOtillU On May 11.

title: Reid Is Quitting State Post As Chief of Environment
description: Ogden R. Reid, who has been New York State Commissioner of Environmental Conservation for 15 months, has decided to resign his post and probably will make a formal announcement today.

title: Soy Protein Mix Maker Is Curbed by Drug Agency
description: WASHINGTON, April 28 (UPI) The manufacturer of a soy protein mix billed as a baby feeding formula has been ordered not to say that the mix is an adeauate substitute for regular milk for infants, the Federal Trade Commission said today.

title: Ambassador Who Plays the Piano Uses Music for Diplomacy
description: WASHINGTON, April 28 Adrian Meisch, as he would probably be the first to admit, is a lucky man. Next to diplomacy, he loves musicor the other way aroundand as Ambassador from Luxembourg he will serve as a kind of musical Bicentennial gift from his country to the United States. This fall he will accompany a Luxembourg baritone in a series of lieder recitals around the country.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Three recent controversies have drawn attention to the need in this country for a new body of law guaranteeing the artist's right to protect the quality of his creation and to profit fairly from its success: Ken Kesey's battle against the producers of the film version of One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, the Monty Python troupe's unsuccessful struggle to keep their work off network television rather than have It censored and cut, and the attempts of two sculptors to withdraw their works from the Whitney Museum rather than have them displayed in ways that they consider destructive,

title: Personal Finance: Banks and Overdraft Checking
GUARDS EXONERATED IN JAIL DRUG INQUIRY
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., April 28 (UPI) A grand jury has concluded an eightmonth investigation into drug use atthe Bergen County jail by concluding that inmates and their friendsnot guardsare supplying the contraband materials.

title: Death Penalty for Slayers Supported by 65% In Poll
description: Support for the death penalty for persons convicted of murder has increased over the last decade, with the percentage favoring capital punishment now at the highest point in 25 years, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: Reid Is Quitting State Post As Chief of Environment
description: Ogden R. Reid; who has been New York State Commissioner of Environmental Conservation for 15 months, has decided to resign his post and probably will make a formal announcement today.

title: Issue and Debate
description: The bureaucratic tangle that ensnares the construction industry in New York City confounds the uninitiated and infuriates the veteran developer.

title: List Is Moved
description: The Amusements for Children listing, which has appeared regularly on the Family/Style page, will be published every Friday,. starting tomorrow, in the new Weekend section.

title: 4YearOld Unharmed As Thief Steals a Car
description: A fouryearold Queens boy was found unharmed yesterday morning, more than 15 hours after a car thief had jumped into his parents station wagon and sped off with the youngster asleep on the back seat.

title: Jury Exonerates Suffolk Prosecutor
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., April 28 A state grand jury today refused to take action on charges of sodomy and sexual misconduct that had been filed against District Attorney Henry F. O'Brien of Suffolk County by Eugene R. Kelley, the county's Police Commissioner.

title: Criticism of Foreign Policy
description: LOS ANGELES, April 28 (UPJ)  Mr. Reagan challenged President Ford's foreign policy theme of peace through strength in a fiveminute nationwide television address tonight.

title: Carter Victory in Primary Leaves Vaunted Democratic Machine in Pennsylvania in State of Disrepair
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 28 When Jimmy Carter headed south toward home today, savoring his seventh Presidential primary victory of the year, he left Pennsylvania's vaunted and venerable nolitical machinery in a state of disrepair.

title: But The Patient Died
description: On April 30, 1970, six years ago tomorrow, President Nixon ordered United States forces into Cambodia. It is a day that will live in the shame of Americans who know the good in their country and suffer when evil is done in its name.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES INQUIRY ON SIKES
description: WASHINGTON, April 28 The House ethics committee voted overwhelmingly today to look into complaints of a conflict of interest involving Representative Robert L. F. Sikes but. balked at a major investigation into the legislative and business affairs of the Florida Democrat.

title: Market Place
description: Quality corporate bonds offer a natural refuge for the small investor and can at times, provide a better return with greater safety than most alternatives.

title: Washington Heights Gets Transit Information Center
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority will open its fourth neighborhood transit information center today.

title: Backgrounds of the 4 Tribal Chiefs
description: Jeremiah Chirau

title: MRS. HODGE GUILTY OF 73 DEATH PLOT
description: Beverly Donna Hodge was convicted last night in State Supreme Court of having hired two men to kill her husband a rock music arranger, to collect $164,000 in insurance.

title: Soviet Is Purchasing $400 Million Worth Of American Grains
description: WASHINGTON, April 28 The Soviet Union, in a longawaited reentry into the United States market, has bought 3.1 million tons, or 122 million bushels, of corn and 300,000 tons, or 11 million bushels, of wheat, the Department of Agriculture announced today.

title: Italian Scores at Rome Show
description: ROME, April 28 (UPI)Warming up to defend his 1972 Olympic title, Graziano Mancinelli of Italy won both openingday events at the 44th Rome international horse show today as riders from eight nations began five days of competition. Mancinelli guided the Irishbred chestnut gelding, Bel Oiseau, to first place in the Targa Lancia event for horses who had competed previously in the international. Then he rode La Bella through two clear roumis to take the Equizole prize for horses making their Rome debuts. Each event carried $115,000 in prize money.

title: The Main Derby Question: Will Speed Kill Top Two?
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.April 28 Bold Rulers can't go a mile and a quarter, the doubters used to say, and mostly they were right.

title: Composite Economy Index Fell by 0.4% During March
Kissinger Offers U.S. Help in Rhodesia Negotiations
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, April 28 (Reuters) Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger offered the good offices of the United States tonight in possible negotiations to secure swift black majority rule in Rhodesia.

title: William M. Murphy Jr., 60, Of St. Joe Minerals Is Dead
description: William M. Murphy Jr., who retired in 1973 as controller of the St. Joe Minerals Corporation, at 250 Park Avenue, died yesterday in his home, at 81A Highview Avenue, New Brighton, Staten Island. His age was 60. .

title: Soviet, in New Overture, Calls on China to Resume Border Talks
description: MOSCOW. April 28 The Soviet Union proposed today that China return to the stalled border talks with the Soviet Union, cpntending that a Chinese reexamination of Moscow's sfa,nding package of constructive proposals could break the deadlock.

title: St. John's Plans Opener With Soviet Five, Names Scott May Lapchick Trophy Winner
description: A smorgasbord, in more ways than one, is what the St. John's Athletic Department served at its luncheon at Mamma Leone's yesterday.

title: Humphrey May Attempt to Stop Carter, But Few in Party Think He Can Succeed
description: WASHINGTON, April 28  Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota appeared poised tonight to undertake a limited effort to halt Jimmy Carter short of the Democratic Presidentid nomination, but there were few in the party who gave their longtime hero much chance of success.

title: Soviet Buying Lifts Prices for Futures In Wheat and Corn
description: Buoyed by the reappearance of the Soviet Union in the gran markets, traders pushed prices ahead yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: CONGRESS PASSES FOREIGN AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, April 28 Congress gave final approval today to a $4.4 billion foreign aid authorization bill that now faces a probable veto by President Ford and is likely to set off a new clash between the legislative and executive branches.

title: Music: Steinberg Farewell Concert
description: William Steinberg's final New York concert as music director of the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, which he has headed since 1952, made for a sentimental leavetaking last night at Carnegie Hall. The 76yeaeold conductor, who has resigned his post to become Pittsburgh's music director emeritus, effective this fall, chose a grandstyle farewell: Berlioz's Romeo and Juliet, in one of that masterly work's rarely heard complete performances.

title: Advertising
description: The home smoke detector seems destined to become one of the heavily promoted electric appliances. What would seem to make its future assured is the increasing number of state, county and municipal governments that have passed legislation requiring such equipment in all new private housing.

title: CARBIDE IS CHARGED IN SALES TRUST SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, April 28 (UPI)The Justice Department charged today the Union Carbide Corporation, the nation's second largest chemical company, with illegally restraining sales of its patented carbaryl insecticides. Union Carbide sells its carbaryl insecticides under the trade name Sevin."

title: Flights to Greece Canceled
description: ATHENS, April 28 (Reuters)  Foreign airlines canceled all flights in and out of Greece. today after their Greek technical and administrative employees began a twoday strike for higher wages, a civil aviation spokesman said. The stateowned airline, Olympic Airways, continued normal operationsj and also handled charter flights for foreign companies.

title: HANOI AIDE CITES KEY THU ERROR
description: HONG KONG, April 14 North Vietnam's Chief of Staff, drawing on the testimony of a captured South Vietnamese colonel, has described how South Vietnam's President decided on the error in strategy that led to the rout of his forces a year ago.

title: Nastase Beats Borg
description: COPENHAGEN, April 28 (AP)With tiebreakers in all sets, Ilie Nastase of Rumania beat Sweden's Bjorn Borg, 76, 76, 67, 76, before 5,000 fans in a headtohead match today. Each player received $10,000. Nastase has an 84 edge in their career meetings.

title: N.A,A.C.P. CHECKED 25 YEARS BY E.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, April 28  The Federal Bureau of Investigation spent 25 years monitoring the wholly lawful political activity of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People on the ground that it was conducting a search for Communist infiltration, the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence disclosed today.

title: OCCIDENTAL ADMITS ILLEGAL PAYMENTS
description: LOS ANGELES, April 28 (UPI) The Occidental Petroleum Corporation has admitted giving unlawful contributions and payments to domestic political campaigns and persons in foreign governments.

title: Indian Court Upholds Political Jailings
description: NEW DELHI, April 28 The Supreme Court of India today upheld the right of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government to imprison political opponents without court hearings.

title: Buckley Assumes Russians Infiltrate Staffs of Congress
description: ALBANY, April 28 Senator James L. Buckley said today that he assumed Soviet spies had successfully infiltrated Congressional staffs in Wash, ington and that he hoped the Central Intelligence Agency was doing the same thing in Moscow.

title: Irish Official Deplores ChurchInspired Law
description: DUBLIN, April 28 (Reuters)  A senior Irish cabinet minister called tonight for the elimination of Roman Catholic morality from Ireland's Constitution and Laws.

title: European Soccer
description: U.E.F.A. CUP

title: CHARLES D. DICKEY, BANKER, 82, DEAD
