description: New York politicians who publicly supported Henry M. Jackson and New York politicians who publicly supported Morris K. Udalla good percentage of whom privately support Hubert H. Humphreyexpressed disappointment yesterday at Mr. Humphrey's decision to stay out of primary elections and some foreboding about what his decision meant for New York.

title: North Korea Appoints A New Prime Minister
description: TOKYO, Friday, April 30 (AP) The Pyongyang radio, monitored here said today that North Korea had named Deputy Prime Minister Pak Sung Chul its new Prime Minister, succeeding Kim II.

title: Jazz Benefit Lauds Music Of Ellington
description: Betty Ford gave the downbeat last night for a concert of Duke Ellington's music at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine in celebration of Duke FIlington's birthday.

title: Rate Rise For Water Approved
description: NEWARK, April 29  The State Board of Public Utility Commissioners today approved an 11.6 percent rate increase for the Middlesex Water Company of Woodbridge, which serves 44,000 homes in seven municipalities.

title: Sperry Rand's Earnings Up 12% in Quarter to Record
It's a Park Slope Renaissance: Young Women Run New Shops
description: Two years ago Michele Valowitz, a hospital research technician, was busy pondering the notion of returning to graduate School, Jessica Lipsky worked in a Manhattan drug rehabilitation program and Ariala Boronat was dabbling in buying and selling on the local flea market circuit.

title: Art: Brooklyn Showin Manhattan
description: ONCE upon a time there was a natural relationship between a great museum building and its collections. But somewhere along the line we have lost the knack of that particular equation. Since World War II we have seen great collections (Glasgow, Duesseldorf) with no firstrate building to house them, and in this country we have seen firstrate new museum buildings with nothing in particular to put in them. In this matter we are like apprentice mathematicians who just won't give up believing that the square root of 64 is 11.

title: Will Inaiades Man Who Says He Rescued Hughes in Desert
description: SALT LAKE CITY, April 29 (UPI) Eight years ago in the middle of the Nevada desert. Melvin Dummar picked up a scruffy, bleeding man who said he was Howard Hughes. Mr. Dummar thought he was a bum.

title: CAREY PROPOSES DOUBLING OF TERM FOR YOUTH CRIME
description: ALBANY, April 29 Governor Carey asked the Legislature today to mandate the minimum confinement of one year for juveniles who commit serious crimes of violence and to double, from 18 months to three years, the maximum time they can be sentenced to serve in state training schools.

title: Ballet: The Unidentical Twins
description: IN a sense, our own New York City Ballet and Britain's Royal Ballet are twin companies. They were started at around the same timethe Royal traces its beginnings to 1931 and the City Ballet to 1934and they were both national ballets formed in reaction to the international touring Ballet Russe companies of the day. And both, in a sense, were based on the style and training methods of the old Maryinsky ballet in St. Petersburg. They were little Russian saplings growing up in alien and, if you will pardon the phraseEnglishspeaking soil. Also, they both had a sovereign advantagethe possession of a master choreographer, George Balanchine for the Americans and Sir Frederick Ashton for the British.

title: BROWN PRESSES MARYLAND DRIVE
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., April 29 Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California ended his first full day of campaigning for the Democratic Presidential nomination here by saying that if he did well in Maryland's May 18 primary election he would take his message"the new voice of the new politics one Brown aide called itto a number of nonprimary states.

title: House Backs Ford Veto of Bill to Revise Hatch Act
description: WASHINGTON. April 29 A Congressional effort to allow 2.8 million Federal Civil Service employees to take part in political campaign ended today when the House sustained President Ford's veto of a bill revising the 37yearold Hatch Act.

title: British Elated With New Policy, but They See Smith Stalling
description: LONDON, April 29  The British Government, which has cared more openly and worried more deeply about Africa than any other Western power, is delighted with Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's n e w Africa policy and profoundly disappointed by the latest effort of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith to give Rhodesian blacks some semblance of power.

title: Circus Performers Take Time Out to Play
UDALL SEEKS FUNDS TO PRESS CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 Representative Morris K. Udall, in a brief television broadcast tonight, made a second appeal for contributions for his underdog campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Ford's TV Ads on Superiority Of U.S. Hint Gains by Reagan
description: HOUSTON, April 29 The slow, solemn horn music is suddenly lost in a reverberating artillery explosion. In place of the! smiling faces in a political! crowd that had just filled the television screen, there is now the exhausted expression of a soldier at war.

title: Books of The Times An Uninsurable Risk
description: Karl Muhlbach, a middleaged insurance; executive, is .rather tired of being a Symbol of respectibility, and Lambeth Brent, a beautiful and irrational young girl, is bored withcbeing a symbol, of sex: As he adjusts his necktie before entering her apartment. Muhlbach adjusts his . morality in an attempt to rationalize her egocentrism, her cruelty and her promiscuity. He is the kind of Man w.ho.carries an umbrella on .cloudY days, And we feel, that, when he makes love to Lambeth, he holds the umbrella over them so that God cannot see.

title: Business Trends
description: GOOD MORNING, ladies and gentlemen, this is your airlines industry speaking. We've had some trouble with the economy, so we're a little late taking offabout a year. But we'll he airhorne shortly, and we expect strong economic tailwinds that should make up some lost time, We'll be flying as high and far as we can on the money we have. We have no Idea where we're heading. Now please extinguish all smoking materials, make sure your seat hacks and tray tables are in their full upright position and fasten your parachutes.

title: Congressmen Consider Rhodesia Ban
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 Moves were made in Congress today to support Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's pledge to obtain repeal of the Byrd Amendment, which allows the import of chrome from Rhodesia in violation of United Nations sanctions.

title: Byrne Endorses Carter and Requests All Democratic Governors to Back Him
description: TRENTON, April 29  Governor Byrne of New Jersey urged the country's 36 other Democratic governors today to rally behind Jimmy Carter in a national demonstration of party unity in behalf of the former Georgia Governor's Presidential nomination campaign.

title: FORD IS AVOIDING MENTIONING NIXON
description: WACO, Texas, April, April 29 President Ford said today that he would rather not mention the name of former President Richard .M. Nixon in public because it is better for all of us to just not remind ourselves of the Watergate era.

title: Stars Drawing Full Houses in The Suburbs
description: WHEN Tom Jones strides onstage at the Westchester Premier Theater tonight, the house will be jampacked. Frank Sinatra and Liza Minnelli filled the 3500seat center in 10day runs recenty. And next month, big crowds are expected for Johnny Mathis, Alan King, Bobby Vinton and Paul Anka.

title: About the Yankees
description: The Yankees took advantage of clear but cold weather to work out in Kansas City yesterday, but there is a ferecast of rain for tonight's opener with the Royals. . . . The Yanks have played only one game since Saturday, a 10 victory in Texas Tuesday night. . . Catfish Hunter, Ed Figueroa and Rudy May are the scheduled starters for the Kansas City games, each with too much rest. . . . Monday will be another off day as the Yankees head for California, to play the Angels and Oakland A's. . . Meanwhile, they have some delightful averages to contemplate: They have 18 stolen bases in 23 tries, a success rate of 78 percent, and 11 of the steals have become runs; they, are batting 306 as a team; the bull pen has three saves in four victories, without a loss; and the relievers road wonlost record is 41.... Yankee home attendance is up 50 percent for the first seven dates and that doesn't hurt any feelings either.

title: REDUCED ACTIVITY BY BREDINEV SEEN
description: MOSCOW, April 29 The unexpected death of Defense Minister Andrei A. Grechko at the age of 72 has focused new attention on the stamina of his aging Kremlin colleagues, notably Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Records: Rubinstein Still Has Old Magic
description: Arthur Rubinstein confessed, a couple of days after his triumphant Carnegie Hall recital in March, that his dread before that event was that he would be praised as an old man who still plays the piano. Thus put on guard against condescension by the 89yearold master himself, a listener goes to these records in an especially demanding frame of mind. But it's no use.

title: Saigon Lifting Curfew For Victory Celebration
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 29 (Reuters) The nightly curfew was being lifted in Saigon tonight to allow people to celebrate tomorrow's first anniversary of the Communist victory in South Vietnam.

title: KAUFMAN OPPOSES COURT CUTBACKS
description: Taking issue with many of his colleagues who have increasingly called for diversion of large classes of cases from the judicial system, Judge Irving R. Kaufman urged yesterday that many of these cases should not be removed permanently from the courts.

title: Market Place
description: With the recent rise in stock market prices, many investors have seen the value of their equities grow substantially over the last few months. And some ot them have found a way to use these equities to borrow money for other purposes at a lower interest rate than they might pay otherwise.

title: KY LAYS TAKEOVER TO WEAK LEADERSHIP
description: Nguyen Cao Ky, former Vice President of South Vietnam, said yesterday that the Communist takeover of his country a year ago was a result of weak moral leadership by President Nguyen Van Thieu and a lack of understanding by the United Stales, according to United Press International.

title: Panama Says It Foiled Plot To Seize Two Embassies
description: PANAMA, April 29 (Reuters) The Panamanian National Guard said today that it had uncovered a plot by a Miamibased group of exiles from several nations to take over the Cuban and Spanish Embassies in Panama and hold diplomats for ransom.

title: WARDEN WILL ALLOW HEARST COURT PLEA
description: SAN DIEGO, April 29 (AP) Patricia Hearst will be able to meet a court date May 12, in Los Angeles, the warden of San Diego's Federal prison said today.

title: The Post and Stereotypers Reach Accord on Contract
description: The New York Post reached an agreement yesterday with the New York Stereotypers Union, subject to a union membership vote Sunday, according to the union and Sidney Orenstein, labor counsel for the newspaper.

title: Washington and Business
description: WASHINGTONFarreaching bank legislation, some of which traces its origins back 15 years, is now reaching the decision stage.

title: Demarest Is Sued for Violating Terms of Park Grants
description: DEMAREST, April 29 In the first court action in the 14year history of the Green Acres Program, the State Department of Environmental Protection announced today that it had filed a suit against this Bergen County borough charging that it had violated the terms of two parkland purchaie grants it received in 1974.

title: SUBSIDY ESTIMATE FOR AMTRAK RAISED
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (AP)Amtrak operations over the next five years will require a Federal subsidy of at least $6.2 billion, the General Accounting Office said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: GUNMAN IS CHASED OFF HOSPITAL FLOOR
description: ALBANY, April 29 (AP) A gunman was spotted and chased today from the hospital floor where Mel Patrick Lynch, a suspect in the kidnapping of Samuel Broniman 2d. was under guard.

title: FUTURES OF CORN IN HEAVY DEMAND
description: News that the Soviet Union had made sizable corn purchases spurred speculators to buy futures contract yesterday on the Chicago Boar ?? Trade.

title: Nets Well Rested for Nuggets
description: The American Basketball Association's championship series will begin tomorrow night in Denver with the New York Nets and the Nuggets opening a fourofseven series for the league title.

title: Marines on Trial
description: In ordering three drill instructors and one officer to stand court martial in connection with the fatal beating of a private at the San Diego recruit depot, the Marine Corps has taken a first step toward acknowledging its responsibility to put a halt to brutality masquerading as manly toughness. Beyond establishing the nature of the criminal actions that led to Pvt. Lynn A. McClure's death, the trial should provide firsthand evidence whether Marine training concepts are at fault, or whether it laxity in supervision that has been responsible for such sadistic incidents.

title: Fading Hope in India
description: If India ever finds its way back to the freedom and democracy that were proud hallmarks of its first eighteen years as an independent nation, someone will surely erect a monument to Justice H. R. Khanna of the Supreme Court., It was Mr. Justice Khanna who spoke out fearlessly and eloquently for freedom this week dissenting from the Court's decision upholding the right of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government to imprison political opponents at will and without court hearings.

title: Stage: Linda F'olan Monologues
description: LINDA POLAN brings her monologues about the terrors of single and wedded neurosis all the way from the English Midlands. It is a bulky and uneconomic effort; about like sending a shipment of sandwiches across the Atlantic.

title: Checks at Savings Banks Gain in Albany With Hitch
description: ALBANY, April 29 The Assembly passed a bill today granting checkingaccount privileges to savings banks and at the same time requiring them to finance a pool for mortgages in highrisk redlined areas.

title: Israel's U.N. Envoy Rebuffs Criticism Of Visit by Vorster
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 29 Israel's chief delegate today rejected criticism of a recent visit to his country by the South African Prime Minister, denying that the visit automatically meant Israeli endorsement of South African policies.

title: Javelin Suspension Lifted
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (Reuters) The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that it was ending its oneyear trading suspension of Canadian Javelin securities on May 2. The suspension began on April 29, 1975.

title: Antiques
description: THERE are two good reasons why nautical buffs and the merely curious are visiting Mystic Seaport in Connecticut earlier than usual this year. The first is a stdpioedup interest in this country's seafaring past that has spurred museum visits and collecting of everything from binnacles to buoys. Second is a special exhibition of some remarkable acquisitions at this 40acre museum.

title: CIVILIAN TO HEAD SOVIETS DEFENSE
description: MOSCOW, April 29 Dmitri F. Ustinov a civilian, was named tonight as the new Soviet Minister of Defense.

title: New Faces Lighting Up The Season On Broadway
description: SEVERAL months ago Keith McDermott might have been the young waiter bringing you spaghetti in a Greenwich Village restaurant.

title: Stage View
description: LET me explain to you what you are going to do wrong. Let's say that you're coming into the city for a weekend from out of town, or from somewhere much farther away, like Connecticut. (If you don't think it takes longer to get to New York City from Connecticut than it does from St. Louis, just keep an eye on your watch as you stand still in traffic on what are quite properly called the parkways.) You want to see some theater and you think you know what theater. The big hits, of course, the ones people are talking about. Won't Chorus Line be wonderful for Saturday night?

title: Beame Eases Restrictions On City University Budget
description: The Beame administration eased its budget restrictions on the City University yesterday as state and city officials estimated that the Board of Higher Education was gradually moving toward accepting the end of free tuition as the keystone to a settlement of the university controversy.

title: MasterPlan Contract Due On Study of Water Supply
UAL Reports a Record Loss Despite Increase in Revenues
description: UAL Inc., which owns United Airlines, the nation's largest airline, reported yesterday a record firstquarter consolidated net loss of $44.5 million, against a yearearlier deficit of $8.6 million. Revenues rose of $614.2 million from $552.9 million.

title: The Meaning of Congressional Intelligence Inquiries
Levi Orders F.B.I. Files on Dr. King Reviewed in a Broadening of Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 Atfney General Edward H. Lei has ordered an internal Justice Department review of some 2,500 files compiled by the Federal Bureau of Investigation on the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., both before and after his assassination in 1968.

title: Two Sides of Julie Wilson
description: After more than 25 years on the supperclub circuit, Julie Wilson is making what might be a farewell tour. In the fall she is going back home to Omaha to raise her two boys who are now 11 and 12 years old. En route to Nebraska, she is appearing at the Valentine Room of Once Upon a Stove, Third Avenue at 25th Street, where she is giving a performance that would be worthy of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde.

title: Carey Names Berle
description: Governor Carey yesterday designated Peter A. A. Berle, a former State Assemblyman and a highly respected environmental lawyer, as Commissioner of Environmental Conservation, Page D17.

title: ALBERT B. FERGUSON
description: Albert B. Ferguson, who was one of the first Xray specialists, died last Sunday at a hospital in Walnut Creek, Calif. He was 80 years old.

title: A Concert and a Musical Visited by First Lady
description: Betty Ford bestowed her best wishes on two benbfit performances in New York City last night, visiting the Cathedral of St. John the Divinethe first wife of a President to do soand then taking in a musical abbut her residence, "1600 Pennsylvania Avenue.

title: LLOYD P. BURNS
description: Lloyd P. Burns of Highland Park, N.J., general manager of the New Jersey Press Association since 1950, died yesterday in his home, 217 Lincoln Avenue. He was 60 years old.

title: Agency Steps Up Tourism Drive
description: New Jersey is gearing up for a major promotion of its second largest industrytourism.

title: Show Retains Mystery Of African Sculpture
description: The exhibition of African sculpture entitled African Spirit Images and Identities, which opened this week at the Pace Gallery, 32 East 57th Street, is one of the most beautiful surveys of this field we have had in New York in some years. It is also one of the largest and most varied. Over 240 objects are included in a show that is not not only handsome to look atthe installation is itself of museum qualitybut has the additional merit of offering some new insight into an art that has managed to retain a good deal of its original mystery for the Western observer.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: It is difficult to be an informed consumer in search of a day camp for your child. For one thing, there evidently no directory of day ramps that is even nearly complete.

title: The Halls of Ivory
description: John Kenneth Galbraith, who taught economics, was recently given $10,000 in cash and a $13,000 purpleandgold Cadillac by the Harvard Lampoon, the nation's oldest college humor magazine, for being Harvard's funniest prolessor in 100 years. Harvard's Fogg Museum will get the money. The car, he has said, he'll drive on state occasions. In receiving the award, at a ceremony in Cambridge, he delivered the following remarks.

title: The Pop Life
description: NEOPRIMITIVE artrock, with those determined twanging variants on the same three chords, should by rights be indistinguishable, and, in truth, a lot of it does sound alike. But the very first notes of any Modern Lovers song instantly stamp Jonathan Richman and his cohorts as something absolutely fresh.

title: G.O.P. AIDES SCORE PLEA FOR BROOKE
description: Aides to President Ford and Vice President Rockefeller are among several black Republicans who have condemned the blackled effort promoting Senator Edward W. Brooke of Massachusetts as the Republican nominee for Vice President.

title: MAY AUTO OUTPUT TO TOP 75 LEVEL
description: DETROIT, April 29 American auto makers are expected to build 774,000 cars in May, up 25.5 percent from the 616,334 built a year ago.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Plans to sell the Central Presbyterian Church at Park Avenue and 64th Street to the Asia Society have been rejected by a 49to9 vote of the congregation. Instead, the church will embark on a renewal program that will eliminate theater and arts programs and retaineducation, worship and other core programs until its farmer financial and membership strength is regained. An initial simple majority vote for the sale early last year Was rejected last Noveznbet in a court order that stipulated approval of the transaction by a twothirds vote. The Asia Society had planned to replace the church with new quarters to house its $10 million art collection.

title: Best Face Forward for Men
description: Are you ready for it, fellas? Mascara give you long, sweeping eyelashes? Crayons to emphasize your dreamy eyes? Lip gloss to make you kissable?

title: American Airlines Is Found In Violation on Rights Law
description: CHICAGO, April 29 (UPI) A Federal judge has ruled that American Airlines violated civil rights law by barring mothers from being stewardesses, but he deferred ruling on the requests of more than 300 dismissed stewardesses for back. pay.

title: Court Rules Cunningham Must Provide Bank Data
description: A fivemember state appeals court unanimously ruled yesterday that Patrick J. Cunningham, the Democratic state chairman and Bronx County leader, must turn over his personal bank records subpoenaed by a special grand jury investigating corruption in the Bronx.

title: The Labor Scene
description: AMERICAN labor is undergoing its most sweeping face lifting in a quarter century. Its new look will require the heads of industry and government to adjust to new leaders and new approaches in unions with stoporgo power over most of the country's giant corporations.

title: Cavs Defeat Bullets by 2 In 7th Game
Text of the Purported Will
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., April 29 (UPI)  Following is the text of the threepage handwritten document, dated March 19, 1968, purporting to be the last will and testament of Howard R. Hughes (verbatim including punctuation and misspellings):

title: Gov. Moore Denies the Charges At ExtortionConspiracy Trial
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., April 29 (AP) Gov. Arch A. Moore Jr. denied today at his extorUonconspiracy trial that he ever met with Theodore R. Price to discuss Mr. Price's application for a state bank charter or accepted a $25,000 political contribution from him in 1972.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 1.6 From WeekAgo Level
$415 Billion Budget Approved by House; Tops Ford Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 The House of Representatives passed today a budget resolution that sets a target for Federal spending for the coming fiscal year that is $19.6 billion higher than the total recommended by President Ford, The vote was 221 to 155.

title: Defendant Floors His Lawyer in Brooklyn Court
description: A 21yearold man who did not like the lawyer his family had engaged to defend him on a mugging charge turned suddenly, punched the lawyer twice and knocked him to the floor, bleeding, in front of the judge and jury in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday.

title: Critic's Notebook: A Barge Adrift In Our History
description: It helps to think of the Bicentennial as a barge, a sort of Moby Dick made possible by a grant from Exxon. They've piled it up with the clutter of our historysome Greek columns, some Confederate money, some dead Indians, a hymnal, a Louisiana Purchase. Coke bottles. space capsules, laundry bags of used rhetoric, blind heads of statesmen carved from Styrofoam, Abraham Lincoln and Wyatt Earp and Irving Berlin and Pete Rozelleand towed it out into the Hudson River. We watch from, say, the Jersey shore. Are those torches, or is the barge burning? Are those Rhine maidens, or sharks? Where is the barge going? We're uneasy.

title: Reid Out
description: The excellent appointment of Peter A. A. Berle to succeed Ogden Reid as New York State's Commissioner Environmental Conservation has spared Governor Carey the sharp criticism of those environmentalists who deplore Mr. Reid's departure under pressure. His administrative troublesand he had his sharewere not enough to warrant the loss to the state of an official whose devotion to the cause of an improved environment was strong and whose actions to advance that cause were vigorous and untiring.

title: Berle Named to Succeed Reid in Environment Post
description: Governor Carey yesterday designated Peter A. A. Berle, a former State Assemblyman and a highly respected environmental lawyer, as State Commissioner of Environmental Conservation.

title: Ballet Soaring in Popularity
description: It took Sol Hurok, a master of the double negative, to aslOss the boxoffice problems common to dance companies years ago. If the peciple don't want to come. the impresario said, nothing will stop them.

title: Rabbinical Student Speaks With Eloquent Fingers to the Deaf
description: With pleasure that thawed on their faces and in the way they swayed in their chairs, some 40 women, watching Lynn Gottlieb's lips and hands, sang a song they could not hear.

title: Kojak: Telly Rules Waves From Tokyo To London
Management
description: THE BOWERY Savings Bank, the nation's largest savings bank, and Sears, Roebuck & Company, the nation's largest merchandiser, both announced in recent months that they had established an office of the chairman.

title: PRICE M. CHENAULT, STATE EDUCATOR, 75
description: Price M. Chenault. who retired in 1970 as director of education for the New York State Department of Education, died Saturday in Decatur, Ala., where he lived. He was 751 years old.

title: TRANSIT CONTRACT DEFENDED BY KHEEL
description: Theodore W. Kheel, the labor mediator who helped avert a transit strike on April 1, called on the Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday not to reject the transit contract but to subject it to periodic review,
